f.d: [44. 'jig rten las 'das pa'i le'u]
BOOK THIRTY-EIGHT. Detachment from the World
bam po bdun cu lnga pa/

bcom ldan 'das shin tu rnam par sangs rgyas pa'i thugs mnga' ba mi gnyis pa la yang dag par spyod pa/ mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la rab tu brten pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa/ bsgribs pa med pa thugs su chud par rtogs pa/ phyir mi ldog pa'i chos dang ldan pa/ spyod yul la 'phrogs pa med pa/ dus gsum rnam par dgod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mnyam pa nyid du byung ba/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du shin tu khyab pa'i sku mnga' ba/ chos thams cad la the tshom mi mnga' ba'i ye shes can/ spyod pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i thugs mnga' ba/ chos kyi ye shes la nem nur mi mnga' ba/ rnam par ma brtags pa'i skad dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis yang dag par gnon pa'i ye shes can/ sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa mi gnyis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog brnyes pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par thar pa tha mi dad pa'i ye shes kyi mthar phyin pa/ sangs rgyas kyis mtha' dang dbus med pa'i mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa/ sangs rgyas kyi spyod pas rnam par spyod cing yul ma ga d+ha'i chos kyi dgon pa'i snying po byang chub la pho brang 'od kun nas 'byung ba na/ gdan seng+ge'i khri pad+mo'i snying po can la bzhugs shing /

AT THAT TIME the World-Honored One was in the country of Magadha, in the forest, in the shrine of universal light at the site of enlightenment, sitting on a lotus lion seat; he had completely fulfilled ineffable enlightenment, put an end to afflictions and views, and arrived at formless truth. Abiding in the abode of buddhas, he had attained the equanimity of buddhas and arrived at nonobstruction in the state of imperturbability. All his actions were unimpeded. He stood in the inconceivable and saw through all time. His body continually pervaded all lands; his knowledge always comprehended all things. He understood all activities. He exhausted all doubts. His knowledge was that sought by all enlightening beings. He had arrived at the nondual ultimate perfection of buddhahood and fully attained the equal liberation of the enlightened. He had realized the stage of impartiality of buddhas, which is without extremes or middle, extending throughout the cosmos, equal to space.

byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed thams cad kyang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu tshe gcig gis thogs pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dang gzhan nas 'dus pa kun kyang / byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi tshul thams cad rab tu thob pa sha stag ste/ 'di ltar sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rnam par gdul ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos la rab tu dgod par mkhas pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad dpyad pa'i tshul gyi ye shes 'byams klas pa la zhugs pa dag ste/ 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i sa dang / spyod yul dang ye shes la spyod cing rtog pa spros pa thams cad yongs su chad pa spyod pa nye bar bzung ba rgyun mi 'chad pas/ sems can thams cad yang dag par gzung ba la mkhas pa/ chos kyi tshul la 'jug par bya ba mtha' dang dbus med pa la rab tu zhugs pa/ sems can thams cad kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa chud mi za zhing mi dmigs par brtag cing dpyad pa la shin tu mkhas pa/ sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / dbang po dang / rtsom pa dang / sbyor ba mthon dman brtag cing dpyad pa la rab tu mkhas pa/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i don dang / tshig dang / yi ge gzung zhing bcang ba dang / shes par bya ba dang / mnyam par gzung ba dang / brtag par bya ba la shin tu mkhas pa 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi tshul la 'jug par bya ba mtha' dang dbus med pa la shin tu zhugs pa/ 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / dus rnam pa tha dad pa'i tshul brtag pa la rab tu mkhas pa/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor skad cig gcig gi de ma thag tu rab tu thob par rnam par spyod pa/ sems kyi skad cig re re la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yang dag par ston pa/ sems can thams cad kyi sems bskyed pa dang mi 'bral bar byang chub tu rnam par 'tshang rgya bar sems can gcig gi sems kyi dmigs pa la zhugs pas/ sems can ma lus pa thams cad kyi sems kyi dmigs pa la mkhas par khong du chud pa/ rang 'byung gi ye shes dang / sa mngon du gyur pa las mi nyams pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa thob kyang rgyun mi 'chad pa'i spyod pa las phyir mi ldog pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon par 'du bya ba'i mthu rgyun mi 'chad pa/ mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i ye shes kyi tshul la zhugs pa/ sems can gcig gi don du/ bskal pa mu med par spyod pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i byin gyi rlabs la mkhas pa/ bskal pa grangs med par 'byung zhing / mthong bar dka' ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rin po che shin tu bzang po chos kyi 'khor lo thogs pa med pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis 'gro ba thams cad rnam par 'dul ba'i dbyings la 'jug par mkhas pa/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa'i gnas yang dag par gzung ba'i phyir sngon gyi spyod pa'i mthu'i khyad par dang / smon lam phun sum tshogs pa dag ste/ de dag dang / de ma yin pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis yon tan bsngags shing yongs su brjod kyang bskal pa mu med par mi zad/ mi thug pa/ legs pa/ shin tu brjod pa rab tu thob pa sha stag ste/

He was with as many great enlightening beings as atoms in untold quadrillions of buddha-lands, all of whom were to attain unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment in one lifetime, and had come from various lands in other regions. All of them were endowed with the means and wisdom of enlightening beings: that is, they skillfully observed sentient beings and civilized them by the power of appropriate means so that they would live by the way of enlightening beings; they skillfully observed all worlds and went to them by the power of appropriate means; they skillfully examined the realm of nirvana and meditated on it and assessed it; they did away with all false conceptions and cultivated sublime practices without interruption; they were well able to take care of all sentient beings; they skillfully penetrated the principles of infinite liberative means; they knew sentient beings are empty and have no existence, yet they did not deny the fruits of action; they knew the various differences in the compulsions, faculties, spheres, and means of sentient beings’ minds; they were able to absorb and hold the teachings of buddhas of past, present, and future, to understand them themselves, and also explain them to others; they were well versed in all mundane and transmundane things and knew their true reality; they examined all compounded and uncompounded things and knew them to be nondual; in a single moment of thought they were able to acquire all the knowledge and wisdom of the buddhas of all times; they were able to show attainment of true awakening moment to moment, to cause sentient beings to become inspired and attain the Way; they knew the spheres of all sentient beings in the mental objects of one sentient being; though they entered the stage of the enlightened, they did not give up the works carried out by enlightening beings; their deeds, knowledge, and means did not fabricate anything; they stayed in the world for countless ages for each and every sentient being, yet they were hard to meet even in incalculable eons; they turned the wheel of the true Teaching, pacifying sentient beings without fail; they had already fulfilled the pure practical commitments of the buddhas of past, present, and future. They had perfected infinite such virtues, so that even if all the buddhas spoke for boundless eons they could not tell of them all.

Their names were Universally Good, Universal Eye, Universal Emanation, Universal Wisdom, Universal Vision, Universal Light, Universal Contemplation, Universal Illumination, Universal Symbol, Universal Awareness, and so on. * * *

byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kun kyang kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang smon lam du ldan pa/ smon lam dang lhag pa'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa/ sangs rgyas byung ba thams cad kyi drung du 'gro zhing gsol ba gdab pa la mkhas pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi tshul yang dag par 'dzin pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rigs rgyun mi gcod pa; sangs rgyas 'byung ba gcig nas gcig tu lung bstan pa dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / ming dang / zhing dang / 'khor lo'i tshul yongs su sbyong ba/ sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sangs rgyas skye ba yongs su ston pa/ kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su dag par byed pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i las kyi sgrib pa thams cad rab tu sel ba/ chos kyi dbyings sgrib pa med pa la shin tu zhugs pa sha stag dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs te/

There were as many such enlightening beings as atoms in untold quadrillions of buddha-lands: all of them had accomplished the vow of practice of Universal Good; their profound determination and great vows were already fulfilled; they traveled to all places where buddhas were appearing in the world, requested them to turn the wheel of teaching, and were well able to receive and hold the eye of truth of the buddhas, perpetuating the lineage of buddhas; they knew the order of all buddhas’ appearance in the world and giving instructions, their names, countries, attainment of enlightenment, and turning the wheel of teaching; in worlds where there were no buddhas, they appeared and became buddhas, able to purify defiled sentient beings, able to destroy the action obstructions of enlightening beings, and enter the unimpeded pure realm of reality.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po de'i tshe/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so/ /de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos/ ting nge 'dzin chen po sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba de la mnyam par bzhag ma thag tu/ de'i tshe phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ / gzhal med khang ni gang / dga' ba ni gang / rgyan ni gang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa'i mi sgul ba ni gang / lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su mi gtong ba la gnas pa ni gang / rtsom pa chen po ni gang / brtsams pa chen po mthar phyin par bya ba ni gang / dad pa mi phyed pa ni gang /

Then the great enlightening being Universally Good entered a vast concentration called Buddha flower array. When he entered this concentration, all worlds quaked in six ways, moving in eighteen ways, producing a tremendous sound that none did not hear. After that he rose from concentration. At that point the enlightening being Universal Wisdom, knowing the congregation had assembled, asked the enlightening being Universally Good, “Please tell us—what are the reliances of great enlightening beings? What are their extraordinary thoughts? What are their practices? What are their spiritual friends? What are their exertions of energy? What are their attainments of peace of mind? What are their ways of developing sentient beings? What are their precepts? How do they receive the prediction of enlightenment? How do they enter into the state of enlightening beings? What are their entries into enlightenment? What are their penetrations of the activities of sentient beings? What are their entries into worlds? What are their entries into ages? What are their explanations of past, present, and future? What are their entries into past, present, and future? What are their developments of a tireless mind? What are their knowledges of differentiation? What are their mental masteries? What are their explanations of Buddha? What are their developments of the Universally Good mind? What are their principles of Universally Good practice? For what reasons do they generate great compassion? What are the causes of their development of the will for enlightenment? What are their expressions of respect to spiritual friends? What are their purities? What are their transcendent ways? What are their conscious knowledges? What are their realizational knowledges? What are their powers? What are their impartialities? What are their expressions of the true meaning of the Buddha teaching? What are their teachings? What do they preserve? What are their intellectual powers? What are their masteries? What are their qualities of nonattachment? What are their equanimities? What are their generations of knowledge? What are their magical displays? What are their supports of powers? What are their attainments of great joy and solace? What are their profound penetrations of the Buddha teaching? What are their bases? What are their developments of fearlessness? What are their developments of minds free from doubt? What are their inconceivabilities? What are their skillful esoteric sayings? What are their skillful analytic knowledges? What are their entries into concentration? What are their universal entries? What are their doors of liberation? What are their spiritual powers? What are their insights? What are their liberations? What are their groves? What are their palaces? What are their enjoyments? What are their adornments? What are their developments of an unshakable mind? What are their profound, great determinations they don’t give up? What are their contemplations? What are their explanations of things? What are their purities? What are their definitive marks? What are their illuminations of knowledge? What are their peerless states? What are their indomitable attitudes? What are their outstanding minds? What are their oceanic knowledges entering unexcelled enlightenment? What are their jewel-like states? What are their adamantine commitments to universal enlightenment? What are their great undertakings? What are their ultimate great tasks? What are their indestructible faiths?

gang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi rgyan ni gang / rkang pa ni gang / lag pa ni gang / lto ni gang / snying po ni gang / snying ni gang / go cha ni gang / mtshon cha ni gang / mgo ni gang / mig ni gang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rna ba ni gang / sna ni gang / lce ni gang / lus ni gang / yid rnam par rgyu ba ni gang / 'gro ba ni gang / gnas pa ni gang / stan la 'dug pa ni gang / mal ni gang / rnam par spyod pa ni gang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul ni gang / lta ba ni gang / rnam par lta ba ni gang / rnam par bsgyings pa ni gang / seng+ge'i nga ro ni gang / sbyin pa yongs su dag pa ni gang / tshul khrims yongs su dag pa ni gang / bzod pa yongs su dag pa ni gang / brtson 'grus yongs su dag pa ni gang / bsam gtan yongs su dag pa ni gang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab yongs su dag pa ni gang / byams pa yongs su dag pa ni gang / snying rje yongs su dag pa ni gang / dga' ba yongs su dag pa ni gang / btang snyoms yongs su dag pa ni gang / don ni gang / chos ni gang / bsod nams kyi tshogs ni gang / ye shes kyi tshogs ni gang / rig pa skye ba ni gang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos yongs su tshol ba ni gang / chos rab tu brjod pa ni gang / chos kyi nan tan ni gang / bdud ni gang / bdud kyi las ni gang / bdud kyi las bzlog pa ni gang / sangs rgyas mthong bar bya ba ni gang / sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las ni gang / nga rgyal gyi las ni gang / ye shes kyi las ni gang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs ni gang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs ni gang / chos kyi byin gyi rlabs ni gang / dga' ldan na gnas pa'i las ni gang / dga' ldan gyi gnas nas 'chi 'pho ston pa ni gang / mngal na gnas par ston pa ni gang / shin tu phra ba'i rgyud ston pa ni gang / cher skye ba ni gang / gad mo cher dgod pa ni gang / gom pas rnam par gnon pa ni gang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzhon nu'i sa kun tu ston pa ni gang / btsun mo'i 'khor nye bar ston pa ni gang / mngon par 'byung ba ni gang / dka' ba spyod pa'i sbyor ba ni gang / snying po byang chub tu 'gro ba ni gang / snying po byang chub la 'dug pa ni gang / snying po byang chub la 'dug pa rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos ni gang / bdud 'dul ba ston pa ni gang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni gang / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba ni gang / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i chos dkar po'i rnam pa ni gang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba chen po bstan pa ni gang / de skad ces smras pa dang /

What are their ways of receiving the prediction of enlightenment? What are their dedications of roots of goodness? What are their attainments of wisdom? What are their developments of a boundlessly broad mind? What are their hidden treasuries? What are their rules of behavior? What are their controls? What are their unimpeded functions? What are their unimpeded functions in respect to sentient beings? What are their unimpeded functions in respect to lands? What are their unimpeded functions in respect to phenomena and principles? What are their unimpeded functions in respect to bodies? What are their unimpeded functions in respect to vows? What are their unimpeded functions in respect to realms? What are their unimpeded functions of knowledge? What are their unimpeded functions of spiritual capacities? What are their unimpeded functions of miraculous abilities? What are their unimpeded functions of power? What are their versatilities? What are their spheres? What are their powers? What are their fearlessnesses? What are their unique qualities? What are their activities? What are their bodies? What are their physical actions? More kinds of body? What is their speech? What is their purification of speech? What are the protections they receive? What are their accomplishments of great works? What are their minds? What are their determinations? What are their comprehensive minds? What are their faculties? What are their profound minds? What are their intense profound minds? What do they strive to practice? What are their certain understandings? What are their certain understandings of worlds? What are their certain understandings of beings? What are their habit energies? What are their graspings? What do they cultivate? What are their accomplishments of the Buddha teachings? What makes them regress from the way of the Buddha teachings? What are their paths of emancipation? What are their qualities of certainty? What are their ways of generating the qualities of buddhahood? What are their appellations of greatness? What are their paths? What are their infinite paths? What are their aids to enlightenment? What are their ways of cultivation? What are their ways of adornment? What are their feet? What are their hands? What are their guts? What are their internal organs? What are their hearts? What is their armor? What are their weapons? What are their heads? What are their eyes? What are their ears? What are their noses? What are their tongues? What are their bodies? What are their minds? What is their action? What is their abiding? What is their sitting? What is their reclining? What are their dwelling places? What are their spheres of action? What are their observations? What are their universal observations? What is their springing? What is their lion’s roar? What is their pure giving? What is their pure discipline? What is their pure tolerance? What is their pure energy? What is their pure concentration? What is their pure wisdom? What is their pure benevolence? What is their pure compassion? What is their pure joy? What is their pure equanimity? What are their principles? What are their pure laws? What are their virtues used to foster enlightenment? What are their knowledges used to foster enlightenment? What are their sufficiencies of insight? What are their quests for truth? What are their understandings of truth? What are their norms of practice? What are demons? What are demons’ actions? How are the actions of demons gotten rid of? What are visions of Buddha? What are actions of Buddha? What are actions of conceit? What are actions of knowledge? What is possession by demons? What is being supported by Buddha? What is being supported by truth? What do enlightening beings do while living in the heaven of satisfaction? Why do they die in that heaven? Why do they appear to abide in the womb? Why do they manifest subtle processes? Why do they manifest birth? Why do they manifest a smile? Why do they show the act of walking seven steps? Why do they appear as children? Why do they appear to live in a palace? Why do they appear to leave home? Why do they demonstrate austerities? How do they go to the site of enlightenment? How do they sit on the site of enlightenment? What are the extraordinary signs when they sit on the site of enlightenment? Why do they demonstrate the conquering of demons? What are the attainments of the power of the enlightened? How do they turn the wheel of teaching? How are good and pure ways acquired due to the turning of the wheel of teaching? Why do the enlightened ones manifest extinction in final nirvana? Please explain these things to us.”

byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu shes rab la dmigs nas/ byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs de dag thams cad la smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rgyu mthun pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar chud mi za ba'i phyir/ byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyu mthun pa dang / rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu bya ba'i phyir/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rgyu mthun pa dang / shin tu bsags pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu mthun pa dang / nan tan bya ba'i phyir/ pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang / 'byung ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi rgyu mthun pa dang / byang chub brtan pa'i phyir smon lam gyi rgyu mthun pa dang / rgya chen po yang dag par bsags pa'i phyir/ spyod pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang / tshul gcig tu bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang rgyu mthun pa dang / sems rab tu dang ba'i phyir/ sangs rgyas mchod pa rgyu mthun pa dang / pha lta bur brjod pa'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang rgyu mthun pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

Then the great enlightening being Universally Good said to Universal Wisdom and the others, “Offspring of Buddha, great enlightening beings have ten kinds of reliance. They take the determination for enlightenment as a reliance, as they never forget it. They take spiritual friends as a reliance, harmonizing as one. They take roots of goodness as a reliance, cultivating, gathering, and increasing them. They take the transcendent ways as a reliance, fully practicing them. They take all truths as a reliance, as they ultimately end in emancipation. They take great vows as a reliance, as they enhance enlightenment. They take practices as a reliance, consummating them all. They take all enlightening beings as a reliance because they have the same one wisdom. They take honoring the buddhas as a reliance because their faith is purified. They take all buddhas as a reliance because they teach ceaselessly like benevolent parents. These are the ten: if enlightening beings rest in these principles, they can become abodes of the unexcelled great knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngo mtshar gyi 'du shes te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la mi dge bar 'du shes pa dang / dge ba thams cad la byang chub kyi sa bon du 'du shes pa dang / sems can thams cad la byang chub kyi snod du 'du shes pa dang / smon lam thams cad la smon lam med par 'du shes pa dang / chos thams cad la 'byung bar 'du shes pa dang / spyod pa thams cad la spyod pa med par 'du shes pa dang / chos thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi chos su 'du shes pa dang / tshig tu spyod pa thams cad la ngag gi lam med par 'du shes pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la phar 'du shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la gnyis su med par 'du shes pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngo mtshar gyi 'du shes te/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'du shes rnam par bzlog pa la mkhas pa/ bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of extraordinary thought. What are they? They think of all roots of goodness as their own roots of goodness. They think of all roots of goodness as seeds of enlightenment. They think of all sentient beings as vessels of enlightenment. They think of all vows as their own vows. They think of all truths as emancipation. They think of all practices as their own practices. They think of all things as teachings of Buddha. They think of all modes of language as the path of verbal expression. They think of all buddhas as benevolent parents. They think of all buddhas as one. These are the ten: if great enlightening beings rest on these principles, they will attain unexcelled skillful thought.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du spyod pa dang / chos thams cad yongs su btsal ba'i don du spyod pa dang / bslab pa thams cad nan tan du bya ba'i don du spyod pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsags pa'i don du spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig tu bya ba'i don du spyod pa dang / ye shes rab tu shes par bya ba'i don du spyod pa dang / sgom pa yongs su bsgom pa'i don du spyod pa dang / zhing brgyan pa'i don du spyod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen bkur ba'i don du spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mchod cing rim gro bya ba'i don du spyod pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po'i spyod pa bla na med pa yongs su rdzogs pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of practice. What are they? Practice dealing with all sentient beings, to develop them all to maturity; practice seeking all truths, to learn them all; practice of all roots of goodness, to cause them all to grow; practice of all concentrations, to be single-minded, without distraction; practice of all knowledge, to know everything; practice of all cultivations, to be able to cultivate them all; practice dealing with all buddha-lands, to adorn them all; practice dealing with all good companions, respecting and supporting them; practice dealing with all buddhas, honoring and serving them. These are the ten: if great enlightening beings rest on these principles, they will attain the practice of the unexcelled knowledge and wisdom of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems la rab tu gzhog pa'i bshes gnyen dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba la sbyor ba'i bshes gnyen dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug par byed pa'i bshes gnyen dang / chos thams cad ston pa'i bshes gnyen dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba la gzhog pa'i bshes gnyen dang / spobs pa la rnam par gdon mi za bar byed pa'i bshes gnyen dang / 'gro ba thams cad nas gyen du bskyod pa'i bshes gnyen dang / bskal pa thams cad du gnas shing mi skyo bar byed pa'i bshes gnyen dang / kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la rab tu gzhog pa'i bshes gnyen dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes la 'jug cing / 'bab par byed pa'i bshes gnyen te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen no/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of spiritual friends. What are they? Spiritual friends who cause them to persist in the determination for enlightenment; spiritual friends who cause them to generate roots of goodness; spiritual friends who cause them to practice the ways of transcendence; spiritual friends who enable them to analyze and explain all truths; spiritual friends who enable them to develop all sentient beings, spiritual friends who enable them to attain definitive analytic and expository powers; spiritual friends who cause them not to be attached to any world; spiritual friends who cause them to cultivate practice tirelessly in all ages; spiritual friends who establish them in the practice of Universal Good; spiritual friends who introduce them to the reaches of knowledge of all buddhas. These are the ten.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtson 'grus brtsams pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su smin par bya'o snyam ste brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / chos thams cad la gzung bar bya'o snyam ste brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yongs su sbyang bar bya'o snyam ste brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa thams cad shes par bya'o snyam ste brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi nyes byas zad par bya'o snyam ste brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal thams cad rgyun gcad do snyam ste brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / bdud thams cad las rgyal bar bya'o snyam ste brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / sems can thams cad 'khrug pa med par bya'o snyam ste brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod par bya'o snyam ste brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mnyes par bya'o snyam ste brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtson 'grus rtsom pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of exertion of energy: exertion of energy to educate all sentient beings, to enter deeply into all Buddha teachings, to purify all worlds, to practice all sciences of enlightening beings, to eliminate all evils of sentient beings, to stop the miseries of all vicious cycles, to destroy all demons, to become pure, clear eyes for all sentient beings, to honor all buddhas, and to please all buddhas. These are the ten: if great enlightening beings abide by these things, they will be able to fully achieve the unexcelled transcendent energy of the buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbugs phyin pa thob pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar bdag ni byang chub kyi sems la gnas pa yin gyi/ da dung gzhan yang byang chub kyi sems la dgod do zhes te/ dbugs phyin pa rab tu 'thob bo/ /bdag ni 'jig rten gyi rtsod pa thams cad kyis rtsod du med pa la gzhol ba yin gyi/ da dung gzhan yang rtsod pa med par dga' ba la rab tu dgod par bya'o zhes dbugs phyin pa 'thob bo/ /bdag ni byis pa'i chos las 'phags kyi/ da dung pha rol yang byis pa'i chos las gyen du bskyod de/ sangs rgyas kyi chos la dgod par bya'o zhes dbugs phyin pa 'thob bo/ /bdag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba btsal ba la brtson pa yin gyi/ da dung gzhan yang dge ba'i rtsa ba tshol bar brtson pa la rab tu dgod par bya'o zhes dbugs phyin pa 'thob bo/ /bdag ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam du zhugs pa yin gyi/ da dung gzhan yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam du 'jug pa la dgod par bya'o zhes dbugs phyin pa 'thob bo/ /bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs su skye ba yin gyi/ da dung gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi rigs su skye ba la rab tu dgod par bya'o zhes dbugs phyin pa 'thob bo/ /bdag ni dngos po med pa'i chos kyi tshul la zhugs pa yin gyi/ da dung gzhan yang dngos po med pa'i chos kyi tshul la dgod par bya'o zhes dbugs phyin pa 'thob bo/ /bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mi spong ba la brtson pa yin gyi/ da dung gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mi spong bar brtson pa la dgod par bya'o zhes dbugs phyin pa 'thob bo/ /bdag gis ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i byang chub tu smon lam yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur gyi/ da dung gzhan yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i byang chub tu smon lam yongs su rdzogs par byed pa la dgod par bya'o zhes dbugs phyin pa 'thob bo/ /bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi mdzod mi zad par zhugs pa yin gyi/ da dung gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi mdzod mi zad par 'jug pa la dgod par bya'o zhes dbugs phyin pa 'thob bo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbugs phyin pa 'thob pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po'i dbugs phyin pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go ;

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of attainment of peace of mind. What are they? Abiding themselves in the will for enlightenment, they should also induce others to abide in the will for enlightenment, to attain peace of mind. Ultimately free from anger and strife themselves, they should also free others from anger and strife, to attain peace of mind. Free from the state of ordinary ignorance themselves, they also free others from the state of ordinary ignorance, and attain peace of mind. Diligently cultivating roots of goodness themselves, they also induce others to cultivate roots of goodness, and attain peace of mind. Persisting in the path of the transcendent ways themselves, they also induce others to abide in the path of the transcendent ways, and attain peace of mind. Being born themselves in the house of Buddha, they should also enable others to be born in the house of Buddha, to attain peace of mind. Deeply penetrating the real truth of absence of intrinsic nature, they also introduce others into the real truth of absence of inherent nature, and attain peace of mind. Not repudiating any of the buddhas’ teachings, they also cause others not to repudiate any of the buddhas’ teachings, and attain peace of mind. Fulfilling the vow of all-knowing enlightenment, they also enable others to fulfill the vow of all-knowing enlightenment, and attain peace of mind. Entering deeply into the inexhaustible treasury of knowledge of all buddhas, they also lead others into the inexhaustible treasury of knowledge of all buddhas, and attain peace of mind. These are the ten; if great enlightening beings abide by these principles, they will attain the peace of the supreme knowledge of the buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dag ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni; sbyin pas kyang sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par byed do/ /gzugs kyis kyang sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par byed do/ /chos ston pas kyang sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par byed do/ /bskal pa mnyam pas kyang sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par byed do/ /gnas med pas kyang sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par byed do/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa brjod pas kyang sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par byed do/ /'jig rten gyi khams kun tu 'bar ba yang dag par bsten pas kyang sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par byed do/ /sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi che ba nyid brjod pas kyang sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par byed do/ /rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'phrul bas kyang sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par byed do/ /thabs mkhas pa'i sbyor ba dang / tshul gyis 'jig rten du spyod pa sna tshogs kyis kyang / sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par byed do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba ste/ de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par byed pa dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten ways of developing sentient beings: by giving, by their physical bodies, by teaching, by cooperation, by nonattachment, by showing the practices of enlightening beings, by clearly showing all worlds, by showing the great magnificent qualities of the Buddha teachings, by various manifestations of spiritual powers, and by various subtle skillful means. These are ten ways in which enlightening beings develop and perfect the realm of sentient beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems mi nyams pa'i tshul khrims dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa yongs su spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / sems can thams cad la phan par dga' bas rnam par lta ba'i tshul khrims dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la rab tu dgod pa'i tshul khrims dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa thams cad la nan tan du bya ba'i tshul khrims dang / chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i tshul khrims dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad las phyir phyogs su mi lta ba'i tshul khrims dang / chos thams cad nges par rtogs pa la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang / dbang po sdom pa'i tshul khrims so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims te/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims rgya chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of precepts: not giving up the determination for enlightenment, leaving behind the stages of individual salvation, observing and benefiting all sentient beings, inducing all sentient beings to live by the teachings of Buddha, cultivating all the sciences of enlightening beings, not being acquisitive in respect to anything, dedicating all roots of goodness to enlightenment, not being attached to any of the incarnations of buddhas, reflecting on all things and getting rid of grasping and clinging, and regulating all their faculties. These are the ten; if great enlightening beings abide by these principles, they will attain the unexcelled great transcendent discipline of the buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lung bstan pa ste/ lung bstan pa de dag gis lung bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag cag lung bstan to zhes bya bar shes so/ /bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar snying thag pa nas byang chub kyi sems phun sum tshogs pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rang gi rgyud las lung bstan pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la mi skyo ba ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i lung bstan pa'o/ /bskal pa thams cad du zhe non pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lung bstan pa'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la nan tan du byed pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lung bstan pa'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bka' la gcig tu chad par mos shing yid ches la mngon par dad pa ni; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lung bstan pa'o/ /dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par gsog cing sgrub pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lung bstan pa'o/ /sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la rab tu dgod par brtson pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lung bstan pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu byed pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lung bstan pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad la ston par 'du shes pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lung bstan pa'o/ /sngon gyi byang chub kyi smon lam rjes su srung ba ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lung bstan pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lung bstan pa ste/ lung bstan pa de dag gis lung bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag cag lung bstan to zhes bya bar shes so/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten ways of receiving the prediction of buddhahood, by which they know inwardly they will receive the prediction: arousing the determination for enlightenment with extraordinary will; never giving up the practices of enlightening beings; continuing to carry out the practices of enlightening beings in all ages; practicing all Buddha teachings; having complete faith in the guidance of all buddhas; cultivating all roots of goodness and bringing them to fulfillment; placing all sentient beings in the enlightenment of buddhas; harmonizing and unifying with all spiritual friends; thinking of all spiritual friends as buddhas; perpetually preserving the fundamental aspiration for enlightenment with diligence.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa' la 'jug pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sngon gyi smon lam la 'jug pa dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / yang dag par bsgrub pa la 'jug pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug pa dang / bsgrub pa la 'jug pa dang / smon lam rnam pa tha dad pa la 'jug pa dang / mos pa tha dad pa la 'jug pa dang / zhing gi rgyan la 'jug pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa la 'jug pa dang / skye ba bstan pa la 'jug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa' la 'jug pa ste/ 'jug pa de dag gis ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la 'jug pa dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten ways of entry into the state of enlightening beings: they enter into fundamental vows, practices, precepts, ways of transcendence, attainment, different undertakings, various understandings, adornment of buddha-lands, command of spiritual powers, and manifestation of incarnation. By these they enter into the states of enlightening beings of all times.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jug pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar mu med pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la 'jug pa dang / mu med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la 'jug pa dang / mu med pa'i chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa dang / mu med pa'i dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor la 'jug pa dang / mu med pa'i sems can 'dul ba la 'jug pa dang / mu med pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyis rnam par 'phrul pa la 'jug pa dang / mu med pa'i sku sna tshogs la 'jug pa dang / mu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa dang / mu med pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la 'jug pa dang / mu med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su bstan pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jug pa ste/ 'jug pa de dag gis ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la 'jug par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten ways of entering enlightenment: they enter boundless realization of true awareness, boundless turning of the wheel of teaching, boundless means of liberation, boundless different explanations, boundless taming of sentient beings, boundless command of spiritual powers, boundless different embodiments, boundless concentrations, boundless powers and fearlessnesses, and boundless revelation of nirvana. By these great enlightening beings enter among all the enlightened ones of all times.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can gyi bsam pa dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa ste/ sems can gyi spyod pa dang bsam pa la 'jug pa de dag gis ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang / spyod pa la rab tu 'jug go /bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyi sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi phyi ma'i mtha'i spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi da ltar byung ba'i spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi mi dge ba'i spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dbang po'i spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi mos pa sna tshogs kyi spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang / bag la nyal ba'i spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dus dang / dus ma yin par yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rnam par 'dul ba'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can gyi bsam pa dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa ste/ de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gyi bsam pa dang / spyod pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba dag go/

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of penetrations of actions of sentient beings: they penetrate all sentient beings’ past actions, future actions, present actions, good actions, bad actions, mental actions, actions of senses, actions of understanding, actions of afflictions and habit energies, timely and untimely actions of teaching and training. By these enlightening beings penetrate the actions of all beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams la 'jug pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams rnams la kun nas nyon mongs par 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rnams la rnam par dag par 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rnams la chung ngur 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rnams la chen por 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rnams la rdul shin tu phra mor tshud par 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rnams la rab tu phra bar 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rnams la yangs par 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rnams la 'byung bar 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rnams la sangs rgyas dang bcas par 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rnams la sangs rgyas med par 'jug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams la 'jug pa ste/ de dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la 'jug par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of entry into worlds: they enter defiled worlds, pure worlds, small worlds, large worlds, worlds within atoms, subtle worlds, inverted worlds, upright worlds, worlds where there are buddhas, and worlds where there are no buddhas. Thereby enlightening beings enter all worlds in the ten directions.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bskal pa la 'jug pa ste/ de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams bskal pa thams cad la rab tu 'jug go /bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'das pa'i bskal pa la 'jug pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa la 'jug pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i bskal pa la 'jug pa dang / grangs yod pa'i bskal pa la 'jug pa dang / grangs med pa'i bskal pa la 'jug pa dang / grangs yod pa grangs med pa'i bskal pa la 'jug pa dang / grangs med pa grangs yod pa'i bskal pa la 'jug pa dang / bskal pa thams cad la bskal pa gcig tu 'jug pa dang / bskal pa ma yin pa la bskal par 'jug pa dang / bskal pa thams cad la skad cig gcig gis 'jug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bskal pa la 'jug pa rnams te/ de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams bskal pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of entry into ages: they enter into past ages, future ages, present ages, countable ages, uncountable ages, countable ages as uncountable ages, uncountable ages as countable ages, all ages as not ages, nonages as all ages, and all ages as one instant. Thereby they enter into all ages.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dus gsum bstan pa ste/ de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams dus gsum shin tu ston to/ /bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'das pa'i dus la 'das par bstan pa dang / 'das pa'i dus la ma 'ongs par bstan pa dang / 'das pa'i dus la da ltar byung bar bstan pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la 'das par bstan pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la da ltar byung bar bstan pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la mi zad par bstan pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la 'das par bstan pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma 'ongs par bstan pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la dus gsum skad cig tu bstan pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dus gsum bstan pa ste/ de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams dus gsum ston par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of explanation of past, present, and future: they speak of the past of the past, the future of the past, and the present of the past; they speak of the past of the future, the present of the future, and the endlessness of the future; they speak of the past of the present, the future of the present, and the equality of the present; they speak of past, present, and future being the one instant of the present. These are the ten ways by which enlightening beings explain all pasts, presents, and futures.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dus gsum la 'jug pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar brda la 'jug pa dang / tshig gi lam la 'jug pa dang / mngon par brjod pa la 'jug pa dang / gdags pa la 'jug pa dang / 'du shes la 'jug pa dang / legs par bsngags pa la 'jug pa dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / mi zad pa la 'jug pa dang / zhi ba la 'jug pa dang / dben pa la 'jug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dus gsum la 'jug pa ste/ de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams dus gsum la 'jug par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten ways of knowing the worlds of past, present, and future: they know their definitions, their speech, their deliberations, their rules, their appellations, their orders, their provisional names, their endlessness, their quiescence, and their total emptiness. Thus do enlightening beings know all things in all times.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi skyo zhing / yongs su sgyid lug pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas thams cad mchod cing rim gro bya bas mi skyo zhing / yongs su sgyid lug pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad bsnyen bkur bas mi skyo zhing / yongs su sgyid lug pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / chos thams cad btsal ba la mi skyo zhing / yongs su sgyid lug pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / chos thams cad mnyan pa la mi skyo zhing / yongs su sgyid lug pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / chos thams cad bstan pa la mi skyo zhing / yongs su sgyid lug pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul bas mi skyo zhing / yongs su sgyid lug pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la rab tu dgod par bya bas mi skyo zhing / yongs su sgyid lug pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par 'jig rten gyi khams re rer byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pas mi skyo zhing / yongs su sgyid lug pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du rjes su spyod pas mi skyo zhing / yongs su sgyid lug pa med pas sems bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rtogs par bya ba dang / yang dag par lta ba la mi skyo zhing / yongs su sgyid lug pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi skyo zhing / yongs su sgyid lug pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po yongs su skyo ba med pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings develop ten kinds of tireless mind: honoring and serving all buddhas tirelessly; attending all spiritual teachers tirelessly; seeking all truths tirelessly; listening to true teaching tirelessly; expounding true teaching tirelessly; educating and civilizing all sentient beings tirelessly; placing all sentient beings in the enlightenment of the buddhas tirelessly; spending untold eons in each and every world carrying out enlightening practices tirelessly; traveling in all worlds tirelessly; examining and pondering all Buddha teachings tirelessly. These are the ten; if enlightening beings abide by these principles they will attain the tireless supreme knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi kun tu dbye ba'i ye shes te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can kun tu dbye ba'i ye shes dang / dbang po kun tu dbye ba'i ye shes dang / las dang rnam par smin pa kun tu dbye ba'i ye shes dang / skye ba kun tu dbye ba'i ye shes dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu dbye ba'i ye shes dang / chos kyi dbyings kun tu dbye ba'i ye shes dang / sangs rgyas kun tu dbye ba'i ye shes dang / chos kun tu dbye ba'i ye shes dang / dus gsum kun tu dbye ba'i ye shes dang / tshig gi rgyud thams cad la ngag gi lam kun tu dbye ba'i ye shes so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi kun tu dbye ba'i ye shes te/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po kun tu dbye ba bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of knowledge of differentiation: knowledge of differentiations of sentient beings, differentiations of faculties, differentiations of consequences of action, differentiations of forms of birth, differentiations of worlds, differentiations of spheres of reality, differentiations of buddhas, differentiations of phenomena, differentiations of times, and differentiations of all ways of speaking. If great enlightening beings rest on these principles, they will attain the buddhas’ unexcelled, far-reaching knowledge of differentiation.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzungs te; bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar chos thams cad mi brjed par 'dzin pa'i phyir thos pa'i gzungs dang / chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu 'byed pa'i phyir chos khong du chud pa'i gzungs dang / chos kyi rang bzhin rjes su rtogs pa'i phyir chos thams cad nges par rtogs pa'i gzungs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa thob pa'i phyir chos snang ba rab tu 'thob pa'i gzungs dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams las chos mngon du thos pa yongs su mi zad pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs dang / sgra skad dang / tha snyad bsam gyis mi khyab pa la 'jug pa'i phyir dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor la 'jug pa'i gzungs dang / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa shin tu ston pa'i phyir dus gsum gyi gzungs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' dang dbus med pa rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad shin tu ston pa'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs su spobs pa'i gzungs dang / sangs rgyas byung ba brjod du med pa thams cad du rna ba'i dbang pos khyar [?] par byed pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa'i rna ba mngon par bsgrub pa'i gzungs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi bsnyengs pa la rab tu 'god pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi gzungs so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzungs te/ de dag thob par bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis brtson par bya ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of mental command: mental command of retaining what they hear, as they retain all teachings without forgetting; mental command of practice, as they skillfully observe all things as they really are; mental command of reflection, as they comprehend the nature of all things; mental command of the light of the teachings, as they illumine the inconceivable attributes of buddha-hood; mental command of concentration, as their minds are not distracted as they hear the teachings of all buddhas of the present; mental command of universal sound, as they understand inconceivable numbers of utterances; mental command of all times, as they expound the inconceivable Buddha teachings of all times; mental command of various intellectual powers, as they expound boundless Buddha teachings; mental command of producing unobstructed ears, as they hear all the teachings of untold buddhas; mental command of all qualities of buddhahood, as they are firmly established in the powers and fearlessnesses of the enlightened. If enlightening beings want to attain these things, they should study and practice diligently.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sangs rgyas bstan pa rjes su rtogs par bya ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar mngon par byang chub pa'i sangs rgyas dang / smon lam gyi sangs rgyas dang / las rnam par smin pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byin gyis brlabs kyi sangs rgyas dang / sprul pa'i sangs rgyas dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi sangs rgyas dang / sems kyi sangs rgyas dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sangs rgyas dang / rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas dang / bsam pa ji lta ba'i sangs rgyas so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas bstan pa rjes su rtogs par bya ba rnams so/ /

“Great enlightening beings speak of ten kinds of Buddha: the Buddha of attainment of true enlightenment, the Buddha of vows, the Buddha of rewards of action, the Buddha of preservation of true teaching, the Buddha of nirvana, the Buddha of the cosmos, the Buddha of mind, the Buddha of concentration, the Buddha of fundamental nature, the Buddha adapting to mentalities.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi kun tu bzang po'i sems bskyed pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems bskyed pa de ni 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa'i phyir byams pa chen po dang ldan pa'o/ /sems bskyed pa de ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po rang gi lus kyis len pa'i phyir snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'o/ /sems bskyed pa de ni ci bdog pa yongs su gtong ba'i phyir gtang ba thams cad yongs su gtong ba sngon du 'gro ba'o/ /sems bskyed pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mngon par mos pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yid la byed pa sngon du 'gro ba'o/ /sems bskyed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa thams cad la nan tan du byed pas yon tan gyis brgyan pa'o/ /sems bskyed pa de ni skye ba'i skye mched thams cad du nyams par mi 'gyur bas rdo rje lta bu'o/ /sems bskyed pa de ni chos dkar po thams cad la yang dag par gzhol bas rgya mtsho lta bu'o/ /sems bskyed pa de ni gzhan gyi ngan du brjod pa dang / ngan du smos pa'i ngag dang / tshig bzod pa'i phyir ri bo chen po'i dbang po dam pa lta bu'o/ /sems bskyed pa de ni sems can thams cad la dbugs phyin pa chen pos sdud pa'i phyir bde bar byed pa'o/ /sems bskyed pa de ni chos thams cad rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rtogs par khong du chud pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi kun tu bzang po'i sems bskyed pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams myur du kun tu bzang po'i ye shes khong du chud pas mkhas pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go ;

“Great enlightening beings develop ten kinds of Universally Good mind: they develop a mind of great benevolence, to save all beings; they develop a mind of great compassion, to bear suffering in place of all beings; they develop a mind of total giving, relinquishing all they have; they develop a mind that thinks of omniscience above all, gladly seeking all Buddha teachings; they develop a mind adorned with virtues, learning all practices of enlightening beings; they develop an adamantine mind, so as not to become heedless wherever they may live; they develop an oceanic mind, as all pure qualities flow in; they develop a mind like a mountain, enduring all harsh words; they develop a peaceful mind, giving to all sentient beings without fear; they develop a mind with ultimate transcendent wisdom, skillfully observing that all things have no existence. If enlightening beings establish these minds, they will soon be able to achieve the skillful knowledge of the enlightening being Universally Good.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i chos te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa thams cad du gnas pa'i smon lam ni kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i chos so/ /ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod cing rim gror bya ba'i smon lam ni kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i chos so/ /sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la dgod pa ni kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i chos so/ /dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsags pa'i smon lam ni kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i chos so/ /pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la 'jug pa'i smon lam ni kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i chos so/ /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i smon lam ni kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i chos so/ /'jig rten gyi khams thams cad brgyan pa'i smon lam ni kun tu bzang pa'i spyod pa'i chos so/ /sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du skye ba gzung ba'i smon lam ni kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i chos so/ /chos thams cad yongs su btsal zhing rab tu dbye ba la mkhas par bya ba'i smon lam ni kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i chos so/ /sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i smon lam ni kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i chos so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i chos te/ de dag gis smon cing mngon par brtson par byas na/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams myur du kun tu bzang po'i smon lam dang / spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go / //

“Great enlightening beings have ten principles of Universally Good practice: vowing to live through all future ages; vowing to serve and honor all buddhas of the future; vowing to settle all sentient beings in the practice of Universally Good enlightening beings; vowing to accumulate all roots of goodness; vowing to enter all ways of transcendence; vowing to fulfill all practices of enlightening beings; vowing to adorn all worlds; vowing to be born in all buddha-lands; vowing to carefully examine all things; vowing to attain supreme enlightenment in all buddha-lands. If enlightening beings practice these principles diligently, they will soon be able to fulfill the practical undertakings of Universal Good.
bam po bdun cu drug pa/

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje chen po rab tu thob pa ste/ de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems can gyi khams la rnam par blta'o/ /bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can gyi khams mgon med pa rnams la rnam par lta ba'i snying rje chen po rab tu thob pa dang / sems can gyi khams theg pa med pa la rnam par lta ba'i snying rje chen po rab tu thob pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa bas dbul ba'i sems can gyi khams la rnam par lta ba'i snying rje chen po rab tu thob pa dang / yun ring po nas gnyid kyi brgyal ba'i sems kyi khams la rnam par lta ba'i snying rje chen po rab tu thob pa dang / dge ba med pa'i sems can gyi khams la rnam par lta ba'i snying rje chen po rab tu thob pa dang / 'dod chags kyi bcing bas glags pa'i sems can gyi khams la rnam par lta ba'i snying rje chen po rab tu thob pa dang / srid pa'i grangs chen mtshor rab tu gzhol bar gyur pa'i sems can gyi khams la rnam par lta ba'i snying rje chen po rab tu thob pa dang / yun ring po nas na ba'i sems can gyi khams la rnam par lta ba'i snying rje chen po rab tu thob pa dang / dge ba'i chos la mos pa med pa'i sems can gyi khams la rnam par lta ba'i snying rje chen po rab tu thob pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos las shin tu 'khyams par gyur pa'i sems can gyi khams la rnam par lta ba'i snying rje chen po rab tu thob pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje chen po rab tu thob pa ste/ de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems can gyi khams la rnam par lta ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings arouse great compassion by ten kinds of observations of sentient beings: they see sentient beings have nothing to rely on for support; they see sentient beings are unruly; they see sentient beings lack virtues; they see sentient beings are asleep in ignorance; they see sentient beings do bad things; they see sentient beings are bound by desires; they see sentient beings are sunk in the sea of birth and death; they see sentient beings chronically suffer from illness; they see sentient beings have no desire for goodness; they see sentient beings have lost the way to enlightenment. Enlightening beings always observe sentient beings with these awarenesses.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rkyen gang gis byang chub tu sems skye bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rkyen rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rnam par gdul bar bya ba'i rkyen ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rkyen to/ /sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po rnam par bzlog pa'i rkyen ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rkyen to/ /sems can thams cad la bde ba'i yo byad kyis sdud pa'i rkyen ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rkyen to/ /sems can thams cad kyi mi shes pa bsal ba'i rkyen ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rkyen to/ /sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi ye shes nye bar bsgrub pa'i rkyen ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rkyen te/ /sangs rgyas thams cad mchod cing rim gro bya ba'i rkyen ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rkyen to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par bya ba'i rkyen ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rkyen to/ /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gzugs dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po yongs su bstan pa'i rkyen ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rkyen to/ /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes la 'jug cing khong du chud par bya ba'i rkyen ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rkyen to/ /sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang / mi bsnyengs pa thams cad yongs su bstan pa'i rkyen ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rkyen to; ; kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi rkyen to/ rkyen de dag gis byang chub kyi sems yang dag par skye bar 'gyur ba dag go /

“There are ten kinds of causes of enlightening beings’ development of the will for enlightenment: they become determined to reach enlightenment to educate and civilize all sentient beings, to remove the mass of suffering of all sentient beings, to bring complete peace and happiness to all sentient beings, to eliminate the delusion of all sentient beings, to bestow enlightened knowledge on all sentient beings, to honor and respect all buddhas, to follow the guidance of the buddhas and please them, to see the marks and embellishments of the physical embodiments of all buddhas, to comprehend the vast knowledge and wisdom of all buddhas, and to manifest the powers and fearlessnesses of the buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa des kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / bsnyen bkur bya'o/ /de dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa'i tshe/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la sems bskyed pa bcu po'di dag bskyed par bya ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar rim gro bya ba'i sems dang / dga' bar bya ba'i sems dang / ji skad bsgo ba bzhin du nan tan du bya ba'i sems dang / yid mi 'byung ba'i sems dang / ji snyam yang mi byed pa'i sems dang / gcig tu nges pa'i sems dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pa'i sems dang / smon lam gcig pa'i sems dang / ston pa'i sems dang / spyod pa mtshungs par yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i sems te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la sems bskyed pa rnams so/ /

“When enlightening beings develop the will for supreme enlightenment and attend and serve spiritual teachers in order to awaken to omniscient knowledge, they should generate ten kinds of spirit: a spirit of service, a spirit of joy, a spirit of noncontention, a spirit of docility, a spirit of not seeking anything else, a spirit of wholehearted devotion, a spirit of having the same virtues, a spirit of having the same vows, a spirit of being in the presence of enlightenment, a spirit of cooperation in perfection of action.

de sems bskyed pa bcu po'di dag bskyed pa'i tshe/ yongs su dag pa bcu rab tu 'thob par 'gyur te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar chud mi za ba'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems can ji lta bur 'dul ba bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir gzugs yongs su dag pa dang / sgra skad dang / tha snyad bsam gyis mi khyab pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir spobs pa yongs su dag pa dang / mi shes pa thams cad dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir ye shes yongs su dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dbang rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir skye ba yongs su dag pa dang / sngon bskal ba mnyam par spyad pa'i sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'khor yongs su dag pa dang / sgrib pa'i las thams cad spangs pas rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa yongs su dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang tshul gcig tu bya ba'i phyir smon lam yongs su dag pa dang / kun tu bzang po'i theg pas 'byung ba'i phyir spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste/ yongs su dag pa bcu po'di dag 'thob par 'gyur ro/ /

“If great enlightening beings arouse such spirits, they will attain ten kinds of purity: purity of profound determination, reaching the ultimate end without corruption; purity of physical embodiment, appearing according to need; purity of voice, comprehending all speech; purity of intellectual powers, skillfully explaining boundless Buddha teachings; purity of wisdom, getting rid of the darkness of all delusion; purity of taking on birth, being imbued with the power of freedom of enlightening beings; purity of company, having fully developed the roots of goodness of sentient beings they worked with in the past; purity of rewards, having removed all obstructions caused by past actions; purity of great vows, being one in essence with all enlightening beings; purity of practices, riding the vehicle of Universal Good to emancipation.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na; 'di ltar bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i stobs kyi bsam pa mi 'khrugs pas sangs rgyas kyi stobs la sbyar ba'i phyir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mos pa thams cad las phyir mi ldog par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / dran pa rtse gcig tu bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / chos thams cad yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi stobs la 'jug pa'i phyir ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / kun tu bzang po'i smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / chos thams cad la yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba'i phyir chos kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten transcendent ways: transcendent giving, relinquishing all they have; transcendent discipline, keeping the precepts of buddhas pure; transcendent tolerance, abiding in the tolerance and forbearance characteristic of the enlightened; transcendent vigor, not regressing in whatever they do; transcendent meditation, focusing their minds on one point; transcendent wisdom, observing all things as they truly are; transcendent knowledge, entering into the powers of buddhas; transcendent vowing, fulfilling the great vows of Universal Good; transcendent spiritual powers, demonstrating all autonomous actions; transcendent teaching, penetrating all buddhas’ teachings. If enlightening beings abide by these principles, they will attain the supreme transcendent knowledge of the buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes pa khong du chud par bya ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la rnam pa tha dad pa shes pa khong du chud par bya ba dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi ris bsam gyis mi khyab pa la 'jug pa'i shes pa khong du chud par bya ba dang / chos thams cad la gcig pa dang / tha dad par yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba'i shes pa khong du chud par bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings 'byams klas pa thams cad shin tu bstan pa'i shes pa khong du chud par bya ba dang / nam mkha'i dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyis klas pa'i shes pa khong du chud par bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi 'jug pa khong du chud par bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la 'das pa'i dus kyi 'jug pa'i shes pa khong du chud par bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi 'jug pa'i shes pa khong du chud par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyod pa dang / smon lam rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya bas gcig tu rtogs par 'gyur ba'i shes pa khong du chud par bya ba dang / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad spyod pa gcig gis byung ba'i shes pa khong du chud par bya ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes pa khong du chud par bya ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos snang ba thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba 'thob pa dang / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du smon lam yongs su rdzogs pa 'thob pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mtshan nyid gcig tu mos pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of conscious knowledge: conscious knowledge of the infinite differentiations of all worlds; conscious knowledge of the inconceivability of all realms of sentient beings; conscious knowledge of all things, each individual being immanent in the variegated manifold, and the variegated manifold being immanent in each individual unit; conscious knowledge of the vastness of all spheres of reality; conscious knowledge of the ultimacy of all realms of space; conscious knowledge of all worlds entering the past; conscious knowledge of all worlds entering the future; conscious knowledge of all worlds entering the present; conscious knowledge of the infinite undertakings and vows of all buddhas reaching fulfillment in one knowledge; conscious knowledge that the buddhas of past, present, and future all attain emancipation by one and the same practice. By these, enlightening beings can attain the illumination of mastery of all truths; their vows will all be fulfilled, and they will be instantly able to understand all buddhas’ techniques and attain true enlightenment.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rab tu rtogs pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar chos thams cad la tshul gcig tu rtogs pa dang / chos thams cad la tshul tha dad par rtogs pa dang / chos thams cad la mtshan nyid gcig tu rtogs pa dang / sems can gyi sems dang / bsam pa thams cad la chags pa med pa'i ye shes su rtogs pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dbang po mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags kyi spyod pa rtogs pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba'i spyod pa rtogs pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i spyod pa thams cad rtogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / smon lam dang / rnam par rtse ba dang / 'phrul ba dang / byin gyi rlabs thams cad rtogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ma lus par mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i byin gyi rlabs rtogs pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rtogs pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad kyi tshul la mkhas pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of realizational knowledge: they know the unity of all things; they know the infinity of all things; they know the presence of all things in a single instant; they know the interpenetration of mental activities of all sentient beings; they know the equality of faculties of all sentient beings; they know the impassioned habitual activities of all sentient beings; they know the mental compulsions of all sentient beings; they know the good and bad acts of all sentient beings; they know all enlightening beings’ vows and practices, masteries, preservation of the Teaching, and mystical transfigurations; they know all buddhas’ fulfillment of the ten powers and attainment of true enlightenment. By these, enlightening beings can attain skillful use of all the teachings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stobs kyi shugs te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la 'jug pa'i stobs kyi shugs dang / chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu'i stobs kyi shugs dang / chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu'i stobs kyi shugs dang / chos thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi chos su 'jug pa'i stobs kyi shugs dang / chos thams cad la mngon par chags pa med pa'i stobs kyi shugs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la shin tu mos pa'i stobs kyi shugs dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad la shin tu gus pa'i bsam pa mi gtong ba'i stobs kyi shugs dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis ye shes kyi rgyal po chen po mnyes par byed pa'i stobs kyi shugs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la zab par yid ches pas mi spangs pa'i stobs kyi shugs dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems las mi ldog par mkhas pa'i stobs kyi shugs so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stobs kyi shugs te/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of power: the power to comprehend the inherent essence of all things; the power to comprehend that all things are like phantoms; the power to comprehend that all things are like illusions; the power to comprehend that all things are Buddha’s teachings; the power to have no attachments to anything at all; the power to clearly understand all things; the power of the respectful mind never abandoning spiritual teachers; the power to cause all roots of goodness to reach supreme knowledge; the power of deep faith in all buddhas’ teachings without rejection; the power of skill in preventing the will for omniscience from backsliding. Based on these powers, enlightening beings can acquire the supreme powers of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid de/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad la mnyam pa nyid dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa thams cad la mnyam pa nyid dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la mnyam pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la mnyam pa nyid dang / smon lam thams cad la mnyam pa nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la mnyam pa nyid dang / spyod pa thams cad la mnyam pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la mnyam pa nyid do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid de/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of impartiality: impartiality toward all sentient beings, all things, all lands, all determinations, all roots of goodness, all enlightening beings, all vows, all ways of transcendence, all practices, and all buddhas.
