If enlightening beings abide by these principles, they will attain the supreme impartiality of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi tshul gyi lam rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar chos thams cad ni ming tsam mo/ /chos thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu'o/ /chos thams cad ni mig yor lta bu'o/ /chos thams cad ni brten pa tsam mo/ /chos thams cad ni las dang bral ba'o/ /chos thams cad ni mi zad pa'i sbyor ba'o/ /chos thams cad ni yang dag pa'i mtha'o/ /chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa'o/ /chos thams cad ni don dam pa'o// chos thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi tshul gyi lam ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshul la mkhas pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of expression of the true meaning of the Buddhas’ Teaching: that is, all things only have names; all things are like illusions; all things are like reflections; all things only originate conditionally; all things are pure in action; all things are just made by words; all things are the ultimate reality; all things are signless; all things are the highest truth; all things are the realm of reality.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos bstan pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar zab mo'i chos bstan pa dang / yangs pa'i chos bstan pa dang / sna tshogs kyi chos bstan pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brjod pa mang po'i chos bstan pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs mngon par bsgrub pa'i chos bstan pa dang / dus gsum dang ldan pa'i chos bstan pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpas bya ba'i chos bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang legs par rab tu brjod pa'i chos bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa thams cad dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i chos bstan pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos bstan pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos bstan pa chen po bla na med pa ston par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings expound ten kinds of teaching: the teaching of profundity; the teaching of enormity; the teaching of variegation; the teaching of omniscience; the teaching of following the ways of transcendence; the teaching of generating the powers of the enlightened; the teaching of the interrelation of past, present, and future; the teaching of causing enlightening beings not to regress; the teaching of praising the virtues of buddhas; the teaching of the sciences of all enlightening beings; the equality of all buddhas, and the interrelation of all spheres of enlightenment. Based on these principles, enlightening beings can accomplish the supremely skillful preaching of the buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su gzung ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs rnams yongs su gzung ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gzungs pa'i chos bstan pa rnams yongs su gzung ba dang / dpe dang mthun par bstun pa thams cad yongs su gzung ba dang / chos kyi tshul dang sgo thams cad yongs su gzung ba dang / gzungs thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo rnams yongs su gzung ba dang / the tshom thams cad yongs su gcod pa rnams yongs su gzung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bsgrub pa thams cad yongs su gzung ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin shin tu bstan pa'i sgo rnams yongs su gzung ba dang / chos snang ba'i sgo thams cad yongs su gzung ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par sprul pa dang / rnam par rol pa dang / byin gyi rlabs rnams yongs su gzung ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su gzung ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po yongs su gzung ba bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings preserve ten things: they preserve all the virtues they have accumulated, all the teachings spoken by all buddhas, all similes, all means of access to true principles, all means of generating mental command, all means of removing doubt and confusion, means of perfecting all enlightening beings, the equal doors of concentration explained by all buddhas, the ways of ingress into the illumination of all truths, and the free exercise of spiritual powers of all buddhas. Based on these principles, enlightening beings can attain the power of preservation of supreme knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spobs pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar chos thams cad la rnam par ma brtags pa'i spobs pa dang / chos thams cad la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i spobs pa dang / chos thams cad la mi gnas pa'i spobs pa dang / chos thams cad la stong pa nyid du snang ba'i spobs pa dang / chos thams cad la mun pa med pa'i spobs pa dang / chos thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi spobs pa dang / chos thams cad la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'i spobs pa dang / chos thams cad la tshig gi bye brag mkhas pa'i spobs pa dang / chos thams cad la de kho na nyid bstan pa'i spobs pa dang / sems can gyi sems dang spyod pa thams cad la bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshim par byed pa'i spobs pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spobs pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spobs pa la mkhas pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of intellectual power: the intellectual power of not arbitrarily discriminating among things; the intellectual power of not fabricating anything; the intellectual power of not being attached to anything; the intellectual power of realizing emptiness; the intellectual power of freedom from the darkness of doubt; the intellectual power of receiving support from Buddha in all things; the intellectual power of spontaneous awareness of all truths; the intellectual power of skill in differentiation of expressions of all truths; the intellectual power of truthfully explaining all things; the intellectual power of gladdening all sentient beings according to their mentalities. Based on these principles, enlightening beings can attain the supremely skillful intellectual powers of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni /byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed cing / 'dul ba'i ye shes kyi dbang dang / chos thams cad snang ba rab tu thob pa'i dbang dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la spyod pa'i dbang dang / ye shes chen po'i dbang dang / mi gnas pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i dbang dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa thams cad las phyir mi ldog pa'i ye shes kyi dbang dang / bdud thams cad shin tu pham par bya ba'i ye shes kyi dbang dang / gang du dga' bar 'gro ba'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i ye shes kyi dbang dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub nam 'dod pa na mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i ye shes kyi dbang ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po'i dbang bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of mastery: mastery of educating and civilizing all sentient beings; mastery of illumining all truths; mastery of cultivating all virtuous practices; mastery of extensive knowledge; mastery of the discipline of nonreliance; mastery of directing all roots of goodness to enlightenment; mastery of undiminishing energy; mastery of wisdom crushing all demons; mastery of inducing the determination for enlightenment according to inclinations; mastery of manifesting attainment of true enlightenment according to the needs of those to be taught. Based on these principles, enlightening beings can attain the mastery of the supreme knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi gnas pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la mi gnas pa dang / sems can thams cad la mi gnas pa dang / chos thams cad la mi gnas pa dang / bya ba thams cad la mi gnas pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la mi gnas pa dang / skye ba'i skye mched thams cad la mi gnas pa dang / smon lam thams cad la mi gnas pa dang / spyod pa thams cad la mi gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la mi gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la mi gnas pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi gnas pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems yangs par bsgyur ba yongs su shes pa'i ye shes yongs su dag cing bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of nonattachment: nonattachment to all worlds, all sentient beings, all phenomena, all actions, all roots of goodness, all places of birth, all vows, all practices, all enlightening beings, and all buddhas. Based on these principles, enlightening beings can quickly overturn all concepts and attain supreme pure wisdom.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems mnyam pa nyid de/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar bsod nams thams cad bsags pa la sems mnyam pa nyid dang / smon lam rnam pa tha dad pas 'byung ba thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can gyi ris thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can gyi las rnam par smin pa la 'jug pa thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid dang / chos la 'jug pa thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid dang / zhing kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can gyi mos pa la 'jug pa thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid dang / spyod pa'i rnam par rtogs pa thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang / mi bsnyengs pa la 'jug pa thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes la 'jug pa khong du chud par bya ba la sems mnyam pa nyid do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems mnyam pa nyid de/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs mnyam pa nyid rgya che zhing bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of equanimity: equanimity in accumulating all virtues; equanimity in undertaking all different vows; equanimity in regard to all living beings; equanimity in regard to the consequences of actions of all living beings; equanimity in regard to all phenomena; equanimity in regard to all pure and defiled lands; equanimity in regard to all phenomena; equanimity in regard to the understandings of all sentient beings; equanimity in regard to nonconceptualization of all practices; equanimity in regard to the nondifference of all buddhas’ powers; equanimity in regard to the wisdom of all buddhas. If enlightening beings rest in these, they will attain the supreme great equanimity of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi mos pa khong du chud par bya ba la zhugs pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs khong du chud par bya ba la zhugs pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa dang / phyogs kyi dra ba rnam par dbye ba thams cad khong du chud par bya ba la zhugs pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams spyi'u tshugs su rgyu ba dang / snrel zhing rgyu ba thams cad khong du chud par bya ba la zhugs pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa dang / chos thams cad gcig pa dang / tha dad pa'i 'byams klas par rnam par dgod pa la mkhas pa khong du chud par bya ba la zhugs pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa dang / lus kyi rgyud thams cad khong du chud par bya ba la 'jug par zhugs pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa dang / 'du shes kyis phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i 'jig rten gyi rnam pa'i 'du shes dang / rlom sems khong du chud par bya ba la zhugs pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa dang / chos kyi rgyud thams cad la 'byung ba gcig gis mthar thug par 'jug pa khong du chud par bya ba la zhugs pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / byin gyi rlabs khong du chud par bya ba la zhugs pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi dus gsum du 'dus pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rigs thams cad rgyun mi gcod pa khong du chud par bya ba la zhugs pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa ste; de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos gang la yang mgo rmongs par mi 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten ways of generating knowledge: they generate knowledge by knowing the understandings of all sentient beings; knowing the various distinctions of all buddha-lands; knowing the domains of the network of the ten directions; knowing all worlds, inverted, upright, and so on; knowing the unity, variety, and universality of all things; knowing all the various physical forms; knowing the misconceptions and delusions of all worldlings without clinging to them; knowing that all truths ultimately lead to emancipation by one path; knowing the spiritual power of the enlightened can enter all universes; knowing that the seed of enlightenment in all sentient beings, past, present, and future, does not die out. Based on these principles, enlightening beings can comprehend all things.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sprul pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can sprul pa dang / lus sprul pa dang / zhing sprul pa dang / mchod pa sprul pa dang / dbyangs sprul pa dang / spyod pa dang smon lam sprul pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba sprul pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa sprul pa dang / chos bstan pa sprul pa dang / byin gyi rlabs sprul pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sprul pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad sprul pa yongs su rdzogs pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of magical displays: magical display of all sentient beings, all bodies, all lands, all gifts, all voices, all practical undertakings, all education and civilization of sentient beings, all attainments of true enlightenment, all explanations of truth, and all empowerments. Based on these phenomena, enlightening beings can acquire all means of supreme magical displays.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / chos kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / sems can gyi byin gyi rlabs dang / las kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / spyod pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / smon lam gyi byin gyi rlabs dang / spyod yul gyi byin gyi rlabs dang / dus kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / dge ba'i byin gyi rlabs dang / ye shes kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs te/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i byin gyi rlabs bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of support of power: support by the power of buddhas, support by the power of truth, support by the power of sentient beings, support by the power of acts, support by the power of practices, support by the power of vows, support by the power of the environment, support by the power of time, support by the power of good, and support by the power of knowledge. Based on these, enlightening beings can gain the support of the power of supreme mastery of all truths.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shin tu dbugs phyin par rab tu rnyed pa bcu ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar sems bskyed de/ ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa gang ji snyed cig 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad mnyes par bya'o zhes dbugs phyin pa chen po rab tu 'thob bo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la yang sangs rgyas kyi tshul dang 'dra ba'i rim gro bla na med pa bya'o/ /mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur bla na med pa bya'o zhes dbugs phyin pa chen po rab tu 'thob bo/ /bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la mchod nas kyang gdams ngag gang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub sems dpa'i sar byung bar gyur pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i gdams ngag dang / man ngag bstan pa mdzad kyi/ gdams ngag dang man ngag de yang bdag gis bsam pa thag pas rim gror byas te/ mnyan la yang dag par nan tan du bya'o zhes dbugs phyin pa chen po rab tu 'thob bo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te/ bdag bskal pa brjod du med par byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur ro zhes dbugs phyin pa chen po rab tu 'thob bo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te/ sngon bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ma zhugs pa'i tshe/ 'di lta ste/ 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa'am/ grags pa med pa'i 'jigs pa'am/ 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa'am/ ngan song gi 'jigs pa'am/ 'khor du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa yang rung ste/ ji snyed kyi 'jigs par gyur pa de dag thams cad ni rnam par bzlog par gyur/ ring du byas par gyur/ rnam par bcil bar gyur te/ byang chub kyi sems bskyed ma thag tu cis kyang mi 'jigs par gyur to/ /mi dngang bar gyur to/ /skyi g.ya' ba med par gyur to/ /cis kyang 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro/ /dngang bar mi 'gyur ro/ /skyi g.ya' bar mi 'gyur ro/ /de bas na brtan zhing rnam par gnon la zil gyis mi non pas bdud dang / mu stegs can dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi thub par gyur to zhes dbugs phyin pa chen po rab tu 'thob bo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems bskyed de/ bdag byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe/ sems can gyi khams thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par bya'o/ /rab tu dgod par bya'o/ /de dag byang chub thob par gyur nas kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la dad pa chen po dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas/ tshe'i tshad kyi mthar thug gi bar du sangs rgyas la 'os pa'i rim gros mchod pa dang / bkur sti bya'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang / sku gzugs la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir mchod rten tshad med pa mang po bya'o/ /de dag gi bstan pa yang yongs su bsrung bar bya'o/ /de dag gi dam pa'i chos kyang yongs su bzung ba bla na med pas yongs su gzung bar bya'o zhes dbugs phyin pa chen po rab tu 'thob bo/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of great joy and solace. Enlightening beings determine to follow, serve, and please all buddhas that emerge in the world throughout the future; thinking of this, they become very happy. They also determine to honor those buddhas with the best of offerings; thinking of this, they become very happy. They also think, ‘When I make offerings to those buddhas, they will surely teach me, and I will faithfully listen with respect and practice according to the Teaching, and will surely always be born in the state of enlightening beings,’ and thinking this they become very happy. They also think, ‘I shall carry out the practices of enlightening beings for untold eons and always be with the enlightening beings and buddhas,’ and they become very happy at this thought. They also think, ‘The fears I had in the past before I set my heart on supreme enlightenment—fear of not being able to live, fear of a bad reputation, fear of death, fear of falling into miserable conditions, fear of the authority of the crowd—have all gone since I set my mind on enlightenment, so that I no longer fear, am not afraid, cannot be intimidated, and cannot be hurt by any demons or cultists.’ With these thoughts they become very happy. They also think, ‘I shall enable all sentient beings to attain supreme enlightenment; after they attain enlightenment, I shall cultivate the practices of enlightening beings in the company of those buddhas for as long as they live, faithfully provide them with offerings appropriate to buddhas, and, after they pass away, set up innumerable monuments to each of them, honor their relics, and preserve the teachings they leave.’ With these thoughts they become very happy.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar sems bskyed de/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad bla na med pa'i mdzes pas brgyan par bya/ spud par bya/ klubs par bya/ yongs su sbyang bar bya/ mnyam par bya/ bsgyur bar bya/ byin gyis brlab par bya/ bskyod par bya/ snang bar bya/ rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul bas dgang bar bya'o zhes dbugs phyin pa chen po rab tu 'thob bo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar sems bskyed de/ sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcad par bya'o/ /nem nur gcad par bya'o/ /bsam pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o/ /sems khong du chud par bya'o/ /nyon mongs pa rnam par bzlog par bya'o/ /ngan song gi sgo gcad par bya'o/ /bde pa'i las kyi sgo dbye bar bya'o/ /mun pa rnam par bsal bar bya'o/ /'od kyis snang bar bya'o/ /bdud thams cad dang / bdud kyi las rnams rab tu gdul bar bya'o/ /bla na med pa'i bde ba chen po 'thob pa 'gro ba thams cad du yang dag par bstan par bya'o/ /rab tu bskyed par bya'o zhes dbugs phyin pa chen po rab tu 'thob bo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar sems bskyed de/ bdag gis sangs rgyas mthong ba ni don yod pa ste/ ji tsam na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas lta bar 'dod pa de tsam na mthong bar 'gyur gyi/ bdag gis sangs rgyas mthong ba ni rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin gshegs pa mngon du 'gyur ba ni rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas/ u dum wa ra'i me tog lta bur bskal pa thams cad du skye zhing mthong bar dka' ba rnams las chos mnyan pa yang rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur te/ de ltar bdag gi bsam pa yongs su dag pas/ sems bskyed pa g.yo thams cad yongs su spangs pa drang ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan pa sgyu'i rnam pa med pas/ sems kyi skad cig re re la sangs rgyas mthong ba'i byin gyi rlabs dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes dbugs phyin pa chen po rab tu 'thob bo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar sems bskyed de/ gang gi tshe bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba de'i tshe/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par 'phrul pas rgyas par dgang ngo/ /bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas nas kyang / 'gro ba thams cad re rer sangs rgyas skye ba yongs su bstan par bya'o/ /bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi rnga chen po brdung bar bya'o/ /chos kyi sprin gyi char chen po mngon par dbab pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa chen po sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa chen po rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir seng ge'i nga ro chen pos rnam par spel pa'i smon lam chen pos/ chos kyi dbyings su gnas pa'i bskal par chos bstan par bya'o/ /'on kyang snying rje chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis bdag gi lus la dub pa med par 'gyur; ngag dang sems la dub pa med par 'gyur ro/ /zhes dbugs phyin pa chen po rab tu 'thob bo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbugs phyin pa chen po rab tu 'thob pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po la mngon par 'tshang rgya ba bla na med par 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

They also think, I shall array all worlds with the finest adornments, filling them with all kinds of marvels, equally pure. I shall also cause all kinds of spiritual powers, sustaining forces, tremors, and shining lights to pervade them all.’ With these thoughts they become very happy. They also think, ‘I shall put an end to the doubts and confusions of all sentient beings, purify all sentient beings’ desires, open up all sentient beings’ minds, annihilate all sentient beings’ afflictions, close the doors of the states of misery for all sentient beings, open the doors of states of felicity for all sentient beings, break through the darkness of all sentient beings, give light to all sentient beings, cause all sentient beings to get free from the action of demons, and cause all sentient beings to reach the abode of peace.’ With these thoughts they become very happy. Great enlightening beings also think, ‘The buddhas are as rare and difficult to meet with as the udumbara flower, which one can hardly get to see once in countless ages. In the future, when I want to see a buddha, I will immediately be able to do so; the buddhas will never abandon me, but will always be with me, allow me to see them, and constantly expound the Teaching to me. After I have heard the Teaching, my mind will be purified, free from deviousness, straightforward, and free from falsehood, and I will always see the buddhas in each moment of thought.’ With these thoughts they become very happy. They also think, ‘In the future I shall attain buddhahood, and by the spiritual power of the enlightened will show the attainment of enlightenment individually to all sentient beings in all worlds, pure and fearless, roaring the great lion’s roar, pervading the cosmos with my original universal undertaking, beating the drum of truth, showering the rain of truth, performing the giving of true teaching, perpetually expounding the truth, with physical, verbal, and mental action, sustained by great compassion, untiring.’ With these thoughts they become very happy. Based on these ten kinds of great joy and solace, enlightening beings can attain the unexcelled great joy and solace of the knowledge and wisdom of true enlightenment.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo la 'jug pa rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'das pa'i dus la 'jug pa 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo la 'jug pa dang po'o/ /'jig rten gyi khams 'grangs pa de dang de dag gi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du ma 'ongs pa'i dus la 'jug pa 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo la 'jug pa gnyis pa'o/ /'jig rten gyi khams 'grangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams yod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams su bstan pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams su shes pa gang ji snyed pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du da ltar byung ba'i dus la 'jug pa 'di ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo la 'jug pa gsum pa'o/ /'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sna tshogs su 'jug pa 'di ni / sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo la 'jug pa bzhi pa'o/ /sems can gyi las dang rnam par smin pa sna tshogs thams cad la 'jug pa 'di ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo la 'jug pa lnga pa'o; /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sna tshogs la 'jug pa 'di ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo la 'jug pa drug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa rnams kyi mtshams sbyor ba shes pa 'di ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo la 'jug pa bdun pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ma byon pa rnams kyi sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa shes pa 'di ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo la 'jug pa brgyad pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras; gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings kyis klas shing nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab tu shes so/ /'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rab tu shes so/ /chos bstan pa rab tu shes so/ /sems can 'dul ba rab tu shes so/ /de bzhin du phyogs bcu kun gyi yang rab tu shes te/ 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo la 'jug pa dgu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi chos rab tu shes so/ /nyan thos kyi chos rab tu shes so/ /rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i chos rab tu shes so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos rab tu shes so/ /chos de dag la'ang rnam par mi rtog pas rab tu zhugs nas rnam pa tha dad par ston te/ chos de dag kyang gzud pa med pa'i tshul gyis chos kyi dbyings su 'dzud do/ /chos rnams rnam par rtag tu med par yang shes la; chos de dag ji lta ba de bzhin du'ang rab tu ston te/ 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo la 'jug pa bcu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo la 'jug pa bcu ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes chen po bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of profound penetration of the buddhas’ teachings: they penetrate all worlds of the past; they penetrate all worlds of the future; they penetrate the numbers, patterns, explanations, and purities of worlds of the present; they penetrate the variety of all worlds; they penetrate the various actions and consequences of all sentient beings; they penetrate the various practices of all enlightening beings; they know the order of appearance of all buddhas of the past; they know the order of appearance of all buddhas of the future; they know the lands and congregations of all buddhas present in the cosmos, their teaching and training; they know principles of the world, principles of Buddhist disciples, principles of individual illuminates, principles of enlightening beings, and principles of buddhas, but though they know all these principles, they have no discrimination, and yet expound various principles. They thoroughly penetrate the realm of reality because there is nothing to penetrate. According to these principles they penetrate the most profound essence of the great knowledge and wisdom of unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod do/ /bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas thams cad mchod pa dang / rim gror bya ba la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod do/ /sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod do/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad dga' bar bya ba la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa byed do/ /dge ba'i rtsa ba rab tu bsags pa la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod do/ /sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod do/ /'gro ba thams cad yongs su mi gtang ba la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod do/ /pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la 'jug pa la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod do/ /byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya pa la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod do/ /byang chub kyi sems tshad med pa la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod do/ /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas su bya ba rnams te/ gnas de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod do/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of basis on which they carry out their practices: they carry out the practices of enlightening beings based on honoring all buddhas, taming all sentient beings, associating with all good companions, accumulating all roots of goodness, purifying all buddha-lands, entering deeply into all transcendent ways, fulfilling all vows of enlightening beings, and on infinite will for enlightenment and the enlightenment of all buddhas. Based on these, enlightening beings carry out their practices.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa bstan pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sgrib pa'i las thams cad rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir; sems brten pa bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rnams kyi brtan pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir/ sems brtan pa bskyed pa dang / bdud thams cad rab tu pham par bya ba'i phyir/ sems brten pa bskyed pa dang / lus dang srog thams cad la mi lta ba'i phyir/ sems brtan pa bskyed pa dang / mu stegs can dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad chos bzhin du tshar gcad pa'i phyir/ sems brtan pa bskyed pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su tshim par bya ba'i phyir/ sems brtan pa bskyed pa dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad mngon par dga' bar bya ba'i phyir/ sems brtan pa bskyed pa dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po thams cad yongs su gdul ba'i phyir/ sems brtan pa bskyed pa dang / chos zab mo rnam par bsgom pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis sa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir/ sems brtan pa bskyed pa dang / bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pas mi skyo ba'i rgyud du bya ba'i phyir/ sems brtan pa bskyed pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa brtan pa rnams te/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po brtan zhing bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of development of fearlessness: they develop fearlessness annihilating all obstructing actions, preserving the true teaching after the extinction of buddhas, conquering all demons, not begrudging their bodies and lives, smashing all the false arguments of heretics, gladdening all sentient beings, causing all congregations to rejoice, taming all spirits, goblins, titans, sprites, and serpents, leaving the states of the two lesser vehicles of individual salvation and entering the most profound teaching, and carrying out enlightening practices tirelessly for untold eons. Based on these enlightening beings can attain the supreme fearlessness of great knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la nem nur thams cad gcod pa'i sems bskyed pa the tshom med cing yid gnyis med la/ som nyi med pa rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar sems bskyed de/ sems can thams cad sbyin pas yongs su bsdu bar bya'o/ /tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyis yongs su bsdu bar bya'o snyam yang / de la de ni de ltar mi 'gyur snyam pa'i nem nur med/ yid gnyis med/ the tshom med de/ de ni gnas ma yin no/ / 'di ni nem nur thams cad gcod pa'i sems bskyed pa dang po'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar sems bskyed de/ ma 'ongs pa'i dus na/ gang ji snyed du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad bla na med pa'i mnyes par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad mchod cing / bsnyen bkur ba'i sems bskyed pas mnyes par bya'o snyam yang / de la de ni de ltar mi 'gyur snyam pa'i nem nur med/ yid gnyis med/ the tshom med de/ de ni gnas ma yin no/ / 'di ni nem nur thams cad gcod pa'i sems bskyed pa gnyis pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar sems bskyed de/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'od zer sna tshogs kyi dra ba'i rgyan gyis yongs su rgyas par dgang ngo snyam yang / de la de ni de ltar mi 'gyur snyam pa'i nem nur med/ yid gnyis med/ the tshom med de/ de ni gnas ma yin no/ 'di ni nem nur thams cad gcod pa'i sems bskyed pa gsum pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar sems bskyed de/ ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa'i mur thug par mi skyo ba'i rgyud kyis sems can tshad med pa yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir/ sems can gyi khams grangs med pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ mtshungs pa med pa/ tshad med pa/ gzhal du med pa/ kun tu mtha' yas pa/ mu med pa/ sa mtshams med pa/ brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa/ grangs dang bgrang ba las 'das pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa thams cad bla na med pa'i yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bla na med pa'i rnam par gdul bas yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par gdul bar bya'o snyam na yang / de la de ni de ltar mi 'gyur snyam pa'i nem nur med/ yid gnyis med/ the tshom med de/ de ni gnas ma yin no/ / 'di ni the tshom thams cad gcod pa'i sems bskyed pa bzhi pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar sems bskyed de/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe/ smon lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes nas/ de la nem nur med cing / yid gnyis med pa dang / the tshom med par gnas pa yin te/ 'di ni nem nur thams cad gcod pa'i sems bskyed pa lnga pa'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten ways of developing a mind free from doubt. They make this determination: ‘I shall take care of all sentient beings by giving; I shall take care of all sentient beings by ethical conduct, tolerance, vigor, meditation, wisdom, benevolence, compassion, joy, and equanimity.’ When they make this determination, they are definitely free from doubt—no doubt can arise in their minds. This is their first way of developing a mind free from doubt. Great enlightening beings also think, ‘When the future buddhas appear in the world, I shall serve and honor them in all ways.’ When they make this determination, they are definitely free from doubt—no doubt can arise in their minds. This is their second development of a mind free from doubt. Great enlightening beings also think, ‘I shall adorn all worlds with various marvelous webs of light.’ When they make this determination, they are definitely free from doubt—no doubt can arise in their minds. This is the third development of a mind free from doubt. Great enlightening beings also think, ‘I shall cultivate the practices of enlightening beings throughout all future ages and fully develop countless sentient beings throughout the entire cosmos by means of the supreme methods of teaching and taming.’ When they make this determination, they are definitely free from doubt—no doubt can arise in their minds. This is the fourth development of a mind free from doubt. Great enlightening beings also think, ‘I shall cultivate the practices of enlightening beings, fulfill the great vows, acquire omniscience, and abide therein.’ When they make this determination, they are definitely free from doubt—no doubt can arise in their minds. This is the fifth development of a mind free from doubt.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam ste/ bdag byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad snang bar gyur pas/ chos thams cad mngon du gyur par 'gyur ro snyam yang / de la de ni de ltar mi 'gyur snyam pa'i nem nur med/ yid gnyis med/ the tshom med de/ de ni gnas ma yin no/ / 'di ni nem nur thams cad gcod pa'i sems bskyed pa drug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam ste/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyi sems khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir/ chos thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos su mos par bya'o snyam yang / de la de ni de ltar mi 'gyur snyam pa'i nem nur med/ yid gnyis med/ the tshom med de/ de ni gnas ma yin no/ / 'di ni nem nur thams cad gcod pa'i sems bskyed pa bdun pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chags pa med pa'i chos kyi sgo thams cad chags pa thams cad mi dmigs pas rab tu shes shing / de la nem nur med/ yid gnyis med/ the tshom med pas/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas kyi bar du yang dag pa nyid la gnas pa 'di ni/ nem nur thams cad gcod pa'i sems bskyed pa brgyad pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas chos thams cad 'du shes kyi phyin ci log rab tu spangs pa dang / blang ba med cing dor ba med pa'i tshul gyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos su shes te/ de la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing nem nur med/ yid gnyis med la/ the tshom med pa yin te; 'di ni nem nur thams cad gcod pa'i sems bskyed pa dgu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te/ 'du shes kyi phyin ci log thams cad rab tu spangs pa'i sems skad cig gcig gi ye shes gcig dang / gnyis su mi dmigs pa bgrang ba thams cad dang bral ba/ 'dus ma byas la shin tu gzhol ba/ brjod pa thams cad rab tu spangs pa/ spyod yul brjod du med pa'i mthar phyin pas/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o snyam yang / de la de ni de ltar mi 'gyur snyam pa'i nem nur med/ yid gnyis med/ the tshom med de/ de ni gnas ma yin no/ / 'di ni nem nur thams cad gcod pa'i sems bskyed pa bcu pa ste; kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la nem nur thams cad gcod pa'i sems bskyed pa the tshom med cing yid gnyis med la som nyi med pa rnams te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la nem nur med pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

Great enlightening beings also think, ‘I shall carry out the practices of enlightening beings for the sake of all beings in the world, become a pure light of all truths, and illumine all the teachings of buddhas.’ When they make this determination, they are definitely free from doubt—no doubt can arise in their minds. This is the sixth development of a mind free from doubt. Great enlightening beings also think, ‘I should know all things are Buddha teachings and explain them to sentient beings according to their mentalities to enlighten them all.’ When they make this determination, they are definitely free from doubt—no doubt can arise in their minds. This is the seventh development of a mind free from doubt. Great enlightening beings also think, ‘I shall attain the way to nonobstruction in the midst of all things, by knowing that all obstructions are ungraspable.’ Thus their minds are free from doubt and they abide in the essence of truth, finally to attain supreme complete perfect enlightenment. When they make this determination they are definitely free from doubt—no doubt can arise in their minds. This is the eighth development of a mind free from doubt. Great enlightening beings also think, ‘I should know that all things are transmundane things, get rid of all false notions and delusions, and adorn myself with the adornment of unity, there being nothing to adorn.’ Here they understand by themselves and not through another. When they make this determination they are definitely free from doubt—no doubt can arise in their minds. This is the ninth development of a mind free from doubt. Great enlightening beings also think, ‘I should realize supreme enlightenment in regard to all things, by getting rid of all false notions and delusions, by attaining instantaneous knowledge, because unity and difference cannot be grasped, by transcending all categories, by ultimate nonfabrication of false descriptions, by detachment from all words, and by dwelling in the realm of ineffability.’ When they make this determination, they are definitely free from doubt—no doubt can arise in their minds. This is the tenth development of a mind free from doubt. Based on these, enlightening beings can be free from all doubt and confusion regarding all Buddha teachings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid de/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin/ smon lam thams cad la bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin/ chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur 'jug pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe/ byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la gnas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba chud mi za zhing rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' zab mo'i chos thams cad la'ang rab tu 'jug pa smon lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs kyi bar du yongs su mya ngan las kyang mi 'da' ba 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa lnga pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe/ mngal du 'gro ba dang / skye ba ba dang / gom pa bdun du 'gro ba dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na gnas pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / dga' ba spyod pa'i sbyor ba dang / snying po byang chub tu 'gro ba dang / bdud 'dul ba dang / rnam par 'tshang rgya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul ba'i byin gyi rlabs thams cad yongs su ston cing / snying rje chen po dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa'i smon lam gyi bar gyis yongs su rgyun mi gcod pa 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa drug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings kyis klas par sems bskyed pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag par ston la/ sems can yongs su smin par bya ba yang rgyun mi gcod pa 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa bdun pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa la mtshan ma yod par 'jug /mtshan ma yod pa la mtshan ma med par 'jug /rtog pa med pa la rtog pa yod par ston /rtog pa yod pa la rtog pa med par ston/ dngos po med pa la dngos po yod par 'jug /dngos po yod pa la dngos po med par 'jug /mngon par 'du byed pa la mngon par 'du bya ba med par ston/ mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la mngon par 'du bya ba yod par ston/ chos thams cad brjod du med pa la brjod du yod par shes/ chos thams cad brjod du yod pa la brjod du med par shes te/ 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa brgyad pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyang sems dang mnyam par shes la/ sems kyang byang chub dang mnyam par shes te/ 'gro ba thams cad kyang sems dang byang chub tu shes mod kyi/ de'i sems phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba med/ 'du shes phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba med/ lta ba phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba med de/ 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dgu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems kyi skad cig re re zhing 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug kyang / yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed/ zag pa zad pa yin yang dge ba'i rtsa ba zag pa zad par mi byed/ chos thams cad zag pa med par yang shes/ zag pa zad par yang shes/ zag pa 'gag par yang shes shing / sangs rgyas kyi chos la 'jig rten gyi chos su 'jug ste/ 'jig rten gyi chos la sangs rgyas kyi chos su 'jug kyang / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis 'jig rten gyi chos la rnam par mi rtog /'jig rten gyi chos kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos la rnam par mi rtog /chos thams cad gzung ba med pa'i tshul du chos kyi dbyings su 'dzud la/ chos thams cad 'gyur ba med pa'i tshul gyis gnyis su med par yang shes pa 'di ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa bcu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams te/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go; ;

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of inconceivability. All their roots of goodness are inconceivable. All their vows are inconceivable. Their knowledge that all things are like illusions is inconceivable. Their arousal of aspiration for enlightenment and cultivation of enlightening practice without losing roots of goodness and without arbitrary notions is inconceivable. Their not grasping extinction and liberation in spite of having profoundly penetrated all things, because all their vows are not fulfilled, is inconceivable. They cultivate the path of enlightening beings and manifest the appearances of incarnation, birth, leaving home, austere practices, going to the site of enlightenment, conquering demons, achieving supreme enlightenment, teaching, and passing away, their spiritual transformations free, unceasing, not abandoning their vow of compassion, saving and protecting sentient beings—all of this is inconceivable. Though they are able to manifest the ten powers of buddhas and their freedom of mystical projection, yet they do not give up the mind equal to the cosmos, and teach sentient beings—this is inconceivable. They know that in all things signlessness is their sign, their signs are signless, nondiscrimination is discrimination, discrimination is nondiscrimination, nonexistence is existence, existence is nonexistence, inaction is action, action is inaction, nonexplanation is explanation, explanation is nonexplanation—this is inconceivable. They know mind is equal to enlightenment, they know enlightenment is equal to mind, they know mind and enlightenment are equal to sentient beings, yet they do not give rise to confusion of mind, confusion of thoughts, or confusion of views—this is inconceivable. From moment to moment they enter absorption in extinction and exhaust all contamination, yet they do not experience ultimate reality and do not end roots of goodness with contamination: though they know all things are free from contamination, yet they know the end and extinction of contaminations; though they know the principles of buddhas are identical to the things of the world and the things of the world are identical to the principles of buddhas, yet they do not form notions of worldly things within the principles of buddhas, and do not form notions of principles of buddhas in the things of the world—all things enter the realm of reality because there is nothing entered; they know all things are nondual because there is no change: this is the tenth inconceivable. These are the ten inconceivabilities of enlightening beings; if enlightening beings abide in them, they will attain the supreme inconceivable qualities of all buddhas.
bam po bdun cu rtsa bdun pa/

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dgongs te bshad pa la mkhas pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rnam grangs thams cad la dgongs te bshad pa la mkhas pa dang / skye ba'i skye mched thams cad la dgongs te bshad pa la mkhas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba thams cad la dgongs te bshad pa la mkhas pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi las kyi rnam par smin par 'jug pa thams cad la dgongs te bshad pa la mkhas pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / rnam par ldang ba la dgongs te bshad pa la mkhas pa dang / chos thams cad chags pa med pa'i sgo'i mthar phyin pa la bsgribs pa med pa'i tshul gyis dgongs te bshad pa la mkhas pa ste/ 'di ni dgongs te bshad pa la mkhas pa drug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i dbyings kyi phyogs re re dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud re re na yang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'grub pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa rgyun mi 'chad cing mtshams med pa shes pa 'di ni dgongs te bshad pa la mkhas pa bdun pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings thams cad du phra ba dang / yangs pa'i 'jug pas yongs su 'jug pa thams cad gzung ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams skye ba nas bzung ste/ yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba chen po'i bar du gzung ba rgyun chad pa med pas/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad sangs rgyas kyis yongs su gang bar 'jug cing / sangs rgyas skye ba thams cad kyang shin tu rnam par phye bar mthong ba 'di ni dgongs te bshad pa la mkhas pa brgyad pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'gro ba thams cad mi 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis mya ngan las 'das par shes kyang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba yongs su ma rdzogs kyi bar du smon lam phyir zlog par mi byed pa 'di ni dgongs te bshad pa la mkhas pa dgu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par yang shes la/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten par yang ring du mi spong / de bzhin gshegs pa la rim gro bya ba yang rgyun mi gcod/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang yang dag par sdud cing / bskyed pa dang / skyong ba dang / brtan par byed pa dang / rnam pa gcig tu byed pa dang / rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu byed pa dang / gcig tu 'byung bar byed pa dang / yongs su grub pa gcig tu byed pa 'di ni dgongs te bshad pa la mkhas pa bcu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dgongs te bshad pa la mkhas pa rnams te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dgongs te bshad pa la mkhas pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of skillful esoteric sayings: the skillful esoteric sayings in all the discourses of buddhas; skillful esoteric sayings about all places of birth; skillful esoteric sayings about all enlightening beings’ spiritual manifestations and attainment of enlightenment; skillful esoteric sayings about the consequences of actions of all sentient beings; skillful esoteric sayings about the defilement and purity produced by all sentient beings; skillful esoteric sayings about how to be ultimately unobstructed in the midst of all things; skillful esoteric sayings about how in every place in space are worlds, some becoming, some decaying, without any gaps in between; skillful esoteric sayings about how everywhere in all places in all universes, in all phenomena, even in microscopic points, there are buddhas manifesting birth, attainment of buddhahood, and entry into final nirvana, filling the cosmos, each distinctly seen; skillful esoteric sayings about seeing all sentient beings as equally nirvanic, being unchanging, yet not giving up great aspirations, causing them to be fulfilled by the vow for omniscience; skillful esoteric sayings about not abandoning teachers in spite of knowing that truths are not realized through the agency of another, honoring the enlightened even more, becoming one with spiritual friends in cultivating, dedicating, and living by virtues, with the same actions, the same essence, the same emancipation, the same fulfillment. Based on these, enlightening beings can master the unexcelled skillful esoteric speech of the buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar zhing thams cad du ye shes rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa dang / sems can gyi skye mched la 'jug par ye shes rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems dang / spyod pa la 'jug par ye shes rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dbang po yongs su shes par ye shes rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi las dang / rnam par smin pa mngon par 'du byed pa la 'jug par ye shes rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa dang / nyan thos kyi spyod pa thams cad la 'jug par ye shes rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa thams cad la 'jug par ye shes rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad la 'jug par ye shes rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad la 'jug par ye shes rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la 'jug par ye shes rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad du ye shes rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of skillful analytic knowledge: skillful analytic knowledge penetrating all lands; skillful analytic knowledge penetrating all abodes of sentient beings; skillful analytic knowledge penetrating the mental activities of all sentient beings; skillful analytic knowledge penetrating the faculties of all sentient beings; skillful analytic knowledge penetrating the consequences of actions of all sentient beings; skillful analytic knowledge penetrating the practices of all Buddhist disciples; skillful analytic knowledge penetrating the practices of all individual illuminates; skillful analytic knowledge penetrating the practices of all enlightening beings; skillful analytic knowledge penetrating all mundane things; skillful analytic knowledge penetrating all principles and attributes of buddhahood. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the supreme knowledge of buddhas that skillfully distinguishes all things.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad shes pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi lus la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / chos thams cad la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas mthong ba thams cad la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bskal par gnas par mkhas pa thams cad la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i lus kyi rgyud kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par ldang ba mkhas pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad khong du chud par bya bas snyoms pa'i ye shes kyis mkhas pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin la sems kyi skad cig gcig gi ye shes kyis 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / chags pa med pa'i sems skad cig gis ye shes kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad yang dag par blang ba la rab tu gnas shing rgyun mi gcod pa'i smon lam chen po'i ye shes mkhas pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis snyoms par 'jug pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad du snyoms par 'jug pa la mkhas pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of entry into concentration: entry into concentration in all worlds; entry into concentration in the bodies of all sentient beings; entry into concentration in all phenomena; entry into concentration seeing all buddhas; entry into concentration and remaining for all ages; entry into concentration and manifesting inconceivable bodies on emerging; entry into concentration in all buddha-bodies; entry into concentration realizing the equality of all sentient beings; entry into concentration instantly comprehending all enlightening beings’ knowledge of concentration; entry into concentration accomplishing all the deeds and vows of enlightening beings in one instant and never ceasing. If enlightening beings abide in these, they will attain the buddhas’ supremely skillful methods of concentration.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ril po rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar ril gyis sems can dang / ril gyis zhing dang / ril gyis mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i 'gro ba dang / ril gyis bskal pa'i me dang / ril gyis chus 'jig pa dang / ril gyis sangs rgyas dang / ril gyis sna tshogs mngon par bsgrub pa dang / ril gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku kha dog mtha' yas pa dang / ril gyis chos thams cad rnam pa sna tshogs su bstan pa dang / ril gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod pa rnam pa tha dad pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ril po ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po'i ril po bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of universal entry: universal entry among sentient beings, into lands, into the various features of worlds, into fires, into floods, into buddhahood, into arrays of adornments, into the embodiments of boundless virtues of buddhas, and into all kinds of explanations of truth. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the buddhas’ means of penetrating everything by great knowledge.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par thar pa rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du lus kyis rgyas par dgang ba'i rnam par thar pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du kha dog du ma dang / kha dog sna tshogs yongs su bstan pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu 'jug pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad byin gyis brlabs pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis brgyan pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du lus kyis rgyas par dgang ba'i rnam par thar pa dang / bdag 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du phyin par shes par bya ba'i rnam par thar pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems kyi skad cig gcig gis 'gro ba'i rnam par thar pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas thams cad skye ba yongs su bstan pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du lus gcig tu shes par bya ba'i rnam par thar pa dang / sems kyi skad cig gcig la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par sprul pa dang / rnam par rol ba dang / mi 'bral ba yongs su bstan pa'i rnam par thar pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par thar pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par thar pas rnam par rol pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of doors of liberation: pervading all worlds with one body, showing infinite various forms in all worlds, putting all worlds in one buddha-field, universally supporting all realms of sentient beings, filling all worlds with the adornment bodies of all buddhas, seeing all worlds in one’s own body, showing the emergence of all buddhas in one world, filling all worlds with one body, and showing the free play of spiritual powers of all buddhas in a single instant. Through these, enlightening beings can attain the supreme door of liberation of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa rnams te; bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pas mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas shing shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba sgrib pa med pa mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas shing shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems dang / spyod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas shing shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i mig thogs pa med pas rnam par blta ba mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas shing shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sems can rnams kyi bsam pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas shing shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bsam gyis mi khyab par lus yongs su bstan pa mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas shing shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med par sems skad cig gis 'gro ba mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas shing shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bsam gyis mi khyab pa brgyan par byin gyis brlab pa la mkhas shing shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / lus kyi rgyud brjod du med par sprul pa yongs su bstan pa mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas shing shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med par bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas so/ /zhes bya bar sems can gyi bsam pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su bstan pa la mkhas shing shes pa'i mngon par shes pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mngon par shes pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par shes pa chen po bsgrub pa la mkhas pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /sems can thams cad la yongs su ston pa'i nan tan byed par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of spiritual power: the power of knowledge of means of remembering past lives; the power of knowledge of means of unhindered clairaudience; the power of knowledge of means of knowing the inconceivably many mental actions of sentient beings; the power of knowledge of means of unobstructed clairvoyant vision; the power of knowledge of means of manifesting inconceivable great mystic powers according to the minds of sentient beings; the power of knowledge of means of appearing in infinite worlds with one body; the power of knowledge of means of entering innumerable worlds in a moment of thought; the power of knowledge of means of producing infinite adornments and adorning inconceivable worlds; the power of knowledge of means of displaying innumerable emanated bodies; the power of knowledge of means of manifesting unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment in untold worlds, in accord with the minds of innumerable sentient beings. Through these, enlightening beings can attain the supreme skillful spiritual power of buddhas, displaying them variously to all sentient beings to make them learn.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rig pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyi las dang / rnam par smin pa mngon par grub pa la mkhas shing shes pa'i rig pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad dmigs pas dben zhing byed pa med pa la spros pa med pa'i sems rab tu zhi ba mngon par grub pa la mkhas shing shes pa'i rig pa dang / dmigs pa thams cad la zhugs pas sems gcig la yang tha dad du dmigs shing / chos thams cad rab tu rtogs pas rdo rje lta bu'i ye shes kyi rig pa dang / dbyangs bsam gyis mi khyab pa byin gyis brlabs pas/ 'jig rten gyi khams mu med par go bar bya bar mngon par grub pa la mkhas shing shes pa'i rig la dang / gnas thams cad yang dag par gzhom pa mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas shing shes pa'i rig pa dang / skye ba la mkhas pa dang / mi skye ba la mkhas pa mngon par bsgrub pa shes pa'i rig pa dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba'i yul thams cad rnam par bzlog pa mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas shing shes pa'i rig pa dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa dang / mtshan nyid dang bral ba med cing rnam par dgod pa gcig tu gyur pa dang / rnam par dgod pa med pa'i tshul gyis rig par bya ba sna tshogs tha dad pa rab tu shes te/ tshad med pa'i bskal par chos ston cing / chos kyi dbyings su gnas pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par 'byung ba 'di ni ye shes kyi rig pa brgyad pa'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of insight: the insight of practical knowledge of the consequences of actions of all sentient beings; the insight of practical knowledge of the quiescence, purity, and non-conceptuality of all realms of sentient beings; the insight of practical knowledge that the mental objects of all sentient beings are of but one character, totally ungraspable, and that all things are indestructible; the insight of practical knowledge of ability to cause infinite subtle utterances to be heard in all worlds; the insight of practical knowledge of how to universally destroy the obsessions of all minds; the insight of practical knowledge of how to appear to be born or not to be born by expedient means; the insight of practical knowledge of abandoning all objects of perception and sensation; the insight of practical knowledge that all things are neither forms nor formless, are of one nature, which is no nature, not discriminating anything yet able to comprehend all kinds of truths and explain them analytically for measureless ages, abiding in the realm of reality and realizing unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'gro ba thams cad mngon par 'grub pa 'gyur ba med pa'i tshul dang / skye ba mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rab tu shes/ rgyu rab tu shes/ rkyen rab tu shes/ dngos po rab tu shes/ dmigs pa rab tu shes/ 'du byed rab tu shes/ skye ba rab tu shes/ 'gog pa rab tu shes/ de kho na bstan pa rab tu shes/ gti mug dang ldan par gyur pa rab tu shes/ gti mug dang bral ba rab tu shes/ phyin ci log rab tu shes/ phyin ci log med pa rab tu shes/ kun nas nyon mongs pa rab tu shes/ rnam par byang ba rab tu shes/ 'khor ba rab tu shes/ mya ngan las 'das pa rab tu shes/ dmigs pa rab tu shes/ dmigs pa med pa rab tu shes/ mngon par chags pa rab tu shes/ mngon par chags pa med pa rab tu shes/ gnas rab tu shes/ gyen du bskyod pa rab tu shes/ zhugs pa rab tu shes/ log pa rab tu shes/ 'jug pa rab tu shes/ ldog pa rab tu shes/ 'jig pa rab tu shes/ 'byung ba rab tu shes/ yongs su smin pa rab tu shes/ dbang po rab tu shes/ snod tha dad pa'i tshul gyis sems can de dag gi 'dul ba'ang rab tu shes/ sems can 'dul zhing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la mgo rmongs pa yang med de/

“Great enlightening beings know that the birth of all sentient beings is fundamentally birthless because they comprehend that birth cannot be grasped: yet they know causes, know conditions, know events, know objects, know actions, know birth, know extinction, know speech, know confusion, know freedom from confusion, know delusion, know freedom from delusion, know defilement, know purity, know birth and death, know nirvana, know graspability, know ungraspability, know attachment, know nonattachment, know rest, know movement, know departure, know return, know origination, know nonorigination, know dissolution, know emancipation, know maturity, know faculties, know how to civilize—they teach beings according to needs, never forgetting the deeds of all enlightening beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ byang chub sems dpas ni/ sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du ma gtogs par/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems ma bskyed de/ de dag gang gi phyir sems bskyed pa'i sems can de dag yongs su smin par byed cing / rnam par 'dul ba'i lus la nyon mongs par mi rtsi'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'gro ba thams cad kyi bya ba dang mi 'gal ba zhes bya ba rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rig pa ste dgu pa'o/ /

Why? Because enlightening beings set their minds on complete perfect enlightenment for the sole purpose of helping sentient beings. Therefore, enlightening beings always edify sentient beings without tiring, in harmony with what is to be done in all worlds. This is called the insight of practical knowledge of interdependent origination.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas gang la yang mngon par chags pa med de/ sangs rgyas la mngon par chags pa mi skyed/ chos gang la yang mngon par chags pa med de/ chos la mngon par chags pa mi skyed/ zhing gang la yang mngon par chags pa med de/ zhing la mngon par chags pa mi skyed/ sems can gang la yang mngon par chags pa med de/ sems can la mngon par chags pa mi skyed/ sems can gang yang mthong ba med de/ sems can yang yongs su smin par byed cing sems can yang yongs su 'dul bar byed/ chos gang yang ston pa med de/ spyod pa yang yongs su sbyong zhing smon lam yang yongs su rdzogs par byed/ snying rje chen po yang rnam par 'phel bar byed/ sangs rgyas kyang mthong bar byed/ de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan pa la yang rjes su 'brang bar byed/ de bzhin gshegs pa dang rgyu mthun pa yang 'thob par byed/ dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed par byed/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul yang rgyun mi 'chad par byed/ de bzhin gshegs pa mchod pa yang rnam par 'phel bar byed/ 'jig rten gyi khams bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa'i sems kyis yongs su skyod par byed/ chos bstan pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyang rab tu shes par byed/ sems can gyi grangs kyang rab tu shes par byed/ sems can rnam pa tha dad pa yang rab tu shes par byed/ sdug bsngal skye ba yang rab tu shes par byed/ sdug bsngal 'gog pa yang rab tu shes par byed de/ 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad sdug bsngal bar shes nas/ mig yor lta bu'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing / skye ba'i skye mched thams cad rtsa ba nas rgyun mi gcod pa'i sems bskyed pas 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir mi spyod pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa la spyod cing / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rigs kyi rjes su bslab pa dang / rtog pa'i phyin ci log thams cad khong du chud pa/ ri bo'i rgyal po chen po dam pa lta bu thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgo la gzhol bas/ sems can thams cad srid pa'i gangs chen mtsho las phyir bzlog pa'i phyir ye shes 'byams klas pa/ che zhing mi g.yo ba'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o/ /zhes bya ba 'di ni shes pa'i rig pa bcu pa'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have no attachment to Buddha and do not develop attachments; they have no attachment to the teachings and do not develop attachments; they have no attachment to lands and do not develop attachments; they have no attachments to sentient beings and do not develop attachments. They do not see that there are sentient beings, yet they carry on educational activity, civilizing and teaching ways of liberation; they do not give up the practices of enlightening beings, with great compassion and great commitment. Seeing buddhas and hearing their teachings, they act accordingly; trusting the buddhas, they plant roots of goodness, ceaselessly honoring and serving them. They are able to shake infinite worlds in the ten directions by spiritual powers; their minds are broad, being equal to the cosmos. They know various explanations of truth, they know how many sentient beings there are, they know the differences among sentient beings, they know the birth of suffering, they know the extinction of suffering; while knowing all acts are like reflected images, they carry out the deeds of enlightening beings. They sever the root of all subjection to birth. They carry out the practices of enlightening beings for the sole purpose of saving all sentient beings and yet do not practice anything. Conforming to the essential nature of all buddhas, they develop a mind like an immense mountain. They know all falsehood and delusion, and enter the door of omniscience. Their knowledge and wisdom are broad and vast and unshakable, due to attain true enlightenment. This is the insight of practical knowledge of equally saving all sentient beings in the ocean of birth and death.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rig pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen pa'i rig pa chen po mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas pa/ bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /
“These are the ten insights; based on these, enlightening beings can attain the supreme insight of practical knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par grol ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba dang / lta ba las rnam par grol ba dang / nye bar len pa las rnam par grol ba dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched las rnam par grol ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa las 'da' ba'i rnam par grol ba dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / 'gro ba'i zhing thams cad nas sems can gyi chos las gyen du bskyod pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par bsgrub pa mtha' dang dbus med pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad la gyen du bskyod de/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa 'thob pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / dus gsum thams cad skad cig gcig gis shes pa'i rnam par grol ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par grol ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las bla na med pa sems can rnams kyis 'thob par byed pa dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of liberation: liberation from afflictions; liberation from false views; liberation from all grasping; liberation from mental and physical elements; liberation transcending the two lesser vehicles of individual emancipation; liberation by accepting the nonorigination of things; liberation by freedom from attachment to all worlds, all lands, all beings, and all things; liberation in infinite abodes, liberation rising from the practices of enlightening beings into the stage of nondiscrimination of buddhas; liberation able to know all pasts, presents, and futures in a single moment. Based on these, enlightening beings can perform the supreme deeds of buddhas and teach and develop all sentient beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis skyed mos tshal te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar yongs su skyo ba med pas 'khor ba'i skyed mos tshal dang / mi dga' ba med pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i skyed mos tshal dang / spyod pa chen po bskyed cing / rab tu 'dzin pas bskal pa thams cad du zhe non pa'i skyed mos tshal dang / rang gi khyim ltar dga' bas 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag pa'i skyed mos tshal dang / bdud kyi yul mngon par 'dul bas bdud kyi khyim thams cad kyi skyed mos tshal dang / tshul bzhin du rab tu rtogs pas ji skad du thos pa'i chos rtogs par gzhog pa'i skyed mos tshal dang / bdag gi pha'i yul la spyod pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi skyed mos tshal dang / chos gzhan yid la mi byed pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / mdor na sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi skyed mos tshal dang / mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i rgyan gyis rnam par gdul ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba mi gtong bas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang / rnam par rtse ba dang / byin gyi rlabs yongs su bstan pa'i skyed mos tshal dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du chos kyi lus kyis rgyas par 'gengs shing / nam mkha'i dbyings dang mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas sems kyi skad cig thams cad la mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang mi 'bral ba 'gro ba thams cad du bstan pa'i skyed mos tshal lo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skyed mos tshal te/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams yongs su skyo ba med pa'i spyod pa chen po bla na med pas dga' ba rab tu 'thob pa dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of grove. Birth-and-death is a grove for enlightening beings because they do not reject it. Teaching sentient beings is a grove for enlightening beings because they do not tire of it. Living in all ages is a grove for enlightening beings because they embrace all great deeds. Purifying the world is a grove for enlightening beings because it is where they themselves sojourn. All abodes of demons are a grove for enlightening beings because they conquer them all. Thinking about the teachings they hear is a grove for enlightening beings because they examine them truthfully. The six ways of transcendence, four means of integration, and thirty-seven aids to enlightenment are a grove for enlightening beings because they succeed to the domain of the Buddha. The ten powers, four fearlessnesses, eighteen unique qualities, and all other aspects of buddhahood are a grove for enlightening beings because they do not think of anything else. Manifesting the autonomous spiritual capacities of all enlightening beings is a grove for enlightening beings because they use great spiritual powers to turn the wheel of teaching unceasingly and civilize sentient beings.
