Instantly showing all sentient beings the attainment of true enlightenment in all places is a grove of enlightening beings because the body of reality pervades all worlds in space. Based on these, enlightening beings can achieve the buddhas’ unexcelled peaceful, happy action, free from sorrow and affliction.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzhal med khang ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar nyams pa med pas byang chub kyi sems kyi gzhal med khang dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par byed pas/ dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyi gzhal med khang dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par byed pas/ tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi la bsam gtan 'cha' ba'i gzhal med khang dang / nyon mongs pa'i dngos po thams cad kyis mi gos pas/ gnas gtsang ma'i lha'i gnas su skye ba'i gzhal med khang dang / sems can mi khom pa thob par las rnam pa bzlog pas/ gzugs med pa'i lha'i rgyud kyi gzhal med khang dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad las sems can gyen du bskyod pas/ kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su ched du bsams te skye ba 'dzin pa'i gzhal med khang dang / sngon lhan cig spyod spyod pa'i sems can yongs su smin par byed pas slas dang / bu dang / bu mo dang / chung ma kun tu ston pa'i gzhal med khang dang / sems can dbang phyug la chags pa rnam par bzlog pas/ gling bzhi dang / 'dzam bu'i gling dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po'i dbang phyug la dbang byed pa'i gzhal med khang dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pas shin tu rnam par rtse ba shes pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad la gnas pa'i dbang phyug la dbang bsgyur bas rnam par rtse ba'i mngon par shes pa'i gzhal med khang dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i rgyan la gnas pas/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyal srid dang / dbang phyug bla na med pa la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi dbang bskur ba yang dag par blang zhing / chos thams cad dbang bsgyur ba'i rgyal srid gzung ba'i gzhal med khang ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras / bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzhal med khang ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'gro ba thams cad du chos kyi dbang bskur bas rnam par 'phrul ba'i byin gyi rlabs bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of palace. The determination for enlightenment is a palace of enlightening beings because they never forget it. The blessing and wisdom of virtuous conduct are a palace of enlightening beings because they civilize sentient beings in the realm of desire. The meditative concentrations of pure benevolence, compassion, joy, and equanimity are a palace of enlightening beings because they teach the sentient beings in the realm of form. Birth in the heaven of pure abodes is a palace of enlightening beings because no afflictions can affect them. Birth in the formless realm is a palace of enlightening beings because they enable sentient beings to escape difficult situations. Birth in the world of defilement is a palace of enlightening beings because they enable all sentient beings to cut off afflictions. Appearing to abide in a mansion with spouse, children, and retinue, is a palace of enlightening beings, because they develop their past associates. Appearing to dwell in the rank of ruler, celestial world guardian, Indra, or Brahma is a palace of enlightening beings, in order to tame beings with the mentality of controllers. Persisting in all practices of enlightening beings, freely exercising spiritual powers and attaining mastery of them all, is a palace of enlightening beings because they autonomously and skillfuly exercise the knowledge of meditations, liberations, and concentrations. The guarantee that all buddhas receive of coronation as a monarch of all knowledge, supremely independent, is a palace of enlightening beings because they abide among the adornments of the ten powers and perform the autonomous deeds of all monarchs of truth. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain coronation by truth and freedom of spiritual powers in all worlds.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dga' ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'khrug pa med pas dran pa'i dga' ba dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pas blo gros kyi dga' ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung nas mngon sum du chos thos pa yongs su zad par mi 'gyur bas rtogs pa'i dga' ba dang / phyogs bcu tshad med par khyab pas blo'i dga' ba dang / sems can gyi lus sgo mtha' yas pa yongs su ston pas byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul ba'i dga' ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo gcig gis ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad la 'jug pas ting nge 'dzin gyi dga' ba dang / thos pa thams cad 'dzin pa nyams pa med par kun tu 'dzin cing / sems can gzhan gyi rgyud kyis 'thob par byed pas gzungs kyi dga' ba dang / tshig gcig dang / yi ge gcig gis bskal pa brjod du med par gzhan dang gzhan du smra zhing / nges pa'i tshig rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu ston pas spobs pa'i dga' ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi lus mtha' yas pa'i sgo'i rgyud du mngon par byang chub pa ston pas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dga' ba dang / bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad chos dang mthun par tshar gcod pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i dga' ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dga' ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi dgyes pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of enjoyment. They enjoy right mindfulness because their minds are not distracted. They enjoy knowledge, distinguishing all things. They enjoy visiting all buddhas, listening to the teachings tirelessly. They like the buddhas because they fill the ten directions without bound. They like enlightening beings because they freely appear in infinite ways for the benefit of sentient beings. They enjoy the doors of concentration because in one door of concentration they enter all doors of concentration. They enjoy mental command of mnemonic formulae because they hold all the doctrines without forgetting and hand them on to others. They enjoy unhindered powers of analysis and elucidation, expounding a single saying inexhaustibly. They enjoy attaining true enlightenment, manifesting bodies in infinite ways, attaining true enlightenment for the sake of sentient beings. They enjoy turning the wheel of true teaching, destroying all misleading doctrines. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the supreme enjoyment of truth of all buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rgyan te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar thub pa med pas stobs kyi rgyan dang / zil gyis mi non pas mi 'jigs pa'i rgyan dang / don brjod du med cing yangs pa brjod pa'i sgo rgyun mi 'chad pas don gyi rgyan dang / chos kyi phung po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi shin tu brtags pa'i chos rab tu ston pa la mgo rmongs pa med pas chos kyi rgyan dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis bya ba'i smon lam las phyir mi ldog pas smon lam gyi rgyan dang / kun tu bzang po'i theg pas 'byung bas spyod pa'i rgyan dang / zhing thams cad zhing gcig tu byin gyis rlob pas zhing gi rgyan dang / zhing thams cad du chos kyi sprin chen po'i char rgyas pa rab tu 'bebs pas dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgyan dang / bskal pa grangs med pa thams cad du spyod pa'i rgyun mi gcod pas byin gyi rlabs kyi rgyan dang / sems can gcig gi lus sems can snyed kyi lus su ston cing / sems kyis khong du chud par byed pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa'i mthu las phyir mi ldog pas 'phrul ba'i rgyan to/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rgyan te/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyan bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of adornment: the adornment of power, being indestructible; the adornment of fearlessness, being invincible; the adornment of meaning, explaining untold meanings inexhaustibly; the adornment of doctrines, contemplating and expounding the collection of eighty-four thousand doctrines without forgetting them; the adornment of vows, the universal vows undertaken by all enlightening beings never regressing; the adornment of deeds, cultivating the deeds of Universal Good and gaining emancipation; the adornment of lands, making all lands one land; the adornment of the universal voice, showering the rain of truth throughout all buddha-worlds; the adornment of empowerment, carrying out innumerable deeds in all ages without cease; the adornment of mystic manifestations, showing in the body of one being as many bodies as there are sentient beings, causing all sentient beings to perceive them and seek all-knowledge without regressing. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the adornment of all supreme attributes of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa mi sgul ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar gtang ba thams cad yongs su gtong zhing / sbyin pa thams cad sbyin par byed pas sems bskyed pa mi sgul ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad nges par rtogs par gzhag pa la sems bskyed pa mi sgul ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod cing rim gro bya ba'i yid la bya ba mang bas sems bskyed pa mi sgul ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis mi 'khrugs pas sems bskyed pa mi sgul ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su mi gtong bas sems bskyed pa mi sgul ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su btsal ba rgyun mi gcod pas sems bskyed pa mi sgul ba dang / bskal pa 'gro ba thams cad dang mnyam pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pas zhum par mi 'gyur/ sgyid lug par mi 'gyur zhing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las phyir mi ldog pas sems bskyed pa mi sgul ba dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dad pa rting tshugs pa dang / rnyog pa med cing dag pa dang / rnam par dag pa dri ma med pa 'od dang bas/ sangs rgyas thams cad bsnyen bkur ba la brtson pa phyir mi ldog pa/ mi zad pa/ mi 'phrogs pa; dga' ba dang / spro ba dang / mos pa chen pos byung ba dang ldan pas sems bskyed pa mi sgul ba dang / thams cad mkhyen par sbyor zhing 'gyur ba'i lam la shin tu grub pas sems bskyed pa mi sgul ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / gdams ngag dang / man ngag dang / bslab pa thams cad gzung zhing mnyan par yongs su mi spong zhing mos par bya ba la sems bskyed pa mi sgul pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa mi sgul ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mi sgul cing / bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

“Great enlightening beings develop ten kinds of unshakable mind: an unshakable mind able to give up all possessions; an unshakable mind pondering and examining all teachings of Buddha; an unshakable mind recollecting and honoring all buddhas; an unshakable mind pledging not to harm living beings; an unshakable mind caring for all sentient beings without choosing between enemies and friends; an unshakable mind ceaselessly seeking all attributes of buddhahood; an unshakable mind carrying out the practice of enlightening beings for untold ages without wearying or regressing; an unshakable mind perfecting well-rooted faith, clear faith, unpolluted faith, pure faith, extremely pure faith, undefiled faith, faith respecting and honoring all buddhas, unregressing faith, inexhaustible faith, indestructible faith, and ecstatic faith; an unshakable mind believing, accepting, and not repudiating the methods of practice of enlightening beings. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the supreme unshakable mind of omniscience.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su mi gtong ba la gnas pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yongs su mi gtong ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rnam par 'dul ba yongs su mi gtong ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gdung bsab pa yongs su mi gtong ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad la bsnyen pa yongs su mi gtong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa bsnyen bkur bya ba yongs su mi gtong ba dang / yon tan thams cad yongs su btsal ba'i phyir/ theg pa chen po yongs su mi gtong ba dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba thams cad du tshangs par spyad pa spyod cing / tshul khrims bsrung ba yongs su mi gtong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung yongs su btsal zhing / yang dag par gzung ba la mkhas pa yongs su mi gtong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / smon lam thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa yongs su mi gtong ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su mi gtong ba la gnas pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

“There are ten kinds of profound great determinations that enlightening beings do not abandon: they do not abandon the profound great determination to fulfill the enlightenment that all buddhas realize, to edify and civilize all sentient beings, to perpetuate the lineage of buddhas, to associate with all good spiritual friends, to honor all buddhas, to wholeheartedly seek all the virtuous qualities of the Great Vehicle of universal salvation, to cultivate religious practice in the company of all buddhas and maintain pure conduct, to associate with all enlightening beings, to seek the means of applying and preserving all Buddha teachings, and to fulfill all practices and vows of enlightening beings and develop all qualities of buddhahood. Based on these, enlightening beings will be able not to abandon all principles of buddhahood.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi rnam par lta ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi tshig rab tu dbye ba bstan par mkhas pa la ye shes kyi rnam par lta ba dang dus gsum gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la ye shes kyis rnam par lta ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad la ye shes kyis rnam par lta ba dang / chos thams cad kyi tshul gyi sgo la ye shes kyis rnam par lta ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs la ye shes kyis rnam par lta ba dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la ye shes kyis rnam par lta ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du chos bstan pa la ye shes kyis rnam par lta ba dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'jug pa la ye shes kyis rnam par lta ba dang / phyogs bcu thams cad du bsam gyis mi khyab pa la ye shes kyis rnam par lta ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi ye shes snang ba chags pa med pa la ye shes kyis rnam par lta ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyis rnam par lta ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen pos rnam par gzigs pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of contemplation of knowledge: contemplation of knowledge of skillfully analyzing and explaining all things, knowing all roots of goodness of past, present, and future, knowing the practices of all enlightening beings, being able to transform freely, knowing the meanings of all doctrines, knowing the powers of all buddhas, knowing all methods of concentration formulae, expounding truth in all worlds, entering all universes, knowing all spaces are inconceivable, and knowing the light of knowledge of all Buddha teachings is unobstructed. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the contemplation of supreme knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos shin tu bstan pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar bstan pa dang / chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur bstan pa dang / chos thams cad nyon mongs pa med pa bstan pa dang / chos thams cad mtha' dang dbus med par bstan pa dang / chos thams cad gnas med par bstan pa dang / chos thams cad rdo rje lta bur bstan pa dang / chos thams cad de bzhin gshegs par bstan pa dang / chos thams cad rab tu zhi bar bstan pa dang / chos thams cad 'byung ba'i lam du bstan pa dang / chos thams cad don gcig pa'i rang bzhin yongs su ma grub par bstan pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos shin tu bstan pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad shin tu bstan pa la mkhas pa thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of explanation of things: they say all things arise from conditions; all things are like magical illusions; all things are free from contradiction; all things are boundless; all things are baseless; all things are indestructible; all things are thus; all things are quiescent; all things are emancipation; all things are one, inherently complete. Based on these, enlightening beings can skillfully explain all things.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su dag pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa dang / the tshom dang yid gnyis rnam par 'thor ba yongs su dag pa dang / lta ba yongs su dag pa dang / spyod yul yongs su dag pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mos pa yongs su dag pa dang / tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa yongs su dag pa dang / mi 'jigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ye shes kyis rnam par spong ba yongs su dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag par dam bcas pa thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa yongs su dag pa dang / bsod nams brgya pa'i mtshan gyi mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan zhing / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi mthar thug pa'i dge ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su dag pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su dag pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su dag pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of purity: purity of determination; purity of cutting through doubts; purity of detachment from views; purity of perspective; purity of the quest for omniscience; purity of intellectual powers; purity of fearlessness; purity of living by the knowledge of all enlightening beings; purity of accepting all the guidelines of behavior of enlightening beings; purity of full development of the felicitous characteristics, pure qualities, and all fundamental virtues of unexcelled enlightenment. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the supreme purity of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyag rgya ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal shes kyang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su btsal bas sgyid lug par byed par 'gyur ba med cing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la zhum par 'gyur ba med la/ mi 'jigs/ mi skrag/ skrag par mi byed de/ smon lam las phyir mi ldog cing / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa rgyun mi gcod cing / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su btsal ba la mthar thug pa med pa 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba'i phyag rgya dang po'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byis pa so so'i skye bo rang gi kun nas nyon mongs pas shin tu 'khrugs par gyur pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' la mi snyan par brjod cing / ngan du zer la/ mi tshul ba dang / rtsub pa'i ngag 'byin cing / sdigs ra byed pa dang / rdo dang / dbyig pa dang / mtshon chas rdeg cing 'debs kyang / de'i rgyus byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su btsal pa las skyo bar mi 'gyur la/ bzod pa dang / mos pa mang bar spyod cing / chos skyon med pa yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i bzod pa dang ldan pa 'di ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba'i phyag rgya gnyis pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa bstan pa'i tshe/ khong nas shes pas 'jug cing mos pa dang / yid ches pa dang / dga' ba dang / mngon par dad par 'gyur ba 'di ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba'i phyag rgya gsum pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rang gi shes pas bdag shes par byed cing / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa/ lhag pa'i bsam pas 'byung bas sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar bya'o/ /bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o/ /dga' ba dang / mos pa dang / spro ba chen pos byung ba'i sems bskyed pa dang / mos pa chen po'i rgyus rnam par 'phel ba'i brtson 'grus chen pos 'gro ba lnga'i rgyud du 'khor zhing nyon mongs pa'i sems can rnams rab tu dgrol bar bya'o snyam pa 'di ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba'i phyag rgya bzhi pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mu med pa la 'jug kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes las mtshams kyis dpog pa mi byed cing / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med pa rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kun tu mtha' yas pa thos shing / tshad 'dzin par mi byed cing / yi ge rnam par dgod pa thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes las mtshams su dpog par mi byed pa 'di ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba'i phyag rgya lnga pa'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of definitive mark. Great enlightening beings, knowing the suffering of pain, the suffering of disintegration, and the suffering of transitoriness, single-mindedly seek the way of enlightenment; without becoming lazy, they carry out the practices of enlightening beings, unwearied, without fear or apprehension or anxiety; not giving up this great undertaking, seeking omniscience steadfastly, not retreating, ultimately attaining unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment: this is their first definitive mark.
“Great enlightening beings, seeing that there are sentient beings who are foolish and deluded to the point of madness, reviling, attacking, and injuring one another by words and weapons, do not abandon the attitude of an enlightening being because of these scenes; they just forbear with tolerance and gentility, concentrate on cultivating the way of enlightenment, abide in the supreme Path, and enter the state of detachment. This is their second definitive mark.
“When great enlightening beings hear explanation of the most profound teaching of buddhas relating to omniscience, they are able by their own knowledge to deeply believe and accept it, to understand and enter into it. This is their third definitive mark.
“Great enlightening beings also think, ‘Having made the profound determination to seek omniscience, I shall become a buddha and attain supreme, complete perfect enlightenment. All sentient beings are flowing in the whirl of mundane conditions, suffering immeasurable pains—I should also get them to set their minds on enlightenment, to believe and delight in it, and to cultivate it diligently and steadfastly without regressing. This is their fourth definitive mark.
“Great enlightening beings know the knowledge of buddhas is boundless and do not try to assess it in limited terms. Enlightening beings, having heard of the boundlessness of buddhas’ knowledge from innumerable buddhas, are able not to make limited assessments. Everything written or said in all worlds has limitations and cannot comprehend the knowledge of buddhas. This is the fifth definitive mark.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu shin tu mos pa yin te/ mos pa gzhan gyis mi thub pa dang / mos pa zab pa dang / mos pa yangs pa dang / mos pa che ba dang / mos pa sna tshogs dang / mos pa zil gyis mi non pa dang / mos pa bla na med pa dang / mos pa brten pa dang / mos pa las mi mtshungs pa'i mos pa dang ldan / zhing; de la bdud thams cad dang / bdud kyi ris kyi lha thams cad dang / mu stegs can gzhan dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyi mes pa de las bzlog par mi nus shing / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa las phyir bzlog par mi nus te/ de lta bu'i mos pa chen po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa'i mos pa dang ldan pa yin te/ 'di ni phyag rgya drug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' mi zlog cing / lus dang srog la mi lta bar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mngon par phyogs shing / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub snang bas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa la spyod cing / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub yongs su mi gtong la/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen pa las phyir mi ldog pa 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba'i phyag rgya bdun pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po la gnas pa'i rigs kyi bu'am/ rigs kyi bu mo rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su btsal bas nye bar ston par byed de/ dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang rab tu gzhog go /ji ltar na byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur zhes te/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems kyis kyang rab tu 'dzin to/ / 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba'i phyag rgya brgyad pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sems la gnas shing / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yang dag par bsgrub pa la brtson pa yin te/ sems can thams cad la yang snying rje chen po bskyed cing / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par chos ston te/ 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba'i phyag rgya dgu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur cing / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rigs rgyun mi gcod pa la shin tu brtson pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi lam gyis 'byung ba la gnas pa yin te/ 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba'i phyag rgya bcu pa'o/ /

“In regard to unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment, great enlightening beings have supreme desire, profound desire, vast desire, great desire, complex desire, insuperable desire, unsurpassed desire, steadfast desire, desire that cannot be destroyed by any demons or false teachers or their cohorts, unyielding desire to seek omniscience. Enlightening beings, dwelling in such desire, ultimately never turn back from supreme enlightenment. This is their sixth definitive mark.
“Great enlightening beings carry out enlightening actions without concern for their own bodies or lives. No one can discourage or frustrate them, because they proceed with determination toward all-knowledge, because the essence of omniscience is always apparent to them, and because they have the light of knowledge of all buddhas. They never give up on the enlightenment of buddhas and never abandon the wise. This is their seventh definitive mark.
“When great enlightening beings see good men and women aiming for the Great Vehicle of universal enlightenment, they foster the growth of their determination to seek buddhahood, cause them to stabilize all foundations of goodness, to internalize the determination for omniscience, and never to turn back from the quest for supreme enlightenment. This is their eighth definitive mark.
“Great enlightening beings cause all sentient beings to achieve an impartial mind, and induce them to cultivate the path of universal knowledge. They explain the truth to sentient beings compassionately and cause them never to turn back on the Path of enlightenment. This is their ninth definitive mark.
“Great enlightening beings have the same foundations of goodness as all buddhas; they perpetuate the seed of buddhahood and ultimately reach omniscient knowledge. This is their tenth definitive mark.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyag rgya ste/ phyag rgya de dag dang ldan na/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya zhing / chos kyi ye shes kyi phyag rgya bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“These are the ten definitive marks of enlightening beings; by these they can quickly achieve supreme perfect enlightenment and become endowed with the mark of buddhas’ unexcelled knowledge of all truths.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes snang ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges te/ sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyis snang bar gyur pa'i ye shes snang ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad blta ba la ye shes snang ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba'i skye mched la ye shes snang ba dang / mdo sde'i chos kyi rnam grangs thams cad la ye shes snang ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad kyi rgyu mthun pas byang chub tu sems bskyed cing / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsags pa la ye shes snang ba dang / sems can rnam par gdul ba la ye shes snang ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la dgod pa la ye shes snang ba dang / chos kyi tshul 'byams klas shing bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa la ye shes snang ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs la mkhas pa la ye shes snang ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la ye shes snang ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ ye shes snang ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la bla na med pa'i ye shes snang ba 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten illuminations of knowledge: the illumination of knowledge of certain attainment of supreme perfect enlightenment; the illumination of knowledge seeing all buddhas; the illumination of knowledge seeing all sentient beings dying in one place and being born in another; the illumination of knowledge understanding the doctrines of all scriptures; the illumination of knowledge developing the determination for enlightenment through association with the wise and accumulation of roots of goodness; the illumination of knowledge showing all buddhas; the illumination of knowledge teaching all sentient beings so they may abide in the state of enlightenment; the illumination of knowledge expounding inconceivable great means of access to truth; the illumination of knowledge skillfully comprehending the spiritual powers of all buddhas; the illumination of knowledge fulfilling all transcendent ways. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the illumination of supreme knowledge of all buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i gnas sems can thams cad dang / nyan thos thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang mtshungs pa med pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i mtha'i gnas kyis gnas kyang / smon lam thams cad yongs su ma rdzogs kyi bar du mngon du mi byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas mtshungs pa med pa dang po'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bskyed par bya ba yang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyis klas par sems bskyed pas skyed par byed la/ chos gang la yang mngon par chags pa med pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas mtshungs med pa gnyis pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sprul pa lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la chos thams cad rab tu zhi bas spyod kyang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mgo rmongs pa yang med pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas mtshungs pa med pa gsum pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'gro ba thams cad las gyen du 'phags pa'i yid la bya bas bskal pa brjod du med par smon lam chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod kyang yongs su skyo ba mi skyed de/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas mtshungs pa med pa bzhi pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dpen pas/ chos thams cad la mi gnas par spyod kyang / thams cad mkhyen par 'byung ba'i chos yongs su ma rdzogs kyi bar du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi byed pa la 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i gnas mtshungs pa med pa lta bu'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa thams cad bskal pa ma yin pa yang shes la/ bskal pa'i grangs kyang rab tu ston te/ de yang yang dag par de kho na bzhin du 'gyur ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas mtshungs pa med pa drug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad mngon par 'du bya ba med par yang shes la/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su btsal ba'i phyir/ mngon par 'du bya ba'i spros pa yang rgyun mi gcod pa 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i gnas mtshungs pa med pa bdun pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' khams gsum thams cad sems tsam du 'jug ste/ dus gsum yang sems tsam du shes la/ sems de yang mtha' dang dbus med par khong du chud pa 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i gnas mtshungs pa med pa brgyad pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems can gcig gi don du yang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa la rab tu gzhag pa'i phyir bskal pa brjod du med par byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod la/ sems can gcig gi don du ji lta ba de bzhin du/ sems can thams cad kyi don du yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa la dgod pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod kyang dus su spyod pas yongs su mi skyo ba yin te/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas mtshungs pa med pa dgu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang yongs su rdzogs la/ sems can thams cad kyi don du 'gyur bas/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang mi rgya zhing / ji srid ji srid du 'khor ba/ de srid de srid du sems can gyi don du phyi phyir zhing tshad med par bya bar 'gyur ro/ /sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu rab tu dgod par 'gyur ro snyam pa 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i gnas mtshungs pa med pa bcu pa'o/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i gnas mtshungs pa med pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la ye shes chen po mtshungs pa med pas gnas pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go / //

“Great enlightening beings have ten peerless states, which no listeners or individual illuminates can equal. Though great enlightening beings see absolute truth, they do not grasp it as their realization, because all their vows are not yet fulfilled; this is their first peerless state. Great enlightening beings plant all roots of goodness, equal to all realities, yet do not have the slightest attachment to them; this is their second peerless state. Great enlightening beings, cultivating the practices of enlightening beings, know they are like phantoms because all things are still and void, yet they have no doubt about the way of buddhahood; this is their third peerless state. Great enlightening beings, though free from the false ideas of the world, still are able to focus their attention and carry out the deeds of enlightening beings for innumerable eons, fulfill their great undertakings, and never give rise to a feeling of weariness therein; this is their fourth peerless state. Great enlightening beings do not grasp anything, because the essence of all things is void, yet they do not experience nirvana, because the path of omniscience is not yet fulfilled; this is their fifth peerless state. Great enlightening beings know that all periods of time are not really periods of time, yet they enumerate periods of time; this is their sixth peerless state. Great enlightening beings know nothing creates anything, yet they do not give up making the way in search of buddhahood; this is their seventh peerless state. Great enlightening beings know that the realms of desire, form, and formlessness are only mind and that past, present, and future are only mind, yet they know perfectly well that mind has no measure and no bounds; this is their eighth peerless state. Great enlightening beings carry out enlightening actions for untold eons for sentient beings one and all, wishing to settle them in the state of omniscience, and yet they never tire or get fed up; this is their ninth peerless state. Great enlightening beings, though their cultivation of practice is completely fulfilled, still do not realize enlightenment, because they reflect, ‘What I do is basically for sentient beings, so I should remain in birth-and-death and help them by expedient means, to settle them on the supreme path of enlightenment.’ This is their tenth peerless state. Based on these ten peerless states, enlightening beings can attain the peerless state of supremely great knowledge and all qualities of buddhahood.
bam po bdun cu rtsa brgyad pa/

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu zhum pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la byang chub sems dpas 'di ltar bdud dang / bdud kyi ris kyi lha thams cad rab tu pham par bya'o snyam ste/ zhum pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / mu stegs can gzhan dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad chos dang mthun par tshar gcad do snyam ste/ zhum pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / legs par bshad pas sems can gyi khams thams cad tshim par bya'o snyam ste/ zhum pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / chos kyi dbyings yongs su rdzogs par bya bas/ pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam ste/ zhum pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba yongs su rdzogs par bya'o/ /yang dag par bsdu bar bya'o snyam ste/ zhum pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / gter chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu brtsams pa chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rdzogs par dka' ba yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam ste; zhum pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad bla na med pa'i yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bla na med pa'i gdul bas yongs su smin par bya'o/ /gdul bar bya'o snyam ste/ zhum pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kha dog du ma dang / kha dog sna tshogs dang / brgya stong du ma las 'das pa'i kha dog tu mos pas bsgyur la / byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o snyam ste/ zhum pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di lta sems bskyed pa dang / bdag byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe/ gang la la zhig gis bdag gi lus la dmigs te/ lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / sha dang / khrag dang / rus pa dang / rkang dang / bu dang / bu mo dang / chung ma dang / glang po dang / rta dang / rgyal srid dang / g.yog 'khor thams cad slong ba zhig byung na de la bdag gis thams cad yongs su gtang bar bya ste/ sems can thams cad la yongs su skyo ba dang ldan pa'i sems gcig kyang mi skyed do/ /sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir/ rnam par smin pa la re ba med cing / snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba dang / byams pa chen po'i mthas gtugs pa'i sems bskyed pas/ lus thams cad kyang yongs su gtang ngo snyam ste/ zhum pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of indomitable attitude. They think, ‘I should conquer all celestial demons and their cohorts.’ This is their first indomitable attitude. They also think, ‘I should destroy all false teachings.’ This is their second indomitable attitude. They also think, ‘I should open sentient beings’ minds and edify them with good words, making them all happy.’ This is their third indomitable attitude. They also think, ‘I should fulfill all transcendent practices throughout the cosmos.’ This is their fourth indomitable attitude. They also think, ‘I should amass all virtues.’ This is their fifth indomitable attitude. They also think, ‘Supreme enlightenment is vast and hard to accomplish; I should cultivate practice to bring it to complete consummation.’ This is their sixth indomitable attitude. They also think, ‘I should teach and tame sentient beings with the supreme teaching and the supreme training.’ This is their seventh indomitable attitude. They also think, ‘All worlds are variously different—I should attain enlightenment there in infinite bodies.’ This is their eighth indomitable attitude. They also think, ‘While I am cultivating the conduct of enlightening beings, if sentient beings should come and ask me for my hands, feet, ears, nose, blood, flesh, bones, marrow, spouse, children, elephant, horse, or royal status, I should be able to give them all up without a single thought of sorrow or regret, doing so only to benefit all sentient beings, not seeking resulting rewards, beginning with great compassion and ending with great kindness.’ This is their ninth indomitable attitude.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te/ dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang / sems can thams cad dang / zhing thams cad dang / 'gro ba thams cad dang / dus thams cad dang / nam mkha'i khams thams cad dang / spyod par brtags pa'i khams thams cad dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams zhi ba gang ji snyed pa thams cad dang / chos tha dad pa de dag thams cad sems skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis shes par bya/ rtogs par bya/ mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya; blta bar bya/ khong du chud par bya/ bsgom par bya/ rnam par bsgom par bya/ mngon par shes par bya/ yongs su shes par bya/ rab tu spang bar bya/ mngon du bya ste/ de dag thams cad la ma brtags/ rnam par ma brtags/ sna tshogs su ma byas/ rnam pa tha dad du ma byas/ ched du bskyod par ma byas/ dmigs par ma byas/ bsgom par ma byas/ rnam par bsgom par ma byas/ gcig tu ma byas/ gnyis su ma byas pa'i ye shes mi gnyis pa gnyis po thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa'i ye shes mtshan nyid thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / rtog pa med pa'i ye shes rtog pa thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / sna tshogs su gyur pa med pa'i ye shes sna tshogs thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / rnam pa tha dad par gyur pa med pa'i ye shes rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / 'jig rten du gyur pa med pa'i ye shes 'jig rten thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams su phyin pa med pa'i ye shes 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rab tu shes pa dang / dus su gyur pa med pa'i ye shes dus thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / sems can gyi sar gyur pa med pa'i ye shes sems can gyi khams thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / mngon par shes pa thams cad las gyen du 'phags pa'i ye shes mngon par chags pa'i spyod yul gyi mthar thug pa dang / gnas med pa la gzhol ba'i ye shes gnas thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i ye shes kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / mi zad pa'i mthar phyin pa'i ye shes zad pa thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / chos kyi dbyings la gzhol ba'i ye shes 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du lus yongs su ston pa dang / brjod pa dang / tshig dang / sgra dang / dbyangs dang bral ba'i ye shes sgra dbyangs brjod du med pa rab tu brjod pa dang / rang bzhin gcig pa'i ye shes rang bzhin med pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / spyod yul gcig la zhugs pa'i ye shes spyod yul tha dad pa yongs su ston pas brjod pa chen po'i byin gyi rlabs yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir/ brjod du med pa'i chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o/ /sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang; gdul ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sa chen po mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o/ /cho 'phrul chen po dang / rnam par 'phrul ba'i cho 'phrul yang 'gro ba thams cad du bstan par bya'o snyam pa 'di ni/ zhum pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa bcu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhum pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la zhum pa med pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur pa dag go /

They also think, ‘All in past, present, and future—all buddhas, all Buddha teachings, all sentient beings, all lands, all worlds, all times, all realms of space, all realms of phenomena, all realms of verbal usage, all realms of tranquil nirvana—all these various things I should, by means of instantaneous discernment, know, be aware of, see, realize, cultivate, and detach from, and have no conceptions of them, being detached from conceptions, not having various notions, having no attributes, no object. They are neither existent nor nonexistent, not one, not dual. I should know all duality by knowledge of nonduality, know all forms by formless knowledge, know all discriminations by nondiscriminatory knowledge, know all differences by knowledge of nondifference, know all distinctions by non-differentiating knowledge, know all worlds by nonworldly knowledge, know all times by timeless knowledge, know all sentient beings by knowledge of nonexistence of sentient beings, know all attachments by unattached knowledge, know all abodes by nonabiding knowledge, know all defilements by undefiled knowledge, know all ends by endless knowledge, appear physically in all worlds by ultimate knowledge of the realm of reality, make untold statements by speechless knowledge, enter absence of intrinsic nature by knowledge of one intrinsic nature, manifest various realms by knowledge of one realm, know all things are inexplicable yet manifest free speech, realize the stage of omniscience, and manifest great spiritual powers and displays in all worlds in order to teach and tame all sentient beings.’ This is their tenth indomitable attitude. Based on these ten indomitable attitudes, enlightening beings can attain the supreme quality of indomitability of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa ri bo lta bu ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos yid la bya bas rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par brtson pa yin te/ 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag pa'i bsam pa ri bo lta bu dang po'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras; gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad mi dmigs pas/ chos thams cad la rang bzhin gyis stong par rnam par lta ba 'di ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag pa'i bsam pa ri bo lta bu gnyis pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa mtha' dang dbus med par chos dkar po thams cad kyi spyod pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing / chos dkar po yang dag par blangs pa thams cad la nan tan du byed pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes tshad med pa yang khong du chud par byed pa 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag pa'i bsam pa ri bo lta bu gsum pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyis/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen la tshul dang 'dra ba'i rim gro byed cing / re ba med pa'i sems bskyed pa chos rku ba dang bral bas nan tan du byed de/ gzhan du na 'di la/ bdag gis de bas kyang rim gro dang / bkur sti rgya chen po bskyed par bya'o/ / 'di la yongs su btang ba thams cad kyang dbul bar bya'o snyam pa 'di ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag pa'i bsam pa ri bo lta bu bzhi pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad las sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzod par byed de/ lus la gnod pa dang / srog la 'bab pa yang nyams su len cing / gshe ba dang / mi snyan du zer ba dang / sdigs pa dang / smod pa dang / khyad du gsod pa thams cad la bzod par byed de/ de'i rgyus nyams par mi 'gyur/ 'khrug par mi 'gyur/ 'khrug pa dang / rnam par 'khrug par mi byed de/ de'i rgyus sems can rnams la snying rje chen po'i go bgos pa yang yongs su mi 'dor/ rgyun mi gcod cing de bas kyang shas cher snying rje chen po rnam par 'phel bar byed do/ /rgyun mi gcod do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni byang chub sems dpa' de chos thams cad yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ba'i btang snyoms dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos thams cad rab tu rtogs pa'i bzod pa dang / des pa'i dbang dang ldan pa'i phyir te/ 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag pa'i bsam pa ri bo lta bu lnga pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams kyis dbang bsgyur ba chen po dang ldan pa yang yin te/ lha la dbang bsgyur ba dang / mi la dbang bsgyur ba dang / gzugs la dbang bsgyur ba dang / stobs la dbang bsgyur ba dang / 'khor la dbang bsgyur ba dang / 'dod pa la dbang bsgyur ba dang / rgyal srid la dbang bsgyur ba dang / dbang phyug la dbang bsgyur ba dang / yon tan la dbang bsgyur ba dang / shes rab la dbang bsgyur ba chen po dang ldan pa yin te/ de rgyal srid kyi bde ba'i dbang du mi 'gyur/ 'dod pa'i bde ba'i dbang du mi 'gyur/ longs spyod kyi bde ba'i dbang du mi 'gyur 'khor gyi bde ba'i dbang du mi 'gyur te/ gzhan du na chos 'dod pa'i chos la gzhol ba/ chos la 'bab pa/ chos la bab pa/ chos kyi mthar thug pa/ chos la brten pa/ chos la skyabs tshol ba/ chos la dpung gnyen tshol ba dang / chos la gnas pa/ chos la don du gnyer ba/ chos la mngon par dga' ba/ chos la tshol ba yin te/ chos nyid la bsam gtan 'cha' zhing gnas pa yin te/ rnam pa de lta bu'i bde ba'i bye brag dang 'grogs pas/ bdud kyi yul la gnas pa ma yin/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de yang ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni byang chub sems dpas sngon sems can thams cad bdag gis bdud kyi yul las rnam par bzlog par bya'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi yul la dgod par bya'o zhes sems bskyed pa'i phyir te/ 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag pa'i bsam pa ri bo lta bu drug pa'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of mind outstanding like a mountain. They attentively cultivate the means of omniscience; this is the first. They always observe that the fundamental nature of all things is empty and ungraspable; this is the second. They vow to carry out the acts of enlightening beings over measureless eons and cultivate all pure qualities, and by living according to all good and pure principles, see and know the boundless wisdom of the buddhas; this is the third. In quest of all aspects of buddhahood, they serve all wise teachers impartially, without seeking anything else, with no ambition to steal the Teaching; with nothing but respect, they are never willful; they are able to give up everything they have, this is the fourth. If anyone reviles and slanders them, beats or wounds them, or even kills them, they can accept it all and do not become disturbed or hostile, and do not give up their universal vow of great compassion—indeed, they continually make it grow even more because they are truly emancipated from all things, have perfected relinquishment, realize the truth of all buddhas, and have mastered forbearance and gentility; this is the fifth. Great enlightening beings develop overmastering great virtues—virtue overmastering celestials, virtue overmastering humans, virtue overmastering form, virtue overmastering power, virtue overmastering dependents, virtue overmastering desire, virtue overmastering kingship, virtue overmastering sovereignty, virtue overmastering felicity, virtue overmastering intelligence—yet though they perfect such virtues, they are never attached to them: that is, they do not cling to enjoyment, desire, wealth, or followers; they only profoundly delight in truth, go according to truth, live according to truth, start out according to truth, end up according to truth, take truth for their reliance, take truth for their salvation, take truth for their refuge, take truth for their home. They guard the truth, love the truth, seek the truth, and ponder the truth. While great enlightening beings experience all kinds of delights of truth, they always avoid all manias, because in the past they determined to enable all sentient beings to get rid of all manias forever and abide in the realm of buddhas. This is their sixth outstanding mind.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu brtson 'grus 'di lta bur brtsams te/ bskal pa grangs med par byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod kyang / de ring kho nar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu gzod zhugs pa tsam du 'dzin te/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas mi 'jigs/ mi skrag /skrag par mi 'gyur zhing / mi 'jigs pa 'di lta bu dang ldan pa yin te/ de ring kho na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba snyam du 'dzin pas/ de phyin chad kyang 'di ltar sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir/ bskal pa tshad med par byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa 'di ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag pa'i bsam pa ri bo lta bu bdun pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol cang shes ma yin pa; gdul dka' ba/ gso dka' ba/ byas pa mi gzo ba/ byas pa mi dran pa shes nas/ de dag rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir/ go cha chen po bgos te/ sems can thams cad kyi sems la dbang bsgyur ba la yang bsam pa'i spyod yul ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa yin te/ sems can 'khu bas skyo bar mi 'gyur zhing / sems can pha rol gyi nyon mongs pas phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag pa'i bsam pa ri bo lta bu brgyad pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di lta bu zhig bdag gis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang dag par bsgrub par 'gyur/ zhes bya bar su la'ang skabs 'byed pa med par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de/ gzhan du na bdag gcig pus phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad par bya'o/ /rang gi rgyud 'di nyid las sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrub par bya'o/ /sems bskyed pa la rag las par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rtogs par bya ste/ byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o/ /rang gi rgyud rnam par sbyang bar bya'o/ /gzhan gyi rgyud rnam par sbyang bar bya'o/ /rang gi yul khong du chud par bya'o/ /gzhan gyi yul khong du chud par bya'o/ /'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / yul gcig tu 'gyur bar bya'o snyam pa 'di ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag pa'i bsam pa ri bo lta bu dgu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni chos gang byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa de lta bu'i chos kyang rjes su mi mthong ngo/ /chos gang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de lta bu'i chos kyang rjes su mi mthong ngo/ /chos gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa'am/ 'tshang rgya ba'am/ 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ches kyang rjes su mi mthong ngo/ /gang gis chos bstan pa dang / ston pa dang / ston par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos kyang rjes su mi mthong ngo/ /de la ston par byed pa de yang mi dmigs la/ chos ston pa nyid kyang mi dmigs te/ 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las smon lam phyir zlog par mi byed do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i spyod pas/ chos thams cad yongs su btsal ba de lta bus ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur te/ de ni gnyen po yongs su sbyang ba dang / shes rab yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir/ las dang dge ba'i rtsa ba de bas kyang shas cher yang dag par sdud do/ /dge ba'i las thams cad yang dag par bsdus pas sems kyi skad cig re re zhing shin tu shas che bar rnam par 'phel te / de la gal te chos 'di dag thams cad de lta bur dpen na/ bdag kyang su zhig gi phyir/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs snyam pa'i 'jigs pa med/ sdang ba med de/ 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag pa'i bsam pa ri bo lta bu bcu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa ri bo lta bu ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po thugs ri bo'i rgyal po lta bu bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

Great enlightening beings have already practiced the way of enlightening beings diligently for immeasurable eons in quest of unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment, yet they still think of themselves as just having set their hearts on enlightenment and carry out the acts of enlightening beings, without fright or fear. Though they are able to attain unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment in an instant, yet for the sake of sentient beings they carry out enlightening practices ceaselessly for measureless eons. This is their seventh outstanding mind. Great enlightening beings know all sentient beings are by nature not harmonious or good and are difficult to harmonize, difficult to liberate, are heedless and ungrateful; therefore, enlightening beings make great vows for their sake, wishing to enable them to attain mental and intellectual freedom and autonomy, to be unhindered in their actions, to give up evil thoughts, and not to afflict others. This is their eighth outstanding mind. Great enlightening beings also think, ‘Nobody makes me aspire to enlightenment, and I do not wait for others to help me cultivate practice. I aspire to enlightenment of my own accord, accumulate the qualities of enlightenment, and am determined to work on my own, traveling the path of enlightening beings forever, and accomplish unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment. For this reason I now cultivate the practice of enlightening beings; I should purify my own mind and also purify others’ minds, I should know my own sphere and also know the spheres of others; I should be equal in perspective to the buddhas of all times.’ This is their ninth outstanding mind. Great enlightening beings perform this contemplation: ‘There is not a single thing that cultivates the practice of enlightening beings, not a single thing that fulfills the practice of enlightening beings, not a single thing that teaches and tames all sentient beings, not a single thing that honors all buddhas, not a single thing that has been or will be or is ever attained or explained in complete enlightenment.’ The teacher and the teaching are both ungraspable, yet they do not abandon unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment. Why? Because enlightening beings search out all things and find they cannot be grasped—this is how they develop supreme perfect enlightenment. Therefore, although they do not obtain anything, yet they diligently cultivate dominant good actions and pure curative measures, so that their knowledge and wisdom develop fully, growing moment by moment to total repletion. They are not frightened by emptiness and do not think, ‘If all things are null, what is the sense of seeking the Path of supreme enlightenment?’ This is their tenth outstanding mind. These are enlightening beings’ ten mountainlike outstanding minds directed toward unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment, based on which enlightening beings can attain the mountainlike outstanding mind of supremely great knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can gyi khams thams cad tshad med par 'jug pa/ 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu dang po'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa la gnas pas 'jug pa med par zhugs pa yin te/ 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu gnyis pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i dbyings tshad med pa thams cad yongs su sbyangs shing / nam mkha' la sgrib pa med pa'i tshul gyis phyogs kyi dra ba rnam par phye ba thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa 'di ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu gsum pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni chos kyi dbyings khong du chud par bya ba la chags pa med par 'jug pa'i tshul dang / chad pa med par 'jug pa'i tshul dang / rtag pa med par 'jug pa'i tshul dang / tshad med par 'jug pa'i tshul dang / 'jug pa med par 'jug pa'i tshul dang / ldog pa med par 'jug pa'i tshul dang / 'jug pa thams cad yongs su shes pa'i tshul gyis shin tu zhugs pa yin te/ 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu bzhi pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sdud cing yongs su gsog ste/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / chos smra pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / so so'i skye bo thams cad la dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed cig byas pa dang / byed pa dang / byed par 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba gang gis 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / de ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa dang / 'tshang rgya ba dang / 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang / chos gang 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bstan pa dang / ston pa dang / ston par 'gyur ba dang / sems can ji snyed cig chos bstan pa de dag la grub pa dang / 'grub pa dang / 'grub par 'gyur ba dang / sems can ji snyed cig dul ba dang / 'dul ba dang / 'dul bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad rab tu shes so/ /mos par byed do/ /rjes su yi rang bar byed do; ;dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su btsal bas kyang skyo bar mi byed/ skyo ba mi skyed de/ 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu lnga pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni 'das pa'i skal pa la 'jug pa ste/ sems bskyed pa re res kyang bskal pa brjod du med pa la 'jug go /bskal pa re re la yang sangs rgyas skye ba khrag khrig phrag brg+ya'am/ khrag khrig phrag stong ngam/ khrag khrig brgya phrag stong ngam/ sangs rgyas skye ba tshad med pa dang; grangs med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mtshungs pa med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / mtha' yas pa dang / mu med pa dang / sa mtshams med pa dang / brjod du med pa la 'jug go /sangs rgyas skye ba grangs dang bgrang ba las 'das pa la 'jug cing shes par byed do/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yang khong du chud par byed do/ /byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang / chos bstan pa dang / sems can gdul ba dang / sku tshe'i tshad dang; byin gyi rlabs dang / bstan pa gnas pa'i rim pa la yang 'jug go /bskal pa gcig la ji ltar zhugs pa de bzhin du bskal pa thams cad la yang 'jug na/ sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa dang / sangs rgyas ma byung ba'i bskal pa lta ci smos te/ bskal pa gang la sems can gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sems can gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par byas pa dang / sems can gang gis ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas mthong bar dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par byas pa de dag kyang / byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes te/ de ltar 'jug pas brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bskal pa la 'jug cing rtog kyang / sngon gyi bskal pa'i dus la 'jug pas ngoms par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu drug pa'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of oceanic knowledge entering into unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment. They penetrate all realms of sentient beings—this is their first oceanic knowledge. They penetrate all worlds without giving rise to arbitrary discriminations—this is their second oceanic knowledge. They know all realms of space are measureless and immaterial, and enter the network of all different worlds in the ten directions—this is their third oceanic knowledge. Great enlightening beings skillfully penetrate phenomena—they penetrate their fluidity, nonannihilation, noneternity, infinity, nonbirth, nondestruction, and totality, because they know them all—this is their fourth oceanic knowledge. Great enlightening beings know the roots of goodness accumulated by the buddhas, enlightening beings, listeners, individual illuminates, and all ordinary people, of the past, present, and future, the roots of goodness they have accumulated, do accumulate, and will accumulate, the roots of goodness already accomplished, now being accomplished, and to be accomplished by the buddhas of all times in perfect enlightenment, and the roots of goodness in the teaching and civilizing of all sentient beings by the buddhas of all times—knowing all these, they believe in them, approve of them, aspire to them, and cultivate them tirelessly; this is their fifth oceanic knowledge. Moment to moment great enlightening beings enter untold eons of the past and know how many buddhas appeared in each eon, no matter how unspeakably many they were, and know their congregations, their teaching and training methods, the life spans of all the sentient beings, and how long their doctrine lasted—all this they see clearly, in each and every eon. They also know if there were sentient beings who planted roots of goodness for enlightenment in ages when there were no buddhas. They also know if there are any sentient beings who will get to see buddhas in the future when their roots of goodness ripen. In this way they tirelessly examine untold eons of the past. This is their sixth oceanic knowledge.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa la 'jug cing / rnam par dpyod la sems shing rtog ste/ ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi bskal pa gang dang gang ni sangs rgyas dang bcas par 'gyur/ bskal pa gang dang gang ni sangs rgyas mi bzhugs par 'gyur/ bskal pa de dag la yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni ji snyed cig 'byung / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi mtshan ni ci zhes bya bar 'gyur/ 'jig rten gyi khams ni gang du/ ming ni ci zhes bya ba zhig tu/ sems can ni ji snyed cig yongs su smin par mdzad par 'gyur/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni sku tshe'i tshad ji tsam dang ldan pa zhig tu 'gyur zhes bskal pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / gcig nas gcig tu 'brel pa thams cad la rtog ste/ de ltar 'jug cing rtog pas bskal pa brjod du med pa zad par byed kyang / phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i dus la 'jug pas ngoms par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu bdun pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' da ltar byung ba'i dus la 'jug cing rtog ste/ phyogs sna tshogs la 'jug par bya ba dang / phyogs bcu rnam pa gnas pa dang / phyogs kyi rgyud bstan pa mtha' yas pa dang / phyogs kyi dra ba dang / phyogs kyi dra ba'i rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad bstan pa dag tu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang / snying po byang chub kyi shing drung du gshegs pa dang / byang chub kyi gzhi la nyug pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / bdud kyi dkrugs ma rab tu pham par mdzad pa dang / rnam par 'tshang rgya ba dang / bzhengs pa dang / grong rdal du gshegs pa dang / lha'i gnas su chos ston pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / sems can gyi khams rnam par 'dul ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba yongs su ston pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su gtong ba dang / sku tshe'i 'du byed spong ba dang / phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / chos kyi tshul yang dag par 'gro ba dang / bstan pa yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / dam pa'i chos gsal bar byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten gyis brgyan par byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la mchod pa byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mchod rten gyi rgyan yid la byed pa dag la sems shing / rnam par sems la yid la byed de/ de lta bur 'jug pas sems bskyed pa re re la yang 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa la 'jug cing; sems can thams cad kyang rtogs par byed/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang mthong bar byed/ dam pa'i chos kyang thos par byed/ thos nas kyang kun chub par byed; dran pas yongs su 'dzin/ blo gros kyis rnam par 'byed/ rtogs pas rnam par 'phel bar byed de/ blos phyogs bcur tshad med par rgyas par byed kyang / sangs rgyas kyi chos la mgo rmongs par mi 'gyur ro/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ rmi lam lta bur rnam par bsgoms pa'i phyir te/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la yang mchod cing rim gror bya ba thams cad byed pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dang de dag gi zhabs drung du bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod cing rim gro byed par brtson par ston kyang / bdag gi lus la yang mngon par chags pa med/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la yang ma yin/ 'jig rten gyi khams la yang ma yin/ chos mnyan pa la yang ma yin/ bskal pa'i grangs la 'jug pa la yang ma yin te/ da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas mthong bas ngoms par yang mi 'gyur la/ chos mnyan pas kyang ma yin/ 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par brtags pas kyang ma yin/ bskal pa'i grangs la 'jug pas kyang ma yin te/ 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu brgyad pa'o/ /

Great enlightening beings penetrate the ages of the future, examine and distinguish all ages, measureless, boundless, and know what ages will have buddhas and what ages will not, how many buddhas will appear in what ages, what the names of each buddha will be, what worlds they will live in, what the names of those worlds will be, how many sentient beings they will liberate, and how long they will live—they observe in this way throughout the future, knowing all endlessly, tirelessly; this is their seventh oceanic knowledge. Great enlightening beings enter the present, observe and reflect, and moment after moment see boundless kinds of worlds in the ten directions, each having buddhas who have attained, are attaining, and will attain supreme enlightenment, as they go to the site of enlightenment, sit under the tree of enlightenment, conquer the demons, attain unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment, get up and go into the city, ascend to the heavens, expound the subtle truth, turn the great wheel of teaching, manifest spiritual powers, tame sentient beings, and finally hand on the teaching of complete enlightenment, give up their lives, and enter final nirvana; after they have entered nirvana, their teachings are collected to preserve them in the world; the buddhas’ monuments are adorned and honored in various ways. The enlightening beings also see the sentient beings in those worlds encounter the buddhas’ teachings, accept and preserve and repeat them, remember and ponder them, and increase in wisdom and understanding. They extend such observations throughout the ten directions and have no misunderstandings about the buddhas’ teachings. Why? Because great enlightening beings know the buddhas are all like dreams, yet they go to all buddhas and honor them. At such times enlightening beings do not cling to their own bodies, they do not cling to the buddhas, they do not ding to the world, they do not cling to the congregation, they do not cling to the preaching, they do not cling to the age; yet they see the buddhas and hear the teachings, observe the world and enter into all ages tirelessly. This is their eighth oceanic knowledge.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro byed/ bkur sti byed/ mchod pa byed de/ bskal pa re re la yang brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro byed/ bkur sti byed/ mchod pa byed cing / bdag gi lus skye ba dang / shi 'pho yongs su bstan pas khams gsum thams cad las 'das pa'i mchod pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba la mchod pa byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa rnams kyi sku gdung la yang bla na med pa'i mchod pas mchod par byed cing / yongs su gtong ba'i sems bsam gyis mi khyab pas sems can gyi khams thams cad shin tu tshim par bya ba'i phyir/ rnam par smin pa la re ba med cing phan gdags pa lhur bya ba dang / phan par 'dod pas yongs su gzung bar sbyin pa byed kyang / sangs rgyas mchod cing rim gror bya ba dang / sems can thams cad la yongs su btang ba shin tu btang bas ngoms par mi 'gyur te/ bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gror bya ba dang / sems can nye bar bsgral ba dang / bstan pa yongs su bzung ba dang / dam pa'i chos brjod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems can gdul bas kyang / ngoms par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu dgu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni; byang chub sems dpa'i gdams ngag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i man ngag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i nan tan dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su smin par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'dul ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mnyam pa nyid dang; byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs kyi sgo'i lam sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang; chos smra ba thams cad las tshol ba dang / yongs su tshol ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / kun chub par byed cing sems can thams cad yongs su bsdu ba dang / bslab pa dang / grub par bya ba dang / sems can de dag la chos bstan pas ngoms par mi 'gyur te/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi tshul gyi rjes su song bas/ bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par sems can brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par rab tu gzhog pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la sbyor yang ngoms par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu bcu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi ye shes chen po rgya mtsho lta bu bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

Great enlightening beings honor countless buddhas in each age, for untold eons, appearing to die in one place and be born in another; they honor the buddhas, as well as the enlightening beings and disciples in their congregations, with all kinds of transmundane offerings. After the buddhas pass away, they honor their relics with unsurpassed offerings and also extensively practice charity, satisfying sentient beings. With an inconceivable mind, a mind not seeking reward, with ultimate determination, determination to provide benefit, great enlightening beings, for the sake of supreme complete perfect enlightenment, honor the buddhas, benefit sentient beings, preserve the true teaching, and reveal and expound it, for untold eons. This is their ninth oceanic knowledge. Great enlightening beings wholeheartedly seek, from all buddhas, from all enlightening beings, from all teachers of truth, the principles expounded by enlightening beings, the principles studied by enlightening beings, the principles taught by enlightening beings, the principles practiced by enlightening beings, the methods of purification of enlightening beings, the methods of development of enlightening beings, the methods of training of enlightening beings, the methods of equanimity of enlightening beings, the method of emancipation of enlightening beings, and enlightening beings’ methods of total mental command. Having obtained these teaching, they absorb and retain them, read and repeat them, analyze and explain them, never tiring of this, causing countless sentient beings to develop an awareness of the Buddha teachings that corresponds to omniscience, to penetrate the characteristics of reality, and to attain nonregression in respect to unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment. Enlightening beings continue this way tirelessly for untold eons; this is their tenth oceanic knowledge. These are the ten oceanic knowledges by which great enlightening beings enter unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment; based on these, enlightening beings can attain the ocean of supreme knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras; bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med par 'gro zhing / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams blta ba dang / de dag la phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu dang po'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams las chos nyan cing thos nas kyang 'dzin cing khong du chud par byed de/ dran pas yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / blo gros kyis rnam par 'byed pa dang / rtogs pas rnam par 'phel bar byed pa dang / blos phyogs bcur tshad med par 'gengs pa 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu gnyis pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di nas kyang mi snang bar ma gyur la/ gzhan du yang lus ston la/ sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang mgo rmongs pa med pa 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu gsum pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chos gcig la rnam par spyod pas chos thams cad shes shing / chos thams cad don gcig pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mthar thug pa'i tshul gyis chos tha dad pa yang dag par bstan pa yang rab tu shes pa 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu bzhi pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa rnam par bzlog pa yang rab tu shes/ nyon mongs pa'i rgyun bcad pa yang rab tu shes/ nyon mongs pa rnam par gzhil ba yang rab tu shes te/ nyon mongs pa spong ba la shin tu gnas kyang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed cing yang dag pa'i mtha' la yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog kyang thob la/ thabs mkhas pa'i bslab pa la shin tu byang bas/ sngon gyi smon lam yongs su bskang ba'i spyod pa de yongs su rdzogs par byed kyang lus dub par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu lnga pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang
