chub sems dpa' ni 'gro ba thams cad sems kyis brtags pa yul na mi gnas pa/ phyogs na mi gnas par yang shes shing 'jug la/ yul dang gnas kyang ston te/ rtog pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa yang med la/ sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba'i phyir mngon par 'du bya ba'i sa la yang spyod pa 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu drug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa dang / sna tshogs ma yin pa dang / rnam pa tha dad pa med pa dang / bgrang ba med pa dang / mtshungs pa med pa dang / kha dog med pa dang; mtshan nyid med pas rang bzhin gcig par rab tu shes te/ gcig tu yang mi dmigs la/ mang po'i rang bzhin du yang yod pa ma yin par rab tu shes te/ byang chub sems dpas chos 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so/ / 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos so/ / 'di dag ni rang sangs rgyas kyi chos so/ / 'di dag ni nyan thos kyi chos so; ;'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'i chos so/ / 'di dag ni dag pa'i chos so/ / 'di dag ni mi dge ba'i chos so/ / 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'i chos so/ / 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so/ / 'di dag ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i chos so/ / 'di dag ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos so/ / 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos so; ;'di dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos so/ / 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos so/ / 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos so zhes bya bar rab tu shes pa 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu bdun pa'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of jewel-like state in unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment. They go to the buddhas in countless worlds, behold them, pay obeisance to them, serve them and honor them with offerings; this is their first jewel-like state. They listen to true teaching from inconceivably many buddhas, absorb it and remember it, analyze and ponder it, increasing in awareness and wisdom, carrying this out everywhere; this is their second jewel-like state.
“They disappear from this land and appear to be born elsewhere, yet have no confusion about the Buddha teaching; this is their third jewel-like state. They know how to elicit all principles from one principle and are able to analyze and expalin each of them, because the various meanings of all principles are ultimately all one meaning; this is their fourth jewel-like state.
“They know how to reject afflictions, how to stop afflictions, how to prevent afflictions, and how to extirpate afflictions; they cultivate the practices of enlightening beings, do not experience absolute truth but ultimately arrive at the further shore of ultimate truth; with expedient skill they learn well what is to be learned and cause their past vows to reach fulfillment, without physical fatigue. This is their fifth jewel-like state.
“They know that all the objects of mental discriminations of enlightening beings have no location, yet they still say there are various locations; though they have no discrimination and do not create anything, yet because they want to tame all sentient beings they do cultivate practices and do act. This is their sixth jewel-like state. They know all things are of one and the same essence, which is no essence, no variety, no infinity, no calculability, no measurability, no form, no characteristics—whether one or many, all are ungraspable: yet they know for certain what the norms of buddhas, enlightening beings, individual illuminates, hearers, and ordinary people are, what things are good and what are not good, what is mundane and what is supramundane, what is in error and what is without error, what is contaminated and what is uncontaminated, what is compounded and what is uncompounded. This is their seventh jewel-like state.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang mi dmigs/ byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs/ chos kyang mi dmigs /sems can yang mi dmigs te/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad gdul ba dang / chos thams cad rtogs par bya ba'i phyir smon lam gyi rgyun kyang mi gcod do/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems la mkhas pas sems can gzhan gyi rab tu rtog pa la mkhas pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dmigs pa la mkhas pas/ sems can thams cad la gdams ngag rjes su ston pa la mkhas pa dang; sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba la mkhas pa'i phyir te/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa de yang smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir spyod pa 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu brgyad pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni 'du shes kyi byin gyi rlabs thams cad la mkhas pas chos rab tu ston cing rnam par 'byed de/ shes par yang byed la/ thabs mkhas pas mya ngan las 'das pa yang yongs su ston te/ de yang phyin ci log med pa dang / nor pa med par rab tu shes te/ byang chub sems dpa' des de bzhin nyid mi g.yo ba'i phyir/ chos thams cad dus gsum mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing / yang dag pa'i mtha' la rab tu rten par yang yang dag par shes te/ sems can gang dul ba'am/ 'dul ba'am/ 'dul bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sems can gang yang rjes su mi mthong la/ byung rgyal du bdag gis bskyed do/ /snyam du yang mi sems te; chos gang skye ba'am/ 'gag par 'gyur ba de lta bu yang mi dmigs te/ chos thams cad la mi gnas pas don yod par 'gyur ba 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu dgu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa re re las kyang rnam pa tha dad du bgrang ba'i tshul gyis bskal pa bgrang ba sna tshogs ming tha dad pa gzhan dang gzhan bskal pa de dang de dag tu gdags pa'i bskal pa gcig bzung ba nas brjod du med pa shin tu bstan pa'i bar du lung bstan pa nyan cing / lung bstan pa de dag thos nas kyang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa la 'khor ba med cing mgo rmongs pa med pa la lung bstan pa de dag rnam pa de lta bur thos nas kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis su mi gsung ba dang / bdag nyid kyi spyod pa'i mthu dang / smon lam gyi khyad par gyis sems can ji ltar smin par byas pa rnams kyi smon lam de dag thams cad chos kyi dbyings khong du chud pas/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su rdzogs par byed pa 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu bcu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rin po che chen po bla na med par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dag go /

Great enlightening beings find that ‘Buddha’ cannot be grasped, enlightening beings’ cannot be grasped, ‘phenomena’ cannot be grasped, and ‘sentient beings’ cannot be grasped; yet they do not give up the vow to tame sentient beings and enable them to attain true enlightenment. Why? Great enlightening beings are skillful observers, and know the mentalities of all sentient beings, and know the perspectives of all sentient beings, and guide them accordingly, so that they can attain nirvana; they practice the deeds of enlightening beings zealously in order to fulfill their vow to enlighten sentient beings. This is their eighth jewel-like state.
“Great enlightening beings know that tactful instruction, manifestation of nirvana, and all means of liberating sentient beings are construed by mind and thought, and are not aberrant or false. Why? Enlightening beings realize that all things are equal in all times; they do not move from Thusness, yet do not abide in ultimate truth; they do not see that there are any sentient beings who ever have received, will receive, or do receive teaching, and they know in themselves they have nothing to practice, there being nothing at all born or perishing that can be grasped; yet they cause their vows not to be in vain by means of all things. This is their ninth jewel-like state.
“Great enlightening beings hear from countless buddhas predictions of future buddhas, each with different names, living in different ages; they listen to this for untold eons and, having heard, cultivate practice, not startled or frightened, not lost or confused, because they know the knowledge of buddhas is inconceivable, because the predictions of the buddhas have no ambiguity in their words, because of the extraordinary power of their own active commitment, and because they foster perfect enlightenment in all who are capable of being taught, fulfilling all their vows, equal in extent to the cosmos. This is their tenth jewel-like state. Based on these ten jewel-like states in unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment, enlightening beings attain the jewel of supreme great knowledge and wisdom of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i go cha rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la chos thams cad mtha' yas pa yin yang / byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar chos thams cad dus gsum ma lus par shes pas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o snyam du sems bskyed pa 'di ni/ theg pa chen po'i go cha rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa dang po'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang skra'i rtse mo'i go dang / sgo re re la yang sems can mtha' yas te/ mu med pas chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi sems can lta smos kyang ci dgos na/ byang chub sems dpa' ni go cha chen po bgos shing / 'di skad du sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa chen po bla na med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig brjod pa 'di ni/ theg pa chen po'i go cha rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa gnyis pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras; gzhan yang 'jig rten gyi khams rnams ni mtha' yas mu med pa ste/ ris med la sa mtshams med pa na/ byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba bla na med pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yongs su spyad bar bya'o/ /zhes smon lam mngon par sgrub cing / de yang yang dag pa dang / dben par yongs su sbyong ba 'di ni/ theg pa chen po'i go cha rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa gsum pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang 'gro ba thams cad ni mtha' yas mu med pa ste; ris med la sa mtshams med pa na/ byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar 'gro ba thams cad bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba chen pos snang bar bya'o zhes te/ dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni/ theg pa chen po'i go cha rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa bzhi pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mtha' yas mu med pa ste/ ris med la sa mtshams med pa na/ byang chub sems dpa' ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing / 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mnyes par byas pa'i 'og tu bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni/ theg pa chen po'i go cha rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa lnga pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mthong ste/ chos kyang nyan la dga' ba dang / spro ba bskyed kyang rang gi lus la yang mngon par chags par mi byed de/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la yang mngon par chags par mi byed cing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku de dag kyang yod par yang mi byed/ med par yang mi byed/ med pa ma yin par yang mi byed/ yod pa ma yin par yang mi byed/ dngos por yang mi byed/ dngos po med par yang mi byed/ gzugs su yang mi byed/ mtshan du yang mi byed/ 'byung bar yang mi byed/ 'jig par yang mi byed/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku de dag skye bar yang mi byed/ 'jig par yang mi byed/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la dngos por yang mi 'jug ste/ dngos po chud za bar yang mi byed do/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni dngos po thams cad ma bzung ba'i phyir te/ 'di ni theg pa chen po'i go cha rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa drug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems can gzhan dang / gang zag gzhan dag gis mgo bcad par gyur tam/ lag pa bcad dam/ rkang pa bcad dam/ rna ba dang / sna bcad dam/ mig phyung bar gyur tam/ gshe'am/ mi snyan par zer ram/ rdeg gam/ sdigs sam/ smod dam/ 'ching ngam/ co 'dri 'am/ tho 'tsham yang bzod cing de'i rgyus sems khro bar mi 'gyur/ 'khrug pa dang rnam par 'khrug par mi 'gyur/ gnod par sems pa dang / khong khro bar mi 'gyur te/ brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bskal par byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod kyang; sems can thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i sems mi bskyed do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad mi gnyis par rnam par spyad pa'i bslab pa la slob cing / mi 'khrugs pa'i bsam pas sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal du byas pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad rang gi lus kyis nyams su blang bas bzod par byed cing btang snyoms su gnas pa 'di ni/ theg pa chen po'i go cha rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa bdun pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ni mtha' med de/ thug pa med cing rgyun 'chad pa med pa yin na/ byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa 'grangs pa chos kyi dbyings kyis gtugs pa; nam mkha'i dbyings ltar gnas pa gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can yongs su smin par bya bas/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad par bya'o/ /'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu ji ltar spyad pa de bzhin du/ 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mtha' gtugs pa thams cad du yang spyad par bya'o zhes sems bskyed kyang de lta bu'i dus su spyod pas/ sdang ba med cing / mi 'jigs/ mi skrag go / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ltar sems can thams cad kyi don du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa nyams su len pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i yi dam bstan pa ste/ 'di ni theg pa chen po'i go cha rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa brgyad pa'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings generate ten kinds of adamantine mind of commitment to universal enlightenment. They think, ‘All truths are boundless, inexhaustible; I should realize them thoroughly by means of knowledge comprehending past, present, and future.’ This is their first adamantine commitment to universal enlightenment.
“They also think, ‘There are infinite sentient beings even on a point the size of a hairtip, to say nothing of in all universes—I should calm them and liberate them by means of unexcelled nirvana.’ This is their second adamantine commitment to universal enlightenment.
“They also think, ‘The worlds of the ten directions are measureless, boundless, limitless, inexhaustible: I should adorn them all with the finest adornments of the buddha-lands, with all the adornments being truly real.’ This is their third adamantine commitment to universal enlightenment.
“They also think, ‘Sentient beings are measureless, boundless, limitless, inexhaustible: I should dedicate all roots of goodness to them and illumine them with the light of unexcelled knowledge.’ This is their fourth adamantine commitment to universal enlightenment.
“They also think, ‘The buddhas are infinite, boundless, unlimited, inexhaustible: I should dedicate the roots of goodness I plant to offer to them, causing those roots of goodness to reach everywhere, with no lack; after that I will attain unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.’ This is their fifth adamantine commitment to universal enlightenment.
“Seeing all buddhas and hearing their teachings, great enlightening beings become very joyful: not attached to their own bodies or to the bodies of buddhas, they understand the body of a buddha is not real or unreal, not existent or nonexistent, not of a particular nature, not without nature, not material, not immaterial, not form, not formless, not born, not extinct, really without existence yet not destroying existence. Why? Because it cannot be grasped through any nature or characteristic at all. This is their sixth adamantine commitment to universal enlightenment.
“If anyone should revile or beat enlightening beings, cut off their hands or feet, gouge out their eyes, or even cut off their heads, they are able to bear it all and never become angry or vicious as a result of this. They cultivate the practices of enlightening beings for countless eons, taking care of sentient beings, never abandoning them. Why? Because enlightening beings have already observed all things to be nondual, and their minds are undisturbed. They can give up their own bodies and endure those pains. This is their seventh adamantine commitment to universal enlightenment.
“Great enlightening beings also think, ‘The ages of the future are infinite, boundless, limitless, inexhaustible: I should travel the path of enlightening beings throughout those ages in one world, teaching sentient beings, and do the same in all worlds in the space of the cosmos, without fright or fear. Why? Because this is the way the path of enlightening beings should be in principle, cultivated for the sake of all sentient beings.’ This is their eighth adamantine commitment to universal enlightenment.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems la rag lus par yid ches par byas te/ bsam pa yongs su dag pas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sdud cing yongs su rdzogs par byed de/ nam 'dod par gyur pa de'i tshe/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes byang chub la/ dbang bsgyur bar gnas shing / bgegs med pa'i lam du zhugs pa dang / nye bar len pa'i rkyen thams cad yongs su byang bas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu brten pa thogs pa med kyang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste/ de yang ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir te/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyis klas te spyod pa 'di ni/ theg pa chen po'i go cha rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa dgu ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mi dmigs/ byang chub kyang mi dmigs/ byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs/ chos thams cad kyang mi dmigs/ sems can thams cad kyang mi dmigs/ sems kyang mi dmigs/ spyod pa yang mi dmigs/ sngon gyi mtha' yang mi dmigs/ phyi ma'i mtha' yang mi dmigs/ da ltar byung ba yang mi dmigs/ 'gro ba thams cad kyang mi dmigs/ 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyang mi dmigs te/ de de ltar dben bar gnas pa yin/ de ltar zab mo la gnas pa dang / de ltar zhi ba la gnas pa dang / de ltar nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa dang / de ltar brjod du med pa la gnas pa dang / de ltar gnyis su med pa la gnas pa dang / de ltar rtog pa med pa la gnas pa dang / de ltar chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la gnas pa dang / de ltar rig pa la gnas pa dang / de ltar grol ba la gnas pa dang / de ltar mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa dang / de ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa yin yang smon lam gyi rgyun kyang mi gcod/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / sems can gdul ba dang / sangs rgyas mchod cing rim gror bya ba dang / chos bstan pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgyan pa'i rgyun kyang mi gcod do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ci'i phyir zhe na; 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni smon lam chen pos shin tu byung ba'i phyir te/ gang gis chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid 'di lta bur rab tu shes pa ni snying rje chen po de bas kyang rnam par 'phel bar byed/ yon tan brjod du med pas kyang sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i sems cher bskyed de/ de ltar dngos po med pa'i chos thams cad la yang byis pa so so'i skye bo kun tu gti mug pa 'di dag gis chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin khong du mi chud mi shes kyi/ de khong du chud par bya'o/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'gro ba thams cad na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams las lhag par zhi ba'i gnas kyang med na/ de dag gis kyang chos de lta bur bstan te/ sems can yang yongs su smin par mdzad cing / thugs rje chen po yang ma glod na bdag cag gis lta sems bskyed pa bden pa'i tshig la gnas la mi slu ba/ sangs rgyas dang chos kyi rigs thams cad mi gcod pa/ smon lam chen pos mngon du byas pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don la gdon mi zar sems bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad shin tu bsags pas yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa'i gnas pa la rab tu gnas pa ye shes zab mos mngon par bsgrubs pa 'gro ba'i tshogs thams cad khong du chud pa dang / sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i chos sbyin pa chen po la bod bod la; sems can thams cad grol bar ma byas/ sems can thams cad sangs rgyas su phyin par ma byas/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par ma byas te/ smon lam chen po yongs su ma rdzogs par snying rje chen po yang ji ltar glod par bya/ smon lam chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam pa 'di ni theg pa chen po'i go cha rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa bcu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i go cha rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par mkhyen pa chen po'i ye shes rdo rje lta bu thob par 'gyur ba dag go / //

“Great enlightening beings also think, ‘Unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment is based on the mind—if the mind is pure and clear, one can fulfill all roots of goodness and will surely attain freedom in enlightenment. If I wish to attain supreme consummate enlightenment, I can do so at will; if I wish to annihilate all grasping of objects, I can do that too—yet I do not annihilate, because I want to reach the ultimate end of the enlightenment of the buddhas. And I also do not immediately realize supreme enlightenment, in order to fulfill my original vow to carry out the practice of enlightening beings through all worlds and enlighten sentient beings.’ This is their ninth adamantine commitment to universal enlightenment.
Great enlightening beings know Buddha is ungraspable, enlightenment is ungraspable, enlightening beings are ungraspable, all things are ungraspable, sentient beings are ungraspable, the mind is ungraspable, action is ungraspable, the past is ungraspable, the future is ungraspable, the present is ungraspable, all worlds are ungraspable, and the created and uncreated are ungraspable: thus enlightening beings dwell in quiescence, profundity, silent extinction, noncontention, speechlessness, non-duality, incomparability, essence, truth, liberation, nirvana, and ultimate reality, yet do not give up any of their great vows, do not give up the will for omniscience, do not give up the deeds of enlightening beings, do not give up teaching sentient beings, do not give up the transcendent ways, do not give up taming sentient beings, do not give up serving buddhas, do not give up explaining truths, do not give up adorning the world. Why? Because great enlightening beings have made great vows. Though they comprehend the characteristics of all things, their great kindness and compassion increase, and they cultivate measureless virtues. Their minds do not abandon sentient beings, because while things have no absolute existence, the ignorant do not realize this, so enlightening beings are committed to enlightening them so that they clearly comprehend the nature of things. Why? All buddhas rest peacefully in quiescence, yet by great compassion they teach in the world ceaselessly—reflecting on this, enlightening beings do not abandon sentient beings. Also, they will not abandon great compassion because they have already developed great commitment and have vowed to certainly benefit all sentient beings, to accumulate all roots of goodness, to persist in appropriate dedication, to develop profound wisdom, to accommodate all sentient beings, to be impartial toward all sentient beings; they speak truthfully, without falsehood, vow to give all sentient beings the supremely great teaching, and vow to perpetuate the lineage of buddhas—as long as all sentient beings are not yet liberated, are not yet enlightened, and have not yet realized buddhahood, the enlightening beings’ great undertaking is not completed and they will not give up great compassion. This is their tenth adamantine commitment to universal enlightenment.
“These are the ten adamantine commitments of enlightening beings to universal enlightenment: based on these they can attain the indestructible supreme spiritual knowledge of buddhas.
bam po bdun cu rtsa dgu pa/

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rtsom pa chen po ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas thams cad mchod do/ /bsnyen bkur ro zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bstan par bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad kyi mchod rten me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyis brgyan par bya'o/ /mchod par bya'o/ /dam pa'i chos kyang yang dag par gzung bar bya'o/ /bstan pa yang yongs su bsrung bar bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa bla na med pas yongs su dag par bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te/ ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa 'grangs pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyis 'jig rten gyi khams re rer yang sems can re re'i don du yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad par bya'o/ /sems can gcig gi don du ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad ma lus pa'i don du yang snying rje chen po bskyed de/ sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la dgod pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad par bya'o zhes sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi don du yongs su skyo ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig kyang mi skyed pa'i brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa gcig la yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bskal par mchod pa dang / rim gro bya ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la yang mchod pa dang / rim gro bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang thams cad kyi sku gdung la bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab par rin po che thams cad kyi gdugs dang / dril bu dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / bdug spos dang / na bza' thams cad kyis mchod pa bya ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa re re zhing yang mchod rten 'jig rten gyi khams yangs pa brjod du med par khyab pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs kyis brgyan pa mang po byas te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs de dag kyang 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams yangs pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab par khyab pa de lta bu'i rnam pa dang ldan par bya'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi don du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsnyen bkur ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bstan pa yongs su gzung ba dang / dam pa'i chos brjod pa la rgyun gcod cing / gtang ba'i sems bskyed pa gcig kyang bskyed par mi bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba des kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang gcig cing mtshungs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa thob par bya ba'i phyir/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / mngon par sangs rgyas nas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang / cho 'phrul bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang dag par bstan cing / bskal pa brjod du med par chos bstan kyang bdag gi lus la dub par mi 'gyur zhing ngag dang / sems la dub par mi 'gyur bar bya'o/ /'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyang ba'i phyir sems bskyed pa chos dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyis brtan pa/ sems can thams cad kyi don du smon lam chen po btab pa dang ldan pa/ byams pa chen po sngon du 'gro ba snying rje chen po'i mthar thug pa/ mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyi gzhis gtugs pa/ bden pa'i tshig la gnas pa/ chos thams cad kyis dben pa mngon du byas pa/ sems can thams cad mi dmigs pa; las dang bya ba mi 'gal ba/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa/ mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la gzhol ba/ 'jug pa dang / ldog pa med par yongs su rdzogs pa/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rgyun mi gcod pa dang; smon lam chen po dang ldan pas/ sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las chen po sgrub bo zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po phun sum tshogs pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten great undertakings. They think, ‘I should serve and honor all buddhas.’ This is their first great undertaking. They also think, ‘After the final extinction of all buddhas, I should adorn monuments of the buddhas, offering all kinds of flowers, garlands, incenses, perfumes, aromatic powders, cloths, parasols, pennants, and banners, and take up and preserve the true teachings of the buddhas.’ This is their third great undertaking. They also think, I should teach and tame all sentient beings so that they may realize supreme perfect enlightenment.’ This is their fourth great undertaking. They also think, ‘I should adorn all worlds with the supreme adornments of the buddha-lands.’ This is their fifth great undertaking. They also think, ‘I should develop great compassion and tirelessly carry out the acts of enlightening beings forever in all worlds for the sake of sentient beings, one and all, so that they may all attain the unsurpassed enlightenment of buddhas.’ This is their sixth great undertaking. They also think, The buddhas are infinite: I should spend inconceivable eons with each and every buddha, honoring them and making offerings.’ This is their seventh great undertaking. They also think, ‘After the passing away of the buddhas, I should set up a precious monument for the relics of each one, those monuments to be as high and wide as untold worlds; I should also make effigies of buddhas in the same way, and present all kinds of precious banners and pennants, canopies, fragrances, flowers, and robes for inconceivable eons without a thought of weariness, in order to fulfill the teachings of buddhas, in order to honor the buddhas, in order to edify sentient beings, in order to preserve the true teaching, and in order to reveal and expound the teaching.’ This is their eighth great undertaking. Great enlightening beings also think, ‘By these roots of goodness I should accomplish unexcelled enlightenment, gain entry into the state of all buddhas, and be equal in essence to all buddhas.’ This is their ninth great undertaking. Great enlightening beings also think, ‘Once I have attained true awakening, I should expound the truth in all worlds for untold eons, and show inconceivable autonomous spiritual powers, without weariness of body, speech, or mind, and without deviating from the truth, because of being supported by the power of Buddha, because of diligently carrying out great vows for the sake of all sentient beings, because of great benevolence being foremost, because of great compassion being ultimate, because of having arrived at the formless truth, because of abiding by true speech, because of realizing that all things are silent and void, because of realizing that all sentient beings are ungraspable and yet not contradicting the doings of action, because of being the same one substance as the buddhas of past, present, and future, because of pervading the cosmos and space, because of realizing that all things are signless, because of attaining birthlessness and deathlessness, because of embodying all qualities of buddhahood, ceaselessly taming sentient beings and carrying out buddha-work by the power of great vows.’ This is their tenth great undertaking. Based on these ten great undertakings, enlightening beings persist in the acts of enlightening beings and are imbued with the supremely great knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtsams pa chen po mthar phyin par bya ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod pa dang / rim gro bya ba la brtsams pa chen po mthar phyin par byed pa dang / sems can thams cad mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su bsrung ba la brtsams pa chen po mthar phyin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad btsal ba la brtsams pa chen po mthar phyin par byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsags pa la brtsams pa chen po mthar phyin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad nges par rtogs par bya ba la brtsams pa chen po mthar phyin par byed pa dang / smon lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la brtsams pa chen po mthar phyin par byed pa dang / byang chub kyi spyod pa thams cad khong du chud par bya ba la brtsams pa chen po mthar phyin par byed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad mnyes par bya ba la brtsams pa chen po mthar phyin par byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'gro ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du nye bar 'gro ba la brtsams pa chen po mthar phyin par byed pa dang / chos thams cad mnyan par bya ba'i phyir/ sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du 'gro ba la brtsams pa chen po mthar phyin par byed pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtsams pa chen po mthar phyin par bya ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes chen po brtsams pa chen po mthar dbyung ba bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten ultimate great tasks: to honor and provide for all buddhas; to be able to save all the sentient beings they think of; to single-mindedly seek all facets of buddhahood; to accumulate all roots of goodness; to contemplate all Buddha teachings; to fulfill all vows; to accomplish all enlightening practices; to serve all genuine teachers; to visit the buddhas in all worlds; and to hear and remember the true teachings of all buddhas. Based on these, enlightening beings can accomplish the ultimate great task of the knowledge of unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dad pa mi phyed pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas thams cad la dad pa mi phyed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la dad pa mi phyed pa dang / 'phags pa'i dge 'dun thams cad la dad pa mi phyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la dad pa mi phyed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad la dad pa mi phyed pa dang / sems can thams cad la dad pa mi phyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam thams cad la dad pa mi phyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad khong du chud par bya ba la dad pa mi phyed pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod cing bsnyen bkur bya ba la dad pa mi phyed pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul bar bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i thabs mkhas pa mtshams sbyar ba'i tshul la dad pa mi phyed pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dad pa mi phyed pa ste; de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes chen po'i dad pa mi phyed pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of indestructible faith: they have indestructible faith in all buddhas, in all buddhas’ teachings, in all wise and holy mendicants, in all enlightening beings, in all genuine teachers, in all sentient beings, in all great vows of enlightening beings, in all practices of enlightening beings, in honoring and serving all buddhas, in the skillful mystic techniques of enlightening beings, and in teaching and taming all sentient beings. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the supreme indestructible faith of great knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lung bstan pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar mos pa drag pos rang gi rgyud la lung bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la gzhol ba'i skabs kyis lung bstan pa dang / spyod pa rgya chen pos lung bstan pa dang / mngon du lung bstan pa dang / gsang ste lung bstan pa dang / rang gi sems la rag las par khong du chud pas lung bstan pa dang / bzod pa thob pas lung bstan pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don gyis lung bstan pa dang / bskal pa 'grangs pa thams cad mi zad pas lung bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad kyis rnam par 'phrul bas lung bstan pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lung bstan pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas thams cad kyis lung bstan pa thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten ways of receiving the predictions of enlightenment: having extremely profound inner understanding; being able to develop the roots of goodness of enlightening beings as appropriate; cultivating extensive great practices; open receiving of the prediction; occult receiving of the prediction; realizing enlightenment by their own minds; accomplishing tolerance; teaching and taming sentient beings; comprehending the number of all ages; and mastery of all practices of enlightening beings. By these, enlightening beings can receive the prediction of enlightenment from all buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang smon lam gcig pa phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ram/ 'gyur zhe na/ rnam pa gzhan du ma 'gyur bar de ltar phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang bsam pa gcig pa phun sum tshogs par gyur cig/ phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ram/ 'gyur zhe na/ rnam par gzhan du ma 'gyur bar de ltar phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang spyod pa gcig tu yongs su rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ram/ 'gyur zhe na/ rnam pa gzhan du ma 'gyur bar de ltar phun sum tshogs par 'gyur cig /bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig pa phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ram/ 'gyur zhe na/ rnam pa gzhan du ma 'gyur bar de ltar phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /bdag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang gcig cing mnyam pa phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ram/ 'gyur zhe na/ rnam pa gzhan du ma 'gyur bar de ltar phun sum tshogs par gyur cig / bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang yid la bya ba gcig pa phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ram/ 'gyur zhe na/ rnam pa gzhan du ma 'gyur bar de ltar phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa 'dis dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang yongs su dag pa gcig pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur cig /phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ram/ 'gyur zhe na/ rnam pa gzhan du ma 'gyur bar de ltar phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /bdag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang gcig tu rnam par spyod pa phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ram/ 'gyur zhe na/ rnam pa gzhan du ma 'gyur bar de ltar phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang gcig cing mnyam par 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ram/ 'gyur zhe na/ rnam pa gzhan du ma 'gyur bar de ltar phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang tha ma dang pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur cig /phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ram/ 'gyur zhe na/ rnam pa gzhan du ma 'gyur bar de ltar phun sum tshogs par 'gyur cig ces bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of dedication of roots of goodness, by which they can dedicate all roots of goodness. They dedicate their roots of goodness to be the same as the enlightened guides in terms of vows, mind, action, faculties, impartiality, mindfulness, purity, state, fulfillment, and incorruptibility; they dedicate their roots of goodness to develop in this way and none other. Based on this, they attain supreme dedication of roots of goodness.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes khong du chud pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar gtong ba'i sems kyis rnam par 'phrul pa'i ye shes khong du chud pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mos pa'i ye shes khong du chud pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes mtha' dang dbus med pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes khong du chud pa dang / dris pa thams cad kyi the tshom gcod pa'i ye shes khong du chud pa dang / don shes pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes khong du chud pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung la mkhas pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la yid ches par 'jug pa'i ye shes khong du chud pa dang / sangs rgyas la bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba chung yang rung ste/ thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes tshad med par 'gyur bar yid ches par byas shing / chos dkar po thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i ye shes khong du chud pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par spyod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i ye shes khong du chud pa dang / sems kyi skad cig gcig gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med par 'gro zhing gnas par bya ba'i phyir/ sems kyi skad cig gcig gis ye shes khong du chud pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad la 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bstan pa dang / gzung ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung sna tshogs la 'jug pa'i rgyan gyi ye shes khong du chud pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes khong du chud pa rnams te/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes khong du chud pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of attainment of wisdom: giving freely; deeply understanding all Buddha teachings; entering the boundless knowledge of buddhas; being able to cut off doubts in all dialogues; penetrating the doctrines of the wise; deeply understanding the skillful use of words by the buddhas in all their teachings; deeply understanding how planting a few roots of goodness in the company of buddhas will enable one to fulfill all pure qualities and attain the infinite knowledge of buddhas; accomplishing the inconceivable states of enlightening beings; being able to visit untold buddha-lands in one moment of thought; and awakening to the enlightenment of all buddhas, entering all realms of reality, hearing and holding the teachings expounded by all buddhas, and deeply penetrating the variously arrayed sayings of all buddhas. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the supreme realizational knowledge of all buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni /byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa mtha' dang dbus med pa rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas thams cad la sems bskyed pa rgya chen po mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'jug pa la sems bskyed pa rgya chen po mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi zhing dang / dus dang / chos kyi dbyings su 'jug pa las sems bskyed pa rgya chen po mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam par lta ba la sems bskyed pa rgya chen po mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad la rgya cher brtag pa la sems bskyed pa rgya chen po mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad yid la bya ba la sems bskyed pa rgya chen po mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / las dang rnam par smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab par 'jug pa la sems bskyed pa rgya chen po mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba la sems bskyed pa rgya chen po mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du 'jug pa la sems bskyed pa rgya chen po mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbyings rnam par blta ba la sems bskyed pa rgya chen po mtha' dang dbus med pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa rgya chen po mtha' dang dbus med pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad kyi ye shes chen po rgya mtsho lta bu bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of development of a boundlessly vast mind: development in the company of all buddhas; observing the realms of all sentient beings; observing all lands, all worlds, all phenomena; observing all things as being like space; observing the extensive great practices of all enlightening beings; correctly remembering all buddhas of past, present, and future; observing the results of innumerable actions; purifying all buddha-lands; entering the great congregations of all buddhas; investigating the subtle pronouncements of all buddhas. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the boundlessly vast ocean of knowledge of all Buddha teachings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras; bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gter te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar chos thams cad la bgrang bas sbyar ba'i gter dang / chos thams cad la nges par rtogs pa'i gter dang / chos thams cad la gzung snang ba'i gter dang / chos thams cad la tha dad pa yang dag par shes pas rab tu snang ba'i gter dang / chos thams cad la brjod du med pa'i tshul la mkhas par khong du chud pa'i gter dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul ba dang / cho 'phrul thams cad la so sor rtog cing lta ba'i gter dang / chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du mngon par bsgrub par mkhas pa'i gter dang / sangs rgyas thams cad mthong ba dang mi 'bral ba'i gter dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su grub par 'jug pa la mkhas pa'i gter dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / mos pa chen po rab tu rnyed pa'i gter ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gter te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi ye shes kyi gter bla na med pa 'thob pas sems can thams cad 'dul ba la brtson par byed pa dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of hidden treasury: they know all things are a treasury producing virtuous practices; they know all things are a treasury of right thought; they know all things are a treasury of illumination of mental control; they know all things are a treasury of intellectual powers and exposition; they know all things are a treasury of inexpressible accurate awareness of truth; they know all buddhas’ autonomous spiritual powers are a treasury of observation of revelations; they know all things are a treasury of skillfully developing impartiality; they know all things are a treasury of constant vision of all buddhas; they know all inconceivable eons are a mine of realization that all exist like illusions; they know all buddhas and enlightening beings are treasuries producing joy and pure faith. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the treasury of truth of supreme knowledge of buddhas, and can tame all sentient beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sdom pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mi 'khrug mi 'khrul ba'i sdom pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la bsam pa'i sdom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la bsam pa rlabs po che'i sdom pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad la bsam pa mi 'dor ba'i sdom pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas yid la bya ba thams cad la yongs su mi rgyu ba'i sdom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' chud za ba'i lam thams cad rnam par bzlog pa'i sdom pa dang / sems can thams cad la khong khro ba med pa'i sdom pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsam pa thams cad mthar phyin par bya ba'i sdom pa dang / bdud thams cad rab tu pham par bya ba'i sdom pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i sdom pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sdom pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ye shes chen po'i sdom pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of rules of behavior: they should not slander any enlightening teachings; their faith in the buddhas should be indestructible; they should honor and respect all enlightening beings; they should never give up their friendship with wise people; they should not think of those who seek individual salvation; they should avoid all regression on the Path of enlightening beings; they should not give rise to any malice toward sentient beings; they should cultivate all roots of goodness to perfection; they should be able to conquer all demons; they should fulfill all the ways of transcendence. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the supreme discipline of great knowledge.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar bskal pa brjod du med par tshe'i tshad byin gyis rlob pas tshe la dbang ba dang / ting nge 'dzin grangs med pa la nges par rtogs par gzhog cing / ye shes kyis 'jug pa'i tshul gyis sems la dbang ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rgyan rnam par dbye ba du mas rab tu brgyan par byin gyis brlab par ston pa'i tshul gyis yo byad la dbang ba dang / dus ji lta ba bzhin du las kyi rnam par smin pa byin gyis rlob pas las la dbang ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du skye ba ston pas skye ba la dbang pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyis yongs su gang bar lta bas mos pa la dbang ba dang / dus dang zhing gang du 'dod par mngon par 'tshang rgya bas/ smon lam la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad yongs su ston pas rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang / chos kyi sgo dang / snang ba mtha' dang dbus med pa yang dag par ston pas chos la dbang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi bsnyengs pa skad cig skad cig tu go bar yongs su ston pas/ ye shes la dbang ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub kyi mnga'i pha rol tu phyin pa ye shes kyi rnam par 'phrul pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of control: control of life, being able to remain alive for untold eons; control of mind, their intellect being able to enter countless concentrations; control of facilities, being able to array all worlds with infinite embellishments; control of action, being able to experience consequences at any time; control of birth, being able to manifest birth in all worlds; control of understanding, being able to see Buddha filling all worlds; control of will, being able to achieve true awakening in any lands whenever desired; control of spiritual powers, showing all kinds of great mystical displays; control of doctrine, revealing boundless gateways to truth; control of knowledge, in each moment of thought manifesting the ten powers and fearlessnesses of buddhas, attaining true enlightenment. Based on these ten controls, enlightening beings can attain mastery of enlightenment, fulfilling the transcendence, knowledge, and spiritual power of all buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par 'phrul ba rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / zhing la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / las la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / smon lam la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / spyod yul la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / ye shes la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / mngon par shes pa la rnam par 'phrul pa dang / rdzu 'phrul la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / stobs la rnam par 'phrul ba ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par 'phrul pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras; de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can la rnam par 'phrul ba gang zhe na/

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of unimpeded functions: unimpeded functions relating to sentient beings, lands, phenomena and principles, bodies, vows, realms, knowledge, spiritual capacities, miracles, and powers. What are their unimpeded functions relating to sentient beings and so on?

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can la rnam par 'phrul ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad sems can med pas sgrol ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi 'du shes kyi rnam par byin gyis brlab pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can thams cad la dus la bab na chos ston pa rgyun mi gcod pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad du sprul pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad skra'i sbubs gcig tu btsud kyang gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams su byin gyis brlabs te/ pha rol shes par byed pa dang / yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad du brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po'i dbang yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / kha dog dang / mtshan dang / cho ga dang / spyod lam yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thob pa yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i gzugs kyi sku dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po sna tshogs kyi rgyan yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can la rnam par 'phrul ba'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of unimpeded functions relating to sentient beings: knowing that all sentient beings are void of being; knowing that all sentient beings are only upheld by thought; explaining the truth to all sentient beings in a manner appropriate to the time; magically producing the appearance of all realms of sentient beings; placing all sentient beings inside a pore without crowding; showing all sentient beings other worlds; manifesting the bodies of the celestial beings Indra, Brahma, and the world guardians for all sentient beings; manifesting the calm behavior of buddhas’ disciples and individual illuminates for all sentient beings; manifesting the deeds of enlightening beings for all sentient beings; manifesting the buddhas’ physical embellishments, powers of omniscience, and attainment of enlightenment for all beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhing la rnam par 'phrul ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar zhing thams cad zhing gcig tu byin gyis rlob pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / zhing thams cad skra'i sbubs gcig tu 'dzud pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / zhing thams cad mi zad pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / zhing thams cad skyil mo krung gcig gis rgyas par 'gengs pa'i lus gcig yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / zhing thams cad rang gi lus su chud par yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / zhing thams cad rab tu bskyod kyang / sems can 'jigs par mi 'gyur ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / zhing thams cad kyi rgyan rnam par phye ba zhing gcig tu yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / zhing gcig gis rnam par phye zhing thams cad kyi rgyan rnam par phye bar yongs su ston pa dang / zhing thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gcig gis yongs su khyab par sems can thams cad la ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / zhing phra ba dang / che ba dang / yangs pa dang / rgya che ba dang / zab pa dang / snrel zhi dang / spyi'u tshugs su rgyu ba dang / gzhi mnyam pa la 'jug par yongs su gzhol bas phyogs kyi dra ba rnam par phye ba la 'jug par sems can ma lus pa thams cad la yongs su ston ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhing la rnam par 'phrul ba'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of unimpeded function relating to lands: making all lands one land; fitting all lands in a pore; knowing that the totality of lands is inexhaustible; filling all lands with one body sitting; showing all lands in one body; shaking all lands without frightening the beings there; arraying one land with the adornments of all lands; pervading all lands with one buddha and one congregation, showing sentient beings; showing all sentient beings the infinite differentiations of the network of lands filling the ten directions—all small lands, middle-sized lands, large lands, broad lands, deep lands, upright lands, inverted lands, sideways lands, straight lands.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos la rnam par 'phrul ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar chos thams cad chos gcig tu yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba dang / chos gcig po chos thams cad du yang dag par gzhol bar byed kyang / sems can gyi bsam pa dang mi 'gal bar rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sgrub par khong du chud par bya ba pha rol gyi go bar bya ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad 'du shes dang bral bar sems can mang pos khong du chud par bya ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad la tshul gcig tu 'jug cing tshul mtha' yas par ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad la brjod du med par 'jug cing / sgo brgya stong gi pha rol gyi rgyud du bstan pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad sgo kun nas rgyu ba'i yi ge'i tshul la mkhas par rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad chos kyi sgo gcig dang mi 'gal ba la 'jug pa'i tshul khong du chud par bstan pas bskal pa brjod du med cing mi zad pa rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos su 'jug pa la sems can mang po gzung ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad mtha' dang dbus med par yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad la chags pa med pa'i mthar phyin cing mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sgyu ma'i dra ba rnam pa tha dad pa la 'jug pa med pas bskal pa mu med par mi zad par sems can la ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos la rnam par 'phrul ba'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of unimpeded function relating to phenomena and principles: they know that all phenomena are in one phenomenon and one phenomenon is in all phenomena, yet they do not contravene the understanding of sentient beings; they elicit all principles from transcendent wisdom, explain them to others, and enlighten them all; they know all things are beyond words, yet they enable all sentient beings to understand them; they know all things are of one characteristic, yet they can expound infinite characteristics of things; they know all truths are beyond explanation, yet they explain boundless ways of access to truth; they can skillfully operate a pregnant symbol representing all truths, accommodating all things in one principle without contradiction, expounding it for untold eons without exhausting it; including all things in the teaching of enlightenment, they enable all sentient beings to gain understanding; they know all things have no boundaries; they know the ultimate nonobstruction of all things, like a network of illusions, with infinite differentiations, explaining this to sentient beings for infinite eons without exhausting it.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus la rnam par 'phrul ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyi lus rang gi lus su byin gyi rlob cing / mos par byed pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / rang gi lus sems can thams cad kyi lus kyi 'du shes su byin gyi rlob pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku sangs rgyas gcig gi skur mos shing / 'jug pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sangs rgyas gcig gi sku sangs rgyas ma lus pa thams cad kyi skur 'jug cing / gzhan la yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / zhing thams cad du nam mkha' byin gyi rlob pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / dus gsum thams cad chos kyi sku gcig gis yongs su rgyas par sems can la ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / lus gcig tu ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag cing lus mtha' yas pa las rnam par ldang ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / lus gcig gis mngon par sangs rgyas shing sems can snyed kyi lus su yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi lus sems can gcig gi lus su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi lus chos kyi skur ston cing / chos kyi sku sems can gyi lus su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus la rnam par 'phrul ba'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of unimpeded function relating to bodies: encompassing the bodies of all sentient beings in one’s own body; merging one’s own body into the bodies of all sentient beings; all buddha-bodies entering one buddha-body; one buddha-body entering all buddha-bodies; encompassing all lands in one’s own body; pervading all things of all times with one body, showing sentient beings; showing boundless bodies in one body entering concentration; in one body showing as many bodies as sentient beings attaining enlightenment; showing the body of one being in the bodies of all beings, showing the bodies of all beings in the body of one being; showing the body of reality in the bodies of all beings, showing the bodies of all beings in the body of reality.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam la rnam par 'phrul ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi smon lam rang gi smon lam du byin gyis rlob pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi smon lam gyi stobs dang mthu mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par yongs su ston par rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can ji ltar smin pa rang rang gi bsam pa de bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / bskal pa 'grangs pa mu med pa thams cad du smon lam gyi rgyun mi gcod pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i lus las gyen du bskyod de/ ye shes kyi lus la'ang mi gnas pa'i smon lam la dbang bsgyur bas lus thams cad yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / rang gi lus tshad du gyur bas pha rol gyi tshogs kyi smon lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i smon lam las phyir mi ldog pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / bskal pa 'grangs pa thams cad byang chub kyi spyod pas rgyas par dgang ba'i smon lam rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / skra'i sbubs gcig tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rgyas par dgang zhing / 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa/ sems can gcig tu ston pa'i smon lam la rnam par 'phrul pa dang / chos kyi tshig gcig brjod pas chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad rgyas par bkang ste/ chos kyi sprin chen po byung ba las chos bdud rtsi'i char rab tu 'bab cing / rig pa dang rnam par grol ba'i glog snang ba dang / yang dag pa de kho na nyid kyi chos kyi 'brug sgra mngon par 'byung bas sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su ngoms par bya ba'i smon lam chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya bas rnam par rtse ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam la rnam par 'phrul ba'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of unimpeded function relating to vows: they make the vows of all enlightening beings their own vows; they manifest themselves attaining enlightenment by the power of the vow of attainment of enlightenment of all buddhas; they themselves attain supreme perfect enlightenment in accordance with the sentient beings they are teaching; they never end their great vows, throughout all eons, without bounds; detaching from the body of discriminating consciousness and not clinging to the body of knowledge, they manifest all bodies by free will; they give up their own bodies to fulfill the aspirations of others; they edify all sentient beings without giving up their great vows; they cultivate the deeds of enlightening beings in all ages, yet their great vows never end; they manifest the attainment of true enlightenment in a minute point, pervade all buddha-lands by the power of vowing, and show this to each and every sentient being in untold worlds; they explain a phrase of teaching, throughout all universes, raising great clouds of true teaching, flashing the lightning of liberation, booming the thunder of truth, showering the rain of elixir of immortality, fulfilling all sentient beings by the power of great vows.

kye rgyal ba'i sras /bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul la rnam par 'phrul ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos kyi dbyings kyi spyod yul dang yang ldan la sems can gyi khams kyi spyod yul du'ang snang ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul la mngon par dga' ba'ang yin la/ bdud kyi spyod yul la gnas par yang snang ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ mya ngan las 'das pa'i spyod yul dang yang ldan la/ 'khor ba'i spyod yul las kyang mi g.yo'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi spyod yul dang ldan la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul gyi rgyud kyang rgyun mi gcod do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba'i spyod yul dang yang ldan la/ sems can ma zhi ba/ rab tu ma zhi ba/ nye bar ma zhi ba'i spyod yul can rnams kyang rnam par mi spong ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / spro ba med pa dang / mi 'gro ba dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / rnam par mi dmigs pa dang / bar snang dang mnyam pa'i spyod yul dang yang ldan la/ sems can spros pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad du dmigs pa'i spyod yul can rnams kyi gnas na yang snang ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni stobs dang; rnam par thar ba'i spyod yul dang yang ldan la/ phyogs gcig pa'i spyod yul thams cad du yang snang ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can med pa'i mtha'i spyod yul dang yang ldan la/ sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba yang rnam par mi spong ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / rtogs pa dang / ye shes dben pa'i spyod yul dang yang ldan la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du skye bar yang snang ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de bzhin gshegs dpa'i spyod pa dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi rgyan dang / spyod yul thams cad kyang thob la/ nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod lam dang / cho ga yang yongs su ston te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul la rnam par 'phrul pa'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of unimpeded functions relating to realms: they abide in the realm of reality without abandoning the realm of sentient beings; they abide in the realm of buddhas without abandoning the realm of demons; they abide in the realm of nirvana without abandoning the realm of birth and death; they enter the realm of omniscience without putting an end to the realm of the nature of enlightening beings; they abide in the realm of tranquillity and calm without abandoning the realm of distraction; they abide in the spacelike realm where there is no coming or going, no conceptualization, no form, no essence, and no verbalization, yet they do not abandon the realm of all sentient beings, conceptual representations; they dwell in the realm of occult powers and liberation, yet without abandoning the realm of specific locations; they enter the realm of ultimate nonexistence of sentient beings, yet do not give up teaching all sentient beings; they dwell in the realm of meditation, liberation, spiritual powers, and higher knowledges, quiet and peaceful, yet they manifest birth in all worlds; they dwell in the realm of realization of true enlightenment adorned by all the deeds of buddhas, yet they manifest the composed, tranquil comportment of the personally liberated and individually illuminated.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes la rnam par 'phrul ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa'i ye shes mi zad pa la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / rmongs pa med pa'i gzungs thams cad thob pa'i ye shes la rnam par 'phrul pa dang / smon lam shin tu rnam par gdon mi za ba bstan pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi dbang po yongs su 'dzin pa dang / khong du chud pa'i ye shes la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / rang gi sems kyi ye shes pha rol gyi sems kyi ye shes dang sems gcig las sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa dang / rnam par g.yo bar byed pa'i ye shes la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / bag chags dang / nyon mongs pa'i nad la gang dang 'byor ba'i sman yang dag par gtong ba'i ye shes rnam par 'phrul ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la skad cig gcig gis 'jug pa'i ye shes la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / dus gsum gyi bskal pa'i grangs thams cad la chags ba med pa'i ye shes yangs pa sems can gzhan gyis thob par byed pa'i ye shes la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / thogs pa med pa'i sems kyi skad cig tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gro pa thams cad du yongs su ston pa'i ye shes la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can gcig gi 'du shes kyis sems can ma lus pa thams cad kyi las dang / bya ba la mngon sum du ye shes la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can gcig gi sgra dbyangs kyis sgra thams cad la 'jug pa yongs su ston pa'i ye shes la rnam par 'phrul ba ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras / bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes la rnam par 'phrul ba'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of unimpeded function relating to knowledge: inexhaustible analytic powers; retention of all mnemonic concentration formulae; ability to know and explain with certainty the faculties of all sentient beings; instantly knowing, by unhindered knowledge, the actions of the minds of all sentient beings; knowing all sentient beings’ inclinations, propensities, habits, and afflictions, and giving them remedies in accordance with their ailments; in a single moment they are able to enter into the ten powers of buddhas; by unimpeded knowledge they are able to know all ages of past, present, and future and the sentient beings therein; moment to moment they manifest the attainment of enlightenment, showing it to sentient beings endlessly; they know the actions of all sentient beings in the thoughts of one sentient being, understand the language of all sentient beings in the words of one sentient being.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa la rnam par 'phrul ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du lus yongs su ston kyang / lus gcig tu dmigs pa'i mngon par shes pa la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang / chos bstan pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i mngon par shes pa la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can gcig gi sems la dmigs pas byang chub kyi rgyud brjod du med pa rnam par 'tshang rgya zhing sems can thams cad kyi sems kyis go bar byed pa'i mngon par shes pa la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / dbyangs gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du go bar byed cing; sgra rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad du shes par byed pas/ sems can gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud du phyin par byed pa'i mngon par shes pa la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi sngon gyi mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal pa/ sems kyi skad cig gcig gis rjes su dran zhing shes pas/ las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon sum du ston cing / sems can gyi go bar byed pa'i mngon par shes pa la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad brgyan par bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / dus thams cad mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa'i mngon par shes pa la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub tu spyod pa'i smon lam yang dag par bskyed ba dang / chos kyi snang ba rab tu dgye ba'i mngon par shes pa la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po thams cad kyis mngon par shes pa la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs dpa'i stobs bcu dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis yongs su bsrung ba'i mngon par shes pa la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ mdor na/ byang chub sems dpa' ni mngon par shes pas chos thams cad la yang dag par gzhol ba yin te/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa la rnam par 'phrul pa'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of unimpeded function relating to spiritual capacities: they show the bodies of all worlds in one body; in the audience of one buddha they hear the teachings spoken in the assemblies of all buddhas; in the mind and thoughts of one sentient being they accomplish inexpressible, unsurpassed enlightenment and open the minds of all sentient beings; with one voice they manifest the different sounds of speech of all worlds and enable sentient beings each to attain understanding; in a single moment they show the various differences in results of actions of all ages of the entire past, causing sentient beings all to know and see; they cause all worlds to be fully adorned; they penetrate all pasts, presents, and futures; they emanate the great light of truth and show the enlightenment of all buddhas and the acts and aspirations of sentient beings; they protect all living beings, saints, individual illuminates, enlightening beings, the ten powers of enlightenment they have, and the roots of goodness of enlightening beings. If enlightening beings attain these ten unimpeded functions, they can penetrate all Buddha teachings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul la rnam par 'phrul ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa/ rdul shin tu phra ba gcig tu 'dzud pa'i rdzu 'phrul la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la chos kyi dbyings thams cad dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig yongs su ston pa'i rdzu 'phrul la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / rgya mtsho thams cad kyi chu'i phung po chen po bsdu'i khung bu gcig tu blugs te/ chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro yang sems can la gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i rdzu 'phrul la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa rang gi lus su btsud de/ bya ba thams cad yongs su ston pa la mkhas pa'i rdzu 'phrul la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / khor yug dang rdo rje'i ri bsam gyis mi khyab pa thams cad ba spu'i khung bu gcig tu bres te/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'gro yang sems can rnams sdang bar mi 'gyur ba'i rdzu 'phrul la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bskal pa gcig tu byin gyis brlabs te/ bskal pa gcig la brjod du med pa yang brjod du med pa'i bskal pa 'du ba dang / 'jig pa ston kyang sems can la gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i rdzu 'phrul la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du chus 'jig pa yongs su bstan pa dang / me dang rlung gis 'jig pa yongs su bstan kyang sems can la gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i rdzu 'phrul la rnam par 'phrul pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'tshig cing chu dang / me dang rlung gis 'jig kyang longs spyod dang / nye bar spyod pa thams cad kyi sa yongs su gang bar byas shing sems can la kun tu ston pa'i rdzu 'phrul la rnam par 'phrul pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bsam gyis mi khyab pa lag pa'i mthil gyis blangs te/ 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par bkod kyang / sems can la gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i rdzu 'phrul la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / zhing thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin du yongs su bstan pas/ sems can gyis go bar byed pa ni rdzu 'phrul la rnam par 'phrul ba ste; kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul la rnam par 'phrul pa'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of unimpeded functions of miraculous abilities: they place untold worlds in one atom; they manifest all buddha-lands, equal to the cosmos, in a single atom; they place the water of all oceans in one pore and travel throughout the universe, without the sentient beings therein being disturbed; they contain untold worlds within their own bodies and manifest all spiritual powers; they tie up innumerable mountain chains with a single hair and carry them through all worlds, without frightening sentient beings; they make untold ages one age and make one age untold ages, showing therein the differences of formation and disintegration, without scaring sentient beings; in all worlds they show various changes and devastations by floods, conflagrations, and gales, without troubling sentient beings; when such disasters arise, they can safeguard the necessities of life of all sentient beings in all worlds, not letting them be damaged or lost; they can hold inconceivably many worlds in one hand and toss them beyond untold worlds, without exciting fear in the sentient beings; they explain how all lands are the same as space, causing sentient beings all to gain understanding.
