kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stobs la rnam par 'phrul pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar yongs su smin par bya ba dang / 'dul ba mi gtong bas sems can gyi stobs la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / nam mkha' brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa thams cad rgyan rnam par phye bas brgyan par yongs su ston pas zhing gi stobs la rnam par 'phrul pa dang / lus thams cad lus med par 'jug pas chos kyi stobs la rnam par 'phrul pa dang / spyod pa rgyun mi spyod pas bskal pa'i stobs la rnam par 'phrul pa dang / gnyid kyis log pa sangs par byed pas sangs rgyas kyi stobs la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad skyed cing rab tu 'dzin pa'i phyir spyod pa'i stobs la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad yang dag par sgrol bas sangs rgyas kyi stobs la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad bdag po med par mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir/ rang byung gi stobs la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ma lus par mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs la rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong bas/ snying rje chen po'i stobs la rnam par 'phrul ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stobs la rnam par 'phrul ba ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ sems can la rnam par 'phrul ba bzung ba man chad stobs la rnam par 'phrul ba yan chad kyi bar du/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par 'phrul ba ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' gang gis rnam par 'phrul ba bcu po de dag thob par gyur pa de ni/ 'dod na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o/ /mi 'dod na mngon par 'tshang mi rgya'o/ /'dod na mngon par 'tshang yang rgyal spyod pa yang rgyun mi gcod do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni smon lam chen pos byung ba ste/ sgo mtha' yas pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba yongs su bstan pa la mkhas pa'i phyir ro/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of unimpeded function of power: unimpeded function of power relating to sentient beings, teaching and taming them without abandoning them; of power relating to lands, manifesting untold adornments and arraying them; of power relating to phenomena, causing all bodies to enter the bodiless; of power relating to eons, cultivating practices unceasingly; of the power of enlightenment, awakening those who are asleep; of the power of action, including all practices of enlightening beings; of the power of buddhas, liberating all sentient beings; teacherless power, spontaneously awakening to all truths; of the power of omniscience, attaining true enlightenment by omniscience; of the power of great compassion, not abandoning sentient beings.
“These are called the ten unimpeded functions of enlightening beings; for those who attain them, being on the verge of attaining supreme perfect enlightenment or not attaining it is up to them and makes no difference—though they attain enlightenment, they still do not stop carrying out the deeds of enlightening beings. Why? Because great enlightening beings vow to enter infinite doors of unimpeded function and manifest them skillfully, as is appropriate.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par rtse ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi lus la zhing gi lus byin gyis rlob pa byed kyang / sems can gyi lus 'byed par mi byed pa de ni rnam par rtse ba dang po'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' zhing gi lus la sems can gyi lus byin gyis rlob kyang / zhing gi lus 'dres par yang mi byed pa de ni rnam par rtse ba gnyis pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi sku la sems can gyi lus byin gyis rlob kyang / sangs rgyas kyi sku dma' bar mi byed pa de ni rnam par rtse ba gsum pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lus la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yongs su ston kyang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lus rgya chen por yang mi byed pa 'di ni/ rnam par rtse ba bzhi pa'o; ; kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa'i lus la mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i lus yongs su ston kyang / spyod pa'i rgyun mi gcod pa de ni rnam par rtse ba lnga pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i lus la spyod pa yongs su ston kyang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nye bar len par yang mi byed pa de ni rnam par rtse ba drug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'khor ba'i rgyun yongs su ston kyang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par chags pa mi skyed pa de ni rnam par rtse ba bdun pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba la mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su ston kyang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas shin tu mya ngan las 'da' bar mi byed pa 'di ni rnam par rtse ba brgyad pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' mnyam par gzhag bzhin du 'di lta ste/ 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa'i bya ba thams cad yongs su ston kyang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mnyam pa nyid 'khrug par mi byed pa 'di ni rnam par rtse ba dgu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi zhabs kyi drung nas chos thos nas/ lus kyang mi snang bar mi byed la ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa gzhan dang gzhan du lus rnam par dgod pas ldang yang lus tha dad par yang mi byed/ ting nge 'dzin tha dad par yang mi byed la/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag las kyang chos nyan cing thos nas kyang 'dzin cing kun chub par byed la/ ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug cing / chos dri ba bzung ba'i rgyun kyang mi gsod de/ de de ltar mnyam par gzhag bzhin du lus mi snang bar yang mi byed la/ ting nge 'dzin gyi lus dang sgo mngon par sgrub pa re re las kyang brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi lus dang / sgo mngon par sgrub cing / de lta bu'i tshul gyis bskal pa thams cad zad par gyur kyang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo mngon par sgrub pa'i mtha' gang yang med pa de ni rnam par rtse ba bcu pa'o; ; kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par rtse ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen pos rnam par rol pa bla na med par thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of versatility: they make the body of sentient beings the body of lands, without destroying the body of sentient beings; they make the body of lands the body of sentient beings, without destroying the body of lands; in the body of Buddha they show the body of disciples and self-illumined ones, without diminishing the body of Buddha; in the body of disciples and selfillumined ones they show the body of Buddha, without augmenting the body of disciples and self-illumined ones; in the body of practices of enlightening beings they show the body of attainment of enlightenment, without cutting off the body of practices of enlightening beings; in the body of attainment of enlightenment they manifest cultivation of the body of practices of enlightening beings, without diminishing the body of attainment of enlightenment; they show the body of birth and death in the realm of nirvana, without clinging to birth and death; they show nirvana in the realm of birth and death, yet without finally entering nirvana; they enter into concentration, yet manifest all ordinary action, without relinquishing the correct reception of concentration; in the presence of one buddha they hear and absorb the teaching, not moving physically yet by the power of concentration appearing physically in the audiences of untold buddhas, neither dividing their bodies nor rising from concentration, continuously hearing and absorbing the teachings, in this way moment to moment producing untold concentration-bodies in each concentration-body, going on this way, so that the ages of time may be exhausted but the concentration-bodies of enlightening beings are inexhaustible. Based on these ten kinds of versatility, enlightening beings can attain the versatility of great knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yul te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings mtha' yas pa'i sgo la 'jug par sems can la yongs su ston pa'i yul dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs du ma dang / mngon par sgrub pa 'gro ba thams cad kyis rnam par dmigs par bya ba'i yul dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad du/ sprul pa mngon par sgrub pa rnam par dmigs par bya ba'i yul dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku byang chub sems dpa'i lus su mngon par sgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lus de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur mngon par sgrub pa'i yul dang / nam mkha'i khams 'jig rten gyi khams su mngon par bsgrub pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams nam mkha'i khams su mngon par sgrub pa'i yul dang / mya ngan las 'das pa 'khor bar mngon par sgrub pa dang / 'khor bar mya ngan las 'das pa mngon par sgrub pa'i yul dang / sems can gcig gi skad du brjod pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bstan par mngon par sgrub pa'i yul dang / mtha' yas pa'i sgo nas lus kun tu ston cing / lus gcig tu byin gyis brlab pa dang / lus rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad mngon par sgrub pa'i yul dang / lus gcig gis chos kyi dbyings thams cad du rgyas par dgang ba'i yul dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems bskyed pa'i skad cig re re la/ mtha' yas pa'i sgo mngon par sgrub cing / rnam par 'tshang rgya ba'i yul lo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yul te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po'i yul bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go / //

“Great enlightening beings have ten spheres: showing infinite ways of access to the realm of reality so that sentient beings can enter; showing the infinite wonderful arrays of all worlds, so that sentient beings can enter; traveling by projection to the realms of all sentient beings to enlighten them all by appropriate means; producing embodiments of enlightening beings from the body of Buddha, producing embodiment of Buddha from the body of an enlightening being; manifesting the world in the realm of space, manifesting the realm of space in the world; manifesting the realm of nirvana in the realm of birth and death, manifesting the realm of birth and death in the realm of nirvana; producing verbalizations of all Buddha teachings in the language of one sentient being; showing all bodies as one body, one body as all different bodies; filling all universes with one body; in one instant causing all sentient beings to rouse the will for enlightenment, each manifesting infinite bodies attaining enlightenment. These are the ten spheres of enlightening beings; if they abide in them, they will attain the supreme sphere of great knowledge of buddhas.
bam po brgyad cu pa/

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stobs te; bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'jig rten thams cad dang 'du 'dzi med pa'i phyir bsam pa'i stobs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la sgyid lug pa med par bya ba'i phyir/ lhag pa'i bsam pa'i stobs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i brtsams pa thams cad mthar phyin par bya ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir sbyor ba'i stobs dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa rab tu shes par bya ba'i phyir ye shes kyi stobs dang / bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir smon lam gyi stobs dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug par rgyun chad pa med par bya ba'i spyod pa'i stobs dang / theg pa thams cad kyi 'byung bar kun tu bstan pa dang / theg pa chen po las phyir mi ldog par bya ba'i phyir theg pa'i stobs dang / skra'i sbubs gcig tu sangs rgyas 'byung ba thams cad dang / 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag pa thams cad kun tu bstan pa'i phyir/ rnam par 'phrul pa'i stobs dang / sems bskyed pa thams cad la byang chub tu rnam par 'tshang rgya ba dang / mi 'bral ba'i phyir byang chub kyi stobs dang / chos kyi tshig gcig brjod pas sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang / dbang po ma lus pa lhag ma med pa mtha' dag rtogs par bya ba'i phyir/ chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i stobs te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stobs te/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / stobs bcu dang ldan pa'i mchog tu 'gyur ba 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of power: the power of the profound mind, not getting mixed up in worldly feelings; the power of the overmastering profound mind, not giving up the ways of enlightenment; the power of means, consummating whatever they do; the power of knowledge, comprehending the activities of all minds; the power of vows, fulfilling all aspirations; the power of practice, continuing forever; the power of vehicles of liberation, able to produce all vehicles of liberation without abandoning the great universal vehicle; the power of miraculous transformations, showing all pure worlds and all buddhas appearing in the worlds in each pore; the power of enlightenment, inspiring all sentient beings to seek enlightenment and become buddhas, without end; the power of turning the wheel of the teaching, explaining one expression of truth in accord with the faculties, temperaments, and inclinations of all sentient beings. Based on these ten powers, enlightening beings can attain the buddhas’ ten powers of omniscience.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi 'jigs pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sgra thams cad 'dzin pa'i gzungs rab tu thob pa yin te/ de 'di snyam du/ shar phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs nas/ ston pa la la zhig bdag gi gan du byon te/ 'gro ba chen po brgya stong rab tu bshad par gyur na/ bdag gis de gzung bar mi nus snyam du mi sems te/ byang chub sems dpas rgyu yang rjes su mi mthong ngo/ /rgyu yang rjes su mi mthong bas/ mi 'jigs pa chen po'i dam ba thob cing / brtan la zhum pa med pa'i yid kyis 'gro ba thams cad la ci 'dod pa de dris shig ces skabs 'byed pa 'di ni/ mi 'jigs pa dang po'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni yi ge dang / don brjod pa dang / sgra dang / skad thams cad kyi mtshams sbyar ba rab tu rtogs par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pas dbang bskur ba'i spobs pa thogs pa med pa dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa yin te/ de dag 'di snyam du shar phyogs dang / lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs nas la la zhig 'ongs te; bdag la chos kyi the tshom chen po zhig dris par gyur na/ bdag gis lan mi lon pa snyam du mi sems te/ byang chub sems dpas rgyu yang rjes su mi mthong ngo/ /rgyu yang rjes su mi mthong bas mi 'jigs pa chen po'i dam pa thob cing / 'gro ba thams cad kyi dri ba yongs su dri ba ci yod pa bstan pa dang / 'jigs shing spu ldang ba med par byos la gang 'dod pa de dag dris shig /ces skabs 'byed pa 'di ni mi 'jigs pa gnyis pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni stong pa'i chos khong du chud par rtogs pa yin te/ bdag dang / bdag gi dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa dang / tshor ba po dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched du lta ba dang bral te/ sems nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i rjes su song ba de dag 'di snyam du bdag la la la zhig gis lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis gnod par bya ba'am/ gcig tu mi 'gyur ba'am snyam du sems pa med de/ byang chub sems dpas mtshan ma yang rjes su mi mthong ngo/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar skyes bu dam pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir te/ mtshan ma yang rjes su mi mthong bas/ mi 'jigs pa chen po'i dam pa thob cing / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sngon du 'dor ba la rab tu brtan pa 'di ni mi 'jigs pa gsum pa'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of fearlessness. They can remember all verbal explanations, and think that even if infinite people should come from all over and ask them about a hundred thousand great principles, they would see nothing difficult to answer about those questions. Because of this their minds become fearless and they ultimately reach the Other Shore of great fearlessness, able to answer any question and resolve doubts, without any timidity. This is enlightening beings’ first fearlessness.
“Great enlightening beings attain the unimpeded intellectual powers bestowed by Buddha and arrive at the furthest reaches of revelation of the secrets intimated by all speech and writing. They think that even if infinite people should come from the ten directions and ask them about infinite doctrines, they would not see anything difficult to answer about those questions. Because of this their minds become fearless and they ultimately reach the Other Shore of great fearlessness. They are able to answer any question and resolve doubts, without any timidity. This is enlightening beings’ second fearlessness.
“Great enlightening beings know all things are empty and are without self or anything pertaining to self, without creation or creator, without knower, without life, without soul, without personality, detached from mind, body, sense, and sense experience—they forever leave all views and their minds are like space. They reflect that they do not see sentient beings in any way harmful to them, in terms of physical, verbal, or mental action, because they do not see anything as having any essence at all. Therefore their minds become fearless and they ultimately reach the Other Shore of great fearlessness. They are firm, stable, and brave, impossible to discourage or break down. This is enlightening beings’ third fearlessness.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byin du brlabs te/ sangs rgyas kyi snang bas nye bar brtan cing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam dang / spyod pa dang / tshul la rab tu gnas la/ spyod lam rnam par ma brtags shing / ji lta bzhin du gnas pas/ de dag 'di snyam du bdag gi spyod lam la la la zhig gis brgal bar mi 'gyur ram snyam du mi sems te/ byang chub sems dpas mtshan ma yang rjes su mi mthong ngo/ /mtshan ma yang rjes su mi mthong bas mi 'jigs pa chen po'i dam pa thob cing / 'khor gyi nang du phyin nas chos ston pa 'di ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lus dang / ngag dang / yid shin tu dag cing yongs su dag pa dang / gtsang ba dang / gtsang sbra dang / nges pa dang ldan zhing / ngan par spyod pa dang / ngan du byed pa dang / ngan du smra ba dang bral ba yin te/ de dag ni 'di snyam du bdag gi lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las la la la zhig gis brgal bar mi 'gyur ram snyam du mi sems te/ byang chub sems dpas mtshan ma yang rjes su mi mthong ngo/ /mtshan ma yang rjes su mi mthong bas/ 'jigs pa dang bral zhing mi 'jigs pa chen po'i dam pa thob cing / sems can gzhan chos la sbyor ba byed pa 'di ni mi 'jigs pa lnga pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lag na rdo rje rtag tu phyi bzhin 'brangs pas yongs su bsrung ba chen po thob cing / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin gyis rtag tu rim gror bya ba yin/ brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po rnams kyis rtag tu phyag bya ba yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rtag tu dgongs pa yin te/ de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag la bdud dam bdud kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha'am/ mu stegs can nam/ mu stegs spyod pa dang / kun tu rgyu ba dag gam/ sems can dmigs pa la mngon par zhen pa la la zhig 'ongs shing / bar chad byed par mi 'gyur ram zhes bya bar sems pa med de/ byang chub sems dpa' mtshan ma yang rjes su mi mthong ngo/ /mtshan ma yang rjes su ma mthong bas 'jigs pa dang bral zhing / mi 'jigs pa'i dam pa chen po thob pas dga' zhing / yid bde ba dang ldan par byang chub sems dpa'i las thams cad la nan tan du byed pa 'di ni mi 'jigs pa drug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ sangs rgyas kyi sa bsngags pa'i dran pa rab tu thob cing / dran pa'i dbang po mchog dang ldan pas yongs su rmongs pa med pa yin te/ de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag gis chos kyi tshig dang / yi ge byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal nas byung pa la la zhig yongs su ma zin pa'am/ chud za par 'gyur zhing nub par gyur pa med dam zhes bya bar sems dpa' med de/ byang chub sems dpas mtshan ma yang rjes su mi mthong ngo/ /mtshan ma yang rjes su mi mthong bas 'jigs pa dang bral zhing mi 'jigs pa chen po'i dam pa thob pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bstan pa yang dag par gzung ba'i phyir nan tan du byed pa 'di ni mi 'jigs pa bdun pa'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings are protected and sustained by the power of Buddha, they live according to the conduct of buddhas, their action is truthful and never degenerates. They reflect that they do not see any conduct in themselves that would provoke the criticism of others. Therefore their minds become fearless and they teach calmly among the masses. This is enlightening beings’ fourth fearlessness.
“The physical, verbal, and mental actions of great enlightening beings are all pure, immaculate, harmonious, free from all evils. They reflect that they do not see any physical, verbal, or mental action in them that is blameworthy. Therefore their minds become fearless, and they are able to cause sentient beings to live by the teachings of Buddha. This is enlightening beings’ fifth fearlessness.
“Great enlightening beings are always accompanied and guarded by powerful thunderbolt-bearers, celestial rain spirits, demigods, celestial musicians, titans, Indra, Brahma, the world-guardian gods, and so on; and all buddhas watch over them heedfully. They reflect that they do not see that there are any demons, false teachers, or people with set views that can hinder their practice of the path of enlightening beings in any way. Therefore their minds become fearless and they ultimately reach the Other Shore of great fearlessness. They become very joyful and carry out the deeds of enlightening beings. This is enlightening beings’ sixth fearlessness.
“Great enlightening beings have developed the faculty of recollection and are free from forgetfulness, as approved by buddhas. They reflect that they do not see any sign of forgetfulness of the ways of expressing the path of attainment of enlightenment as explained by the buddhas. Therefore they become fearless in mind, absorb and hold all buddhas’ true teachings, and carry out the practices of enlightening beings. This is enlightening beings’ seventh fearlessness.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thabs dang / shes rab dang / ye shes khong du chud par rtogs shing / byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchog thob pas/ rgyun mi 'chad par sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par byed cing / de dag sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu smon lam dang / bsam pa chen po rab tu btang ste/ sems can rnams la snying rje chen po bskyed nas ched du bsams te/ 'jig rten gyi gnas 'dod pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa can du skye ba bzung zhing / 'dod pa'i dga' ba la rtse ba dang / 'khor gyi longs spyod chen po sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du bdag gis yongs su gzung bar byed kyang / de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag sems can gyi 'du 'dzi'i gos pas yongs su gos par gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / spobs pa'i bar chad dam; gcig tu mi 'gyur ram zhes sems pa med de/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis rgyu yang rjes su mi mthong ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam la rgyun mi 'chad par spyod pa'i phyir/ chos thams cad la dbang gi pha rol tu phyin pa dam pa thob pa dag ste/ de dag gis 'jig rten gyi rnam par 'khrug pa thams cad kyis/ byang chub sems dpa'i las la rnam par 'khrug par 'gyur ba rjes su mi mthong ngo/ /rjes su mi mthong bas 'jigs pa dang bral zhing / mi 'jigs pa chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa dam pa thob pas/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gnas thams cad kyi skye ba'i skye mched thams cad du skye ba gzung bar smon lam rab tu 'debs te/ 'di ni mi 'jigs pa brgyad pa'o/ /kye rgyal 'a sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems ma nyams shing / byang chub sems dpa'i lam la gnas pas theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa dag ste/ de dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems kyi stobs dang shugs la gnas shing / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi cho ga dang / spyod lam yongs su ston kyang / de dag 'di snyam du/ bdag cag nyan thos sam/ rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am/ gcig gis 'byung bar mi 'gyur ram snyam du sems pa med de/ byang chub sems dpas rgyu yang rjes su mi mthong ngo/ /rgyu yang rjes su mi mthong bas 'jigs pa dang bral zhing / mi 'jigs pa chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa dam pa thob pas/ theg pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid du ston cing /theg pa chen po'i mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa 'di ni mi 'jigs pa dgu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par bsdus pas dkar po'i chos yongs su 'dus pa yin/ mngon par shes pa dang / bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin/ rgyun chad pa med par sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la rab tu rten pa yin; byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin/ sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / rdzu 'phrul la mngon par dbang bskur ba yang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir/ spyod pa nye bar blang ba de yang rgyun mi gcod de/ de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag gis/ sems can yang yongs su smin par ma gyur la/ bdag cag kyang sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba ston par mi nus pa'am/ gcig tu mi 'gyur ram zhes sems pa med de/ byang chub sems dpa' rgyu yang rjes su mi mthong ngo/ /rgyu yang rjes su mi mthong bas 'jigs pa dang bral zhing / mi 'jigs pa chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa dam pa thob pas sems can yongs su smin pa'i tshul ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi yul yongs su ston te/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang rgyun mi gcod la/ byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam chen pos skye ba yang rgyun mi gcod cing / byang chub sems dpas yongs su smin par bya ba yang rgyun mi gcod de/ 'di ni mi 'jigs pa bcu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi 'jigs pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi 'jigs pa chen po bla na med pa thob par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mi 'jigs pa las kyang phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have already attained knowledge and skill in means, and have consummated the powers of enlightening beings. They always strive to edify all sentient beings. Their aspiration is always focused on perfect enlightenment, yet because of compassion for sentient beings, to perfect sentient beings, they appear to be born in the polluted world of afflictions, noble, with a full retinue, able to satisfy all their desires at will, leading a pleasant and happy life. Yet they reflect that although they are together with their family and associates, they do not see anything to be attached to to the extent of giving up their cultivation of the ways of enlightening beings, such as meditation, liberations, concentrations, mnemonic spells, and analytic and expository powers. Why? Because great enlightening beings are already free in the midst of all things and have reached the Other Shore. They cultivate the practices of enlightening beings and vow never to stop. They do not see any object in the world that can disturb the path of the enlightening being. Because of this their minds become fearless, and they ultimately reach the Other Shore of great fearlessness. By the power of great vows they manifest birth in all worlds. This is enlightening beings’ eighth fearlessness.
“Great enlightening beings never forget the determination for omniscience. Riding the Great Vehicle, they carry on the practices of enlightening beings. By the power of the great determination for omniscience, they demonstrate the tranquil comportment of all saints and individual illuminates. They reflect that they do not see in themselves any sign of needing to gain emancipation by means of the lesser vehicles of individual salvation. Because of this their minds become fearless and they ultimately reach the other shore of great fearlessness. While able to demonstrate to all the paths of all vehicles of liberation, they ultimately fulfill the impartial Great Vehicle of universal liberation. This is enlightening beings’ ninth fearlessness.
“Great enlightening beings perfect all good and pure qualities, are imbued with virtue, fully develop spiritual powers, ultimately abide in the enlightenment of all buddhas, fulfill all practices of enlightening beings, receive from the buddhas the prediction of coronation with omniscience, and still always teach sentient beings, carrying on the path of enlightening beings. They reflect that they do not see any sign of even a single sentient being who can be developed to maturity to whom they cannot show the masteries of buddhas in order to develop them. Because of this, their minds become fearless and they ultimately reach the Other Shore of great fearlessness. They do not stop the practices of enlightening beings, do not give up the vows of enlightening beings, and show the sphere of buddhahood to any sentient beings who can learn, in order to teach and liberate them. This is enlightening beings’ tenth fearlessness.
“These are the ten fearlessnesses of enlightening beings; based on these, enlightening beings can attain the supreme great fearlessness of buddhas without giving up the fearlessness of enlightening beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma 'dres pa rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras; 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma bstan par pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brtson zhing gtong ba yongs su gtong ba la 'jungs pa dang bral ba yin/ tshul khrims yongs su dag la tshul khrims ngan pa thams cad rab tu bsal ba yin/ bzod pa phun sum tshogs la bsam pa mi sgul pa yin/ brtson 'grus chen po dang ldan la dus thams cad du phyir mi ldog pa yin; shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes dang ldan la/ 'khrug pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa yin/ shes rab kyis shin tu byung zhing sdig pa'i lta ba dang bral ba yin te / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar ma bstan par pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ma 'dres pa'i chos te/ de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam dang mthun pa 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i ma 'dres pa'i chos dang pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can gyi khams yongs su sdud cing / 'jig rten gyi zang zing dang / chos kyi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i dang tshul can bzhin 'dzum pa/ snyan par smra ba/ tshig 'jam pa/ sems can thams cad kyi sems mngon par dga' ba/ don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin la rab tu sbyor ba/ sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi don khong du chud par byed pa/ mi mnyam pa'i sems med pa; sems can thams cad la snyoms par don du sems pa dag ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar ma bstan par sems can gyi khams yongs su bsdu ba'i phyir nan tan du byed pa de ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ma 'dres pa ste/ de ltar bsdu ba'i dngos po'i lam dang mthun pa 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ma 'dres pa gnyis pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni yongs su bsngo ba'i tshul la mkhas shing / rnam par smin pa la re ba med par sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi rjes su song bar yongs su bsngo zhing / 'jig rten gyi snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad la ye brngam pa med pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la rab tu gnas shing sems can gyi don du yongs su bsngo ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar ma bstan par dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad brtsam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes de ltar tshol zhing sems can gyi don yongs su tshol ba 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ma 'dres pa ste/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos ma 'dres pa gsum pa'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten unique qualities. Without depending on the teaching of another, they spontaneously practice the six transcendent ways: they always gladly give generously and are not mean; they always keep pure precepts, without transgression; they are full of patience and forbearance, their minds imperturbable; they have great energy, never backsliding; they skillfully enter the various meditations, never distracted; they skillfully cultivate wisdom, getting rid of all wrong views. This is their first unique quality, practicing the six transcendent ways according to the path of transcendence without being taught by another.
“Great enlightening beings are well able to take care of all sentient beings: that is to say, they practice charity, giving material goods as well as teaching; they are rightly heedful at all times; they are mild of countenance and friendly in speech; their hearts are joyful as they point out what is true; they foster understanding of the enlightenment of buddhas; without aversion they impartially benefit all. This is enlightening beings’ second unique quality, striving to unite sentient beings according to the four integrative methods, without being taught by another.
“Great enlightening beings skillfully practice dedication—dedication without seeking resulting rewards, dedication in conformity with enlightenment, dedication unattached to any worldly meditations or trances; dedication to benefiting all sentient beings, dedication to perpetuating the knowledge and wisdom of buddhas. This is enlightening beings’ third unique quality, developing roots of goodness and seeking enlightened knowledge and wisdom without relying on the teaching of another.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dam pa thob pas/ sems can thams cad kyi rjes su 'brang zhing 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi lam la yongs su skyo ba med pa'i yid dang ldan te/ 'phags pa'i spyod yul la mngon du bltas la/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'byung ba las phyir phyogs te; sems can thams cad yongs su smin pa la mngon par brtson zhing / bdag gi bde ba la chags pa med de/ bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par ldang ba la mkhas pas rang gi dbang du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob cing / 'khor bas yongs su skyo ba med pa'i sems dang ldan te/ 'khor ba la bza' shing gi ra ba lta bu'i 'du shes chen po thob pa dang / bdud kyi khyim thams cad na gnas pa dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten kyi mgon po thams cad kyi dbang chen po yongs su ston cing / skye ba'i skye mched thams cad du gzugs brnyan byung bar gyur la/ zhags pa 'thub pa'i rab tu byung ba thams cad kyi lta ba dang bral te/ 'jig rten pa'i rang bzo dang / sngags dang / gtsug lag dang / yi ge dang / shod thabs dang / grangs dang / rtsis dang / rang gi rtsed mo dang / 'jig rten pa'i dga' ba thams cad yongs su ston cing / bud med kyi cho ga dang / mtshan ma dang / cha lugs dang / sgyu rtsal thams cad kyi tshul la mkhas pa/ 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / dpyad pa dang / dri ba dang / brtags pa shin tu bsten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob pa/ 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dgos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob/ sems can thams cad kyi ngor blta ba dbang dang ldan pa dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi cho ga dang / spyod lam yongs su ston pa/ theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'tshang rgya ba skad cig skad cig tu ston pa spyod pa'i rgyun yongs su mi gcod pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob kyang / bstan pa med pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ma 'dres pa'i chos te/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos ma 'dres pa bzhi pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' zung dang smrel zhi la mkhas shing ye shes kyi rnam par rtse ba dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob pas/ 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas kyang 'khor ba'i sgo yongs su ston pa/ sems can med pa'i mtha'i spyod yul dang ldan yang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba ma btang ba shin tu dul ba dang / zhi ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob kyang / nyon mongs pa'i 'bar ba sems can la yongs su ston pa/ chos kyi ye shes gcig tu stug pa'i lus dang ldan yang / sems can gyi sgo mtha' yas pa yongs su ston pa/ bsam gtan chen po la bsam gtan 'cha' yang / 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad kyis rtse zhing longs spyod par sems can la rnam par ston pas gcig tu dga' bar dga' zhing mos pa/ khams gsum pa thams cad las phyir bltas kyang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i bsam pa ma btang ba/ rtag tu chos kyi dga' bas dga' zhing mos kyang / lha'i bu mo brgya phrag stong gi sgra rab tu phyung ba dang rtse ba/ mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / dge ba'i mchog brgya phrag stong gis brgyan pa'i lus dang ldan yang dbul ba thams cad kyi tshul yongs su ston pa/ rtag tu kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las dge ba spyad kyang / sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skye ba yang yongs su ston pa/ sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob kyang / byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi lus las gyen du ma g.yos pa dag ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ye shes mu med pa dang ldan pas/ de'i phyir de dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang khong du chud par dka' na/ sems can byis pa gzhan gyis lta smos kyang ci dgos te/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma 'dres pa lnga pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ lus dang / ngag dang / yid ye shes sngon du 'gro ba dang ldan pa ste/ las shin tu dag par spyod cing srog gcod pa dang bral ba nas/ sdig pa'i lta ba'i bar dang bral bas/ byams pa phun sum tshogs shing yang dag pa'i lta ba la zhugs pa yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las ye shes sngon du 'gro ba dang ldan pa 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos ma 'dres pa ste/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma 'dres pa drug pa'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings arrive at consummate skill in means; they are always concerned with the welfare of all sentient beings, they do not reject the realm of common ignorance, do not seek individual escape, do not cling to their own happiness. They only strive to edify and liberate others; they are able to enter and exit meditations and liberations, and have attained mastery of all concentrations. They come and go in birth and death as though roaming through a park, never getting sick of it. They may live in the palace of demons or may be celestial beings—they manifest their bodies in all realms of life. They may become mendicants in non-Buddhistic groups, yet they always avoid all false views. They display all secular literature, incantational arts, writing and mathematics, and even entertaining song and dance, being highly skilled in all of these. They may appear as beautiful women, intelligent and talented, foremost in the world. They are able to ask about and to answer about all mundane and transmundane principles, able to ultimately resolve all doubts. They also comprehend all mundane and transmundane phenomena to the ultimate degree. All sentient beings look up to them. Though they manifest the behavior of mendicants and individual illuminates, still they do not lose the mind of the Great Vehicle. Though they show attainment of true enlightenment moment to moment, still they do not stop the practice of enlightening beings. This is their fourth unique quality, the ultimate consummation of skill in means without relying on the teaching of another.
“Great enlightening beings know well the path of simultaneous practice of the provisional and the true; their intellect is free, and they reach the other shore. That is to say, they abide in nirvana, yet give the appearance of birth and death; they know there are no sentient beings, yet they diligently carry out teaching activities; they are ultimately calm and dispassionate, yet they appear to have afflictions; they abide in the one indestructible mystic reality-body of wisdom, yet they manifest infinite bodies of sentient beings everywhere; they always enter meditative concentration, yet they give the appearance of experiencing sensual pleasure; they are always aloof from the triple world, yet they do not abandon sentient beings; they always enjoy the pleasures of spirituality, yet they appear to have concubines who sing and play; though their bodies are arrayed with a multitude of marks and embellishments of greatness, yet they appear as ugly derelicts; they always accumulate virtues and are free from faults, yet they manifest birth in hells or as animals and hungry ghosts; though they have arrived at the furthest reaches of buddha-knowledge, they do not abandon the body of knowledge of enlightening beings. Even saints and solitary illuminates cannot know such infinite knowledge and wisdom developed by great enlightening beings—how much less can infantile sentient beings. This is enlightening beings’ fifth unique quality, the simultaneous practice of the provisional and the true without being taught by another.
“Great enlightening beings’ physical, verbal, and mental actions are carried out in accord with knowledge and wisdom and are all pure. That is to say, they are imbued with great compassion and forever abandon malice; they are imbued with true understanding and have no false views. This is enlightening beings’ sixth unique quality, of physical, verbal, and mental action in accord with knowledge and wisdom, without depending on the teaching of another.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying rje chen po dang ldan pas/ sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong zhing / sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po rang gi lus kyis len par mkhas pas sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal gyi sems can gyi don du yongs su skyo ba med pa'i sems dang ldan zhing / sems can gyi khams thams cad dgrol ba la zhugs pa/ 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad kyis rtse zhing yongs su longs spyod pa la chags pa med pa'i yid dang ldan pas rtag tu sems can rnams sdug bsngal gyi phung po las dgrol ba la mngon par brtson pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar snying rje chen po'i stobs yongs su mi gtong ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos ma 'dres pa ste/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma 'dres pa bdun pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi yid du 'ong zhing mthong na dga' ba ste/ brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po thams cad kyi phyag bya ba/ 'gro ba thams cad mthong bar smon pa/ sems can thams cad mngon par dga' ba'i sems dang ldan pa dag ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras; de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams sngon nas las kyi mtha' kha na ma tho ba med pa dang ldan zhing / yongs su dag pa'i las kyi tshul gyis spyod pas; de'i phyir de dag mthong bas 'gro ba thams cad mi ngoms pa yin/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar 'gro ba thams cad mthong bar mngon par dga' ba de ni; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos ma 'dres pa ste/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos ma 'dres pa brgyad pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems brtan pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i go cha shin tu bgos pas de dag ji ltar nyon mongs shing / byis pa'i skye bo'i 'du 'dzi dang ji ltar brten tam/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi tshogs kyi nang du ji ltar phyin kyang rung ste/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems rin po che bzang po 'od dang ldan pa de 'jig par mi byed do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ni 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nor bu rin po che chen po rgyan bzang po zhes bya ba de chu dang bar byed pa ni; pad+mo'i rdzing bu ji ltar rnyogs kyang rung ste/ nang du btsug na nor bu rin po che'i 'od gsal zhing bzang ba de nyid rnam par mi spong ste/ chu de thams cad kyang rnyog pa med par rab tu dang bar byed do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang / byis pa'i skye bo'i 'du 'dzis ji ltar brten kyang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems rin po che 'od gsal zhing / snang ba bzang po de chud zos par mi byed de/ sems can de dag kyang nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa de las zlog cing / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems rin po che 'od gsal zhing / snang ba de nyid la rab tu 'god do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar ji ltar nyon mongs par gyur kyang rung / byis pa'i skye bo'i 'du 'dzin dang ji ltar brten tam/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi tshogs kyi nang du ji ltar phyin kyang rung ste/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems rin po che de nyid 'jig par mi byed pa de ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma 'dres pa ste/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma 'dres pa dgu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rang gi yul gyi ye shes kyi chos la dbang bsgyur ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa dam pa thob pa ste/ rang byung gi ye shes kyi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur zhing / go 'phang skyon med pa la gnas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen la gnas pa ring du mi spong zhing / de bzhin gshegs pa la rim gror bya ba'i rgyun mi gcod de/ de ltar tshul phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad du dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa las phyir mi ldog cing / de bzhin gshegs pa la rim gror bya ba rgyun mi gcod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma 'dres pa ste/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma 'dres pa bcu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos ma 'dres pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ma 'dres pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings are full of great compassion and do not abandon sentient beings; they accept suffering in place of all sentient beings—the sufferings of hell, the sufferings of animals, the sufferings of hungry ghosts. They do this in order to help, and do not become weary—they are only devoted to liberating all sentient beings. They never become addicted to objects of desire. They always diligently work to extirpate suffering for sentient beings. This is enlightening beings’ seventh unique quality, always exercising great compassion without depending on the instruction of another.
“All beings like to see enlightening beings and never tire of seeing them, because great enlightening beings have for ages been pure in deed, without fault. This is enlightening beings’ eighth unique quality, being a welcome sight to all sentient beings, without depending on the instruction of another.
“Great enlightening beings’ determination, the adornment of the great commitment to omniscience, is unbending; though they be in dangerous, difficult places, among ordinary people, Buddhist disciples, or self-enlightened people, they never lose the clear, pure, wonderful jewel of the determination for omniscience. Just as there is a jewel called pure adornment whose luster does not change when it is put in mire, and which can clarify muddy water, in the same way, great enlightening beings, even though they be in places of confusion and pollution, among fools, they never lose or spoil the pure jewel mind seeking omniscience—they can even cause those evil sentient beings to get rid of erroneous views, afflictions, and defilements, and gain the pure mind-jewel seeking omniscience. This is enlightening beings’ ninth unique quality, not losing the precious will for omniscience even though in difficult situations, even without the instruction of another.
“Great enlightening beings achieve the knowledge of the realm of self-awakening and become enlightened spontaneously without a teacher. Ultimately free, they arrive at the other shore. The turban of the state of freedom from defilement crowns their heads. Still they do not give up association with the wise and always gladly honor the buddhas. This is enlightening beings’ tenth unique quality, attaining the supreme state without abandoning the wise or giving up honoring buddhas, without depending on the teaching of another.
“These are the ten unique qualities of enlightening beings, based on which they can attain the buddhas’ supreme, grandiose unique qualities.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi las te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yongs su sbyang ba'i las dang / sangs rgyas thams cad bsnyen bkur ba'i las dang / byang chub sems dpa'i grogs thams cad dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig tu bya ba'i las dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i las dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus thams cad kyi phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug par yongs su bzung ba'i las dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'gro yang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig nas mi g.yo ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi las dang / kha dog mtha' yas pa'i 'od zer dgye ba'i 'od kyi las dang / pad+mo'i snying po la byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs 'khod pa yongs su bstan pa'i 'od zer gyi las dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bstan pa bzung bas/ dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rgyun mi gcad pa'i las dang / 'jig rten thams cad du rgyu zhing chos bstan pa dang / sems can gdul ba yang dag par sgrub pa'i sprul pa'i las dang / nam 'dod pa dang / nam sems bskyed pa na smon lam yongs su rdzogs par sems can la yang dag par ston pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi las so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi las te/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'phrin las rgya chen po bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of activity: activity related to all worlds, able to purify them all; activity related to all buddhas, able to provide offerings to them all; activity related to all enlightening beings, planting the same roots of goodness; activity relating to all sentient beings, able to teach and transform them all; activity relating to the future, able to take in the whole future; activity of all spiritual powers, able to reach all worlds without leaving one world; activity of all light, emanating lights of infinite colors, with an enlightening being sitting on a lotus seat appearing in each light beam; activity perpetuating the lineage of the three treasures, preserving and sustaining the buddhas’ teachings after the demise of the buddhas; activity of all miraculous transformations, expounding the truth and teaching the sentient beings in all worlds; activity of all empowerments, instantly appearing to sentient beings according to their mental inclinations, causing all aspirations to be fulfilled. Based on these ten kinds of activity enlightening beings can achieve the supremely great activity of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'gro ba thams cad du byung ba med pas/ byang chub sems dpa'i lus ni 'ongs pa med pa'o/ /'gro ba thams cad du mi dmigs pa med pas/ byang chub sems dpa'i lus ni 'ongs pa'o/ /'jig rten thams cad kyis dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i lus ni bden pa ma yin pa'o/ /'jig rten gyi bden pa rnam par dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i lus ni rdzun ma yin pa'o/ /phyi ma'i mtha'i mur rgyun mi 'chad pas/ byang chub sems dpa'i lus ni rgyun mi zad pa'o/ /bdud thams cad kyis mi shigs pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus ni brtan pa'o/ /bdud kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi sgul bas/ byang chub sems dpa'i lus ni sra ba'o/ /bsod nams brgya ba'i mtshan gyis shin tu rnam par dag par snang bas/ byang chub sems dpa'i lus ni mtshan bzang po dang ldan pa'o/ /chos kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i mthar thug pas/ byang chub sems dpa'i lus ni mtshan nyid med pa'o/ /'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang mnyam pa nyid thob pas byang chub sems dpa'i lus ni kun tu song ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus te/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mi zad pa/ bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of body: the noncoming body, not being born in any world; the nongoing body, impossible to find in any world; the nonreal body, realizing all worlds as they really are; the nonfalse body, showing the world the truth; the inexhaustible body, never being annihilated; the stable body, impossible for demons to destroy; the imperturbable body, impossible for demons and false teachers to disturb; the formal body, manifesting pure marks of virtue; the formless body, the forms of all things being ultimately formless; the omnipresent body, being the same one body as all buddhas of all times.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus kyi las te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad lus gcig gis rgyas par 'gengs pa'i lus kyi las dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad du sgo yongs su stan pa'i lus kyi las dang / skye ba thams cad du gnas pa'i lus kyi las dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'gro ba'i lus kyi las dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du 'gro ba'i lus kyi las dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad lag pa gcig gis kun tu khebs par byed pa'i lus kyi las dang / khor yug dang / rdo rje'i ri thams cad lag pa gcig gis nyug pa'i lus kyi las dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rang gi lus 'jig pa dang / 'byung ba yongs su ston pa'i lus kyi las dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad lus gcig gis yongs su 'dzin pa'i lus kyi las dang / /sems can gyi khams thams cad lus med par khong du chud pas zhing yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa kun tu ston pa'i lus kyi las so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus kyi las te/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos 'gro ba kun gyis rnam par rig par bya ba bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of physical action: filling all worlds with one body; ability to appear before all sentient beings; ability to undertake birth in all states of being; traveling in all worlds; going to the assemblies of all buddhas; ability to cover all worlds with one hand; ability to grind the iron surrounding mountains of all worlds to dust with one hand; manifesting the formation and disintegration of all buddha-lands in one’s own body to show sentient beings; admitting all realms of sentient beings into one body; in one’s own body manifesting all pure buddha-lands, with all sentient beings attaining enlightenment therein. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supreme action of buddhas and be able to enlighten all sentient beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rang bzhin te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar nan tan dang ldan pas/ pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su mi gtong pas; bsdu ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin dang / sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po rang gi lus kyi len kyang yongs su mi skyo bas/ snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pas/ byams pa chen po'i rang bzhin dang / 'gro ba thams cad nye bar 'tsho bas bsod nams kyi rang bzhin dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku dang gcig tu 'dres pas ye shes kyi rang bzhin dang / skye ba'i skye mched thams cad las 'das pas chos kyi rang bzhin dang / thams cad du sgo yongs su ston pas/ thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad yongs su ston pas/ rdzu 'phrul gyi rang bzhin dang / nam 'dod pa'i dus su mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bas/ byang chub kyi rang bzhin no/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rang bzhin te/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po'i rang bzhin bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings also have ten more kinds of body: the body of transcendent ways, due to correctly practicing them all; the body of the four integrative methods, due to not abandoning sentient beings; the body of great compassion, due to accepting immeasurable suffering in place of all sentient beings without wearying; the body of great benevolence, due to saving all sentient beings; the body of blessings and virtue, due to benefiting all sentient beings; the body of wisdom, being of the same one nature as the bodies of all buddhas; the body of reality, being forever free from undergoing birth in conditioned states; the body of expedient means, appearing in all places; the body of spiritual powers, manifesting all mystic transformations; the body of enlightenment, achieving true awareness at any time, as desired. Based on these, enlightening beings attain the supreme body of wisdom of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngag ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad bde bar byed pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngag ni 'jam pa'o/ /sems can thams cad kyi sems sim par byed pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngag ni snyan pa'o/ /yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du go bar byed pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngag ni mi rdzun pa'o/ /rmi lam na yang log par mi smra bas/ byang chub sems dpa'i ngag ni bden pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'o/ /brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po thams cad zil gyis gnon pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngag ni rgya che ba'o/ /chos kyi rang bzhin ston pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngag ni zab mo'i dbyangs su sgrog pa'o/ /chos bstan pa thams cad mi zad pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngag ni snying po dang ldan pa'o/ /sgra ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par byed pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngag ni shin tu gsal ba'o/ /dus dang las dang rnam par smin pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su ston pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngag ni rnam pa tha dad pa'o/ /bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par spyod pa la 'jug par byed pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngag ni 'gro ba thams cad la bgro ba'o/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngag ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of speech: gentle speech, causing all sentient beings to be calm; sweet elixir speech, causing all sentient beings to be clear and cool; nondeceptive speech, everything they say being true; truthful speech, not lying even in dreams; great speech, being honored by all the gods; profound speech, revealing the essence of things; steadfast speech, expounding truth inexhaustibly; straightforward speech, their statements being easy to understand; various speech, being spoken according to the occasion; speech enlightening all sentient beings, enabling them to understand according to their inclinations. Based on these, enlightening beings attain the supreme subtle speech of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras; byang chub sems dpa'i ngag de yang las rnam par dag pa bcus yongs su sbyangs pa yin te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung la mos pa yongs su dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshig sngon ma thos pa la mngon par mos pa yongs su dag pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshig yongs su spangs pas yongs su dag pa dang / sngon gyi mthar ngag gi nyes pa bzhi dang bral bas yongs su dag pa dang / dga' ba dang mos pa chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa mngon du bstod pas yongs su dag pa dang / sgra chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa mchod par 'os pa/ yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang / legs pa brjod pas yongs su dag pa dang / bsam pa thag pas sems can gzhan la chos kyi sbyin pas sdud pas yongs su dag pa dang / glu'i dbyangs dang / rol mo brdung ba dang / dkrol ba'i dbyangs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la mngon par bstod pas yongs su dag pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams las mngon sum du chos thos nas/ rang gi lus 'bul bas yongs su dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos smra ba thams cad las chos thos nas rim gro bya ba'i phyir/ bdag 'bul zhing snying thag pa nas yongs su gtong bas yongs su dag pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa'i ngag ni las rnam par dag pa bcu po de dag gis shin tu sbyangs par 'byung ngo/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten ways of purifying speech: joyfully listening to the voice of Buddhas; joyfully listening to explanations of the virtues of enlightening beings; not saying anything unpleasant to sentient beings; truly avoiding all faults of speech; joyfully praising the enlightened; singing the praises of buddhas aloud at the monuments of deceased buddhas; giving teachings to sentient beings with a profound, pure mind; praising Buddha with music and song; listening to the true Teaching without worrying about one’s body or life; giving oneself up to serve all enlightening beings and teachers of truth, and receiving the sublime teaching from them.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngag de ltar yongs su sbyangs pa de yang yongs su 'dzin pa bcus yongs su gzung bar 'byung ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar lha'i dbang po la sogs pa lha thams cad kyis yongs su gzung bar 'byung ba yin/ klu'i dbang po dang / gnod sbyin gyi dbang po dang / dri za'i dbang po dang / lha ma yin gyi dbang po dang / nam mkha'i lding gi dbang po dang / mi'am ci'i dbang po dang / lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po dang / tshangs pa'i dbang po la sogs pa tshangs pa'i ris su gtogs pa'i lha thams cad kyis yongs su gzung bar 'byung ba yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi dbang po la sogs pa chos su smra ba thams cad kyis yongs su gzung bar 'byung ba yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa'i ngag ni yongs su 'dzin pa bcu po de dag gis shin tu gzung bar 'byung ngo/ /

“Based on these ten things which purify speech, great enlightening beings gain ten kinds of protection: they are protected by all celestial beings, by all nagas, all yakshas, all gandharvas, all titans, all garudas, all kinnaras, all maharagas, all Brahmas, and all teachers of truth, beginning with the buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa'i ngag de ltar shin tu gzung bar 'byung ba de yang dgos pa bcu yongs su grub par byed de/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can gyi khams mngon par dga' bar byed do/ /'jig rten gyi khams su go bar byed do/ /dbang po'i khams la 'jug par byed do; ;mos pa'i khams rnam par dag par byed do/ /nyon mongs pa'i khams sel bar byed do/ /bag chags kyi khams spong bar byed do/ /bsam pa'i khams sbyong bar byed do/ /lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khams rnam par 'phel bar byed do/ /chos kyi khams rgyas par byed do/ /mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams yang dag par rtogs par byed do/ /dgos pa bcu po de dag yongs su sgrub bo/ /

“Having received this protection, great enlightening beings are able to accomplish ten great works: gladdening all sentient beings; going to all worlds; knowing all faculties; purifying all devotions; exterminating all afflictions; getting rid of all habit energy; purifying all inclinations; increasing all profound determinations; causing all to pervade all universes; causing all nirvanas to be clearly seen.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par 'dzin cing ston pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems ni sa lta bu'o/ /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes rgya chen po'i rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa la zhugs pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems ni rgya mtsho lta bu'o/ /'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu mtho ba la 'gro ba thams cad rab tu dgod pa'i phyir; byang chub sems dpa'i sems ni ri bo chen po lta bu'o/ /kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing bsam pa dag pa dang ldan pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems ni nor bu rin po che lta bu'o/ /chos thams cad la rab tu rno bas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems ni rdo rje lta bu'o/ /bdud dang mu stegs can gzhan dang phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi sgul bas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems ni ri'i rgyal po rdo rje'i khor yug shin tu brtan zhing mi shigs pa lta bu'o/ /'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis mi gos pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems ni pad+mo lta bu'o/ /bskal pa thams cad du 'byung ba dang / mthong bar dka' bas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems ni me tog u du ma wa ra lta bu'o/ /'gro ba thams cad kyi ma rig pa'i mun pa mun nag dang / rab rib kyi rmugs pa sel ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems ni nyi ma lta bu'o/ /'gro ba thams cad kyis brjod du med pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems ni bar snang lta bu'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras; bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rgya chen po yongs su dag pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of mind: a mind like the earth, able to hold the roots of goodness of all sentient beings and make them grow; a mind like the ocean, with the water of truth of infinite great knowledge of all buddhas all flowing into it; a mind like the polar mountain, placing all sentient beings on the supreme transmundane foundations of goodness; a mind like the finest jewel, their desires being pure and unpolluted; a mind like diamond, deeply penetrating all truths with certainty; a mind like the adamantine world-surrounding mountains, being invulnerable to disturbance by any demons or false teachers; a mind like a lotus blossom, which worldly things cannot affect; a mind like an udumbara flower, difficult to encounter through all time; a mind like the clear sun, destroying the darkness; a mind like space, being immeasurable. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the supreme pure mind of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'gro ba thams cad rab tu dgrol bar bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed do/ /sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa bsal bar bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed do/ /bag chags kyi mtshams 'brel ba thams cad spang bar bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed do/ /chos thams cad la the tshom med pa thob par bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed do/ /sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po rab tu zhi bar bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed do/ /ngan song dang mi khom pa thams cad gcad par bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed do/ /byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa thams cad la nan tan du bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed do/ /skra'i sbubs su 'jug pa thams cad kyang ma lus par 'gro ba thams cad du sangs rgyas thams cad byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba bstan par bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed do/ /'gro ba ma lus pa thams cad kyi bsam pa dang / dbang po rab tu rtogs pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du grags par bya bar chos kyi rnga bla na med pa brdung bar bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rgya chen po'i 'phrin las bla na med pa rtsom par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten determinations: to liberate all beings; to cause all beings to get rid of their afflictions; to cause all sentient beings to extinguish their habit energies; to eliminate all doubts; to remove all sentient beings’s miseries; to extirpate the difficulties of the states of woe; to respectfully follow all buddhas; to study what all enlightening beings should learn; to show the enlightenment of all buddhas at each point in all worlds; to beat the drum of the highest teaching in all worlds, to cause all sentient beings to gain understanding in accord with their faculties and inclinations. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain buddhas’ mind of great determination and competence.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems kyis rgyas par dgang ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems shin tu yangs pa dang ldan pas nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad rgyas par dgang ba dang / mtha' dang dbus med pa khong du chud pas chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par dgang ba dang / skad cig gcig tu 'dzud pas dus gsum thams cad rgyas par dgang ba dang / gshegs pa dang / skye ba dang / 'byung ba dang / rnam par 'tshang rgya ba dang; chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa chen po mngon sum du shes pas/ sangs rgyas skye ba thams cad du rgyas par dgang ba dang / bag chags dang dbang po nam mkha' lta bur khong du chud pas/ sems can gyi khams thams cad du rgyas par dgang ba dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad khong du chud pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas/ mig yor lta bu'i ye shes kyis rgyas par dgang ba dang / sgyu ma'i dra ba rnam pa tha dad pa lta bur khong du chud pas/ mtha' dang dbus med par rgyas par dgang ba dang / rang bzhin mi dmigs pas mi skye bar rgyas par dgang ba dang / rang gi sems dang gzhan gyi sems la thogs pa med pas/ chags pa med par rgyas par dgang ba dang / sems bskyed pa thams cad la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yongs su ston pas/ dbang gis rgyas par dgang ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems kyis rgyas par dgang ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyis rgyas par dgang ba mtha' dang dbus med pa'i rgyan bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of comprehensive mind: a mind comprehending all spaces, their intentions far-reaching; a mind comprehending all realms of reality, deeply penetrating infinity; a mind comprehending all past, present, and future, knowing them all in a single thought; a mind comprehending the manifestation of all buddhas, clearly understanding their entry into the womb, birth, leaving home, attainment of enlightenment, teaching activity, and ultimate nirvana; a mind comprehending all sentient beings, knowing their faculties, inclinations, and habit energies; a mind comprehending all knowledge, knowing the realms of reality everywhere; a mind comprehending all infinities, knowing the differentiations of the networks of illusions; a mind comprehending all nonorigination, not apprehending any intrinsic nature in any thing; a mind comprehending all nonobstruction, not dwelling on the mind of self or the mind of other; a mind comprehending all freedoms, manifesting realization of buddhahood everywhere in a single instant. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the comprehensive adornments of supreme buddhahood.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas thams cad mthong bar dad pa phyir ldog pa med pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni dga' bar byed pa'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par 'tshang rgya bar byed pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni mngon par mos pa'o/ /bya ba thams cad la thogs pa med pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni phyir mi ldog pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad rgyun mi gcod pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni gnas pa'o/ /shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul khong du chud pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni shin tu phra ba'o/ /sems can thams cad kyi dgos pa yongs su grub par byed pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni rgyun mi 'chad do/ /chos thams cad la rab tu rno ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni rdo rje lta bu'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul la snang ba 'thob pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni rdo rje'i 'od 'phro ba ltar snang bar byed pa'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang / lus gcig tu gyur pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni tha mi dad pa'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni chags pa med pa'i mthar phyin pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po rgya chen po yongs su rdzogs pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of faculties: joyful faculties, seeing all buddhas, with faith indestructible; hopeful faculties, understanding whatever Buddha teachings they hear; nonregressing faculties, consummating all their tasks; steadfast faculties, not stopping the practices of enlightening beings; subtle faculties, entering the subtle principle of transcendent wisdom; unceasing faculties, consummating the tasks of all sentient beings; adamantine faculties, realizing the nature of all things; indestructible glowing faculties, illumining all spheres of buddhahood; undifferentiated faculties, being the same one body as all buddhas; unobstructed faculties, deeply penetrating the ten powers of the enlightened. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the supreme faculties of fulfillment of great knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis ma gos pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yid la bya ba dang ma 'dres pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi rjes su song ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su 'byung ba'i lam dang mthun pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa bdud dang / mu stegs can gzhan dang / mu stegs spyod pa'i rgol ba thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyis rnam par dag pas/ kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa chos ji skad du thos pa yongs su mi gtong bas shin tu zin par yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa skye ba'i skye mched thams cad kyis ma gos pas yongs su nyams pa med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa ye shes phra ba la zhugs pa'i phyir zab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la shin tu brtson pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa bla na med pa yongs su rdzogs par 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of profound mind: a profound mind not stained by any worldly things; a profound mind not alloyed with the ways of the lesser vehicles of individual salvation; a profound mind comprehending the enlightenment of all buddhas of past, present, and future; a profound mind following the path of omniscience; a profound mind unmoved by any demons or heretics; a profound mind clarifying the comprehensive knowledge of all enlightened ones; a profound mind accepting and holding all truths heard; a profound mind not clinging to any state of life; a profound mind imbued with all subtle knowledge; a profound mind cultivating all qualities of buddhahood. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the supreme, pure, profound mind of omniscience.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsags pa la phyir mi ldog par dbang bsgyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dgongs pa'i tshul bstan pa la nem nur med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa smon lam dang spyod pa chen po'i rgyun yongs su 'dzin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la 'jug par bya ba la yul du phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur bas mngon sum du gyur pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa chos sna tshogs kyi tshul la rab tu zhugs pas rgya che ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa brtsams pa thams cad mthar phyin par byed pas gtso bor gyur pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par 'phrul ba'i rgyan thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa sngon gyi smon lam gyis yongs su bzung bas shin tu brtan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba la rgyun mi 'chad pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas thams cad kyi lhag pa'i dgongs pa bla na med pa yongs su dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go / //

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of intense profound mind: an intense profound mind not backsliding, because they accumulate all roots of goodness; an intense, profound mind removing doubt, because they understand the esoteric sayings of all buddhas; an intense profound mind holding truth, being born by great vows and great deeds; a supremely intense profound mind, deeply penetrating all Buddha teachings; a masterful intense profound mind, mastering all Buddha teachings; a vast intense profound mind, entering into various ways of access to truth; a leading intense profound mind, accomplishing all tasks; a free intense profound mind, adorned by all concentrations, spiritual powers, and mystical transformations; an abiding intense profound mind, embracing their past vows; an unceasing intense profound mind, developing all sentient beings to maturity. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the supremely pure intense profound mind of all buddhas.
bam po brgyad cu rtsa gcig pa/

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar rnam par smin pa la re ba med par bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong bas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa'i sbyor ba dang / gzhan la brnyas pa med pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims dang / bslab pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / sdom pa dang / brtul zhugs pa dang / dka' thub thams cad du yi dam bcas pa la nan tan byed pa'i sbyor ba dang / bdag dang pha rol gyi 'du shes med pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnod sems kyi tha ba dang gshe ba thams cad rna la gzon cing / sems can gyis ngan du byas pa thams cad bzod pa'i sbyor ba dang / lus dang / ngag dang / sems yang dag par bskul bas brtsams pa thams cad mthar phyin par byed pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtson 'grus brtsams pa thams cad las phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba dang / 'dod pa 'khrugs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i g.yog 'khor yongs su spong bas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan dang;
