rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa thams cad mngon par sgrub pa'i sbyor ba dang / bsod nams bsags pa thams cad la skyo ba med pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi nan tan gyi sbyor ba dang / sems can med pa la zhugs pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa chen po'i sbyor ba dang / chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'gro ba thams cad kyi sdug bsngal rang gi lus kyis len pa'i snying rje chen po las phyir mi ldog par sbyor ba dang / chags pa med par khong du chud pas 'gro ba thams cad yang dag par ston pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnam par 'tshang rgya ba'i sbyor ba dang / sems can gzhan gyi rgyud du phyin par byed pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba las phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing; byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po'i sbyor ba bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of diligent practice: diligent practice of giving, relinquishing all without seeking reward; diligent practice of self-control, practicing austerities, having few desires, and being content; diligent practice of forbearance, detaching from notions of self and other, tolerating all evils without anger or malice; diligent practice of vigor, their thoughts, words, and deeds never confused, not regressing in what they do, reaching the ultimate end; diligent practice of meditations, liberations, and concentrations, discovering spiritual powers, leaving behind all desires, afflictions, contention, and their congeners; diligent practice of wisdom, tirelessly cultivating and accumulating virtues; diligent practice of great benevolence, knowing that all sentient beings have no nature of their own; diligent practice of great compassion, knowing that all things are empty, accepting suffering in place of all sentient beings without wearying; diligent practice to awaken the ten powers of enlightenment, realizing them without obstruction, manifesting them for sentient beings; diligent practice of the nonreceding wheel of teaching, proceeding to reach all sentient beings. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supreme practice of great knowledge and wisdom of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar bsgrub par dka' ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sbyor bas rlabs po che'i mos pa dang / rgyan sna tshogs mngon par sgrub pas sna tshogs kyi mos pa dang / yid zhum pa med pas rgya chen po'i mos pa dang / chos zab mo'i tshul la zhugs pas zhi bar byed pa'i mos pa dang / sems rgya chen po bskyed pas yangs pa'i mos pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi mthu dang / shugs su ldan pas rang gis skabs phye ba'i mos pa dang / bdud kyi las thams cad rab tu 'joms pas mi 'phrogs pa'i mos pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa la gcig tu nges pas shin tu gdon mi za ba'i mos pa dang / ci 'dod pa'i cho 'phrul yongs su ston pas mngon du gyur pa'i mos pa dang / stobs dang mi ldan pa med pa'i phyir/ dus gang du 'dod par byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bas sangs rgyas thams cad kyis lung bstan pa yang dag par nod pa'i mos pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of certain understanding: certain understanding of the supreme, planting roots of goodness of respect; certain understanding of adornment, producing various adornments; certain understanding of breadth and magnanimity, their minds never narrow or mean; certain understanding of quiescence, able to penetrate the most profound essence of things; certain understanding of universality, their determination for enlightenment extending everywhere; certain understanding of capacity, able to receive the support of the power of Buddha; certain understanding of strength, able to crush all demon activities; certain understanding of clear decision, knowing the consequences of all actions; certain understanding of presence, able to manifest spiritual powers at will; certain understanding of succession, receiving the prediction of buddhahood from all buddhas; certain understanding of freedom, attaining buddhahood at will at any time. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the supreme certain understanding of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams su mos pa la 'jug pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu mos pa la 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gcig 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mos pa la 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad pad+mo'i gdan gcig la bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i skus yongs su khyab par mos pa la 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin du yang dag par bstan par mos pa la 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyi rgyan gyis brgyan par mos pa la 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyis rgyas par gang bar mos pa la 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad skra'i sbubs gcig tu dgod par mos pa la 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sems can gcig gi lus kyi rgyud kyi rjes su 'brang bar mos pa la 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi byang chub kyi shing dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi snying po byang chub kyis yongs su rgyas par gang bar mos pa la 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sgra'i dbyangs gcig gis go bar bya ba dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi sgra skad rnam pa tha dad pa la 'jug pas tshim par bya bar mos pa la 'jug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams su mos pa la 'jug pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing la mos pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of definitive understanding of worlds: they know all worlds penetrate one world; they know one world penetrates all worlds; they know the body and lotus throne of one buddha pervades all worlds; they know all worlds are like space; they know all worlds are endowed with the adornments of buddhas; they know all worlds are filled with enlightening beings; they know all worlds enter one pore; they know all worlds enter the body of a single sentient being; they know the enlightenment tree and site of enlightenment of one buddha pervade all worlds; they know all worlds are pervaded by one message that allows sentient beings to hear it differently, to their delight. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain buddhas’ supreme great understanding of buddha-lands.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can gyi khams su mos pa la 'jug pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can gyi khams thams cad rang bzhin gyis lus med par mos pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad sems can gcig gi lus kyi rgyud du 'dus par mos pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i khong du 'dus par mos pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur 'dus par mos pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad du sems can gcig gi lus yongs su zhugs par gyur bar mos pa la 'dug pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snod du mos pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po dang / ci 'dod pa dang / gar mos pa'i gzugs dang / kha dog dang / cha byad du mngon par blta bar mos pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / kha dog dang / cha byad du yongs su bstan par mos pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyis yongs su brgyan par byin gyis brlab cing / yongs su bstan par mos pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po dang / gzugs kyi sku sna tshogs kyi spyod lam dang / tshul dang / spyod pa yongs su bstan cing / gzhan gyis rig par bya bar mos pa la 'jug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni /byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can gyi khams su mos pa la 'jug pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgyes pa dang / khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of certain understanding of the realm of sentient beings: they know that all realms of sentient beings essentially have no reality; they know that all realms of sentient beings enter the body of one sentient being; they know that all realms of sentient beings enter the body of an enlightening being; they know that all realms of sentient beings enter the matrix of enlightenment; they know the body of one sentient being enters all realms of sentient beings; they know that all realms of sentient beings can be vessels of the buddhas’ teachings; they know all realms of sentient beings and manifest the bodies of celestial beings for them according to their desires; they know all realms of sentient beings and manifest the tranquil, composed behavior of saints and individual illuminates for them, according to their inclinations; they know all realms of sentient beings and manifest to them the bodies of enlightening beings adorned with virtues; they know all realms of sentient beings and show them the marks and embellishments and the tranquil comportment of buddhas, and enlighten sentient beings. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supremely powerful certain understanding of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bag chags te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems kyi bag chags dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bag chags dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i bag chags dang / sangs rgyas lta ba'i bag chags dang / 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag par skye ba'i bag chags dang / spyod pa'i bag chags dang / smon lam gyi bag chags dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i bag chags dang / chos mnyam pa nyid nges par rtogs pa'i bag chags dang / spyod pa rnam pa tha dad pa'i bag chags so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bag chags te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyon mongs pa'i bag chags ma lus par spangs nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen pos bag chags thugs su chud pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of habit energy: the habit energy of determination for enlightenment; the habit energy of roots of goodness; the habit energy of edifying sentient beings; the habit energy of seeing Buddha; the habit energy of undertaking birth in pure worlds; the habit energy of enlightening practice; the habit energy of vows; the habit energy of transcendence; the habit energy of meditation on equality; the habit energy of various differentiations of state. Based on these, enlightening beings can forever get rid of all afflictive habit energies and attain buddhas’ habit energy of great knowledge, the knowledge that is not energized by habit.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nye bar len pa ste/ nye bar len pa de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgyun mi gcod pa'o/ /bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar yongs su smin pa'i mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir/ sems can gyi khams nye bar len pa dang / lhag ma med par yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir/ 'jig rten gyi khams nye bar len pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas mnyes par bya ba'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa nye bar len pa dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / sangs rgyas gyi yon tan yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir/ dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar len pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po nye bar blangs te rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir/ snying rje chen po nye bar len pa dang / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i bde ba la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir/ byams pa chen po nye bar len pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rgyan yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir/ pha rol tu phyin pa nye bar len pa dang / sgo thams cad yongs su bstan pa'i phyir / thabs mkhas pa nye bar len pa dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes kyi phyir byang chub nye bar len pa dang / mdor na thams cad mngon sum du shes pas mngon par shes par bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad nye bar len pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nye bar len pa ste/ nye bar len pa de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgyun mi gcod cing / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nye bar len pa med pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of grasping, by which they perpetuate the practices of enlightening beings: they grasp all realms of sentient beings, to ultimately enlighten them; they grasp all worlds, to ultimately purify them; they grasp Buddha, cultivating the practices of enlightening beings as offerings; they grasp roots of goodness, accumulating the virtues that mark and embellish the buddhas; they grasp great compassion, to extinguish the pains of all sentient beings; they grasp great benevolence, to bestow on all beings the happiness of omniscience; they grasp the transcendent ways, to accumulate the adornments of enlightening beings; they grasp skill in means, to demonstrate them everywhere; they grasp enlightenment, to attain unobstructed knowledge; in sum, enlightening beings grasp all things, to comprehend them everywhere with clear knowledge. Based on these, enlightening beings can perpetuate the practices of enlightening beings and attain the buddhas’ supreme state of not grasping anything.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nan tan te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa'i nan tan tan dang / bslab pa'i nan tan dang / ye shes kyi nan tan dang / don gyi nan tan dang / chos kyi nan tan dang / mngon par bsgrub pa'i nan tan dang / yang dag par bstan pa'i nan tan dang / spyod pas mi skyo ba'i nan tan dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i nan tan dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i nan tan no/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nan tan te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad kyi nan tan bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of cultivation: they cultivate the ways of transcendence, learning, wisdom, purpose, righteousness, emancipation, manifestation, diligence, accomplishment of true awakening, and operation of right teaching. Based on these, enlightening beings achieve supreme cultivation and practice all truths.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'grub pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sems pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'grub pa'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' la mngon par yid ches pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'grub pa'o/ /dam pa'i chos la mi spong ba ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'grub pa'o/ /tshad med pa'i sems kyis sangs rgyas su dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba mi zad pa ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'grub pa'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul sa mtshams med par yid ches pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'grub pa'o/ /'jig rten gyi khams kyi yul la 'jug pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'grub pa'o/ /chos kyi dbyings kyi yul las mi g.yo ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'grub pa'o/ /bdud kyi yul las gyen du spags pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'grub pa'o/ /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul rjes su dran pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'grub pa'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i yul la mngon par mos pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'grub pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'grub pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po 'grub pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten ways of fulfillment of the Buddha teachings: not leaving wise associates; deeply believing in the words of buddhas; not repudiating truth; dedicating unlimited roots of goodness; focusing on the infinity of the sphere of Buddha; knowing the realms of all worlds; not abandoning the realm of cosmic reality; avoiding all realms of demons; correctly recollecting the realm of all buddhas; seeking the realm of the ten powers of buddhas. Based on these, enlightening beings can achieve the supreme great wisdom of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos las gol ba'i lam ste/ de dag ni byang chub sems dpas yongs su spang bar bya ba dag go /bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brnyas pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos las gol ba'i lam mo/ /'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la gol ba'i lam mo/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas skyo ba ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos las gol ba'i lam mo/ /'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pas yongs su skyo ba ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos las gol ba'i lam mo/ /mnyam par gzhag pa la gnas su byed pa ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos las gol ba'i lam mo/ /dge ba'i rtsa ba la chags shing zhen pa ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos las gol ba'i lam mo/ /dam pa'i chos spong ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos las gol ba'i lam mo/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las dpa' bas 'byed pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos las gol ba'i lam mo/ /nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas su 'dod pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos las gol ba'i lam mo/ /byang chub sems dpa' la zhe sdang zhing khong khro ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos las gol ba'i lam mo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos las gol ba'i lam rnams te/ de dag ni byang chub sems dpas yongs su spang bar bya'o/ /de dag yongs su spangs nas de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa nyid du 'da' bar 'gyur ba dag go /

“There are ten things that cause enlightening beings to regress from the Buddha teachings, which they should avoid: slighting the wise; fearing the pains of birth and death; getting tired of practicing the acts of enlightening beings; not caring to remain in the world; addiction to concentration; clinging to roots of goodness; liking the ways of individual liberation; having aversion to enlightening beings. If enlightening beings avoid these ten things, they will enter the enlightening beings’ paths of emancipation.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skyon med pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang mngon par bsgrub la/ sems can thams cad la yang rnam par lta ba dang / lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad dang yang bral la/ lta ba'i bcing bas glags pa thams cad kyang rab tu 'grel ba dang / mtshan ma thams cad kyang yid la mi byed la/ mtshan ma la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can thams cad kyang mi 'dor ba dang / khams gsum pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das te/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gnas thams cad na gnas pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnams kyang rnam par bzlog la/ sems can rnams dang yang phrad cing 'grogs pa dang / chos rnams la yang 'dod chags dang bral la/ sems can thams cad la yang snying rje chen pos byams pa dang / dngos po thams cad kyis kyang dben la/ 'khor thams cad kyang yongs su ston pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams las kyang gyen du 'phags la/ skye zhing shi 'pho ba'i spyod pa yang mngon par bsgrub pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis kyang ma gos la/ 'jig rten gyi bya ba thams cad la yang thogs pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyang mngon du gyur la/ spyod pa dang / smon lam chen po'i nyi ma yang rgyun mi gcod pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skyon med pa/ 'phags pa/ 'jig rten las 'das pa/ 'gro ba thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang ma 'dres pa ste/ skyon med pa de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub sems dpa'i chos nges pa rnam par 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten paths of emancipation: evoking transcendent wisdom, yet always observing all sentient beings; detaching from all views, yet liberating all sentient beings bound by views; not minding any appearances, yet not abandoning sentient beings attached to appearances; transcending the triple world, yet always being in all worlds; forever leaving afflictions, yet living together with all sentient beings; attaining desirelessness, yet always most compassionately pitying all sentient beings attached to desires; always enjoying tranquillity and serenity, yet always appearing to be in company; being free from birth in the world, yet dying in one place and being reborn in another, carrying on the activities of enlightening beings; not being affected by any worldly things, yet not stopping work in the world; actually realizing full enlightenment, yet not abandoning the vows and practices of enlightening beings. These are enlightening beings’ ten ways of emancipation, which are not common to worldlings, and also are not alloyed with the practices of the two vehicles of individual liberation; if enlightening beings live by these principles, they will attain the qualities of certainty of enlightening beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i chos nges pa 'thob ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi yul la gnas pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i las la zhugs pa yin/ pha rol tu phyin pa la nan tan du byed pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi rgyud nas byung ba yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung las skyes pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi stobs la gnas pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub tu rjes su song ba yin/ sangs rgyas thams cad dang sku dang rang bzhin gcig pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par spyod pa dang mi gnyis pa yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i chos nges pa 'thob pa ste/ de dag ni skyon med pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'thob pa dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten qualities of certainty: they are certainly born in the family of buddhas; they certainly live in the realm of buddhas; they certainly know the tasks of enlightening beings; they certainly persist in the transcendent ways; they certainly get to join the assemblies of buddhas; they certainly can reveal the nature of buddhahood; they certainly abide in the powers of the enlightened; they certainly enter the enlightenment of buddhas; they certainly are one and the same body as all buddhas; their abode is certainly none other than that of all buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos la 'byung ba'i lam ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thun mong du mos pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la 'byung ba'i lam mo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang tshul mthun zhing / smon lam chen po la dbugs phyin pa thob pa ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos la 'byung ba'i lam mo/ /sems rgya chen pos rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i go 'byed pa ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos la 'byung ba'i lam mo// las ji ltar byas pa chud mi za bas/ bskal pa 'grangs pa thams cad du mi skyo ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la 'byung ba'i lam mo/ /phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa thams cad du yongs su 'dzin pas/ 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med par gnas par bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la 'byung ba'i lam mo/ /sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba la mkhas pas/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgyun mi gcad pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la 'byung ba'i lam mo/ /snying rje chen po bskyed de sems tshad med par byed pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la 'byung ba'i lam mo/ /nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad sems bskyed pa gcig gis rgyas par dgang bas/ spyod pa dang smon lam chen po'i khyad par la 'jug pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la 'byung ba'i lam mo/ /sngon mngon par bsgrub pa chud mi za bar de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs yang dag par 'dzin pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la 'byung ba'i lam mo/ /'gro ba thams cad la byang chub kyi sems yongs su ston cing / byang chub kyi sems skyes pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad nye bar ston pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la 'byung ba'i lam mo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos la 'byung ba'i lam ste/ de dag gis byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams skyes bu dam pa'i ming bcu 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten ways of generating the qualities of buddhahood: following good friends is a way of generating qualities of buddhahood, because they plant roots of goodness together; profound devotion is a way of generating qualities of buddhahood, because they know the masteries of buddhas; making great vows is a way of generating qualities of buddhahood, because their minds become broad; recognizing their own roots of goodness is a way of generating qualities of buddhahood, because they know their action is not wrong; tirelessly cultivating practice in all ages is a way of generating qualities of buddhahood, because it comprehends the future; appearing in countless worlds is a way of generating qualities of buddhahood, by maturing sentient beings; not stopping the practices of enlightening beings is a way of generating qualities of buddhahood, by increasing great compassion; infinite awareness is a way of generating qualities of buddhahood, by pervading all of space in a single moment of thought; excellent action is a way of generating qualities of buddhahood, because what has been put into practice is not lost; the potential of enlightenment is a way of generating qualities of buddhahood, causing all sentient beings to gladly set their minds on enlightenment and sustain this will by all virtues. Based on these, enlightening beings gain ten appellations of greatness.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skyes bu dam pa'i ming 'thob pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub kyi ye shes kyi lus dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba yin/ theg pa chen po la rab tu gnas pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba yin/ chos kyi dam pa mngon par rtobs pas dam pa'i sems dpa' zhes bya ba yin/ mchog gi chos mngon par 'tshang rgya bas mchog gi sems dpa' zhes bya ba yin/ ye shes kyi khyad par rab dang ldan pas rab kyi sems dpa' zhes bya ba yin/ phul du brtson 'grus rtsom pas phul gyi sems dpa' zhes bya ba yin/ gong na med pa'i chos yang dag par ston pas bla na med pa'i sems dpa' zhes bya ba yin/ stobs bcu'i ye shes yangs pa dang ldan pas stobs kyi sems dpa' zhes bya ba yin/ 'gro ba thams cad na dpe med pas mi mnyam/ mi 'dra ba'i sems dpa' zhes bya ba yin/ nam 'dod pa'i sems kyi skad cig la byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sems dpa' zhes bya ba yin/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skyes bu dam pa'i ming thob pa rnams so/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten appellations of greatness: they are called beings of enlightenment because they are born of knowledge of enlightenment; they are called great beings because they dwell in the Great Vehicle; they are called foremost beings because they realize the foremost truth; they are called superior beings because they are aware of higher laws; they are called supreme beings because their knowledge is supreme; they are called exalted beings because they reveal the unexcelled teaching; they are called beings of power because they have extensive knowledge of the ten powers; they are called incomparable beings because they have no peer in the world; they are called inconceivable beings because they become buddhas in an instant. If enlightening beings win these appellations, they accomplish the paths of enlightening beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar gcig pu grogs med par byang chub kyi sems mi gtong bas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gcig la rten pa dang / thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par bsgrub pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam yan lag gnyis pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi sbyor ba dang / mtshan ma med pa'i mtha'i rtse mor byin pa dang / smon pa med pa'i phyir/ khams gsum dang mi 'dre pas byang chub sems dpa'i lam rnam pa gsum pa dang / nyes pa bshags pa'i tshul dang / bsod nams thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba gdab pa'i rim gro rgyun mi gcod pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba las mkhas pas shin tu bsngo ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa'i lam spyod pa bzhis smos pa dang / dad pa'i rtsa ba tshugs te shin tu brtan pa dang / brtson 'grus chen po las phyir mi ldog pa dang / dran pa rtse gcig pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul ma 'khrugs pa dang / rab tu rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi spyod yul la mkhas pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam dbang po lngas rnam par spel ba dang / 'di lta ste/ lha'i mig gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi gzugs kyi rnam pa thams cad sems can gyi shi 'pho ba dang / skye ba thams cad yongs su mthong ba'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa dang / lha'i rna bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos bstan pa mnyan cing dran par bya ba dang / yongs su gzung bar bya bas sems can pha rol gyi dbang po la yang dag par phyin par byed pa dang / bdag gis sems chags pa med pas pha rol gyi sems shes pas mthong ba la dbang bsgyur ba mngon par bsgrub pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pas bskal pa 'grangs pa thams cad rjes su dran zhing / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel bar byed pa dang / rdzu 'phrul dang rnam par 'phrul pa chen po bsgrub pas/ sems can ji ltar 'dul ba bzhin du cho 'phrul sna tshogs yongs su ston cing / sems can thams cad la chos brjod pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mthong zhing byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bsgrub pa rgyun mi gcod pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam mngon par shes pa drug gis rnam par 'phrul ba dang / 'di lta ste/ sems can gyi gtso bo mtha' yas pa thams cad skra'i rtse mo gcig la bzhugs par mthong ste/ yang dag par bzung zhing / sems can gzhan gyi bsam pas rnam par rig par bya ba la 'jug pas sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor nas ma g.yos par de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du mngon du zhal nas chos bstan pa bsgrags pa mi zad pas/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsam pa dang dbang po ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par rig par bya ba la 'jug pas chos rjes su dran pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs mthong ba dang mi 'bral zhing / 'gro ba thams cad la byang chub sems dpa'i lus yongs su ston pas dge 'dun gyi rjes su dran pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba la yang dag par gzhol zhing / gtong ba chen pos rnam par spel ba yid la byed pas gtong pa rjes su dran pa dang / byang chub sems dang mi 'bral bas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad 'gro ba thams cad la stobs pas tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / dga' ldan gyi pho brang gi mchog na/ byang chub sems dpa' tshe gcig gis thogs pa bzhugs pa rjes su dran pas lha rjes su dran pa dang / thabs kyi ye shes chen pos 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba rgyun mi 'chad pa la zhugs te/ sems can rjes su dran pa'i phyir dge 'dun rjes su dran pas/ byang chub sems dpa'i lam rjes su dran pa bdun gyis mngon par bsgrub pa dang /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of path. One path is a path of enlightening beings because they do not give up the sole determination for enlightenment. Two paths are a path of enlightening beings because they develop wisdom and skill in means. Three paths are a path of enlightening beings because they practice emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and are not attached to the three worlds. Four practices are a path of enlightening beings: ceaselessly removing the barriers of wrongdoing by repentance, rejoicing in virtue, honoring the enlightened and requesting them to teach, and skillfully practicing dedication. The five faculties are a path of enlightening beings: they rest on pure faith, steadfast and imperturbable; they generate great energy, finishing their tasks; they are single-minded in right recollection, without wandering attention; they know the techniques for entering and emerging from concentration; they are able to distinguish spheres of knowledge. The six psychic powers are a path of enlightening beings: with the celestial eye they see all forms in all worlds and know where sentient beings die and are born; with the celestial ear they hear all buddhas teaching, absorb and remember their teachings, and expound them widely to sentient beings according to their faculties; with telepathic knowledge they are able to know the minds of others freely, without interference; with recollection of past life they are able to remember all ages of the past and increase roots of goodness; with the power of psychic travel they are able to appear variously to beings capable of being enlightened, to induce them to delight in truth; with knowledge of extinction of contamination they actually realize the ultimate truth, while carrying out the deeds of enlightening beings without cease. Seven remembrances are a path of enlightening beings: they remember buddhas because they see infinite buddhas in a single pore opening the minds of all sentient beings; they remember the Teaching because they do not leave the assemblies of all buddhas—they personally receive the sublime Teaching in the assemblies of all buddhas and expound it to sentient beings according to their faculties, temperaments, and inclinations, to enlighten them; they remember the harmonious Community because they continually see enlightening beings in all worlds; they remember relinquishment because they know all enlightening beings’ practices of relinquishment increase magnanimous generosity; they remember the precepts because they do not give up the aspiration for enlightenment, and dedicate all roots of goodness to sentient beings; they remember heaven because they always keep in mind the enlightening beings in the heaven of happiness who are to become buddhas in the next lifetime; they remember sentient beings because they teach and tame them with wisdom and skill in means, reaching them all, without interruption.

'di lta ste/ log par lta ba thams cad yongs su spangs pas yang dag pa'i lta ba'i lam du byung ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtogs pa dang bral bas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mthun zhing / don yod la yid la bya ba med pas byung ba dang / ngag gi nyes pa bzhi dang bral bas 'phags pa dang mthun zhing yang dag pa'i dag rab tu brjod pas dang / lus kyi las thams cad sems can nye bar 'tsho bas/ 'gro ba thams cad thogs pa med par yongs su smin par byed cing / 'dul bas mngon par bsgrub pa dang / 'phags pa'i rigs la rab tu gnas shing / sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi sdom pa/ byang chub kyi lam dang ldan pa'i spyod pa lam dang / spyod pa dang / tshul la rab tu gnas shing / thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pas yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi brtul zhugs dang / dka' thub kyis kun nas gdungs pa dang / yongs su gdungs pa yang dag par ston cing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i rang bzhin thogs pa med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / sgra thams cad 'dzin cing dran pa 'jig rten gyi rnam par 'khrug pa thams cad kyis bar du mi mchod pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin gcig gis ting nge 'dzin thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas pa'i phyir/ yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam ni/ 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang ldan zhing / byang chub dang mthun par gyur pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / 'che ba med pa dang / ngag gi las thams cad kyis ma bsgribs par chos ston pa'i tshul dang ldan pas/ rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa bsal ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i bsam pa yongs su mi gtong zhing dga' ba zeng zang po dang bral ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mthong bas dga' ba'i yid bde ba yang rgyun mi 'chad cing / 'jig rten pa'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang bral bas/ 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang mthun pa dang / mi g.yo ba'i gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas mngon par bsgrub pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa las ma g.yos par 'du shes dang / tshor ba thams cad 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas mngon par bsgrubs shing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bsgrub pa rgyun mi gcod pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam mthar gyis spyod cing snyoms par 'jug pa dgus pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / 'di lta ste/ gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i las dang / rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa yongs su len pa shin tu rtog pa dang / dbang po ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston cing / go bar byed pas sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi dbang po rab dang tha ma shes pa'i ye shes kyis shin tu brtags pa dang / khams tha dad pa dang khams du ma la mkhas pa dang ldan pa dang / rab dang tha ma dang 'bring la mos pa rab tu rtogs pa'i chos kyi tshul la zhugs pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad dang / zhing dang / dus dang / bskal pa thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang / gzugs kyis rgyas par dgang zhing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul yongs su bstan pas/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bsgrub pa yongs su mi gtong ba dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba thams cad las rnam par ldang ba dus la bab pa dang / dus la ma bab ba rtogs pa'i ye shes kyi tshul gyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa la rab tu gnas pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi skye ba dang / shi 'pho ba dang / lam gyi rgyud dang / 'pho ba tha dad pa'i gnas la mkhas pa dang ldan pa dang / dus gsum gyi bskal pa 'grangs pa thams cad skad cig gcig tu gzung ba rtogs pa'i ye shes snang bas mngon par bsgrub pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba byang ba thob pa'i ye shes kyi tshul gyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bsgrub pa mi gtong bas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rab tu rtogs pa la yang dag par btang ba'o/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi lam la mkhas pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

Following the holy Eightfold Path to enlightenment is a path of enlightening beings: they travel the path of right insight, getting rid of all false views; they exercise right thought, abandoning arbitrary conceptions, their mind always following universal knowledge; they always practice right speech, getting rid of faults of speech and following the words of sages; they always cultivate right action, teaching sentient beings to make them peaceful and harmonious; they abide by right livelihood, being frugal and content, careful and correct in behavior, eating, dressing, sleeping, eliminating evil, and practicing good, all in accord with enlightenment, forever getting rid of all faults; they arouse right energy, diligently cultivating all the difficult practices of enlightening beings, entering the ten powers of buddhas without hindrance; their minds always recollect correctly, able to remember all messages, eliminating all mundane distraction; their minds are always correctly concentrated, they enter the door of inconceivable liberation of enlightening beings, and in one concentration they produce all concentrations. Entering the nine successive concentrations is a path of enlightening beings: they detach from craving and ill-will, and expound the truth without inhibition in all they say; they extinguish thought and reflection, yet teach sentient beings with the thought and reflection of omniscience; they give up joy and emotion, yet they are most joyful when they see all buddhas; they give up worldly enjoyments and follow the transcendent enjoyment of the Path of enlightening beings; henceforth they are unshakable and enter formless concentration, yet without abandoning life in the realms of desire and form; though they abide in concentration in which all perception and sensation are extinguished, they do not stop the activity of enlightening beings. Learning the ten powers is a path of enlightening beings: knowledge of what is so and what is not so; knowledge of the causes and effects, deeds and consequences, past, future, and present, of all sentient beings; knowledge of the differences in faculties of all sentient beings and explaining the truth to them as is appropriate; knowledge of the infinite different natures of sentient beings; knowledge of the differences in weak, middling, and superior understanding of all sentient beings, and means of introducing them to truth; knowledge of manifesting the appearance and conduct of Buddha throughout all worlds, all lands, all times, all ages, without abandoning the practices of enlightening beings; knowledge of all meditations, liberations, and concentrations, whether defiled or pure, timely or not, expediently producing doors of liberation for enlightening beings; knowledge of distinctions in all sentient beings’ death in one place and birth in another in the various states of existence; instantaneous knowledge of all ages in past, present, and future; knowledge of extinction of all sentient beings’ desires, compulsions, delusions, and habits, without abandoning the practices of enlightening beings. Based on these ten paths, enlightening beings can attain the path of unexcelled skill in means of all buddhas.
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam ni tshad med pa'o/ /lam gyi tshogs ni tshad med pa'o/ /lam bsgom pa ni tshad med pa'o/ /lam gyi rgyan ni tshad med pa'o/ /
“Great enlightening beings have infinite paths, infinite aids to enlightenment, infinite ways of cultivation, and infinite ways of adornment.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de las bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam tshad med pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar nam mkha'i dbyings tshad med pa dang / mtha' dang dbus med pa'i chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa dang / mi zad pa'i sems can gyi khams tshad med pas dang / mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pas dang / mi zad pa'i bskal pa 'grangs pa tshad med pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi tha snyad mtha' yas shing tshad med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku tshad med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi dbyangs tshad med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs tshad med pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes tshad med pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam tshad med pa rnams so/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of infinite path: because space is infinite, so are the paths of enlightening beings; because the cosmos is infinite, so are the paths of enlightening beings; because the realms of sentient beings are infinite, so are the paths of enlightening beings; because the worlds are infinite, so are the paths of enlightening beings; because time is infinite, so are the paths of enlightening beings; because the languages of all sentient beings are infinite, so are the paths of enlightening beings; because the embodiments of Buddha are infinite, so are the paths of enlightening beings; because the utterances of Buddha are infinite, so are the paths of enlightening beings; because the power of Buddha is infinite, so are the paths of enlightening beings; because omniscience is infinite, so are the paths of enlightening beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ nam mkha'i dbyings ji tsam du tshad med pa de tsam du tshad med par byang chub sems dpas lam gyi tshogs yongs su bsdu bar bya'o/ /ji ltar chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa de ltar mtha' dang dbus med par byang chub sems dpas lam gyi 'tshogs yongs su bsdu bar bya'o/ /ji ltar sems can gyi khams mi zad pa de ltar mi zad par byang chub sems dpas lam gyi tshogs yongs su bsdu bar bya'o/ /ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams mu med pa de ltar mu med par byang chub sems dpas lam gyi tshogs yongs su bsdu bar bya'o/ /ji ltar bskal pa grangs su 'grang zhing bstan pa mi zad pa de ltar 'gro ba thams cad du mi zad par byang chub sems dpas lam gyi tshogs yongs su bsdu bar bya'o/ /ji ltar 'gro ba thams cad kyi tha snyad mtha' yas pa de ltar 'gro ba thams cad kyi sgra dang tha snyad la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa mtha' yas par byang chub sems dpas lam gyi tshogs yongs su bsdu bar bya'o/ /ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku tshad med pa de ltar 'gro ba dang / zhing dang / dus dang / sems can dang / bskal pa thams cad du rgyas par 'gengs shing / tshad med par byang chub sems dpas lam gyi tshogs yongs su bsdu bar bya'o/ /ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi dbyangs tshad med pa de ltar byang chub sems dpas tshig gi lam gcig brjod pas chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad du rgyas par khyab cing / sems can gyi khams thams cad go bar byed pa'i lam gyi tshogs yongs su bsdu bar bya'o/ /ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs tshad med pa de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs kyis brtan pa'i byang chub sems dpas lam gyi tshogs yongs su bsdu bar bya'o/ /ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes tshad med pa de ltar tshad med par byas te/ byang chub sems dpas lam gyi tshogs yongs su bsdu bar bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi tshogs ste de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mtha' dang dbus med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go ;

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of infinite aids to enlightenment: as space is infinite, so is enlightening beings’ development of aids to enlightenment; as the cosmos is infinite, so is enlightening beings’ development of aids to enlightenment; as the realms of sentient beings are infinite, so is enlightening beings’ development of aids to enlightenment; as worlds are infinite, so is enlightening beings’ development of aids to enlightenment; as the number of eons can never be fully told, so too all worldlings cannot fully tell of enlightening beings’ development of aids to enlightenment; as the languages of sentient beings are infinite, so is enlightening beings’ development of aids to enlightenment, producing knowledge to comprehend ways of speaking; as the embodiment of Buddha is infinite, so is enlightening beings’ development of aids to enlightenment, extending to all sentient beings, all lands, all worlds, and all times; as the utterances of Buddha are infinite, enlightening beings utter one word pervading the cosmos, heard by all sentient beings, so the aids to enlightenment they develop also are infinite; as the power of Buddha is infinite, the aids to enlightenment accumulated by enlightening beings through the power of Buddha are infinite too. Based on these factors, enlightening beings can attain the infinite knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam bsgom pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyi mi longs pa med pas/ blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa bsgom pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas/ bsnan pa med pa dang / dbri ba med pa bsgom pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'jug pa med pas/ bsgom pa med pa dang / rnam par bsgom pa med pa bsgom pa dang / mngon par zhen pa thams cad dang bral bas/ sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / sgra brnyan dang / gzugs brnyan dang / smig rgyu dang / chu'i zla ba lta bur bsgom pa dang / khams gsum pa'i bsod nams blta bas bsags pa bsal ba'i phyir/ stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa bsgom pa dang / chos su gdags pa rnam par dgod pa dang bral bas brjod du med pa dang / bstan du med pa dang / smos su med pa dang / bshad du med pa bsgom pa dang / chos thams cad la zhugs pa'i ye shes mngon sum dang ldan pas/ chos kyi dbyings tha mi dad pa bsgom pa dang / de kho na nyid dang / de bzhin nyid nam mkha'i mtha' dang mnyam pa khong du chud pas de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' ma nyams par bsgom pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa'i stobs rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes yangs pa bsgom pa dang / chos thams cad mngon sum du gyur te/ the tshom med pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi bsnyengs pa bzhi dang / tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mtshungs pa med pa bsgom pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam bsgom pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bsgom pa la mkhas pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of infinite ways of cultivation: cultivation without coming or going, because their physical, verbal, and mental doings have no action; neither existent nor nonexistent cultivation, there being no inherent nature; cultivation without increase or decrease, being in accord with fundamental essence; cultivation like an illusion, a dream, a shadow, an echo, an image in a mirror, a mirage in the heat, the moon’s image in the water, being free from all clinging; empty, signless, wishless, nondoing cultivation, clearly seeing the triple world yet ceaselessly accumulating virtues; inexplicable, inexpressible cultivation beyond speech, apart from all definitions and constructions; cultivation of the indestructible realm of reality, directly knowing all phenomena; cultivation of the ultimate reality of True Thusness, entering the space of ultimate reality of True Thusness; cultivation of vast wisdom, the power of their deeds being inexhaustible; equal cultivation of the ten powers, four fearlessnesses, and omniscience of buddhas, directly seeing all things without doubt or confusion. Based on these ten elements, enlightening beings can accomplish the supremely skillful cultivation of omniscience of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi rgyan te/ bcu gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'dod pa'i khams nas kyang mi g.yo la/ gzugs dang / gzugs med pa la spyod pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug kyang / de dag gi dbang gis mi skye ba 'di ni lam gyi rgyan dang po'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos kyi lam mngon sum du gyur ba'i ye shes la zhugs kyang / lam des 'byung ba yang ma yin pa 'di ni lam gyi rgyan gnyis pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rang sangs rgyas kyi lam la mngon sum du gyur pa'i ye shes snang bar mkhas kyang / snying rje chen po'i stobs rgyun mi gcod pa 'di ni lam gyi rgyan gsum pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' g.yog 'khor mang po dang ldan zhing / g.yog 'khor lha dang mi rnam par dag pa dang ldan zhing lha'i bu mo brgya stong gis rol mo brdung ba dang / dkrol ba'i sgra phyung ste brjod pa la spyod kyang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa mi 'dor ba 'di ni lam gyi rgyan bzhi ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'gro ba thams cad kyi rtse dga' la dga' dgod pa dang / sems can dang 'dres shing 'bur ldog pa byed kyang / sems kyi skad cig gcig la yang byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa nyid mi 'dor ba 'di ni lam gyi rgyan lnga pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad dang ma 'dres shing 'jig rten gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin yang / sems can bsgral ba'i phyir/ pha rol tu mi 'gro ba'i lam yang mi gtong ba 'di ni lam gyi rgyan drug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi ye shes snang ba la zhugs pa'i lam la gnas kyang / lam ngan par zhugs pa'i sems can phyir zlog pa'i phyir lam ma yin pa dang / lam ngan pa yang gnon la/ lam des 'khor ba 'dzin pa yang ma yin te/ des dag par yang mi sems pa 'di ni lam gyi rgyan bdun pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu tshul khrims legs par bsrungs pa dang ldan zhing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la rten pas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las kyi mtha' kha na ma tho ba med pa dang ldan yang / tshul khrims ngan pa dang ldan pa'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir/ so so'i skye bo tha mal ba'i spyod pa thams cad ston cing / byang chub sems dpa' lam la rten pas bsod nams kyi tshogs rnam par dag pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang / sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / mi khom pa dang / dbul bar skyes pa'i lam du zhugs pa'i sems can thams cad rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir/ de dag gi lam du skyes pa yang ston la/ lam de dag la yang dag par gzhol ba yang ma yin pa 'di ni lam gyi rgyan brgyad pa'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of way of adornment. Without leaving the realm of desire, they enter the meditations, liberations, and trances of the realm of form and formlessness, yet they are not thereby born in those realms. This is their first way of adornment. Their knowledge appears to enter the path of personally liberated saints, yet they do not take emancipation by this route; this is their second way of adornment. Their knowledge appears to enter the path of individual illumination, yet they do not cease to generate great compassion; this is their third way of adornment. Though they have human and celestial retinues surrounding them, hundreds and thousands of concubines and troupes of singers and dancers, they never for a moment leave meditation, liberation, and concentration; this is their fourth way of adornment. They take part in amusements and experience pleasure and happiness with all sentient beings, but they never for a moment leave the concentration of equanimity of enlightening beings; this is their fifth way of adornment. They have already transcended all worlds and have no attachments to anything, yet they do not abandon efforts to liberate sentient beings; this is their sixth way of adornment. They live by the right path, right knowledge, and right insight, yet they can appear to enter false paths, without taking them to be true or pure, to cause the sentient beings involved in them to abandon false principles; this is their seventh way of adornment. They always maintain the Buddha’s pure precepts, and their thoughts, words, and deeds are faultless, but because they want to edify immoral sentient beings, they appear to perform the acts of ordinary ignorant people; though they are already filled with pure virtues and abide in the course of enlightening beings, yet they appear to live in such realms as hells, animality, ghosthood, and in difficulty and poverty, in order to enable the beings therein to gain liberation—really the enlightening beings are not born in those states; this is their eighth way of adornment.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa thob pa/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la ye shes snang bas rnam par lta ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sku dang / lus gcig tu gyur pa/ sems can thams cad kyi chos kyi snying po'i tshul can dgongs pa'i snang ba khong du chud pa/ theg pa thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la rab tu gnas pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod yul la mngon par mos pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi yid du 'ong ba/ sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi ngor lta ba/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi slob dpon du bya ba yin yang / chos yongs su btsal bar bya ba rgyun mi gcod cing / ngo mtshar gyis yongs su zin par snang bas/ sri zhu'i las thams cad la gnas te/ mkhan po dang / slob dpon du ston kyang / de nyid 'gro ba thams cad kyi slob dpon du gyur pa yin te/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thabs mkhas pa dang ldan par byang chub sems dpa'i lam la shin tu gnas pa yin pas/ de dag ni thabs gang dang gang gis sems can rnams 'dul bar 'gyur ba de dang de'i thabs sems can rnams la yongs su ston te/ 'di ni lam gyi rgyan dgu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su 'dus shing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul thams cad thob pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur bas mngon par dbang bskur ba /chos thams cad la dbang ba'i dbang phyug gi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob pa/ chags pa med cing dri ma med pa'i thabs dang ldan pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med par de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yang dag par ston pa/ chos kyi 'khor lo thogs pa med par bskor ba'i byin gyi rlabs dang ldan pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du khyab pa'i lus dang gzugs bdog pa/ chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug gi pha rol tu phyin pa dam pa dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i dbang thams cad rab tu thob pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi zhing du skye ba yongs su ston pa la mkhas pa/ 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang yul gcig tu gyur pa yang yin la/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang rgyun mi gcod cing / byang chub sems dpa' chos nyid kyang rnam par mi spong / byang chub sems dpa'i las las kyang rnam par mi ldog /byang chub sems dpa'i lam las kyang phyir mi ldog/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang rgyun mi gcod/ byang chub sems dpa'i nye bar len pa yang 'chad par mi byed/ byang chub sems dpa'i thabs mkhas pa las kyang phyir mi ldog /byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba yang thogs par mi byed/ byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par 'du byed pa'i stobs kyis kyang yongs su skyo ba med cing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i byin gyi rlabs las kyang ring du 'phang ba ma yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgyun mi gcad pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgo la rnam par lta ba de lta bus ni/ byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu myur du 'byung ba'i phyir te/ 'di ni lam gyi rgyan bcu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi rgyan te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i lam rin po che'i rgyan bla na med pa thob par gyur kyang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi rgyun mi gcod pa'o/ /

Without being taught by another, they attain unhindered intellect and the light of knowledge, are able to illumine and understand all Buddha teachings, are sustained by the spiritual power of all buddhas, are one and the same body of reality with all buddhas, accomplish all incorruptible mystic states of clarity and purity of great people, abide in all equal vehicles of liberation, are aware of all spheres of buddhahood, are endowed with the light of all worldly knowledge, and clearly see all realms of sentient beings; they are able to be truth-knowing teachers for sentient beings, yet they make the appearance of ceaseless search for truth; though they actually are unexcelled teachers of sentient beings, they show respect to preceptors and religious mentors, because great enlightening beings, by skillful expedients, abide in the path of enlightening beings yet manifest whatever is necessary; this is their ninth way of adornment. Their roots of goodness are sufficient, their practices are completed; they are coronated by all buddhas together and reach the furthest extent of mastery of all the teachings, their heads crowned with the turban of the state of nonobstruction. Their bodies reach all worlds and everywhere they show the body of Buddha that has no resistance. Masters of the teachings, they attain supreme fulfillment and turn the unimpeded pure wheel of teaching. They have already accomplished all manner of freedom of enlightening beings, but for the sake of sentient beings they appear to be born in all lands. They are in the same realm as all buddhas, yet they do not abandon the practices of enlightening beings, do not give up the principles of enlightening beings, do not neglect the works of enlightening beings, do not leave the path of enlightening beings, do not slacken the conduct of enlightening beings, do not cut off the graspings of enlightening beings, do not cease the skillful methods of enlightening beings, do not stop doing the tasks of enlightening beings, do not tire of the developmental activities of enlightening beings, do not put an end to the sustaining power of enlightening beings. Why? Because enlightening beings want to quickly realize unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment, so they examine the ways of access to omniscience and cultivate the practices of enlightening beings unceasingly. This is their tenth way of adornment. Based on these principles enlightening beings can attain the supreme way of great adornment of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rkang pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar smon lam chen po'i khyad par yongs su bsdu ba shin tu rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir/ tshul khrims kyi rkang pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba las phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir/ brtson 'grus kyi rkang pa dang / sems can rnams bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su tshim par bya ba'i phyir mngon par shes pa'i rkang pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du 'gro yang zhing gcig nas mi g.yo ba'i phyir/ rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa'i rkang pa dang / bsam pa thams cad mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir/ dam bcas pa brtan pa'i rkang pa dang / bla ma thams cad kyis bsgo ba las 'gal bar mi byed pa'i phyir mthun par 'dzin pa'i rkang pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs pa yang dag par bzung bas mi skyo ba'i phyir/ chos mnyan pa mi ngoms par tshol ba'i rkang pa dang / tshangs pa'i gnas nas 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du 'gro bar sgyid lug pa med pa'i phyir/ chos kyi char 'bebs pa'i rkang pa dang / thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa chen po la nan tan du byed pa'i rkang pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rkang pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyi mchog gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'gro ba bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of feet: the feet of discipline, fulfilling all higher aspirations; the feet of energy, assembling all elements of enlightenment without regressing; the feet of spiritual knowledge, gladdening all sentient beings according to their desires; the feet of psychic powers, going to all buddha-lands without leaving one buddha-land; the feet of determination, seeking all higher laws; the feet of resolute commitment, fulfilling all their tasks; the feet of accord, not opposing the teachings of all the honorable; the feet of delight in truth, tirelessly hearing and holding all teachings spoken by buddhas; the feet of rain of teaching, lecturing to the masses without timidity; the feet of cultivation, getting rid of all evils. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the supreme feet of buddhas, which can reach all worlds in one step.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lag pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs pa la gcig tu mos shing yid ches pas mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir/ dad pa'i lag pa dang; slong ba thams cad yid bzhin du tshim par bya ba'i phyir/ gtong ba rab tu gtong ba'i lag pa dang / lag pa g.yas pa brkyang ba'i phyir/ tshur shog /bde bar 'ongs sam zhes 'dor te; gsong por smra ba'i lag pa dang / bsod nams bsags pa rnam par spel ba las mi g.yo ba'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod cing rim gro byed pa'i lag pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcad pa'i phyir/ thos pa thams cad la mkhas pa'i lag pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'dam du thogs pa'i sems can gyi khams la lag pa ring du brkyang ste 'ju bar rnyeb pa'i phyir/ khams gsum dang bral zhing shin tu 'byung bar byed pa'i lag pa dang / chu bo chen po bzhis khyer ba la lag pa ring du brkyang zhing gdon pa'i phyir/ bde ba'i thang la gzhog pa'i lag pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad la gnod pa med par bstan pa'i chos rab tu bstan pa'i phyir/ yang dag par sbyor ba'i chos la slob dpon gyis mi bcab pa'i lag pa dang / lus dang sems kyi nad rab tu bsal ba'i phyir/ 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gtsug lag thams cad shes pa'i lag pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i mun pa thams cad dang bral ba'i chos kyi snang ba mtshungs pa med pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir shes rab dang / ye shes rin po che'i lag pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lag pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kun nas yog par skyob pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go / //

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of hands: hands of deep faith, wholeheartedly accepting and ultimately taking up the teaching of buddhas; hands of giving, satisfying all those who seek, according to their desires; hands of initiating greetings, extending their right palm to welcome and lead; hands of honoring buddhas, tirelessly gathering blessings and virtues; hands of learning and skillfulness, cutting off the doubts of all sentient beings; hands of fostering transcendence of the triple world, extending them to sentient beings and extricating them from the mire of craving; hands of settlement on the Other Shore, saving drowning sentient beings from the four torrents; hands of generosity with right teaching, revealing all sublime principles; hands of skillful use of philosophies, quelling diseases of body and mind with the medicine of knowledge and wisdom; hands always holding jewels of knowledge, unfolding the light of truth to obliterate the darkness of afflictions. These are the ten: based on these, enlightening beings can acquire the supreme hands of buddhas covering all worlds in the ten directions.
bam po brgyad cu rtsa gnyis pa/

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lto ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar bsam pa dag pas g.yo med pa'i lto dang / drang bas sgyu med pa'i lto dang / thibs po med pas 'chos pa med pa'i lto dang / dngos po thams cad la mngon par chags pa med pas yul la mi 'dzin pa'i lto dang / shes pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad sel ba'i lto dang / skyon med pa'i phyir sems dag pa'i lto dang / chos ji lta ba bzhin du yid la bya ba'i phyir kha zas thams cad yongs su shes par bya ba so sor rtog pa'i lto dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rjes su rtogs par bya ba'i phyir/ mngon par 'du mi byed pa so sor rtog pa'i lto dang / bsam pa shin tu smin pas 'byung ba thams cad shes pa'i lto dang / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi sku'i nang du chud pa khong du chud pa'i phyir/ dri ma mtha' yas pa'i lta ba thams cad dang bral ba'i lto'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lto ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'gro ba thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of guts: guts free from deception, their hearts being pure; guts free from falsehood, being honest by nature; nonprevaricating guts, having no crookedness; nonswindling guts, having no greed for anything; guts cutting off afflictions, being full of wisdom; pure-minded guts, being free from all evils; guts examining food and drink, remembering reality; guts observing noncreation, being aware of interdependent origination; guts aware of all ways of emancipation, fully developing the will; guts rid of the defilement of all extreme views, enabling all sentient beings to enter into the guts of Buddha. These are the ten; based on these, enlightening beings can acquire the supreme, vast guts of buddhas, able to contain all sentient beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying po ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi tshul gyi mthu tshad med pa yongs su bskyed pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying po sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi gcod par kun nas gnas pa dang / ye shes kyi snang ba chen po yongs su bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa'i snying po chos kyi rigs rab tu gsal bar byed par kun nas gnas pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo la yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying po dge 'dun gyi rigs yongs su sdud par kun nas gnas pa dang / dus ji lta ba bzhin lus mi 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying po chos thams cad nges par gleng ba byed pa dang / rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying po nges pa med par yongs su smin par byed par gnas pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu skyon med par bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying po sems can log par nges pa rnams la snying rje chen po skye bar kun nas gnas pa dang / bdud kyi sde thams cad btul te/ dge ba'i rtsa ba mi 'phrogs par bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying po de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu thub pa med pa'i rgyu yongs su rdzogs par byed par kun nas gnas pa dang / 'gro ba ma lus pa thams cad yongs su tshim par bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying po mi 'jigs pa chen po'i seng ge dang / khyu mchog gi nga ro 'byin par kun nas gnas pa dang / thams cad du ye shes yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying po sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad 'thob pa'i phyir kun nas gnas pa dang / skad cig gcig tu mi mnyam pa med par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying po zhing thams cad dang / chos thams cad dang / sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud par gnas pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying po ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad ma log pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po'i snying po bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of internal organs. Perpetuating the seed of buddhas is an organ of enlightening beings, manifesting the immeasurable spiritual power of the Buddha teaching. Causing the seed of the Teaching to grow is an organ of enlightening beings, generating the immense light of knowledge. Preserving the seed of the spiritual community is an organ of enlightening beings, enabling them to gain access to the irreversible wheel of teaching. Awakening those who are rightly stabilized is an organ of enlightening beings, instantly adapting to the time. Fully developing unstable sentient beings is an organ of enlightening beings, producing continuity of causal basis. Conceiving compassion for wrongly stabilized sentient beings is an organ of enlightening beings, causing thorough development of causal basis for the future. Fulfilling the indestructible bases of the ten powers of buddhas is an organ of enlightening beings, with unopposable roots of goodness that conquer the armies of demons. The supremely fearless lion’s roar is an organ of enlightening beings, gladdening all sentient beings. Attaining the eighteen unique qualities of buddhas is an organ of enlightening beings, with knowledge penetrating everywhere. Knowing all sentient beings, all lands, all things, and all buddhas is an organ of enlightening beings, clearly seeing all in a single instant. These are the ten; based on these, enlightening beings can attain the indestructible internal organs of great knowledge with supreme virtues of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ brtsam pa thams cad mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir zhe non pa'i snying dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su bsdu ba'i phyir/ sems zhum pa med pa'i snying dang / bdud kyi sde thams cad rab tu gzhom pa'i phyir/ rnam par gnon pa chen po'i snying dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa'i phyir/ tshul bzhin du sbyor ba'i snying dang / snying po byang chub kyi bar du phyin par bya ba'i phyir/ phyir mi 'gyur zhing phyir mi ldog pa'i snying dang / sems 'pho ba med par khong du chud pas mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir/ rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i snying dang / ji ltar mos pa'i tshul bzhin du rnam par thar pa 'thob par bya ba'i phyir/ sems can gyi tshul shes pa'i snying dang / theg pa gzhan la mos pa med par sems can gyi khams yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir/ tshangs pa'i rnam par spyod pa rgya chen pos sangs rgyas kyi chos la 'jug pa'i snying dang / lta ba'i mtshan mas khams gsum la mngon par chags pa med par bya ba'i phyir/ stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i snying dang / sems can thams cad bdud du gyur pa'i sgos bdud thams cad 'ongs par gyur kyang / spu gcig kyang mi g.yo bas dpal gyi be'us brgyan cing / rdo rje'i khams ltar sra zhing brtan pa'i snying po dam pa dang ldan pa'i snying ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes snang ba chen po'i snying po dang ldan pa'i snying bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of heart: a heart of diligence, fulfilling all tasks; a heart of perseverance, accumulating embellishing virtuous practices; a heart of great courage and strength, crushing all armies of demons; a heart acting according to truth, extinguishing all afflictions; a heart of nonregression, never ceasing until enlightenment is reached; a heart of inherent purity, knowing the mind is immovable, not having any attachments; a heart of knowledge of sentient beings, adapting to their understandings and inclinations to emancipate them; a heart of great kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity, leading into the way of enlightenment, knowing the various understandings and inclinations of sentient beings, and saving them without using separate paths; a heart of emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and nonfabrication, seeing the characteristics of the triple world without grasping them; a heart adorned with an indestructible supreme treasury of marks of felicity, thoroughly invulnerable to all demons. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supreme heart of the treasury of light of great knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras /bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi go cha ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir byams pa chen po'i go cha dang / mi dga' ba thams cad bzod par bya ba'i phyir snying rje chen po'i go cha dang / brtsam pa thams cad mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir smon lam gyi go cha dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rgyun 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba'i go cha dang / 'gro ba thams cad nye bar 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir bsod nams kyi go cha dang / 'gro ba thams cad bsgral pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i mun pa rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir ye shes kyi go cha dang / sgo kun dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir thabs mkhas pa'i go cha dang / theg pa gzhan la mos pa med pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems brtan zhing 'khrug pa med pa'i go cha dang / chos kyi rlom sems med pas gcig tu nges pa'i go cha'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi go cha ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi sde thams cad spa bkong ba bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of armor: they wear the armor of great benevolence, rescuing all sentient beings; they wear the armor of great compassion, enduring all suffering; they wear the armor of great commitment, fulfilling all their tasks; they wear the armor of dedication, constructing the adornments of all buddhas; they wear the armor of virtue, benefiting all sentient beings; they wear the armor of the ways of transcendence, liberating all conscious beings; they wear the armor of wisdom, destroying the darkness of affliction of all sentient beings; they wear the armor of skill in means, generating universal roots of goodness; they wear the armor of the firm stability and freedom from distraction of the mind of universal knowledge, not enjoying other vehicles; they wear the armor of single-minded certainty, free from doubts and confusion in regard to all things. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can wear the supreme armor of buddhas and crush all demon armies.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshon cha ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar ser sna'i skyon rab tu gzhom pa'i phyir/ gtong ba'i mtshon cha dang / tshul khrims ngan pa thams cad bsal ba'i phyir/ tshul khrims kyi mtshon cha dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad bsal ba'i phyir/ chos mnyam pa nyid kyi mtshon cha dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa yongs su gcad pa'i phyir/ shes rab dang ye shes kyi mtshon cha dang / 'tsho ba thams cad la kha na ma tho ba med par bya ba'i phyir/ yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba'i mtshon cha dang / sgo thams cad yongs su bstan pa'i phyir/ thabs mkhas pa'i mtshon cha dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgo nas sems can bzlog pa'i phyir/ 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / mdor bsdu na/ nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi mtshon cha dang / spyod pa rgyun mi 'chad pas sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir/ 'khor ba'i mtshon cha dang / mngon par zhen pa thams cad rab tu bsal ba'i phyir/ chos tshul gcig pa bstan pa'i mtshon cha dang / spyod pa'i sgo las phyir phyogs su mi lta ba'i phyir; thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshon cha'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshon cha ste/ mtshon cha de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can thams cad kyi sems dang / bsam pa la yun ring po'i nye bar nyon mongs pa dang / bag la nyal ba yod pa thams cad rab tu 'joms pa dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of weapon: giving is a weapon of enlightening beings, destroying all stinginess; self-control is a weapon of enlightening beings, getting rid of all crime; impartiality is a weapon of enlightening beings, removing all discrimination; wisdom is a weapon of enlightening beings, dissolving all afflictions; right livelihood is a weapon of enlightening beings, leading away from all wrong livelihood; skill in means is a weapon of enlightening beings, manifesting in all places; in general, all afflictions such as desire, wrath, and folly are weapons of enlightening beings because they liberate sentient beings through afflictions; birth-and-death is a weapon of enlightening beings because they continue enlightening practices and teach sentient beings; teaching the truth is a weapon of enlightening beings, able to break up all clinging; all knowledge is a weapon of enlightening beings because they do not give up the avenues of practice of enlightening beings. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can annihilate the afflictions, bondage, and compulsions accumulated by all sentient beings in the long night of ignorance.
