kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mgo ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar spyi gtsug bltar mi snang ba'i phyir/ mya ngan las 'das pa'i mgo dang / lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten thams cad 'dud par bya ba'i phyir/ bla ma la 'dud pa'i mgo dang / stong gsum thams cad kyi bdag por 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir/ mos pa yangs pa'i mgo dang / khams gsum gyis mchod par bya ba'i phyir/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sngon du 'gro ba'i mgo dang / gtsug tor dang ldan pa'i spyi bo 'thob par bya ba'i phyir/ sems can thams cad kyi khur khyer ba'i mgo dang / thams cad du khyad par du 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir/ gzhan gyi ltung ba la brnyas pa med pa'i mgo dang / spyi bo la gnas pa'i chos thob par bya ba'i phyir/ shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mgo dang / sems can thams cad kyi mgo mnyam par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir; ye shes dang thabs su ldan pa'i mgo dang / 'gro ba thams cad slob par bya ba'i phyir/ sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa'i mgo dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung rgyun mi gcad pa'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi tshul yongs su bsdu ba'i mgo'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mgo ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po'i spyi bor gyur pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of head: the head of nirvana, as no one can see the top; the head of honor, respected by all humans and celestials; the head of universal higher understanding, being supreme in the universe; the head of foremost roots of goodness, honored by the sentient beings of the three worlds; the head bearing sentient beings, developing an indestructible crown; the head of not despising others, in all places always respectful; the head of transcendent wisdom, nurturing all virtuous qualities; the head of union of knowledge and skill in means, everywhere appearing in compatible forms; the head of teaching all sentient beings, taking all sentient beings as disciples; the head of preservation of the eye of reality of buddhas, able to perpetuate the seeds of the three treasures. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supreme head of knowledge and wisdom of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mig ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar gzugs thams cad blta ba'i phyir sha'i mig dang / sems can thams cad blta ba'i phyir lha'i mig dang / sems can thams cad kyi dbang po dang yul blta ba'i phyir shes rab kyi mig dang / chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du blta ba'i phyir/ chos kyi mig dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu blta ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi mig dang / chos yongs su shes pa blta ba'i phyir/ ye shes kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthu'i 'od snang ba blta ba'i phyir snang ba'i mig dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir; mngon par bsgrub pa'i mig dang / bsgribs pa med par bya ba'i phyir/ chags pa med pa'i mig dang / chos kyi dbyings sgo thams cad nas blta ba'i phyir/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i mig go / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mig ste/ mig de dag dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po'i spyan bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of eye: the flesh eye, seeing all forms; the celestial eye, seeing the minds of all sentient beings; the wisdom-eye, seeing the ranges of the faculties of all sentient beings; the reality-eye, seeing the true character of all things; the buddha-eye, seeing the ten powers of the enlightened; the eye of knowledge, knowing and seeing all things; the eye of light, seeing the light of Buddha; the eye of leaving birth and death, seeing nirvana; the unobstructed eye, its vision without hindrance; the eye of omniscience, seeing the realm of reality in its universal aspect. Based on these ten, enlightening beings attain the eye of supreme knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rna ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na; 'di ltar bsngags pa thos na dga' ba spong ba dang / mi snyan thos na khong khro ba spong ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gtam thos na 'dod pa med cing mi smon pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'byung ba'i gtam thos na dga' ba dang / mos pa dang / spro ba chen po skye ba dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / yi dang / lha ma yin dang / mi khom pa dang / dbul por skyes pa thos na snying rje chen po'i go gyon pa dang / lha dang mi'i rgyud kyi bye brag thos na rtag tu chos la gzud pa'i blor 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang bsngags pa thos na de'i yon tan dang bsngags pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i brtson 'grus dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi gtam thos na thams cad kyi pha rol tu 'gro ba dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa'i rna ba'i dbang po la ni/ phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas bsgrags pa'i sgra thams cad kyang grag cing thos par 'gyur te/ sgra thams cad sgra brnyan lta bur brjod du med pa'i don du khong du chud cing shes pa dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi rna ba mnyam par bzhag pa dang ldan te/ thog ma sems bskyed nas snying po byang chub kyi bar du byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang mi gnas kyang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba mi 'dor ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rna ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po'i snyan bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of ear: hearing the voice of praise, they eliminate craving; hearing the voice of criticism, they eliminate anger; hearing explanation of the two lesser vehicles of individual salvation, they do not cling to or seek them; hearing of the Path of enlightening beings, they rejoice greatly; hearing of places of pain and trouble, such as the hells, they arouse great compassion and make vows of universal salvation; hearing tell of the wonderful things of the human and celestial worlds, they know they are impermanent phenomena; hearing praise of the virtues of buddhas, they work diligently to quickly fulfill them; hearing tell of such practices as the six ways of transcendence and four means of integration, they determine to practice them and reach their ultimate end; hearing all sounds of the world, they know they are all like echoes, and penetrate untold profound meanings; great enlightening beings, from their first determination until they reach the site of enlightenment, always hear the true Teaching yet do not give up the work of transforming sentient beings. These are the ten; if enlightening beings accomplish these things, they will attain the supreme ear of great wisdom of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sna ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar mthun pa'i dri la mi mthun par gnas pa dang / mi mthun pa'i dri la mthun par gnas pa dang / dri mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa la mnyam pa nyid du gnas pa dang / dri mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa ma yin pa la btang snyoms su gnas pa dang / gos dang / mal cha dang / yan lag dang / nying lag gi dri la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / cha mnyam pa la spyod pa'i sems can gyi rgyu shes par gnas pa dang / gter chen po de dag dang / rtswa dang / gel ba dang / sman dang / nags tshal ji snyed pa de dag gi dris gter thams cad mngon sum du shes par gnas pa dang / 'og gi sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa yan chad/ srid pa'i rtse mo man chad la gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi dri tshor ba tsam gyis sngon gyi spyod pa ston par gnas pa dang / nyan thos kyi tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / gtong dang / shes rab kyi dri tshor bas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems mi 'khrugs par gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa'i dri tshor zhing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la yang dag par gzhol ba'i ye shes la gnas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul dang / ye shes kyi dri tshor zhing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgyun mi gcod par gnas pa'o// kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sna yongs su dag pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i shangs mtha' dang dbus med pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of nose: when they smell foul things, they do not consider them foul; when they smell fragrances, they do not consider them fragrant; when they smell both fragrance and foulness, their minds are equanimous, abiding in relinquishment; if they smell the fragrance and foulness of people’s clothes, bedding, or bodies, they can discern their conditions of greed, anger, and delusion; if they smell the scents of hidden repositories, plants and trees and so on, they can discern them as if they were right before their eyes; if they smell scents from the hells below to the heavens above, they know the past deeds of the beings there; if they smell the fragrance of generosity, morality, learning, and wisdom of buddhas’ disciples, they remain steady in the will for omniscience and do not let it be distracted; if they smell the fragrances of all enlightening practices, they enter the state of budda-hood by impartial wisdom; if they smell the fragrance of the sphere of knowledge of all buddhas, they still do not give up the practices of enlightening beings. If enlightening beings accomplish these things, they will acquire the infinite, boundless nose of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lce ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can gyi spyod pa mi zad pa rab tu ston pa'i lce dang / chos kyi tshul mi zad pa rab tu ston pa'i lce dang / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang bsngags pa mi zad pa rab tu ston pa'i lce dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa mi zad pa ston pa'i lce dang / theg pa chen po'i tshogs mi zad pa ston pa'i lce dang / de'i lce de phyogs bcu'i nam mkha' rgyas par 'gengs pa dang / de'i lce de sems can thams cad la yang dag par gzhol ba dang / de'i lce de sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du 'od kyis snang bar byed pa dang / de'i lce de sangs rgyas thams cad mnyes par byed cing phyag 'tshal ba dang / de'i lce de bdud dang / rgol ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / 'khor ba thams cad 'jig cing mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ston pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lce ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ljags sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rgyas par khyab pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of tongue: a tongue that reveals and explains the acts of infinite sentient beings; a tongue that reveals and explains infinite doors to truth; a tongue that sings the praises of the infinite virtues of buddhas; a tongue of infinite eloquence; a tongue that expounds aids to the Path of the Great Vehicle; a tongue that covers all space; a tongue that illumines all buddha-fields; a tongue that awakens the understanding of all sentient beings; a tongue that causes all to praise the buddhas; a tongue that defeats all demons and false teachers, destroys all afflictions of birth and death, and fosters arrival at nirvana. If enlightening beings accomplish these things, they will acquire the supreme tongue of buddhas, which covers all buddhalands.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar mi yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir mi'i lus dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang; gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sems can gdul ba'i phyir mi ma yin pa'i lus dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems can gdul ba'i phyir lha'i lus dang / slob pa'i sa bstan pa'i phyir slob pa'i lus dang / mi slob pa'i sa bstan pa'i phyir mi slob pa'i lus dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar gdul ba'i phyir rang sangs rgyas kyi lus dang / theg pa chen po la yang dag par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang / dbang bskur ba'i ye shes 'thob par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang / mngon par bsgrubs pa la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus dang / zag pa med cing lhun gyis grub pa'i bya bas lus thams cad yongs su bstan pa'i phyir chos kyi lus so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of bodies: human bodies to teach humans; nonhuman bodies to teach denizens of hells, animals, and hungry ghosts; celestial bodies to teach the beings of the realms of desire, form, and formlessness; learners’ bodies to demonstrate the stage of learning; nonlearners’ bodies to demonstrate the stage of sainthood; individual illuminates’ bodies to teach the way to enter the stage of individual enlightenment; enlightening beings’ bodies to foster the accomplishment of the Great Vehicle; buddhas’ bodies, anointed by the water of knowledge; mentally produced bodies, generated by adaptive skills; the uncontaminated reality-body, effortlessly manifesting the bodies of all sentient beings. If they accomplish these, they attain the supreme body of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yid rnam par rgyu ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad brtsam pa la yid ni sngon du 'gro'o/ /nan tan lhur blangs pa la yid ni gnas so/ /sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yid ni rjes su zhugs pa'o/ /sems can rnams kyi bsam par yid ni khong du chud pa'o/ /nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ma 'dres pas yid ni rgyu ba med pa'o/ /glo bur gyi dri mas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir/ yid ni 'od gsal ba'o/ /dus ji lta ba'i skad cig las kyang mi 'da' ba'i phyir/ yid ni dpyad pa shin tu brtags pa'o/ /thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir/ yid ni las kyi mtha' shin tu dpyad pa'o/ /dbang po shin tu dul bas yul la mi rgyug pa'i phyir/ yid ni dbang po rung ba'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin la bdag gir mi byed pa'i phyir yid ni shin tu mnyam par gzhog pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yid rnam par rgyu ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rnam par rgyu ba bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of mind: a mind of leadership, generating all roots of goodness; a stable mind, with profound faith steadfast and unwavering; a mind of profound penetration, understanding in accord with the teachings of buddhas; a mind of insight, knowing the mentalities of all sentient beings; an undisturbed mind, not adulterated with any afflictions; a clear, clean mind, which externals cannot stain or adhere to; a mind observing sentient beings well, not missing proper timing in dealing with them; a mind choosing well what to do, never making a mistake anywhere; a mind closely guarding the senses, taming them and not letting them run wild; a mind skilled in entering concentration, entering deeply into the concentrations of buddhas, without egoism or selfishness. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supreme mind of all buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'gro ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar chos 'dod pas chos nyan du 'gro ba dang / sems can gyi don du chos ston du 'gro ba dang / rang gi sems nges par rtogs pas 'dod pa med pa dang / sdang ba med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / 'jigs pa med par 'gro ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir/ 'dod pa'i khams su 'gro ba dang / myur du phyir ldog par bya bas/ gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms pa 'jug par 'gro ba dang / shes rab myur ba 'thob par bya ba'i phyir/ don dang chos kyi rgyud du 'gro ba dang / 'dul ba'i dbang gis skye ba thams cad du 'gro ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du mngon par shes pas 'gro ba dang / 'khor ba'i rgyud kyi rgyun mi gcad pa'i phyir/ mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyud du 'gro ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgyun mi gcad pa'i phyir/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya bar 'gro ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'gro ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa bzhud pa dang / gshegs pa dang / byon pa med pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of action: hearing the Teaching, out of fondness for truth; expounding the Teaching, to benefit sentient beings; getting rid of covetousness, anger, delusion, and fear, by taming their own minds; action in the realm of desire, to teach beings in that realm; concentrations in the realms of form and formlessness, to foster quick return to noncontamination; aiming for the meaning of the Teaching, to quickly attain wisdom; action in all realms of life, to freely edify sentient beings; action in all buddha-lands, honoring all buddhas; nirvanic action, not cutting off the continuity of birth and death; fulfilling all qualities of buddhahood, without giving up application of the principles of enlightening beings. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can achieve the action of buddhas that has no coming or going.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar nyams pa med pa'i phyir/ byang chub kyi sems la gnas pa dang / tshogs kyis mi ngoms pa'i phyir/ pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa dang / shes rab shin tu sbyangs pa'i phyir/ chos kyi gtam la gnas pa dang / bsam gtan chen po khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir/ bas mtha' dgon pa la gnas pa dang / bya ba nyung ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mthun pa'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / chog shes pa dang / 'phags pa'i rgyud la gnas pa dang / chos kyi brtson 'grus rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'i phyir nan tan la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyod lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa bsnyen bkur ba la gnas pa dang / ye shes chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir/ mngon par shes pas 'byung ba la gnas pa dang / lung bstan pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir/ bzod pa thob pa la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir/ snying po byang chub la gnas pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of abiding: abiding in the will for enlightenment, never forgetting it; abiding in the transcendent ways, not tiring of fostering enlightenment; abiding in the teaching of truth, increasing wisdom; abiding in dispassion, realizing great meditational concentration; abiding in conformity to universal knowledge, austerity, contentment, moderation in food, clothing, and dwelling, and getting rid of evil, because few desires means few concerns; abiding in deep faith, bearing the true Teaching; abiding in the company of the enlightened, to learn the conduct of buddhas; abiding in generation of spiritual powers, to fulfill great knowledge; abiding in attainment of acceptance, fulfilling the forecast of enlightenment; abiding in the site of enlightenment, fulfilling power, fearlessness, and all aspects of buddhahood. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can reach the buddhas’ supreme abiding in omniscience.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stan la 'dug pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam bsgrub pa'i phyir/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i stan la 'dug pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi dbang phyug la dgod pa'i phyir/ 'jig rten gyi mgon po'i stan la 'dug pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi dbang por 'gyur ba'i phyir/ brgya byin gyi stan la 'dug pa dang / rang gi sems dang gzhan gyi sems la dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir/ tshangs pa'i stan la 'dug pa dang / chos kyi stan ma nor par bya ba'i phyir/ seng ge'i stan la 'jug pa dang / gzungs dang spobs pa'i stobs kyis brjod pa'i phyir; chos kyi stan la 'dug pa dang / dam bcas pa mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir/ yi dam la brtan pa'i stan la 'dug pa dang / gshe ba dang / sdang ba la byams par bya ba'i phyir; byams pa chen po'i stan la 'dug pa dang / mi dga' ba thams cad bzod par bya bas mi skyo bar bya ba'i phyir/ snying rje chen po'i stan la 'dug pa dang / phas kyi rgol ba dang / bdud kyi sde thams cad bzlog pa'i phyir/ rdo rje'i stan la 'dug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stan la 'dug pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gdan chen po bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of sitting: the sitting of universal monarchs, promoting all virtuous behavior; the sitting of guardian deities, independently establishing the Buddha teaching in all worlds; the sitting of Indra, king of gods, being superior lords of all sentient beings; the sitting of Brahma, being in control of their own and others’ minds; the sitting of lions, being able to expound the truth; the sitting of right teaching, holding forth by means of mental command and intellectual powers; steadfast sitting, vowing to reach the ultimate end; the sitting of great benevolence, bringing happiness to all evil sentient beings; the sitting of great compassion, tirelessly enduring all pains; adamantine sitting, conquering demons and false teachers. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain the buddhas’ supreme sitting of true awareness.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mal te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar lus dang sems dben par bya ba'i phyir/ dben pa'i mal dang / tshul bzhin gyi sbyor ba sgrub pa'i phyir/ nang du yang dag par gzhog pa'i mal dang / lus dang sems las su rung bar bya ba'i phyir/ snyoms par 'jug pa'i mal dang / gzhan dang bdag la gdung ba med par bya ba'i phyir/ tshangs pa'i mal dang / phyis 'gyod pa med par bya ba'i phyir/ legs pa'i las kyi mal dang / phyis khro ba med par bya ba'i phyir/ yang dag pa'i nan tan gyi mal dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bskul bar bya ba'i phyir/ lam kyi mal dang / yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa'i phyir/ shin tu mnyam par bzhag pa'i mal dang / brtsam pa mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir/ dgos pa thams cad yongs su sgrub pa'i mal dang / sngon las legs par spyad pa'i phyir/ lhun gyis grub par spyod pa'i mal lo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mal te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi gzims mal chen por rnam par 'tshang rgya ba bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of reclining: the reclining of silent tranquillity, because of practicing in accord with principle; the reclining of concentration, because of body and mind being supple; the reclining of Brahma, because of not disturbing self or others; the reclining of good works, because of having no regrets afterward; the reclining of true faith, because of being unshakable; the reclining of the right Path, because of awakening by good companions; the reclining of sublime aspirations, because of skillful dedication; the reclining of completion of all tasks, because of having accomplished all that is to be done; the reclining of relinquishment of all effort, because of thorough training. Based on these enlightening beings can attain the supreme reclining of the great teaching of buddhas and be able to awaken all sentient beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par spyod pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pas byams pa chen po la rnam par spyod pa dang / ma bslabs pa la brnyas pa med pa'i phyir/ snying rje chen po la rnam par spyod pa dang; mi dga' ba thams cad bsal ba'i phyir/ dga' ba chen po la rnam par spyod pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas su mnyam zhing mtshungs pa'i phyir/ btang snyoms chen po la rnam par spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi sems sngon du 'gro bas/ pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la rnam par spyod pa dang / rab tu rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pas rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang / ldan pa'i stong pa nyid la rnam par spyod pa dang / skyon med pa la thogs pa med pas mtshan ma med pa la rnam par spyod pa dang / ched du bsams te skye ba 'dzin pa'i phyir/ smon pa med pa la rnam par spyod pa dang / bzod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir/ dran pa dang / shes bzhin la rnam par spyod pa dang / lung bstan pa 'thob par bya ba'i phyir /chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la rnam par spyod pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par spyod pa dang / de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par spyod pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of abode: the abode of great goodwill, being impartial toward all sentient beings; the abode of great compassion, not slighting the uncultivated; the abode of great joy, aloof from all vexations; the abode of great equanimity, regarding the created and uncreated equally; the abode of all transcendent ways, being led by the aspiration for enlightenment; the abode of universal emptiness, by virtue of skillful analysis; the abode of signlessness, not leaving the absolute state; the abode of wishlessness, examining the experience of taking on life; the abode of recollection and awareness, by virtue of full development of recognition of truth; the abode of equality of all things, by virtue of having gained the prediction of buddhahood. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can reach the supreme abode of buddhas where there is no obstruction.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir/ dran pa'i spyod yul dang / chos kyi tshul rtogs par bya ba'i phyir/ rtogs pa'i spyod yul dang / sangs rgyas thams cad mnyes par bya ba'i phyir/ blo gros kyi spyod yul dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir/ pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod yul dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir/ bsdu ba'i dngos po'i spyod yul dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dran pa'i phyir/ 'khor ba'i spyod yul dang / 'du 'dzi bsal zhing sems can mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du gdul ba'i phyir/ sems can thams cad dang 'grogs pa'i spyod yul dang / sems can thams cad kyi dbang po dang yul khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir/ mngon par shes pa bskyed pa'i spyod yul dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshon cha gdags pa'i phyir/ thabs mkhas pa'i spyod yul dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par sangs rgyas kyang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa rgyun mi gcod pa'i phyir/ snying po byang chub kyi spyod yul lo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po'i spyod yul bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of sphere of action: they take right mindfulness as their sphere of action, as they fulfill the points of mindfulness; they take all realms of being as their sphere of action, as they become truly aware of the implications of the Teaching; they take wisdom as their sphere of action, gaining the joy of buddhas; they take the transcendent ways as their sphere of action, as they fulfill omniscience; they take the four integrative practices as their sphere of action, as they educate sentient beings; they take birth and death as their sphere of action, as they accumulate roots of goodness; they take bantering with all sentient beings as their sphere of action, as they teach them according to their needs and cause them to become free; they take spiritual powers as their sphere of action, as they know the realms of the senses of all sentient beings; they take skill in means as their sphere of action, uniting them with transcendent wisdom; they take the site of enlightenment as their sphere of action, as they attain universal knowledge, without stopping the practices of enlightening beings. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can reach the supreme sphere of action of great wisdom of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lta ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar gzugs shin tu phra ba blta ba'i phyir/ las legs par byas pas lta ba dang / sems can gyi grangs la mngon par chags pa med par bya ba'i phyir/ shi 'pho'i rgyud shes pas lta ba dang / sems can gyi dbang po khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir/ sems can gyi dbang po shes pas lta ba dang / chos kyi dbyings tha dad du mi dbye pa'i phyir/ chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i lta ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan gsal ba 'thob par bya ba'i phyir/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mngon du lta ba dang / ji ltar gnas pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir shes rab dang / ye shes thob pas lta ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos nges par rab tu 'thob par bya ba'i phyir/ mi skye ba'i bzod pa 'thob pas lta ba dang / 'du shes dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi khams gsum pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir/ mi ldog pa'i sa la lta ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur bas ye shes mi nyams pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir/ dbang bskur ba'i sa la lta ba dang / phyogs bcur bya ba thams cad bstan pa'i phyir/ blo shin tu rnam par sangs rgyas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas lta ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lta ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen pos lta ba bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of observation: observation knowing all acts, seeing all details; observation knowing various tendencies, not grasping sentient beings; observation knowing faculties, comprehending the nonexistence of faculties; observation knowing phenomena, not violating the realm of reality; observation seeing the verities of buddhahood, cultivating the enlightened eye; observation attaining wisdom, explaining things as they really are; observation accepting the nonorigination of things, definitely comprehending the teaching of Buddha; observation in the state of nonregression, destroying all afflictions and transcending the three worlds and the stages of the lesser vehicles; observation in the stage of coronation, by virtue of unshakable mastery of all Buddha teachings; observation in concentration with hyperconscious knowledge, practicing charity everywhere as Buddhist service. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supremely great observational knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par lta ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar mi dga' ba'i sems med pas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshim par bya ba'i phyir/ slong ba la rnam par lta ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshul khrims la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir/ sems can tshul khrims ngan pa can la rnam par lta ba dang / bzod pa'i stobs kyis sangs rgyas kyi bzod pa la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir/ sems can gnod sems can la rnam par lta ba dang; mi gtong ba la brtson pas theg pa chen po la sems can yang dag par dgod pa'i phyir/ sems can le lo can la rnam par lta ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa rnam par 'khrug pa med pa la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir/ sems can sems rnam par 'khrug pa can la rnam par lta ba dang / the tshom med pas lta ba dang / dmigs pa thams cad rab tu bsal ba'i phyir/ sems can shes rab 'chal ba can la rnam par lta ba dang / ji ltar bstan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen la dge bar rnam par lta ba dang / don gyi mchog nyams su myong bar bya ba'i phyir/ ji skad du thos pa'i chos la lhag mthong gis rnam par lta ba dang / snying rje chen po'i stobs mi gtang ba'i phyir/ sems can thams cad yongs la rnam par lta ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la rnam par lta ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par lta ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen pos rnam par lta ba bla na med par thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of universal observation: they observe all who come seeking of them, satisfying them without aversion; they observe all immoral sentient beings and establish them in the pure precepts of buddhas; they observe all malicious sentient beings and settle them in the power of enlightened tolerance; they observe all lazy sentient beings and urge them to be diligent and not give up bearing the burden of the Great Vehicle; they observe all confused sentient beings and get them to abide in the state of universal knowledge of buddhas, where there is no distraction; they observe all deluded sentient beings and clear away their doubts and break down reification; they observe all impartial good friends and follow their instructions to live by the Buddha teachings; they observe all principles they hear and quickly attain realizational insight into the supreme meaning; they observe the infinite sentient beings, never abandoning the power of great compassion; they observe the teachings of all buddhas and quickly manage to accomplish universal knowledge. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the universal observation of supreme wisdom of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par bsgyings pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang; mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po'i 'khor thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir/ khyu mchog gi rnam par bsgyings pa dang / shin tu dul zhing cang shes pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad kyi khur bkur ba'i phyir/ glang po'i bsgyings pa dang / chos kyi sprin chen po shin tu 'dus pa las rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i glog 'gyu zhing yang dag par ma nor bar 'brug sgra chen po bsgrags te/ dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i bdud rtsi'i chu'i chos kyi char pa mngon par dbab pa'i phyir/ klu'i rnam par bsgyings pa dang / ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs dang; lcag lcig gi spri brtol te/ sred pa'i chu lhag mthong gi gshog pas phye ste/ sems kyi sprul 'dod pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa can mngon par blang zhing dbyung ba'i phyir/ nam mkha' lding gi dbang po chen po'i rnam par bsgyings pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / bag tsha ba thams cad med cing / ye shes chen po mnyam pa nyid kyi sder mos ngan par tshogs pa'i phas kyi rgol ba thams cad rab tu gzhom pa'i phyir/ seng ge chen po'i rnam par bsgyings pa dang / 'dod pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa'i dgra gnod par sems pa/ gdul dka' ba thams cad dbus nas gzhom pa'i phyir/ dpa' bo'i rnam par bsgyings pa dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba thams cad rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir; ye shes kyi rnam par bsgyings pa dang / dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtogs pas thos pa thams cad yongs su bzung ste/ mi brjed par bzhag pas/ sems can gzhan gyi dbang po'i rgyud du phyin par bya ba'i phyir/ gzungs kyi rnam par bsgyings pa dang / myur zhing mgyogs la dag cing thogs pa med pa dang / chags pa med par tshig thams cad rab tu phye ste bstan pas sems can thams cad tshim par byed cing / don yod la rmongs pa med pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pas spobs pa'i rnam par bsgyings pa dang / seng ge'i khri dam pa'i steng du phyin ste/ bdud kyi rgol ba thams cad bcom nas/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rgyas pa'i phyir/ sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis gang thong bar bya ba de thams cad du/ 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya bas sangs rgyas kyi rnam par bsgyings pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par bsgyings pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing; byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i rnam par bsgyings pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of springing; the springing of a majestic bull, overshadowing all dragons, yakshas, kinnaras, gand-harvas, and other creatures; the springing of a majestic elephant, their minds well tamed and gentle, carrying all sentient beings; the springing of a great water spirit, producing dense clouds of the great Teaching, flashing the lightning of liberation, reverberating with the thunder of truth, and showering the sweet rain of the spiritual faculties and powers, the elements of enlightenment, meditations, liberations, and concentrations; the springing of the great golden-winged bird, evaporating the water of covetousness, breaking the shell of delusion, catching the evil poisonous dragons of affliction, and lifting beings out of the ocean of suffering of birth and death; the springing of a great majestic lion, resting secure in fearless, impartial great knowledge and, using that as a weapon, crushing demons and false teachers; the springing of courage and strength, able to destroy the enemy, afflictions, on the great battlefront of birth and death; the springing of great knowledge, knowing the elements of body, mind, and sense experience, as well as all other interdependent productions, and freely explaining all things; the springing of mental command, retaining teachings by the power of recollection and awareness, and expounding them according to the faculties of sentient beings; the springing of intellectual powers, uninhibited and swift, analyzing everything and causing everyone to receive benefit and be happy; the springing of realization of Thusness, fulfilling all aids to the way to omniscience, and with instantaneous wisdom attaining all that can be attained, understanding all that can be understood, sitting on a lion throne, conquering hostile demons, and realizing unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can achieve the supreme springing of buddhas in the midst of all things.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi seng ge'i nga ro ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar bya'o zhes byang chub kyi sems kyi seng ge'i nga ro chen po dang / ma brgal ba brgal bar bya'o/ /ma grol ba dgrol bar bya'o/ /dbugs ma phyin pa dbugs dbyung bar bya'o/ /yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o zhes sems can la snying rje ba'i seng ge'i nga ro chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi gdung dang / chos kyi gdung dang / dge 'dun gyi gdung mi gcad do/ /zhes de bzhin gshegs pas mdzad pa bzo ba'i seng ge'i nga ro chen po dang / zhing thams cad yongs su dag par bya'o zhes dam bcas pa la brtan zhing / kha 'og tu lus 'khrus pa'i seng ge'i nga ro chen po dang / ngan song dang / mi khom pa thams cad bsgom par bya'o zhes rang gi lus yongs su dag pa'i seng ge'i nga ro chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi rgyan dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su btsal bas mi ngoms pa'i seng ge'i nga ro chen po dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su btsal bas mi ngoms pa'i seng ge'i nga ro chen po dang / bdud dang bdud kyi las thams cad rab tu gzhom par bya'o zhes yang dag pa'i nan tan dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i seng ge'i nga ro chen po dang / bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pas nam mkha'i dbyings dri ma med pa lta bur chos thams cad shes par bya'o zhes mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa thob par bya ba'i seng ge'i nga ro chen po dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' srid pa'i tha ma par gyur pa'i tshe/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing gtsang zhing dri ma med la 'od gsal ba'i rgyan dang ldan pa thams cad bskyed do/ brgya byin dang; tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po thams cad kyis rab tu bsngags pa'i rigs su byung ste/ ye shes chen po chags pa med pas rnam par lta ba'i blo'i mig dang ldan pa/ sems can thams cad kyi nang nas bdag bla na med par mthong ste/ sa chen pos yongs su ma bzung bar gom pa bdun du 'gro zhing seng ge'i nga ro chen po sgrog ste/ bdag ni 'jig rten na mchog tu gyur pa/ bdag ni 'jig rten na gtso bor gyur pa yin gyi/ skye zhing 'chi ba mthar dbyung bar bya'o zhes ji skad du smras pa de ltar byed pa'i seng ge'i nga ro chen po'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi seng ge'i nga ro ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i seng ge'i nga ro chen po bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of lion’s roar. They declare, ‘I will surely attain true enlightenment’—this is the great lion’s roar of the determination for enlightenment. ‘I will enable those who have not yet transcended the world to transcend, liberate those who are not yet liberated, pacify those who are not yet at peace, and enable those who have not attained nirvana to attain it’—this is the great lion’s roar of great compassion. ‘I will perpetuate the seeds of the Buddha, the Teaching, and the harmonious Community’—this is the great lion’s roar of requiting the benevolence of the Buddha. ‘I will purify all buddha-lands’—this is the great lion’s roar of ultimately firm commitment. ‘I will get rid of all evil ways and difficult situations’—this is the lion’s roar of personally maintaining pure conduct. ‘I will fully attain the adorning features of body, speech, and mind of all buddhas’—this is the great lion’s roar of tirelessly seeking virtue. ‘I will fully accomplish the knowledge of all buddhas’—this is the great lion’s roar of tirelessly seeking knowledge. ‘I will annihilate all demons and all the works of demons’—this is the great lion’s roar of cultivating right practice to stop afflictions. ‘I will realize that all things are selfless, without being, without life, without personality, empty, signless, wishless, and pure as space’—this is the great lion’s roar of the acceptance of the nonorigination of all things. Enlightening beings in their last life shake all buddha-lands and make them all pure: thereupon all the Indras, Brahmas, and guardian deities come and praise them and entreat them, ‘Please, enlightening being, with the truth of birthlessness, appear to be born.’ The enlightening beings then observe all sentient beings in the world by the unobstructed eye of wisdom and see that there are none who compare to themselves—so they appear to be born in royal palaces, walk seven steps by themselves, and declare in a great lion’s roar, ‘I am supreme in the world—I will forever end the realm of birth and death.’ This is the great lion’s roar of doing what one says. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supremely great lion’s roar of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yongs su dag pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can la mi mnyam pa med pa'i phyir/ sems snyoms pa'i sbyin pa dang / bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir/ bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshim par byed pa'i sbyin pa dang / phan pa'i dngos po yongs su ma nyams pa'i phyir/ 'khrug pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / gang zag rab dang / tha ma shes pa'i phyir ci rigs su sbyin pa dang / rnam par smin pa la re ba med pa'i phyir/ ye brngam pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / sems kyis 'dzin pa thams cad spong ba'i phyir/ yongs su gtang ba shin tu gtong ba'i sbyin pa dang / ma btang ba gtong bas dag par bya ba'i phyir/ phyi nang gi dngos po la phangs pa med par yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas yongs su spang ba'i phyir/ byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa dang / snying po byang chub kyi bar du rjes su gzhol bar bya ba'i phyir/ sems can de dag yongs su smin par bya ba'i sbyin pa dang / sbyin bdag dang / len pa dang / sbyin pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs par yid la byed pa'i phyir/ 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yongs su dag pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtong ba chen po yongs su dag pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of pure giving: impartial giving, not discriminating among sentient beings; giving according to wishes, satisfying others; unconfused giving, causing benefit to be gained; giving appropriately, knowing superior, mediocre, and inferior; giving without dwelling, not seeking reward; open giving, without clinging attachment; total giving, being ultimately pure; giving dedicated to enlightenment, transcending the created and the uncreated; giving to teach sentient beings, never abandoning them, even to the site of enlightenment; giving with its three spheres pure, observing the giver, receiver, and gift with right awareness, as being like space. Based on these ten principles, enlightening beings can accomplish the supreme, pure, magnanimous giving of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims yongs su dag pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sdom pa gsum yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir/ lus yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / ngag gi nyes pa bzhi yongs su spang ba'i phyir/ ngag yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / chags sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir; sems yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lha dang mi thams cad kyi bdag po byed du gzhug pa'i phyir/ bslab pa thams cad god pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang / nyi tshe ba'i theg pa la 'dod pa med pa'i phyir/ byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsrung bas dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / kha na ma tho ba rdul tsam la yang 'jigs par lta ba'i phyir; de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bstan pa'i cho ga dang bslab pa'i gnas ma god cing dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can thams cad ltung ba las bslang ba'i phyir/ 'dul bas dben pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi yi dam brtan pa'i phyir sdig pa thams cad mi byed pas dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / rlom sems med par bya ba'i phyir dmigs pa'i lta ba thams cad yongs su spang ba'i tshul khrims dang / snying rje chen po'i stobs mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir/ 'gro ba thams cad rjes su bsrung bas dag pa'i tshul khrims so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims yongs su dag pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims kha na ma tho ba med cing yongs su dag pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of pure discipline: pure discipline of body, guarding themselves from evil deeds; pure discipline of speech, getting rid of faults of speech; pure discipline of mind, forever getting rid of greed, hatred, and false views; the pure discipline of not destroying any subjects of study, being honorable leaders among people; the pure discipline of preserving the aspiration for enlightenment, not liking the lesser vehicles of individual salvation; the pure discipline of preserving the regulations of the Buddha, greatly fearing even minor offenses; the pure discipline of secret protection, skillfully drawing out undisciplined sentient beings; the pure discipline of not doing any evil, vowing to practice all virtuous principles; the pure discipline of detachment from all views of existence, having no attachment to precepts; the pure discipline of protecting all sentient beings, activating great compassion. Based on these ten principles, enlightening beings can attain the supreme flawless pure discipline of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras; bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bzod pa yongs su dag pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can gzhan gyi yid dang mi 'gal bar bya ba'i phyir/ gzhan gyis mi snyan par brjod pa dang / ngan par 'os pa'i tshig gi lam rna la gzon pa'i bzod pa yongs su dag pa dang / bdag dang gzhan bsrung ba'i phyir/ rdo dang / dbyug pa dang; mtshon cha dang / lag cha thams cad bag la zha bar bya ba'i bzod pa yongs su dag pa dang / rang bzhin gyis mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir/ tha ba dang / khro ba dang / gnod sems thams cad kyis mi gos pa'i bzod pa yongs su dag pa dang / dpon du gyur pas bag la zha bar bya ba'i phyir sems can dma' ba la mi 'khrug pa'i bzod pa yongs su dag pa dang / bdag gi lus dang srog yongs su gtong ba'i phyir/ skyabs tshol ba bskyab pa'i bzod pa yongs su dag pa dang / ma bslabs pa thams cad la mi brnyas pa'i phyir/ bdag gi nga rgyal yongs su spong ba'i bzod pa dang / sgyu ma'i rnam pa lta bur rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir/ lus yan lag so sor phral te gtubs kyang mi 'khrug pa'i bzod pa yongs su dag pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir/ gnod par byas pa thams cad la zhe mi sdang ba'i sems kyi bzod pa yongs su dag pa dang / yul thams cad rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir/ nyon mongs pa dang mi mthun pa'i bzod pa yongs su dag pa dang / chos thams cad zad cing mi skye ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'jug pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ye shes kyi tshul dang mthun pa'i bzod pa yongs su dag pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bzod pa yongs su dag pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bzod pa la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'jug pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of pure tolerance: pure tolerance calmly enduring slander and vilification, to protect sentient beings; pure tolerance calmly enduring weapons, to protect self and others; pure tolerance not arousing anger and viciousness, the mind being unshakable; pure tolerance not attacking the low, being magnanimous when above; pure tolerance saving all who come for refuge, giving up one’s own life; pure tolerance free from conceit, not slighting the uncultivated; pure tolerance not becoming angered at injury, because of observation of illusoriness; pure tolerance not revenging offenses, because of not seeing self and other; pure tolerance not following afflictions, being detached from all objects; pure tolerance knowing all things have no origin, in accord with the true knowledge of enlightening beings, entering the realm of universal knowledge without depending on the instruction of another. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain all buddhas’ supreme tolerance of truth, understanding without depending on another.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtson 'grus yongs su dag pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / sbyin pa'i gnas thams cad la ldang zhing bsnyen bkur dang / rim gro bya ba las mi ldog pa'i phyir/ lus kyis brtsams pa yongs su dag pa'i brtson 'grus dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs pa mnyan pa dang / dran par bya ba dang / gzung ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yon tan dang / bsngags pa rab tu brjod pa dang / ji skad du thos pa'i chos rnams sems can thams cad la ston pas mi skyo ba'i phyir/ ngag gis brtsams pa yongs su dag pa'i brtson 'grus dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug cing ldang ba la mkhas pa las mi ldog pa'i phyir/ sems kyis brtsams pa yongs su dag pa'i brtson 'grus dang / g.yo dang sgyu med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis drang zhing 'chos pa med de/ sbyor ba'i brtsams pa thams cad las mi ldog pa'i phyir; bsam pa zhum pa med pas yongs su dag pa'i brtson 'grus dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro zhing mngon sum gyi ye shes kyi snang bas / dge ba'i chos thams cad la lhag par dmigs pa'i phyir/ lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyin pa dang / dul ba dang / sdom pa dang / des pa dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / gtong pa dang / bag yod pas shin tu bzung zhing thogs pa med par snying po byang chub tu 'gro ba'i phyir/ thogs pa med cing don yod pas yongs su dag pa'i brtson 'grus dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / 'dod pa'i 'khrug pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba dang / kun nas bskor ba dang / sgrib pa dang / bar du gcod pa yongs su chad pa'i phyir/ bdud kyi dgra thams cad dang bral bas yongs su dag pa'i brtson 'grus dang / shes pa dang / rab tu shes pa dang / shin tu khong du chud pa dang / legs par byas pas/ 'gyod pa med par brtsams pa thams cad mthar phyin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir; ye shes snang ba yongs su bsgrubs pas yongs su dag pa'i brtson 'grus dang / sems kyi 'dzin pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad spang bas lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyis brtsams pa mtshan ma dang / mtshan ma med pa mnyam pas sgo kun dang ldan pa'i chos kyi dbyings shin tu rtogs shing ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas khong du chud pa'i phyir; blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pas yongs su dag pa'i brtson 'grus dang / sa dang sa ma yin pa las yang dag par 'das te/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dbang bskur ba yang dag par mnod pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku zag pa med pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / 'byung ba dang / rnam par 'tshang rgya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba chen po yongs su bstan pa dang / kun tu bzang po'i rnam pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir/ chos kyi snang ba yongs su rdzogs pas yongs su dag pa'i brtson 'grus so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtson 'grus yongs su dag pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i brtson 'grus chen po bla na med pa yongs su dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go// //

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of pure energy: pure physical energy, to attend buddhas, enlightening beings, teachers, and elders, honoring fields of blessings, never retreating; pure verbal energy, extensively explaining to others whatever teachings they learn and praising the virtues of buddhahood, without wearying; pure mental energy, able to enter and exit kindness, compassion, joy, equanimity, meditations, liberations, and concentrations, without cease; pure energy of honesty, being free from deceptiveness, flattery, deviousness, and dishonesty, not regressing in any of their efforts; pure energy of determination on increasing progress, always intent on seeking higher and higher knowledge, aspiring to embody all good and pure qualities; unwasteful pure energy, embodying charity, morality, tolerance, learning, and diligence, continuing unceasingly until enlightenment; pure energy conquering all demons, able to extirpate greed, hatred, delusion, false views, and all other bonds and veils of affliction; pure energy fully developing the light of knowledge, being carefully observant in all actions, consummating them all, preventing later regret, and attaining all the unique qualities of buddhahood; pure energy without coming or going, attaining true knowledge, entering the door of the realm of reality, body, speech, and mind all impartial, understanding forms are formless and having no attachments; pure energy developing the light of the Teaching, transcending all stages and attaining the coronation of buddhas, and with an uncontaminated body manifesting the appearances of death and birth, of leaving home and attaining enlightenment, of teaching and passing away, fulfilling such tasks of Universal Good. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supreme great energy of buddhas.
bam po brgyad cu gsum pa/

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan yongs su dag pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar yongs su gzung ba thams cad las 'byung ba'i phyir/ rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu 'byung bas/ mngon par 'byung ba'i sems kyi bsam gtan yongs su dag pa dang / lam bstan pa'i phyir/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen tshul dang 'dra ba rnyed pa'i bsam gtan yongs su dag pa dang / bdag gi med cing yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir/ bas mtha'i dgon pa'i gnas dang / nags tshal na gnas pa'i bsam gtan yongs su dag pa dang / dben pa la mos pas dga' ba'i phyir/ 'du 'dzi spong zhing sems can mi gtong ba'i bsam gtan yongs su dag pa dang / dbang po'i sgo bsdam pa'i phyir sems dul zhing las su rung ba'i bsam gtan yongs su dag pa dang / sgra'i tsher ma thams cad kyis bsam gtan la sgrib pa med pa'i phyir; rang gi ye shes nye bar zhi ba'i bsam gtan yongs su dag pa dang / rab tu dbye ba thams cad mngon sum du shes pas lam dang byang chub kyi yan lag la sbyor ba'i bsam gtan yongs su dag pa dang / da dung 'dod pa'i khams su dmigs pa'i phyir/ bsam gtan gyi ro mi myang ba'i thabs las rnam par mi ldog pa'i bsam gtan yongs su dag pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dbang po rjes su rtogs par bya ba'i phyir/ mngon par shes pa dang / rig pa bskyed pa'i bsam gtan yongs su dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin bdag gir bya ba med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir/ mngon par 'du mi 'byed pa la mngon par phyogs shing rnam par rtse ba'i bsam gtan yongs su dag pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan yongs su dag pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan yongs su dag pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of pure meditation: pure meditation always gladly leaving home, giving up all possessions; pure meditation finding genuine good companions, to teach the right way; pure meditation living in the forest enduring wind and rain and so on, being detached from self and possessions; pure meditation leaving clamorous sentient beings, always enjoying tranquil silence; pure meditation with harmonious mental activity, guarding the senses; pure meditation with mind and cognition silent, impervious to all sounds and nettles of meditational concentration; pure meditation aware of the methods of the Path of enlightenment, contemplating them all and actually realizing them; pure meditation detached from clinging to its experiences, neither grasping nor rejecting the realm of desire; pure meditation awakening psychic knowledge, knowing the faculties and natures of all sentient beings; pure meditation with freedom of action, entering into the concentration of buddhas and knowing there is no self. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supreme pure meditation of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab yongs su dag pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'bras bu chud mi za ba'i tshul gyis rgyu rab tu shes pa'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / tshogs pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir rkyen thams cad la 'jug pa'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / rten cing 'brel pa la 'jug pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir/ rtag pa dang chad pa med pa'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / sems can du 'dzin pa spong pa'i phyir/ lta ba thams cad sel ba'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du yongs su brtag pa'i phyir/ sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa la rnam par lta ba'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / tshig gi bye brag thams cad bstan pa thogs pa med par lung bstan pa'i phyir tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa chen po la 'jug pa'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mkhyen pa dang / mkhas pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir/ bdud dang / phas kyi rgol ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gting dpag dka' pa'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / thams cad du chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su song ba'i phyir/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku mthong ba dang / sems can thams cad thog ma nas rnam par dag par mthong ba dang / chos thams cad dben par mthong ba dang / zhing thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin du mthong ba'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / thams cad la khyad par can gyi ye shes rjes su thob pa'i phyir/ gzungs dang spobs pa la brten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / thabs kyi lag pa rkyong ba'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / chos thams cad kyi spyi bor gyur pa'i ye shes rab tu 'thob pa'i phyir/ sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i ye shes rdo rje lta bu mi 'khrugs shing dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shes rab yongs su dag pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab yongs su dag pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes snang ba chen po bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of pure wisdom: pure wisdom knowing all causes, not denying consequences; pure wisdom knowing all conditions, not ignoring combination; pure wisdom knowing nonannihilation and nonpermanence, comprehending interdependent origination truly; pure wisdom extracting all views, neither grasping nor rejecting characteristics of sentient beings; pure wisdom observing the mental activities of all sentient beings, knowing they are illusory; pure wisdom with vast intellectual power, distinguishing all truths and being unhindered in dialogue; pure wisdom unknowable to demons, false teachers, or followers of the vehicles of individual salvation, deeply penetrating the knowledge of all buddhas; pure wisdom seeing the subtle reality body of all buddhas, seeing the essential purity of all sentient beings, seeing that all phenomena are quiescent, and seeing that all lands are the same as space, knowing all characteristics without impediment; pure wisdom with all powers of mental command, analytic abilities, liberative means, and ways of transcendence, fostering the attainment of all supreme knowledge; pure wisdom instantly uniting with adamantine knowledge comprehending the equality of all things, attaining the most honorable knowledge of all things. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the unobstructed great wisdom of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa yongs su dag pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can la bye brag dbye ba med pa'i phyir/ sems mnyam pa'i byams pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ci yod pa la brtson par bya ba'i phyir/ phan pa'i dngos po'i byams pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems can thams cad rga shi'i nyam nga ba las bsgral ba'i phyir/ rang gis bskyab pa'i byams pa yongs su dag pa dang / 'dus byas kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la lhag par dmigs pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad yongs su mi gtong zhing phangs par sems pa dang ldan pa'i byams pa yongs su dag pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa yang dag par gcad pa'i phyir/ rnam par dbral pa'i byams pa yongs su dag pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems la mos par bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub kyi rnam pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'i byams pa yongs su dag pa dang / thams cad du 'od zer mnyam par rab tu dgye ba'i phyir/ 'gro ba thams cad la khong khro ba med pa'i byams pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir/ nam mkha' rgyas par 'gengs pa'i byams pa yongs su dag pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir/ chos la dmigs pa'i byams pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems can skyon med par gzud pa'i phyir/ sgrib pa med pa'i byams pa yongs su dag pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa yongs su dag pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i byams pa chen po bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of pure benevolence: impartial pure benevolence, caring for all sentient beings without discrimination; helpful pure benevolence, bringing happiness by whatever they do; pure benevolence taking care of people in the same way as oneself, ultimately bringing about emancipation from birth and death; pure benevolence not abandoning the world, the mind always focused on accumulating roots of goodness; pure benevolence able to bring liberation, causing all sentient beings to annihilate all afflictions; pure benevolence generating enlightenment, inspiring all sentient beings to seek omniscience; pure benevolence unobstructed by the world, radiating great light illuminating everywhere equally; pure benevolence filling space, reaching everywhere to save sentient beings; pure benevolence focused on truth, realizing the truth of Thusness; pure benevolence without object, entering enlightening beings’ detachment from life. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supreme, vast, pure benevolence of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje chen po yongs su dag pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar khong nas snying rje ba'i phyir/ grogs med pa'i snying rje chen po yongs su dag pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po thams cad len pa la zhum pa med pa'i phyir/ yongs su skyo ba med pa'i snying rje chen po yongs su dag pa dang / tshad du bsams te skye ba len cing mngon par 'dren pa'i phyir/ ngan song dang mi khom par skyes pa thams cad la snying rje chen po yongs su dag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i don yongs su bstan pa'i phyir/ lha dang mir skyes pa thams cad la snying rje chen po yongs su dag pa dang / bskal pa dpag tu med par go cha mi 'dor ba'i phyir/ log par nges pa thams cad la snying rje chen po yongs su dag pa dang / sems can thams cad la bde pa bstabs pa'i phyir bdag gi bde ba la chags pa med pa'i snying rje chen po yongs su dag pa dang / rang gi sems yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir/ legs par byas pa thams cad la lan mi re ba'i snying rje chen po yongs su dag pa dang / yang dag pa ji ltar bzhin du chos bstan pa'i phyir/ phyin ci log dang / mi shes pa la gnas pa'i 'jig rten gyi rgyud rnam par bzlog pa'i snying rje chen po yongs su dag pa dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od dang zhing gsal ba dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa dang / kun nas 'khrug pa med pa ste/ glo bur gyi dri ma dang / kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs par gyur to/ /zhes bya bar shes nas sems can thams cad la thog ma nas dag cing / rnam par dag pa dang dri ma med cing yongs su dag pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od dang zhing gsal ba'i chos bstan pa'i phyir/ snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas chos thams cad nam mkha'i bya lam lta bu yin yang / rang gi sgrib pas bsgribs pas shes par ma gyur to/ /zhes bya bar shes nas/ sems can thams cad la yang dag pa'i lam theg pa chen po'i 'byung ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir/ snying rje chen po 'byung ba'o; ; kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje chen po yongs su dag pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po bla na med pa yongs su dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of pure compassion: pure compassion without companion, as they make their determination independently; tireless pure compassion, not considering it troublesome to endure pain on behalf of all sentient beings; pure compassion taking on birth in difficult situations, for the purpose of liberating sentient beings; pure compassion taking on birth in pleasant conditions, to show impermanence; pure compassion for the sake of wrongly fixated sentient beings, never giving up their vow of universal liberation; pure compassion not clinging to personal pleasure, giving happiness to all sentient beings; pure compassion not seeking reward, purifying their minds; pure compassion able to remove delusion by explaining the truth. Great enlightening beings know all things are in essence pure and have no clinging or irritation, but suffering is experienced because of afflictions of adventitious defilements: knowing this, they conceive great compassion for sentient beings. This is called essential purity, as they explain to them the principle of undefiled pure light. Great enlightening beings know that all phenomena are like the tracks of birds in the sky, but that sentient beings’ eyes are clouded by delusion and they cannot clearly realize this; observing them, enlightening beings conceive great compassion. This is called true knowledge, as they teach them the principle of nirvana. These are ten kinds of pure compassion, based on which enlightening beings attain the supremely great compassion of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dga' ba yongs su dag pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar rab tu dga' bas byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa ni dga' ba yongs su dag pa'o/ /gnod pa med par bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba ni dga' ba yongs su dag pa'o/ /sems zhum pa med pas sems can tshul khrims ngan pa can yongs su smin par byed pa ni dga' ba yongs su dag pa'o/ sems can thams cad kyi nyes byas bzod par bya ba'i phyir/ dam bcas pa mthar phyin par byed pa ni dga' ba yongs su dag pa'o/ /chos don du gnyer pa'i phyir/ lus dang srog btang ba la 'gyod pa med pa ni dga' ba yongs su dag pa'o/ /chos la mos shing dga' ba ni dga' ba yongs su dag pa'o/ /'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad spong ba ni dga' ba yongs su dag pa'o/ /sangs rgyas blta ba dang bsnyen bkur bas mi ngoms shing / chos kyi dbyings tha dad du mi 'byed pa ni dga' ba yongs su dag pa'o/ /bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pas 'byung ba thams cad la sems can gzhan mos par byed pa ni dga' ba yongs su dag pa'o/ /zhi ba dang thub cing mi 'khrug pa la bsam gtan 'cha' ba/ shes rab kyi shes che bas lta ba bsal ba dang / brtul zhugs dang dka' thub yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i bsam pas/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa ni dga' ba yongs su dag pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dga' ba yongs su dag pa ste/ de dag la ngas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgyes pa chen po yongs su dag pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of pure joy: the pure joy of aspiring to enlightenment; the pure joy of relinquishing all possessions; the pure joy of not rejecting undisciplined sentient beings but teaching them and maturing them; the pure joy of being able to tolerate evil-doing sentient beings and vowing to save and liberate them; the pure joy of giving one’s life in search of truth, without regret; the pure joy of giving up sensual pleasures and always taking pleasure in truth; the pure joy of inducing sentient beings to give up material pleasures and always take pleasure in truth; the pure joy of cosmic equanimity tirelessly honoring and serving all buddhas they see; the pure joy of teaching all sentient beings to enjoy meditations, liberations, and concentrations, and to freely enter and emerge from them; the pure joy of gladly carrying out all austere practices that accord with the way of enlightening beings and realizing the tranquil, imperturbable supreme calmness and wisdom of the sage. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supremely great pure joy of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi btang snyoms yongs su dag pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyis rim gro byas kyang dga' ba med la/ sems can thams cad kyis rim gro ma byas kyang khong khro bar mi 'gyur ba'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad las rnam par 'das par spyod pas btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / snod ma yin pa rnams kyang bkol te mi 'dor la/ snod du gyur pa rnams kyi dus dang yang sbyor ba'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa rnams par dag pa'i chos thob par gyur pa rnams la rtsol ba gtong ba'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / 'dod pa'i dga' ba dang / rtsed mo dang / longs spyod dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngag tu 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad la sems 'brel bar mi gtong ba'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'khor bas skyo ba'i rnal 'byor la spyod pa rnams dang / bsnyen par mi byed pa'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i gtam thams cad dang / mya ngan las mi 'da' ba dang / 'dod chags dang mi 'bral ba'i gtam dang / mi rigs shing 'du 'dzir gyur pa'i gtam dang / gzhan la mtho 'tsham pa'i gtam dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gtam dang / mdor na byang chub sems dpa'i lam las gol ba'i gtam thams cad dang / 'du ba med pa'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa dang / blo'i stobs dang / shugs ji lta ba bzhin du gang la yongs su smin par byas pa'i sems can de dag gis/ de la gong ma'i chos shes par mi nus na yang de dag gi dus bsdad pas btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sngon yongs su smin par byas pa gang / de gzhin [*bzhin?] gshegs pa'i sas 'dul bar gyur pa de dag la bsdad pa'i phyir btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi btang snyoms gnyis dang bral zhing mtho dman med la/ blang dor med cing rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang bral bas rtag tu mnyam par bzhag cing / chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par gnas pa'i bzod pa thob pa'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi btang snyoms yongs su dag pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i btang snyoms chen po yongs su dag pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of pure equanimity: the pure equanimity of not becoming emotionally attached to sentient beings who honor and support them; the pure equanimity of not being angered at sentient beings who slight and revile them; the pure equanimity of always being in the world but not being affected by the vicissitudes of worldly things; the pure equanimity of instructing sentient beings who are fit for the Teaching at the appropriate times, while not conceiving aversion for sentient beings who are not fit for the Teaching; the pure equanimity of not seeking the states of learning or nonlearning of the two lesser vehicles; the pure equanimity of the mind always being aloof from all desires that are conducive to affliction; the pure equanimity of not praising the two lesser vehicles’ aversion to birth and death; the pure equanimity of avoiding worldly talk, talk that is not of nirvana, talk that is not dispassionate, talk that is not according to truth, talk that disturbs others, talk of individual salvation, and in general all talk that obstructs the Path of enlightening beings; the pure equanimity of waiting for the appropriate times to teach sentient beings whose faculties are mature and have developed mindfulness and precise awareness but do not yet know the supreme truth; the pure equanimity of waiting for the appropriate times to teach sentient beings whom the enlightening being has already instructed in the past but who cannot be tamed until the enlightening being reaches buddhahood; the pure equanimity of not considering people as higher or lower, being free from grasping and rejection, being aloof from all kinds of discriminatory notions, always being rightly concentrated, penetrating truth and attaining tolerance. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supremely pure equanimity of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar nan tan lhur len pa'i phyir thos pa'i don dang / rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa'i phyir chos kyi don dang / don dam pa stong ba nyid kyi phyir stong pa'i don dang / sems can kyi 'du 'dzis dben pa'i phyir dben pa'i don dang / sems can gyi sgra la mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir brjod du med pa'i don dang / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin gyi don dang / ro mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa'i don dang / de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyi don dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha'i don dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po yang dag par gcad cing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bsgrub pa bskyed pa'i phyir/ mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i don to/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi don bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of principle: the principle of great learning, steadfastly putting it into practice; the principle of truth, skillfully thinking about it and discerning it; the principle of emptiness, the ultimate truth being emptiness; the principle of silence and calm, being detached from the clamor and confusion of sentient beings; the principle of inexpressibility, not clinging to words; the principle of according with truth, realizing that past, present, and future are equal; the principle of the realm of reality, all things being one in essence; the principle of True Thusness, as all who realize Thusness enter it; the principle of the limit of reality, realizing ultimate truth; the principle of great ultimate nirvana, extinguishing all suffering yet carrying out the practices of enlightening beings. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supreme principle of omniscience.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar ji skad du smras pa de bzhin du bya ba'i phyir bden pa'i chos dang / len cing 'dzin pa thams cad yongs su gcad pa'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i chos dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'bar ba thams cad rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa med pa'i chos dang / yongs su gdung ba dang bral ba'i phyir zhi ba'i chos dang / 'dod chags kyi dri ma dang nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos dang / dmigs pa thams cad rgyun chad pa'i phyir yongs su rtog pa med pa'i chos dang / nam mkha' dang 'dra zhing mtshungs pa'i phyir mi skye ba'i chos dang / skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa med pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas kyi chos dang / rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bsgrub cing / yongs su gzung ba'i phyir phung po thams cad spangs te/ mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i chos so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/
