“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of law: the law of truth, practicing what they teach; the law of detachment from clinging, detaching from both the clinger and that which is clung to; the law of noncontention, being free from all confusing conflicts; the law of silent extinction, extinguishing all irritations; the law of dispassion, all covetousness being ended; the law of freedom from false notions, all arbitrary conceptualization clinging to objects permanently ceasing; the law of birthlessness, being immovable as space; the law of the uncreated, being detached from appearances of origin, subsistence, and annihilation; the law of basic essence, being inherently pure; the law of abandoning all nirvana in which there is still suffering, to be able to generate all practices of enlightening beings and carry them out uninterruptedly. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supremely great law of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung rgyun mi gcod pa'i phyir/ pha rol byang chub kyi sems la yi dam 'char gzhug pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spang zhing dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par bsdu par bya ba'i phyir/ yongs su bsngo ba'i rnam pa bcu'i rjes su 'brang ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / 'jig rten gsum gyi bsod nams zil gyis ngan pa'i phyir/ shes rab dang ye shes bstan pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad pha rol gyi mthar bsgral ba'i phyir/ yongs su skyo ba med pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / yongs su bzung ba thams cad gtong ba'i phyir/ nang dang phyi'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / brtson 'grus chen po brtsams pas sems kyi sgo gtan 'byed cing mchod sbyin rab tu bya ba'i phyir/ mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / thabs dang tshul dang 'thad pas yongs su gzung ba'i phyir/ dge ba'i rtsa ba rab 'bring dang / tha mas rlom sems med par yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / skyes bu dam pa'i rnam par gnon pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir/ yang dag pa dang / log par nges pa dang / nyam dma' zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnams la brnyas pa med cing / snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pas yongs su skyong ba'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod cing rim gror bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la ston pa ltar dben par sems pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ci yod pa byed pa la brtson pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ dge ba'i rtsa ba bskal pa grangs med par bsags shing yongs su bsdus te/ lag pa'i mthil du byin cing bdag la dbang yod par gyur pa'i byang chub kyang sems can la la zhig la yongs su btang ste/ byin na mi dga' ba med la 'gyod pa med cing / de bzhin du sems can ma lus pa thams cad la yang rang la dbang yod par yongs su bsdus te/ lag pa'i mthil du phyin pa'i byang chub yongs su btang ste; byin yang mi dga' ba med la phyis 'gyod pa med pa 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs nam mkha'i dbyings rgya chen po'i rjes su song ba zhes bya ba ste/ ye shes chen po yangs pa khong du chud pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs te; de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur pa dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of virtues instrumental in fostering enlightenment: urging sentient beings to generate the aspiration for enlightenment is one of enlightening beings’ virtues instrumental in fostering enlightenment, because it perpetuates the three treasures; following the ten kinds of dedication is one of enlightening beings’ virtues instrumental in fostering enlightenment, because it stops all that is not good and accumulates all that is good; wisely guiding and teaching is one of enlightening beings’ virtues instrumental in fostering enlightenment, because it transcends the virtues of the worlds of desire, form, and formlessness; indefatigability of mind is one of enlightening beings’ virtues instrumental in fostering enlightenment, because thereby they finally liberate all sentient beings; relinquishing all internal and external possessions is one of enlightening beings’ virtues instrumental in fostering enlightenment, because of having no attachments to anything at all; working unflaggingly to fully develop spiritual refinements is one of enlightening beings’ virtues instrumental in fostering enlightenment, by opening the gate of great charity, without limit; dedicating all roots of goodness, superior, middling, or lesser, to supreme enlightenment without slighting any is one of enlightening beings’ virtues instrumental in fostering enlightenment, being consonant with skill in means; generating great compassion for bad sentient beings who are mean and fixed on error, not despising them, is one of enlightening beings’ virtues instrumental in fostering enlightenment, by virtue of always activating the heart of universal commitment of great people; honoring and serving all buddhas, thinking of all enlightening beings as buddhas, and bringing joy to all sentient beings, is one of enlightening beings’ virtues instrumental in fostering enlightenment, as they keep their original will most firm and steadfast. Great enlightening beings accumulate roots of goodness over measureless eons, wishing to attain realization of supreme enlightenment themselves, as though it were in their palm; yet they give away all their roots of goodness to all sentient beings without any grief or regret, their minds being as broad as space—this is a virtue of enlightening beings instrumental in fostering enlightenment, as they develop great wisdom and realize great truth. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can embody the supremely great mass of virtues of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar bsam pa sgyu med par bya ba'i phyir/ yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen mang du thos pa rnams la bsten pa dang / bkur ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / rim gror bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / gus par bya ba dang / bka' blo bde zhing mthun par len pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang / bdag snod du bya ba'i phyir nga rgyal med cing / 'dud pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / rab tu gus pa dang / lus dang sems las su rung ba dang / khong bde ba dang / mi slu ba dang / mi rtsub pa dang / des shing 'jam la mnyen pa dang / bzhin 'dzum zhing khro gnyer med pa dang / 'dor te gsong por smra ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / mi 'chos pa dang / g.yo med pa dang / sgyu med pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang / ye shes rnam pa bcu la rab tu sbyar ba'i phyir dran pa shes bzhin dang / rtogs pa khong du chud pa dang / blo gros mi g.yeng ba dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / mos pa la rab tu gnas pa dang / rjes su dran par bya ba drug dran pa dang / gus pa drug yongs su bstan pa dang / snying por bya ba'i chos drug gi rjes su 'brang ba'i ye shes kyi tshogs so/ /bsam pa dang yid la bya ba gzhan med par bya ba'i phyir chos don du gnyer ba dang / chos 'dod pa dang / chos la mos shing dga' ba dang / chos btsal ba dang / thos pas mi ngoms pa dang / 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dang ma 'dres pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i gtam thams cad spong ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gtam lhur len pa dang / theg pa dma' ba spong zhing blo gros yangs pa'i theg pa chen po la yang dag par gzhol ba'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang / nan tan lhur blang ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su btsal ba la mthun par brtson pa dang / tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi rab tu sgrub pa dang / rig pa dang mthun pa'i chos dang bsten pa dang; mkhas pa'i skye bo la yongs su 'dri ba dang / lam nyam nga ba dang bral zhing yang dag pa'i lam la ma nor bar gzhol ba dang / bskul ba dang / dran par bya ba dang / mos par bya pas rang gi sems 'dul ba dang / pha rol kyi sems rjes su bsrung ba'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi sems rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba'i sems dang / khams gsum pas dben par dga' zhing rang gi sems rtogs par byed pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems kyi skabs mi 'byed cing / rnam par rtog pa gsum bsal bas lus dang / ngag dang / sems las su rung ba dang / sems kyi rang bzhin gcig tu nges pa rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of knowledge instrumental in fostering enlightenment. They associate with learned, genuine teachers, and respectfully attend them, obeying them in every way, not deviating from their instructions; this is one, being totally honest, without falsehood. They give up conceit forever, they are always humble and respectful, their thoughts, words, and deeds are free from coarseness, they are harmonious and agreeable, and do not prevaricate; this is the second, as their beings become capable of bearing the Buddha teaching. They are mentally collected, aware, always alert, never distracted or confused; conscientious and agreeable, their minds are calm and imperturbable; they always remember the six thoughts, always practice the sixfold respect, and always abide by the six principles of steadfastness; this is the third, being a way to develop tenfold knowledge. They take pleasure in truth and principle, always enjoying listening to teaching of truth, abandoning worldly philosophies and theses, always concentrating on listening to transcendental talk, leaving the lesser vehicles of individual salvation behind and entering the wisdom of the Great Vehicle of universal salvation; this is the fourth, singlemindedly recollecting without distraction. They bear the six ways of transcendence in mind wholeheartedly, have already perfected the practice of the four immeasurable minds, follow the methods of illumination and skillfully put them into practice; they earnestly question intelligent people of knowledge, avoid bad tendencies, and aim for good ways; their minds always like contemplation with right recollection; they subdue their own feelings and protect the minds of others: this is the fifth, firmly executing true practice. They always appreciate emancipation and do not cling to the world; they are always aware of their own minds and never have any evil thoughts; they have done away with greed, anger, and malevolence, and their thoughts, words, and deeds are all good; they have certain knowledge of the inherent nature of mind: this is the sixth, able to purify one’s own and others’ minds.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang phung po rnams la sgyu ma lta bur rtog pa dang / khams rnams la sprul pa lta bu'i 'du shes su rtog pa dang / chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu ba dang / chu'i zla ba dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / sgra brnyan dang / gzugs brnyan dang / mig yor dang 'dra zhing / nam mkha'i ri me dang mnyam pa dang / mgal me bskor ba lta bu ste/ 'ja' tshon dang 'dra ba nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od lta bu ste/ chos thams cad ni gzung du med pa/ mtshan ma med pa/ rtag pa med pa/ chad pa med pa/ song ba med pa/ 'ongs pa med pa ste / chos thams cad mi gnas par rab tu rtog cing 'jug pa dang / mos pa dang yid ches pa 'di ni skye ba dang 'jig pa la mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ye shes kyi tshogs bdun pa ste/ chos thams cad khong du chud pa dag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o/ /chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / sems med pa dang / don med pa dang / 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / lus med pa dang / rdzas med pa dang / lta ba med pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / rje ba med pa dang / gos pa med pa dang / rgyu ba med pa dang / zang zing med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyud du yang dag par gzhol ba thos na mos shing yid ches la/ yid gnyis med cing the tshom mi za ba 'di ni ye shes kyi tshogs brgyad pa ste/ mos pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin gyi sbyor bas yang dag par bral bar byas pas/ dbang po bsdams pa lhag mthong dang / zhi gnas kyis zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi bar gyur pa/ yid la bya ba thams cad kyis ma byas/ ma bskyed/ mngon par ma byas pa'i ngang tshul can bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / bdag gi 'du shes rnam par rgyu ba nan tan du byed pa med pa'i blo dang ldan pa/ zad pa med cing tshad med la/ mi dmigs pa'i bzod pa can/ lus dang / ngag dang / sems blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pas sngon du 'gro ba'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa/ sems can thams cad dang / chos thams cad la mi gnas par bsam gtan 'cha' ba/ tshu rol med pa/ pha rol med pa/ tshu rol dang pha rol dang bral ba/ rgyu ba med pa/ rgyu ba dang bral ba'i shes rab kyis de ltar nges par rtog pa 'di ni ye shes kyi tshogs dgu pa ste/ mtshan ma dang yongs su rtog pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong bas ni/ chos mthong ba shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur/ chos mthong ba ni zhing mthong ba shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur/ zhing mthong bas ni nam mkha' mthong ba shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur/ nam mkha' mthong bas ni chos kyi dbyings mthong ba shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur/ chos kyi dbyings mthong bas ni ye shes mthong ba shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur ba 'di ni ye shes kyi tshogs bcu ba ste/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yang dag par sgrub ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad la ma chags ma bsgrubs pa'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

They observe the five clusters as being like illusory phenomena, the elements like poisonous snakes, the sense mediums like desolate villages, all things as like illusions, flames, reflections, dreams, shadows, echoes, images, like paintings in the sky, like a turning wheel of fire, like the colors of the rainbow, like sunlight and moonlight, signless and formless, neither permanent nor ending, not coming or going, and not abiding either—contemplating in this way, they know all things have no origin and no destruction: this is the seventh, knowing that the essential nature of all things is empty and quiescent. When great enlightening beings hear that phenomena have no self, no being, no soul, no person, no mind, no object, no greed, no anger, no delusion, no body, no thing, no master, no sustenance, no attachment, and no action, all of these having no existence, being ultimately nil—having heard this, they deeply believe it, without doubt or repudiation: this is the eighth, being able to perfect complete understanding. Great enlightening beings tame their faculties well, and they cultivate action according to truth; they always abide in tranquillity and insight, and their minds are silent and calm, with no disturbing thoughts arising; they have no self, no person, no fabrication, no conditioning, no idea of self, no idea of self doing anything, no excess or lack, and no sense of attainment of this either; their physical, verbal, and mental actions have no coming or going, no energy, no vigor; they see all things and all beings impartially and do not dwell on anything; they are neither of this world nor beyond it, notions of ‘here’ and ‘there’ being inherently irrelevant; they come from nowhere and go nowhere—they always meditate in this way by means of knowledge and wisdom: this is the ninth, reaching transcendence of forms of discriminations. Because great enlightening beings see the principle of interdependent origination, they see the purity of phenomena; because they see the purity of phenomena, they see the purity of lands; because they see the purity of lands, they see the purity of space; because they see the purity of space, they see the purity of the realm of reality; because they see the purity of the realm of reality, they see the purity of knowledge; this is the tenth, cultivating and accumulating all-knowledge. These are enlightening beings’ ten kinds of knowledge instrumental in fostering enlightenment, based on which they can attain the buddhas’ store of un-impeded, pure, subtle knowledge of all truths.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rig pa skye ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar chos shin tu rnam par phye ba'i blo ni rig pa skye ba'o/ /chos rnams la chags pa med pa'i rnal 'byor ni rig pa skye ba'o/ /lta ba ma log pa ni rig pa skye ba'o/ /dbang po rnams la shes rab snang ba ni rig pa skye ba'o/ /rig pa brtsams pa la yang dag par sbyor ba ni rig pa skye ba'o/ /ye shes mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir/ bden pa la 'jug pa ni rig pa skye ba'o/ /las dang nyon mongs pa la zad cing mi skye bar shes pa ni rig pa skye ba'o/ /shes rab dang ye shes kyis rnam par 'byed pa'i lha'i mig ni rig pa skye ba'o/ /sngon gyi mtha' nas rnam par sbyangs pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ni rig pa skye ba'o/ /mngon par shes pa yongs su sbyangs pas sems can la lta ba'i zag pa zad pa'i ye shes ni rig pa skye ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rig pa skye ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi rig pa snang ba bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of sufficiency of insight: skillfully analyzing all things; not grasping or clinging to anything; divorcing all deluded views; illumining all senses with the light of knowledge; skillfully generating rightly directed energy; being able to deeply penetrate knowledge of absolute truth; extinguishing the actions of afflictions and developing the knowledge of extinction and knowledge of birthlessness; observing everywhere with the knowledge of the celestial eye; knowing the purity of the past by the recollection of past states; annihilating the contaminations of sentient beings by the spiritual knowledge of ending contamination. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supreme illumination of all teachings of the buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos yongs su tshol ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar g.yo dang sgyu med pas bsam pa thag par chos yongs su tshol ba dang / brtson 'grus lhod pa med par sran 'dzugs pas/ brtson 'grus kyis chos yongs su tshol ba dang / lus dang srog la mi lta bar chos yongs su tshol ba dang / rnyed pa dang / stobs dang / bkur sti dang / grags pa'i phyir ma yin gyi/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa spang pa'i phyir chos yongs su tshol ba dang / bdag 'ba' zhig la phan pa'i phyir ma yin gyi/ bdag dang gzhan dang 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa'i phyir chos yongs su tshol ba dang / chos kyi mdangs kyis bar chod bya ba'i phyir ma yin gyi/ shes rab la 'jug pa'i phyir chos yongs su tshol ba dang / go blo la dga' ba'i phyir ma yin gyi/ rab tu rten par bya ba'i phyir chos yongs su tshol ba dang / byang chub kyi sems ma btang bas/ sems can la snying rje ba'i phyir chos yongs su tshol ba dang / yid gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcad pa'i chos yongs su tshol ba dang / rlom sems med cing 'dod pa med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i chos yongs su tshol ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos yongs su tshol ba ste/ chos yongs su tshol ba de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'i ye shes bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of quest for truth: quest for truth with a straightforward mind, being free from dishonesty; diligent quest for truth, being free from laziness; wholly devoted quest for truth, not begrudging their lives; quest for truth to destroy all sentient beings’ afflictions, not doing it for fame, profit, or respect; quest for truth to benefit self and others, all sentient beings, not just helping themselves; quest for truth to enter knowledge and wisdom, not taking pleasure in literature; quest for truth to leave birth and death, not craving worldly pleasures; quest for truth to liberate sentient beings, engendering the determination for enlightenment; quest for truth to resolve the doubts of all sentient beings, to free them from vacillation; quest for truth to fulfill buddhahood, not being inclined to lesser aims. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain great knowledge of all elements of buddhahood without being instructed by another.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos rab tu brjod pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la kun rdzob la 'jug pa'i dge pa'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams la dad pa mi phyed pa dang / chags pa'i gnas las bzla zhing chos kyi rang bzhin khong du chud par bya ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams la chos la gnas pa dang / chos kyi rjes su brtson pa dang / chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la nan tan du byed pa dang / brgyad pa rnams la log pa brgyad las bzla zhing yang dag pa brgyad la 'jug pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams la kun tu sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang / 'khor ba'i rgyun gcad pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa mthong ba dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams la ro myong ba'i kha na ma tho ba yongs su brtag pa dang / gang du yang ma 'ongs la mi 'gro ba'i chos rab tu brjod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams la khams gsum du mngon par dga' ba med pas skad cig 'ga' tsam du yang skye bar mi smon pa'i phyir/ zag pa zad pa rab tu brjod pa dang / dgra bcom pa rnams la mngon par shes pa drug gis rnam par 'phrul ba dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad kyis rnam par rtse ba dang / mthar gyis spyod cing snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa bzhi rab tu brjod pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la 'jug pa'i ro gcig pa dang / gcig tu dga' ba dang / dben pa la dga' ba dang / smra ba nyung ba dang / bya ba nyung ba dang / rang 'byung gis yongs su gnan pa dang / ma thos par rang gi ye shes kyis mngon par rtogs par bya ba rab tu brjod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la blo gros rgya chen po dang / dbang po rno ba dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems can rab tu thar par byed pa'i sems dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba rab tu brjod pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos rab tu bstan pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab dang / ye shes chen po rab tu brjod pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of understanding of truth: generating and developing roots of goodness in accord with the conventional world is the way of understanding of truth of unenlightened ordinary people; attaining indestructible faith, aware of the essence of things, is the way of understanding truth of people acting according to faith; leaving behind erroneous ways and turning to the eightfold right path is the way people aiming for stream-entering understand truth; getting rid of bonds, putting an end to the contaminations of birth and death, and seeing reality is the stream-enterer’s understanding of truth; seeing tasting as affliction and knowing no coming or going is the once-returner’s understanding of truth; not taking pleasure in the world, seeking to end contamination, not having so much as a single thought of attachment to life, is the nonreturner’s understanding of truth; attaining the six spiritual powers, eight liberations, nine concentration states, and four special knowledges, all fully developed, is the saint’s understanding of truth; naturally being inclined to contemplate uniform interdependent origination, the mind always tranquil and content, having few concerns, understanding causality, awakening on one’s own without depending on another, accomplishing various kinds of spiritual knowledge, is the individual illuminate’s understanding of truth; having vast knowledge, all faculties clear and sharp, always inclined to liberate all sentient beings, diligently cultivating virtue and knowledge to foster enlightenment, fully developing buddhas’ ten powers, fearlessnesses, and other attributes, is the enlightening being’s understanding of truth. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the understanding of truth of the supreme great knowledge of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi nan tan te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen la gus par byed pas chos la nan tan byed pa dang / lhas yang dag par bskul zhing chos la nan tan byed pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la ngo tsha dang khrel gyis 'dzem zhing chos la nan tan byed pa dang / sems can la snying rje ba'i phyir 'khor ba'i rgyun mi gcod pas chos la nan tan byed pa dang / shin tu mthar phyin par legs par byas pas phyir 'khrug pa med par chos la nan tan byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus chen po theg pa chen po la zhugs pa gzhan gyi rjes su bslab par bya'o zhes chos la nan tan byed pa dang / tshul bzhin gyi sbyor bas log pa spang ba'i phyir chos la nan tan byed pa dang bdud kyi las dang nyon mongs pa thams cad gzhom pa'i phyir chos la nan tan byed pa dang / sangs rgyas su gyur nas sems can thams cad kyi dbang po mchog dang / 'bring dang / tha ma shes pas chos bstan par bya'o zhes chos la nan tan byed pa dang / sems chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa yangs shing rgya che bas yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir chos la nan tan byed pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi nan tan te/ de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i nan tan bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten norms of practice: honoring the wise; always being alerted by the celestial spirits; always having shame and conscience before the buddhas; having pity for sentient beings and not abandoning birth and death; carrying tasks through to consummation without change of mind; single-mindedly following the enlightening beings who aspire to universal enlightenment and diligently learning; getting rid of wrong views and earnestly seeking the right Path; destroying demons and the actions of afflictions; knowing the different faculties and temperaments of sentient beings and teaching them to enable them to live in the state of buddhahood; abiding in the infinitely vast cosmos of reality, removing afflictions and purifying the body. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the buddhas’ supreme method of practice.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud de/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar mngon par chags pa'i phyir phung po'i bdud dang / glags su 'gyur ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / sgrib pa'i phyir las kyi bdud dang / slong ba'i phyir sems kyi bdud dang / skyes pa dang bral bar byed pa tsam gyi bdud dang / g.yo ba dang / rlom pa dang / 'gyur ba dang / bag med par spyod pas lha'i bu'i bdud dang / de la zhen pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bdud dang; ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi bdud dang / gzugs brnyan gyi phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bdud dang / smon lam mngon par mi sgrub pas chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes khong du chud pa'i bdud do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud de/ de dag yongs su spang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas brtson par bya ba dag go /

“For great enlightening beings there are ten kinds of demons: the demon of the clusters of mental and material elements, giving rise to attachments; the demon of afflictions, perpetually confusing and defiling; the demon of actions, able to obstruct and inhibit; the demon of mind, which gives rise to pride; the demon of death, which abandons life; the demon of heaven, being self-indulgent; the demon of roots of goodness, because of perpetual clinging; the demon of concentration, because of long indulgence in the experience; the demon of spiritual teachers, because of giving rise to feelings of attachment; the demon of the phenomenon of enlightenment, because of not wanting to relinquish it. Great enlightening beings should apply appropriate means to quickly escape these demons.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems nyams pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsam pa thams cad ni bdud kyi las so/ /sems mi mnyam pa'i sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba dang / tshul khrims la 'khrug pa dang ngan sems dang ldan pa yongs su spong ba dang / le lo can yongs su gtong ba dang / sems 'khrugs pa la brnyas pa dang / shes rab 'chal ba can la smod pa ni bdud kyi las so/ /chos la slob dpon gyis bcabs pa dang / chos kyi snod la khyad du gsod pa dang / zang zing la 'brel bar chos ston pa ni bdud kyi las so/ /snod ma yin pa la chos rgya chen po ston pa ni bdud kyi las so/ /pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mi thos pa dang / thos na log par 'jug pa dang / log par zhugs nas le lo byed pa dang / le lo byas nas sems zhum pa byed pa dang / sems zhum par gyur nas byang chub kyi lam yangs pa dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi 'byung ba ni bdud kyi las so/ /sdig pa'i grogs la bsten pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su spong ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'dod pa dang / skye ba'i skye mched la mngon par mi dga' ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / sems nye bar zhi ba ni bdud kyi las so/ /byang chub sems dpa' la zhe sdang ba'i bsam pa dang / mi snyan par brjod pa dang / 'thob pa'i bgegs byed pa dang / 'khrul pa'i skyon tshol ba dang / mi bde ba'i mig gis lta ba ni bdud kyi las so/ /dam pa'i chos la spong ba dang / ma thos pa'i mdo sde thos na smod pa dang / chos smra ba gzhan gyis bshad pa nyan par mi dga' zhing brnyas te khyad du gsod pa dang / bdag bstod pa dang gzhan smod pa ni bdud kyi las so/ /'jig rten rgyang phan pa tshol zhing yi ge sna tshogs dang 'bru sna tshogs su rang bzor byas pa'i rang bzo la dga' ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gtam rjes su dran pa dang / zab mo'i gtam 'chab cing sbed pa dang / gtam sna tshogs rnam par brjod pa dang / snod ma yin pa la zab mo'i chos ston pa dang / byang chub kyi lam mi tshol ba dang / lam ngan pa'i rgyud la gnas pa ni bdud kyi las so/ /grol ba dang / rgal ba dang / dbugs phyin pa la ni bsten cing bsnyen pa dang / bkur ba dang / rim gro byed kyi/ ma grol ba dang / ma brgal ba dang / dbugs ma phyin pa la mi sten/ mi snyen/ bkur ba mi byed/ rim gro mi byed/ yongs su smin par mi byed pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal du lhung ste/ su la yang mi 'dud cing nga rgyal yongs su 'phel bar byed pa dang / sems can la khong khro ba dang / chos kyi ye shes mi tshol ba dang / ye shes kyi gter mi srung ba dang / sems rtag tu brlang ba dang / mgu dka' zhing gsol ba gdab par dka' ba ni bdud kyi las so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las te/ de dag yongs su spangs shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos tshol bar 'gyur ba dag go /

“For great enlightening beings there are ten kinds of demons’ actions: cultivating roots of goodness while forgetting the aspiration for enlightenment; giving with ill-will, keeping precepts with hatred, rejecting people of bad character, rejecting the slothful, slighting the confused, and despising the ignorant; being jealous and stingy with the profound teaching, not explaining it to those who are capable of being enlightened, insisting on explaining it to people without the capacity for it as long as wealth and honor are thereby available; not liking to hear about the ways of transcendence, not practicing them even when hearing about them, tending to negligence even when practicing them, becoming narrow and mean in spirit because of laziness, and not seeking supreme great enlightenment; avoiding good companions, associating with bad companions, craving personal release, not wanting to accept life, wishing for the desirelessness and tranquillity of nirvana; arousing hatred and anger toward enlightening beings, looking at them with malevolent eyes, looking for faults in them, talking of their faults, cutting off their support; repudiating true teaching and being averse to hearing it, immediately criticizing it when hearing it, having no respect for those who expound it, claiming oneself to be right and others all wrong; indulging in the study of secular literature, expounding the vehicles of individual salvation while obscuring the profound Teaching, or giving subtle doctrines to unsuitable people, straying from enlightenment and persisting in false paths; always liking to associate with those who are already liberated and at peace, and giving them offerings, while not being willing to approach or edify those who have not yet attained liberation or peace; developing conceit, having no respect, often troubling or hurting sentient beings, not seeking genuine knowledge of truth, being mean and difficult to awaken. These are the ten kinds of demons’ actions, which enlightening beings should quickly get away from to seek enlightened action.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las bzlog pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen bkur ba'i phyir nga rgyal thams cad yongs su spang ba ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o/ /bdag la mi bstod mi bsngags pa ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo la mos shing mi spong ba ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o/ /thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems yongs su nyams par mi byed pa ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o/ /chos zab mo'i tshul la brtson zhing bag yod par gnas pa ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la gnas shing chos thams cad yongs su tshol ba ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o; ;yang dang yang mnyan cing yang dag pa'i gtam gyis yongs su mi skyo ba ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o/ /'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la skyabs dang dpung gnyen tshol ba'i 'du shes ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o/ /sgrub pa la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs rjes su dran zhing mos pas yang dag par len pa ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i grogs thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mi gnyis par mngon par bsgrub pa ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o// kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las bzlog pa ste/ de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams bdud kyi lam thams cad las 'da' bar 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten ways of getting rid of demons’ actions: associating with the wise and honoring and serving them; not elevating themselves or praising themselves; believing in the profound Teaching of Buddha without repudiating it; never ever forgetting the determination for omniscience; diligently cultivating refined practices, never being lax; always seeking all the teachings for enlightening beings; always expounding the truth tirelessly; taking refuge with all the buddhas of the ten directions, thinking of them as saviors and protectors; faithfully accepting and remembering the support of the spiritual power of the buddhas; equally planting the same roots of goodness with all enlightening beings. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can escape all demonic ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas mthong bar bya ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten na bzhugs pa mngon par chags pa med par mthong bar bya ba dang / smon lam gyi sangs rgyas mngon par sgrub pa dang / las rnam par smin pa'i sangs rgyas la yid ches par bya ba dang / byin gyi rlabs kyi sangs rgyas kyi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas khong du chud par bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi sangs rgyas la thams cad du gzhol bar bya ba dang / sems kyi sangs rgyas gnas par bya ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sangs rgyas la tshad du gnas par mi bya ba dang / rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i sangs rgyas rab tu rtogs par bya ba dang / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi sangs rgyas rgya chen pos blang bar bya ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas mthong bar bya ba ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

“Great enlightening beings have ten ways of seeing buddhas: the buddha of abiding in the world attaining true enlightenment they see by nonattachment; they see the buddha of vows by production; they see the buddha of rewards of action by deep faith; they see the buddha of preservation by following the Teaching; they see the buddha of nirvana by deeply entering it; they see the cosmic buddha everywhere; they see the buddha of mind by peaceful stability; they see the buddha of concentration by infinite independence; they see the buddha of fundamental essence by clear comprehension; they see the buddha of adaptation by universal awareness. By these they always see the supreme Buddha.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar yang dag pa'i nan tan la mos par bya ba'i phyir/ dus su bskul ba ni sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las so/ /sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par bskul ba'i phyir/ rmi lam du sangs rgyas ston pa ni sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las so/ /the tshom med pa'i ye shes kyi phyir ma thos pa'i mdo sde ston pa ni sangs rgyas kyis phrin las so/ /the tshom med pa'i sems kyi phyir 'gyod pa'i kun nas 'khor bas yongs su non pa la 'byung ba'i las nye bar sgrub pa ni sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las so/ /'jungs pa'i sems dang / shes rab 'chal ba'i bar gyi sems dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang / the tshom dang / nem nur gyi sems dang / de la zhen pa'i sems dang / nga rgyal gyi sems shig byung na/ sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par bsgrubs pa'i phyir/ mtshan gyis brgyan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mdun du gnas te/ bzlog pa ni sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las so/ /chos mnyan pa'i mu ge byung ba'i tshe; chos mnyan pa gang thos pas gzungs kyi ye shes thob par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos mnyan pa thos par byed cing / mngon par shes pa'i ye shes nye bar bstan te/ mos pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sems can gyi don tshad med pa la brtson par sbyar ba 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las drug pa'o/ /bdud kyi las shig byung bar gyur na nam mkha'i dbyings las sgra bsgrags pa'i tshul lam/ 'on tam yan lag nas brgyud pa'i tshul lam/ thabs sna tshogs kyis bdud kyi las de dag shes par byed pa dang / khong du chud par byed pa dang / bsal bar 'dod par byed cing / de thos nas lhag pa'i bsam pa che ba nyid kyis zil gyis mnan te spyod par 'gyur ba 'di ni/ sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las bdun pa'o/ /sngon smon lam shin tu bsgrubs pas mtshams med pa'i sems las yongs su bsrung ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi skyon med par 'jug pa las bsrung ba dang / dbang po ma smin pa rnam par grol bar dmigs pa las bzlog pa 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las so/ /'khor ba rgyud du 'brel bar byed pa'i zag pa rnams yongs su gcod pa dang / gcod pa yongs su 'brel bar byed pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams yang dag par sgrub pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje chen po mngon par sgrub pa dang / spyod pa yongs su bsgrub par mos kyang sbyor ba mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las dgu pa ste/ spyod pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ khyod tshur shog /bdag dang sems can kun kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'das par shes par gyis la/ sems can ma brgal bas ma 'jigs par bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs btsal bas mi ngoms pa la sems zhog cig/ mngon par 'du byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyang ma btang zhig/ sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyi sku yang ma dor cig/ 'dod chags dang bral ba yang thob par gyis shig/ chos thams cad la chags pa med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang btsal bar gyis shig/ chos thams cad la gzhan gyi dring 'jog pa med par sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su sbyang bar gyis shig/ zhing gi mtshan nyid nam mkha' lta bur yang shes par gyis shig/ sems can yongs su smin par bya bas kyang ma skyo zhig/ bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ma spongs shig/ mngon par shes pa'i ye shes la yang rnam par 'phrul bar gyis shig /chos kyi dbyings las kyang ma g.yo zhig/ byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa yang ma btang zhig/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la yang 'byung bar gyis shig/ chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas kyang sems can thams cad tshim par gyis shig/ chos nyid brjod du med pa las kyang 'da' bar ma byed cig/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / byin gyi rlabs kyang yongs su ston cig/ byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyang ma dor cig/ yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po yang yongs su ston cig/ skye ba'i skye mched thams cad du yang snang bar gyis shig ces/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ rnam pa de lta bu'i chos zung dang / snrel zhir bsgrub pa mngon par bsgrub pa rnams nye bar bsgrub pa 'di ni/ sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las yang dag phul gyi chos bcu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams rang 'byung gi 'phrin las gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of buddha-action. Guiding at appropriate times is buddha-action because it fosters correct cultivation of practice. Causing dream visions is buddha-action because it awakens awareness of past roots of goodness. Expounding to others scriptures they have not yet heard is buddha-action because it causes growth of knowledge and resolution of doubts. Teaching the way to emancipation to those bound up in regrets is buddha-action because it frees them from a doubting mind. Manifesting the glorified body of Buddha for the sake of sentient beings with stingy minds, ignorant minds, minds interested in personal salvation, malevolent minds, doubting minds, scattered minds, or conceited minds, is buddha-action because it nurtures past roots of goodness. Widely expounding the true Teaching in times when true Teaching is difficult to come across, causing those who hear it to attain concentrated knowledge and knowledge of spiritual powers, to be able to benefit innumerable sentient beings, is buddha-action because the resolution is pure. If anything demonic occurs, being able to manifest a voice equal to space explaining the principle of not harming others, in order to quell it, causing the awakening of understanding and causing the majesty of demons who hear to vanish, is buddha-action because the will is extraordinary and the power great. The mind having no lapse, being constantly alert, not permitting experiential entry into the absolute state of individual liberation, and never speaking of the realm of liberation to those whose faculties and characters are not yet mature, is buddha-action because it is the performance of the original vow. Shedding all the bonds and contaminations of birth and death, cultivating the practices of enlightening beings continously, taking care of sentient beings with great compassion, causing them to undertake such practice and eventually be liberated, is buddha-action because it does not stop the practice of the deeds of enlightening beings. Enlightening beings realize that their own bodies as well as sentient beings are fundamentally quiescent and null, yet, not being surprised or afraid, they still tirelessly cultivate virtue and knowledge; though they know all things have no creation, yet they do not ignore the individual characteristics of things; though they are forever aloof of craving for objects, yet they always gladly behold the form bodies of buddhas; though they know one is enlightened into the truth without depending on another, yet they seek omniscience through many kinds of methods; though they know all lands are like space, they always enjoy adorning all buddha-lands; though they always observe that there is no real person or self, yet they tirelessly teach and enlighten sentient beings; though fundamentally unmoving in the cosmos of reality, yet they manifest a multitude of transformations by spiritual powers; though they have already accomplished omniscience, yet they practice the acts of enlightening beings without ceasing; though they know all things are inexplicable, yet they turn the wheel of the pure Teaching and gladden the hearts of all beings; though they are able to manifest the spiritual powers of buddhas, yet they do not reject embodiment as enlightening beings; though they appear to enter ultimate final extinction, they manifest birth in all places—being able to perform these practices, simultaneously carrying out the provisional and the true, is buddha-action. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can achieve supreme teacherless great action without relying on the instruction of another.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nga rgyal gyi las te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar bla ma dang / sbyin pa'i gnas dang / pha dang / ma dang / dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa la rim gro med pa ni nga rgyal gyi las so/ /chos smra ba dang / khyad par gyi chos khong du chud pa dang / chos rgya chen po ston pa dang / theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa dang / 'byung ba'i lam gyi tshul shes pa dang / gzungs dang / mdo sde la shin tu byang ba rnams la mi 'dud de khengs shing 'gying la/ chos dang chos smra ba la gus pa mi skyed pa dang / gus par mi nyan pa dang / zhe sa mi byed pa ni nga rgyal gyi las so/ /chos mnyan pa dang / yang dag pa'i gtam bya bar 'jug pa las chos kyi shugs chen po skyes kyang chos smra ba la legs so zhes bya ba mi ster cing / la la zhig 'di la dad par 'gyur du 'ong ngo snyam pa ni nga rgyal gyi las so/ /lhag pa'i nga rgyal bskyed de/ bdag gi gzengs bstod cing gzhan gyi nyams smod pa dang / rang gi drod mi 'dzin cing sems nges par rtogs pa mi skyed pa ni nga rgyal gyi las so/ /mtho ba'i nga rgyal bskyed de/ shes bzhin khong du chud bzhin du bsngags par 'os pa'i gang zag rnams kyi legs pa 'chab pa dang / mi snyan par brjod cing gzhan gyi yon tan bsngags pas dga' bar mi 'gyur ba 'di ni nga rgyal gyi las so/ / 'di ni chos so/ / 'di ni 'dul ba'o/ / 'di ni yang dag par sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin no zhes bya bar yang shes la/ gang zag la zhe sdang zhing chos la zhe sdang ba dang / chos spong ba dang gzhan yang dpa' bas ldog par byed pa ni nga rgyal gyi las so/ /stan mthon po 'dod cing gces par bya ba'i chos tshol ba dang / gzhan gyis rim gro bya bar sdod cing mngon par dga' ba dang / gnas brtan rgan pa tshangs pa'i spyod pa yun ring du spyod spyod pa rnams la mi ldang zhing mi bsu ba dang / bsnyen bkur mi byed pa ni nga rgyal gyi las so/ /bzhin khro gnyer can du byas shing mi 'dzum pa dang / tshig 'jam zhing mnyen pa med la rtag tu khengs pa'i sems kyis klan ka tshol zhing glags lta ba ni nga rgyal gyi las so/ /lhag pa'i nga rgyal du lhung zhing mkhas pa'i drung du mi 'gro/ mi sten mi snyen/ rim gro mi byed cing / dge ba ni gang / mi dge ba ni gang / bya ba ni ci/ mi bya ba ni ci/ ci zhig byas na yun ring por don dang / bde ba dang / phan par 'gyur zhes mi 'dri/ mi dpyod de/ de rmongs pa las kyang ches rmongs par gyur nas/ gti mug gis slong zhing nga rgyal gyis brgyal te/ 'byung ba mi mthong ba ni nga rgyal gyi las so/ /de mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis zil gyis non pas sangs rgyas skye ba mnyes par mi byed pa dang / sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zad par byed cing / gsar du mi sgrub la/ mi bshad pa 'chad pa dang / 'thab mo byed cing rtsod pa mang bar gyur te/ de de lta bu'i chos la mang du spyod pas 'dod rgyal chen por lhung ba'i gnas su gyur kyang / byang chub sems dpa'i stobs dang shugs kyis de da dung dbang phyug thob par 'gyur yang / bskal pa brgya stong du mar yang sangs rgyas skye ba mthong bar yang mi 'gyur na/ chos mnyan pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te/ 'di ni nga rgyal gyi las bcu pa'o// //

“For great enlightening beings there are ten kinds of conceited action. Not respecting teachers, parents, mendicants, people on the right Path, people aiming for the right Path, or honorable fields of blessings, is conceited action. If there are teachers who have attained to supreme truth, who ride the Great Vehicle of universal enlightenment, who know the way to emancipation, who have attained mental command and expound the great principles of the scriptures, to be haughty toward them or their teachings and to be disrespectful is conceited action. When in an audience hearing the sublime Teaching expounded, to be unwilling to laud its excellence and cause others to believe and accept it, is conceited action. Habitually conceiving the illusion of superiority, elevating oneself and looking down on others, not seeing one’s own faults, not knowing one’s own shortcomings, is conceited action. Habitually imagining that one is better than those who are better than oneself, not praising virtuous people who are praiseworthy, and not being happy when others praise them, is conceited action. When seeing someone preach, in spite of knowing it is the norm, the rule, the truth, the word of Buddha, to despise the teaching because of disliking the person, to slander it and incite others to slander it, is conceited action. Seeking a high seat for oneself, declaring oneself to be a teacher worthy of receiving offerings and not supposed to work, failing to rise to greet old people who have cultivated spiritual practice for a long time, being unwilling to serve them, is conceited action. Frowning unhappily on seeing people with virtue, speaking to them harshly and looking for faults in them, is conceited action. When seeing intelligent people who know the truth, not being willing to approach and attend them, respect and honor them, being unwilling to ask them what is good and what is not good, what should be done and what should not be done, what acts result in various benefits and comforts in the long night, being foolish and deluded, stubborn and contentious, swallowed by self-importance, never able to see the way to emancipation, is conceited action. There are also sentient beings with minds shrouded by conceit, who when buddhas appear in the world are unable to approach, respect, and honor them; in them no new good arises, and goodness from the past evaporates and vanishes; they say what they should not, they contend where they should not; in the future they will surely fall into a deep pit of danger and will not even encounter Buddha, much less hear the Teaching, for hundreds of thousands of eons, though because of having once conceived the aspiration for enlightenment they will in the end wake up on their own — this is conceited action.
bam po brgyad cu rtsa bzhi pa/
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nga rgyal gyi las te/ de dag yongs su spangs shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ye shes kyi las bcu 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/
If enlightening beings get rid of these ten kinds of conceited action, they will attain ten kinds of actions of knowledge.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi las te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pas/ rgyu dang 'bras bu chud mi za ba ni ye shes kyi las so/ /byang chub sems mi gtong bas/ rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sangs rgyas yid la byed pa ni ye shes kyi las so/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen cing bsten pa dang / rim gro byed cing de la ldang ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / nyan par dga' ba ni ye shes kyi las so/ /chos la don du gnyer cing chos 'dod pa dang / chos tshol ba dang / thos pa btsal bas mi ngoms pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la bya bas sbyor ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa yongs su spong ba ni ye shes kyi las so/ /sems can rnams la nga rgyal med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ston pa tsam du gces par sems pa dang / chos rnams la bdag tsam du gces par sems pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la srog tsam du gces par sems pa dang / nan tan nyams su blang ba la sangs rgyas tsam du gces par sems pa ni ye shes kyi las so/ /lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / 'tsho ba'i dbang po smad du mi rung ba dang / 'tsho ba mkhas pas bsngags pa dang / byang chub kyi las kyi rjes su rtsom pa'i rtsol ba ni ye shes kyi las so/ /rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / mi 'gal pa dang / lta ba'i thibs po dang bral ba dang / gti mug gi mun pa dang / rab rib sel pa dang / ma rig pa'i mun nag med par byed pa dang / chos thams cad la shes rab kyi snang ba rab tu thob par byed pa ni ye shes kyi las so/ /yongs su bsngo ba bcu'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la mar 'du shes pa dang / thabs mkhas pa la phar 'du shes pa dang / bsam pa byang chub kyi rnam pa la zhugs pa ni ye shes kyi las so/ /sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / lhag mthong dang / zhi gnas yongs su tshol ba dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su tshol bas mi skyo ba ni ye shes kyi las so/ /las gang sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa/ bdud kyi dkrugs ma dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba bsgribs pa dang / gcod pa dang / kun nas 'khor ba thams cad yongs su chad pa/ sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rnam par gdul pa'i ye shes dang mthun pa dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba la brtson pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / rig pa'i ye shes mngon sum du gyur cing / de lta bu'i las byed pa 'di ni ye shes kyi las yang dag phul gyi chos dang ldan pa bcu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi las te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po sngon du 'gro bas/ mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas pa bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“The ten kinds of action of knowledge are believing in consequences of action and not denying causality; not giving up the determination for enlightenment, always remembering the buddhas; attending the wise, respecting and providing for them, honoring them tirelessly; enjoying the teachings and their meanings, never tiring of them, getting rid of wrong awareness and cultivating true awareness; getting rid of haughtiness toward all sentient beings, thinking of enlightening beings as buddhas, valuing the true Teaching as much as one’s own being, honoring the enlightened as though protecting one’s own life, thinking of practitioners as buddhas; being free from all that is not good in thought, word, and deed, praising the excellences of sages and saints, and according with enlightenment; not denying interdependent origination, getting rid of false views, destroying darkness and attaining light, illumining all things; acting in accord with the ten kinds of dedication, thinking of the ways of transcendence as one’s mother, thinking of skillful means as one’s father, and entering the house of enlightenment with a profound, pure mind; diligently accumulating all practices that foster enlightenment, such as charity, morality, learning, cessation and contemplation, virtue and wisdom; indefatigably cultivating any practice that is praised by the buddhas, that can break through the afflictions and conflicts of demons, that can remove all obstructions, veils, shrouds, and bonds, that can teach and tame all sentient beings, that can embrace the truth in accord with knowledge and wisdom, that can purify a buddha-land, that can generate spiritual capacities and insights. Based on these ten actions of knowledge, enlightening beings can attain the supreme action of great knowledge of buddhas, including all skillful means of liberation.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs te; bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems zhum par gyur pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /bsam pa 'khrugs pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so; /rgya chung dus mgu ba ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /gcig las mi bzod pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /smon lam la lhag par mi dmigs pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /nyon mongs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / zhi ba 'dod pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /'khor ba'i rgyun mi gcod pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /spyod pa las phyir mi ldog pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /sems can yongs su smin par mi byed pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /chos la the tshom za zhing dam pa'i chos spong ba ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs te/ de dag yongs su spangs shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“For great enlightening beings there are ten kinds of possession by demons: laziness; narrowness and meanness of aspiration; satisfaction with a little practice; exclusivity; not making great vows; liking to be in tranquil extinction and annihilating afflictions; permanently annihilating birth and death; giving up the practices of enlightening beings; not edifying sentient beings; doubting and repudiating the truth. If enlightening beings can get rid of these possessions by demons, they can gain ten kinds of support by Buddha:

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar thog mar byang chub tu sems skye ba ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /tshe rabs su byang chub kyi sems mi tshor ba ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /bdud kyi las khong du chud cing de rnam par zlog pa ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /pha rol tu phyin pa grag cing thos par 'gyur ba dang / thos nas kyang nan tan byed pa ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rab tu shes shing yongs su skyo bar mi byed pa ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis rlabs so/ /chos zab mo rtogs par bya bas 'bras bu thob par byed pa ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /sems can rnams la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par grol bas chos ston kyang / de'i rnam par grol ba la mos pa med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /'dus byas kyi rang bzhin la rtog cing 'dus ma byas la mi gnas la/ 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la mi gnyis par 'du shes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /nying gi mtshams sbyor ba la gnas kyang / nying gi mtshams sbyor ba sel ba ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes khong du chud kyang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bsgrub pa'i rigs kyi rgyun mi gcod pa ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i byin gyi rlabs bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

they are supported by Buddha in first being able to aspire to enlightenment; in preserving the will for enlightenment life after life without letting it be forgotten; in being aware of manias and being able to avoid them; in learning the ways of transcendence and practicing them as taught; in knowing the pains of birth and death yet not rejecting them; in contemplating the most profound truth and gaining immeasurable reward; in expounding the principles of the two lesser vehicles of salvation for the benefit of sentient beings without actually grasping the liberation of those vehicles; in happily contemplating the uncreated without dwelling therein, and not thinking of the created and the uncreated as dual; in reaching the realm of birthlessness yet manifesting birth; in realizing universal knowledge yet carrying out the practices of enlightening beings and perpetuating the seed of enlightening beings. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supreme supportive power of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi byin gyi rlabs te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag go zhes bya ba ni chos kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /'dus byas thams cad sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni chos kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /'du byed thams cad bdag med do zhes bya ba ni chos kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /chos rnams ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ste/ rkyen rnams med par mi 'byung ba ni chos kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /tshul bzhin ma yin pa kun nas byung bas ma rig pa kun nas 'byung ngo/ /ma rig pa kun nas byung bas rga shi'i bar du kun nas 'byung ngo/ /tshul bzhin ma yin pa 'gags pas/ ma rig pa 'gag go/ ma rig pa 'gags pas/ rga shi'i bar du 'gag par 'gyur ba ni chos kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /nyan thos kyi theg pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyis byung ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos khong du chud pas byung ba ni chos kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /theg pa chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis byung ba'i ni chos kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /sangs rgyas kyi yul zhing thams cad dang / chos thams cad dang / sems can thams cad dang / dus thams cad rab tu mkhyen pa'i ye shes mnga' ba ni chos kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /mya ngan las 'das pa yid la bya ba thams cad yongs su chad pa dang / 'dzin pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su song bar shes pa ni chos kyi byin gyi rlabs so; ; kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi byin gyi rlabs te/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go/

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of support by truth: knowing all conditioned states are impermanent; knowing all conditioned states are painful; knowing all conditioned states are identityless; knowing all phenomena are quiescent nirvana; knowing all phenomena arise from conditions and do not come to be without conditions; knowing that ignorance comes from wrong thought, and finally old age and death come from ignorance, so if wrong thought is extinguished, ignorance is extinguished, and finally old age and death are extinguished; knowing the three doors of liberation and generating the vehicle of hearers, realizing the state of noncontention and generating the vehicle of individual illuminates; knowing the six transcendent ways and the four means of integration, generating the Great Vehicle; knowing that all lands, all phenomena, all sentient beings, and all times are spheres of knowledge of buddhas; knowing how to cut off all thoughts, abandon all grasping, detach from before and after, and accord with nirvana. Based on these ten, enlightening beings can attain the supreme support of truth of all buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dga' ldan na gnas pa'i las te / bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i bu rnams la 'dod pa'i dben pa bstan pa dang / dbang phyug mi rtag pa bstan pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa thams cad rgud par 'gyur ba bstan pa dang / de dag byang chub kyi sems la yang dag par dgod pa 'di ni dga' ldan na gnas pa'i las dang po'o/ /gzugs kyi khams kyi lha'i bu rnams la bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par ldang ba ston cing / bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gyi yan lag de dag la mngon par zhen pa dang / sred pas byung ba'i 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / gti mug gi shas che ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i phyin ci log la zhugs pa thams cad la sdug par yid la byed pa thams cad mi sdug cing mi rtag par yongs su bstan te/ byang chub kyi sems la dgod pa 'di ni dga' ldan na gnas pa'i las gnyis pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ dga' ldan gyi gnas rab na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rgyan bzang po'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas te/ lus las 'od bkye zhing / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang ba chen pos rgyas par bkang nas; sems can rnams la dad pa ji bzhin du chos sna tshogs kyi sgra skad rab tu brjod de/ chos kyi sgra skad de dag thos nas/ sems dang bar gyur te/ dga' ldan gyi lha dang brtul zhugs mthun par skye bar 'gyur zhing de ltar skyes nas kyang / byang chub kyi sems la dgod pa 'di ni dga' ldan na gnas pa'i las gsum pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras; dga' ldan gyi gnas rab na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i mig bsgribs pa med pas phyogs bcu'i dga' ldan gyi gnas rab na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' de mthong ngo/ /mthong nas kyang chos yang dag par bgro [*'gro?] ba chen po dang / yang dag pa'i chos kyi gtam chen po byed do/ /yum gyi skur gshegs pa dang / skye ba dang / 'byung ba dang / snying po byang chub kyi rgyun rnam par dgod pa yang yang dag par bgro'o [*'gro'o?]/ /sngon gyi spyod pa gang gis ye shes kyi che ba nyid de thob par gyur ba'i sngon gyi spyod pa de dag kyang rab tu brjod de/ gnas nas mi g.yo yang bya ba 'di lta bu dag ston pa 'di ni dga' ldan na gnas pa'i las bzhi pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ dga' ldan gyi gnas rab na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i drung du byang chub sems dpa' de la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba'i phyir phyogs bcu nas dga' ldan gyi gnas rab na 'khod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'ongs te/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi sems dang / bsam pa yongs su tshim par bya ba dang / smon pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos yang dag par bgro ba'i sgo chen po yang dag par ston te/ so so'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gang bya ba dang / gang spang ba dang / gang bsgom pa dang / gang mngon du bya ba de dag kyang yang dag par ston to/ /yang dag par bgro ba'i chos de dag thos nas kyang rab tu dga' zhing mgu ba dang / rangs pas legs par brjod cing / rang rang gi zhing dang / rang rang gi gnas su 'dod par 'gyur pa 'di ni dga' ldan na gnas pa'i las lnga pa'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of activities in the heaven of satisfaction. First, they tell the celestials in the heavens of desire the principle of detachment, saying, ‘All dominion is impermanent, all pleasures must fade and vanish,’ and they urge the celestials to aspire to enlightenment. Second, to the celestials of the heavens in the realm of form they explain how to enter and emerge from the meditative and liberative concentrations, and if there are any who become attached to them and therefore regenerate views of the body, erroneous views, nescience, and so on, the enlightening beings explain true wisdom to them; if any conceive a deluded idea of purity of material or immaterial things, they explain that they are not pure and are all impermanent, and thus urge them to aspire to enlightenment. Third, in the heaven of satisfaction, great enlightening beings enter a concentration called magnificent array of light, and their bodies radiate light illumining the entire universe; according to the mentalities of sentient beings, they preach to them in various voices, so that the sentient beings, having heard, have pure faith and are reborn in the heaven of satisfaction after death, where the enlightening beings urge them to aspire to enlightenment. Fourth, the great enlightening beings in the heaven of satisfaction, with their unobstructed eyes, see all the enlightening beings in all the heavens of satisfaction in the ten directions, so that all the enlightening beings see each other; having seen each other, they discuss the marvelous Teaching—that is, descending spiritually into the mother’s womb, being born, leaving home, going to the site of enlightenment, being imbued with magnificent adornments, and also showing the deeds they have been carrying out since ancient times, by which they attained this great knowledge and its virtues, being able to manifest these things without leaving their original places. Fifth, when a great enlightening being is in the heaven of satisfaction, the enlightening beings in the palaces of all the heavens of satisfaction in the ten directions come and gather around respectfully, and then the great enlightening being, wishing to enable those enlightening beings to fulfill their vows, and to gladden them, expounds teachings according to the states those enlightening beings should abide in, according to what they are to do and what they are to stop, what they are to practice and what they are to realize; having heard this, the enlightening beings are very happy and freshly inspired, and return to the places where they live in their own lands.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ dga' ldan gyi gnas rab na gnas pa'i gan du nam bdud sdig can 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang po 'khor mang pos yongs su bskor zhing glags btsal ba'i phyir 'ongs par gyur na yang de'i tshe/ byang chub sems dpa' bdud thams cad tshar gcod pa zhes bya ba'i rdo rje'i tshig la gnas shing / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs mkhas pas yang dag par bzung ba'i ye shes kyi sgos mnyam zhing mnyen pa'i mtha' gnyis bzung nas/ ci nas kyang bdud sdig can gyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ba de lta de ltar byin gyis rlob bo/ /de lta de ltar chos kyang ston te/ bdud kyi 'khor chen po des byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa de lta bu mthong nas/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ba 'di ni dga' ldan na gnas pa'i las drug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' dga' ldan gyi gnas rab na gnas pa ni gang gi tshe/ 'di ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i bu 'di rnams chos mnyan pa dang / yang dag par bgro [*'gro?] bas skyo bar gyur to/ /zhes bya bar shes par gyur pa de'i tshe/ 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnas thams cad du sgra sgrog cing dbyangs 'byin te/ grogs po dag/ de ring byang chub sems dpa' btsun mo'i 'khor chen po ston pa mdzad kyi/ blta bar su 'dod pa de dag myur du shog cig ces nas/ der lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong kun nas 'du par 'gyur te/ de dag dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kun nas 'dus par gyur nas kyang / lha'i bu de dag gis sngon chad ma mthong / ma thos pa'i btsun mo'i 'khor de lta bu bstan nas/ de dag nam dga' bas mos par gyur pa de'i tshe/ de dag gis rol mo brdung ba dang / dkrol ba de dag las/ kye grogs po rnams/ 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag go/ 'du byed thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o/ /chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o/ /mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes sgra 'byung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byung ba thos par 'gyur te/ de dag gis chos kyi sgra de thos pa dang skyo ba skye bar gyur te/ byang chub kyi sems la yang dag par gzhol bar 'gyur ba 'di ni dga' ldan na gnas pa'i las bdun pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' dga' ldan gyi gnas rab na 'dug pa ni/ dga' ldan gyi gnas nas kyang lus mi snang bar ma gyur la/ phyogs bcur yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'gro ste/ de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon par dbang bskur ba thob pa'i mchog tu phyin pas/ thams cad mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan par 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yan lag dang / nye ba'i yan lag thams cad dang ldan zhing / rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa la 'jug pa sems kyi skad cig gcig gis sbyor ba yang dag par bstan par 'gyur ba 'di ni dga' ldan na gnas pa'i las brgyad pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' dga' ldan gyi gnas rab na gnas pa'i mthus/ khyad par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa dang / rim gro rnam pa tshad med pas rnam par dag pa mtha' yas pa'i rnam pa yongs su ston pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa'i las kyi don du 'byung ste/ 'khod pa de mthong nas sems can grangs med tshad med pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de/ 'di ni dga' ldan na gnas pa'i las dgu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ /byang chub sems dpa' dga' ldan gyi gnas rab na gnas pa mtha' dang dbus med pa'i chos sgyu ma la zhugs pa ni/ mig yor lta bus shin tu bsgrubs pa'i ye shes kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad du gzugs sna tshogs dang / kha dog sna tshogs dang / dbyibs sna tshogs dang / spyod lam sna tshogs dang / bya ba sna tshogs dang / sbyor ba sna tshogs dang / bstan pa mngon par bsgrub pa sna tshogs dang / dgod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis/ sems can rnams mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems dang / bsam pa mgu bar bya ba'i phyir/ chos ston cing gzugs yongs su ston te/ 'di ni dga' ldan na gnas pa'i las bcu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dga' ldan na gnas pa'i las te/ de dag byas nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams phyis mi'i 'jig rten du 'ong bar 'gyur ba dag go/

Sixth, when great enlightening beings are in the heaven of satisfaction, the celestial devil, lord of the realm of desire, in order to spoil and disrupt the work of the enlightening beings, comes to the enlightening beings with a retinue of demons; then the enlightening beings, in order to crush the army of demons, abide in the gate of knowledge of skill in means of transcendent wisdom which is included in the adamantine path, and expound the truth to them in both gentle and harsh words, causing the demons to be unable to get the upper hand; and when the demons see the sovereign power of the enlightening beings, they all become inspired to seek supreme enlightenment. Seventh, great enlightening beings in the heaven of satisfaction know that the celestials in the realm of desire do not like to hear the truth; then the enlightening beings announce in a loud voice, ‘Today an enlightening being is going to manifest wonders—those who wish to see should come at once.’ Then the celestials, having heard this, gather in droves. The enlightening beings, seeing that the celestials have gathered, show them wonders in the palace that the celestials have never seen or heard of; having seen these, the celestials are totally enraptured. Then the enlightening beings also produce voices in music saying, ‘Benevolent ones, all conditioned states are impermanent and painful, all things are void of identity; nirvana is tranquil extinction.’ They also say, ‘You all should cultivate the practices of enlightening beings and should fulfill omniscience.’ When the celestials hear this voice of teaching, they grieve and lament and give rise to revulsion and are all inspired to seek enlightenment. Eighth, great enlightening beings living in the palace of the heaven of satisfaction are able, without leaving their original place, to go to the abodes of all the innumerable buddhas in the ten directions, see the buddhas, approach them and pay respects to them, and reverently listen to their teaching. At that time the buddhas, in order to enable enlightening beings to attain the supreme state of coronation, explain to them a stage of enlightening beings called ‘all spiritual capacities,’ in which all supreme virtues are attained by instantaneous realizational wisdom, and they enter the stage of all knowledge. Ninth, great enlightening beings living in the palace of the heaven of satisfaction, wishing to honor the buddhas, use great spiritual powers to produce various offerings called ‘extraordinarily pleasing,’ filling all worlds throughout the space of the cosmos, and present them to the buddhas—when the sentient beings of those worlds see those offerings, all are inspired to seek supreme enlightenment. Tenth, great enlightening beings in the heaven of satisfaction set forth infinite teachings like illusions, like reflections, pervading all worlds in the ten directions, manifesting various forms, various characteristics, various bodies, various modes of conduct, various activities, various methods, various metaphors, various explanations, gladdening all sentient beings according to their mentalities. These are the ten kinds of activities of enlightening beings in the heaven of satisfaction: if they accomplish these things, they can subsequently be born in the human world.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'pho ston pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rnams lha'i ris dga' ldan nas shi 'pho ba'i tshe/ rkang pa'i mthil gyi 'og nas bde ba'i rgyan ces bya ba'i 'od zer 'byung ste/ de byung nas kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang ba chen pos rgyas par bkang zhing / ngan song dang mi khom pa'i rgyud du skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi lus la 'bab bo/ /de ltar 'od de lus la bab ma thag tu/ de nyid kyi tshe/ sems can de dag bde ba thams cad kyis tshim zhing sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba rtse zhil bar 'gyur ro/ /bde ba'i nyams de nyams su tshor ma thag tu de dag gis 'di ltar/ grogs po dag/ sems can gzhan zhig ni 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir skyes so zhes bya bar shes te/ 'di ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'pho ston pa dang po'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de'i smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas/ yang dag par bskul ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer 'byung ste/ de byung nas kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgyas par bkang zhing / sngon lhan cig tu spyod spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus la bab bo/ /'od zer des de ltar lus la bab ma thag tu de nyid kyi tshe/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'pho bar khong du chud de/ de dag thams cad 'dus nas byang chub sems dpa' la mchod pa'i las mngon par bsgrub pa 'di ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'pho ston pa gnyis pa'o/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' lag pa g.yas pa'i mthil nas yongs su dag pa'i yul zhes bya ba'i 'od zer 'byung ste/ de byung nas kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su sbyong zhing / de na zag pa med pa'i rang sangs rgyas 'khod pa de dag 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du sel te/ /ma yin na yang gang gis shes par gyur pa de dag tshe'i 'du byed 'dor ro/ /gzhan yang 'dul ba'i dbang du de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis byin du brlabs pa'i sems can ma gtogs par/ bdud dang mu stegs can gzhan dang / phas kyi rgol ba dang / kun tu rgyu ba dang / dmigs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i sems can rnams 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du sel te/ 'di ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'pho ston pa gsum pa'o; ; kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de'i pus mo gnyis kyi lha nga gnyis nas dri ma med cing bzang la 'od gsal ba'i rgyan ces bya ba'i 'od zer 'byung ste/ de byung nas kyang lha'i gnas tha ma nye bar bzung ba yan chad/ 'og min gyi lha'i gnas man chad du snang bar byed de/ des lha'i bu de dag gis kyang / byang chub sems dpa' dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shing 'pho bar shes nas/ de dag kun kyang skyo ba'i yid kyis me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan thogs te/ rol mo brdung ba dang / dkrol ba'i sgra rab tu phyung nas byang chub sems dpa'i drung du mchod pa'i las kyi phyir 'dong ste/ shi 'pho ba nye bar bzung ba nas/ yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po bstan gyi bar du bsnyen bkur byed do/ /phyi bzhin 'brang ngo/ / 'di ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'pho ston pa bzhi pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de dpal gyi be'u'i rgyan dang ldan pa/ rdo rje'i khams ltar sra zhing brtan pa'i snying po can gyi snying ga nas/ gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba'i 'od zer gtong ste/ de btang nas kyang lag na rdo rje'i 'jig rten thams cad yongs su snang bar byed do/ / de nas lag na rdo rje khrag khrig phrag brgya 'ongs te/ shi 'pho ston pa nye bar bzung ba nas/ yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba chen po bstan gyi bar du byang chub sems dpa'i phyi bzhin 'brang ste/ 'di ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'pho ston pa lnga pa'o/ /
