“When great enlightening beings in the heaven of satisfaction are about to descend to be born in the human world, they manifest Ten Things. First, they radiate a tremendous light from their feet, called adornment of peace and happiness, which illumines all the miserable states in the universe; all sentient beings who come in contact with this light attain peace and happiness free from suffering, and, having realized peace and happiness, they realize that an extraordinarily great person is going to come forth into the world. Second, they emit a tremendous light, called awakening, from the curl of white hair between their brows, illumining the whole universe, shining on all the enlightening beings they worked with in the past; those enlightening beings, bathed in this light, know that an enlightening being is about to be born down on earth, and each produce innumerable offerings and bring them to present to the enlightening being. Third, they emanate from their right palms a great light, called realm of purity, which can purify all universes: if there are any individual illuminates therein who have attained noncontamination and become aware of this light, they give up their lives; if they do not become aware of this light, they are moved to other worlds by the power of the light; all demons, false teachers, and sentient beings with opinions are also removed to other worlds, except sentient beings who are sustained by the spiritual power of buddhas and are fit to be taught. Fourth, they emit great lights from their knees, called pure adornments, which illumine all the palaces of all the heavens; all the celestial beings in those heavens realize that enlightening beings in the heaven of satisfaction are about to descend to be born in the human world, and they feel bereaved and saddened, and each brings various flower garlands, clothing, perfumes, aromatic powders, banners, canopies, and music to the enlightening beings and respectfully present them, and then follow the enlightening beings in their descent to birth and on till their extinction. Fifth, from their gammadion thunderbolt-adorned heart enlightening beings radiate tremendous light, called symbol of invincibility, which shines on the thunderbolt-bearers of power in all worlds; thereupon a hundred billion thunderbolt-bearers all gather and follow and guard the enlightening beings from their birth till their extinction.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de'i ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas 'gro ba thams cad du rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer 'byung ste/ de byung nas kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bar byas nas/ byang chub sems dpa'i lus la bab bo/ /byang chub sems dpa'i lus la bab nas/ lha dang / mi'i gnas su 'char ro/ /des byang chub sems dpa' de dag kyang bdag cag gis 'dir gnas te/ sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mchod pa bya bar 'gyur ro/ /snyam du khong du chud pa 'di ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'pho ston pa drug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de'i khang pa nor bu rin po che chen po'i snying po can nas rnam par bsags pa shin tu gnas pa zhes bya'i 'od zer 'byung ste/ de byung nas kyang khyim gang du byang chub sems dpa' skye bar 'gyur ba'i khyim der 'char ro/ /'od zer de ltar shar ma thag tu de nyid kyi tshe/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag khyim mam/ grong khyer ram/ grong rdal lam/ 'dzam bu'i gling du sems can 'dul ba nye bar bzung zhing skye ba rab tu 'dzin te/ 'di ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'pho ston pa bdun pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de'i khang pa brtsegs pa lha thams cad kyi gnas kyi rgyan ces bya ba las/ gnas thams cad rnam par dag pa'i rgyan ces bya ba'i 'od zer 'byung ste/ de dag byung ma thag tu yum gang gi sku g.yas par skye bar 'gyur ba de'i lus la 'bab bo/ /de ltar bab ma thag tu de nyid kyi tshe/ byang chub sems dpa'i yum bde ba thams cad thob par 'gyur te/ yon tan dang sdom pa thams cad la yang gnas par 'gyur ro/ /yum gyi sku der yang pho brang brtsegs pa chen po rin po che'i dam pas brgyan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i longs spyod kyi don du 'byung ste/ 'di ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'pho ston pa brgyad pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i rkang pa'i mthil gyi 'og nas gnas pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer 'byung ste/ de byung ma thag tu lha'i bu'am/ /tshangs pa gang la byang chub sems dpa'i mchod pa'i las kyi don du shi 'pho bar 'dod par gyur la/ byang chub sems dpas kyang lha'i bu de dag de na 'khod bzhin du/ de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i las mngon par sgrub par nus par shes pa de dag gi lus la bab bo/ /de ltar 'od zer des bab par gyur ma thag tu de nyid kyi tshe/ lha'i bu de dag shi 'pho'i las de las rnam par ldang ste/ de dag de na 'khod bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' la shi 'pho nye bar bzung ba nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa bstan gyi bar du mchod pa'i las byed de/ 'di ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'pho ston pa dgu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dpe byad bzang po rnams las nyi ma sna tshogs kyi tshul zhes bya ba'i 'od zer 'byung ste/ de byung nas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i las sna tshogs ston to/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la lha dang mi la las ni byang chub sems dpa' dga' ldan gyi gnas rab nyid na 'dug par mthong ngo/ /la las ni yum gyi skur bzhud par mthong ngo/ /la las ni skye bar mthong ngo/ /la las ni 'byung bar mthong ngo/ /la las ni rnam par 'tshang rgya bar mthong ngo/ /la las ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mthong ngo/ /la las ni de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'da' bar mthong ste/ 'di ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'pho ston pa bcu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i 'od zer bcu po de dag la sogs pa 'od zer grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu byang chub sems dpa'i lus las 'byung ste/ de bzhin du stan dang / gzhal med khang dang / khang pa brtsegs pa dag nas kyang 'byung ste de dag byung nas kyang / byang chub sems dpa'i las sna tshogs yongs su ston to/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar las yongs su grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad rab tu grub pa'i phyir lha'i gnas dga' ldan nas shi 'pho ston to/ /

Sixth, from each pore of their bodies they radiate great lights, called distinguishing sentient beings, which illumine all universes and touch the bodies of all enlightening beings and also touch the bodies of all celestials and humans; the enlightening beings and others all think they should stay there and honor the buddhas and edify sentient beings. Seventh, from the great jewel palaces they radiate immense light, called continuous observation, which illumines the places where these enlightening beings are going to be born; thereafter other enlightening beings follow them down to earth and take on birth in the same houses, the same villages, or the same cities, in order to teach sentient beings. Eighth, from the celestial palace halls and from the ornaments of the magnificent balconies, they radiate a great light, called pure adornments of all palaces, which shines on the abdomens of the mothers by whom they will be born and causes the mothers to be calm and comfortable and replete with all virtues; in the bellies of the mothers there are naturally immense mansions adorned with great treasures in which to rest the bodies of the enlightening beings. Ninth, they emanate from their feet vast light, called skillfully abiding; celestials about to die who are bathed in this light all have their lives prolonged and provide for the enlightening beings from their birth till their extinction. Tenth, from their minor embellishments they radiate great light, called array of eyes which shows the enlightening beings’ various deeds; at that time humans and celestials may see the enlightening beings in the heaven of satisfaction, or in the womb, or newborn, or leaving home, or attaining enlightenment, or conquering demons, or teaching, or entering extinction. Great enlightening beings emanate countless such lights from their bodies, their thrones, their palaces, their towers, all showing various works of enlightening beings; and, having shown these works, because they are replete with all virtues, they descend from the heaven of satisfaction to be born in the human world.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngal na gnas par ston pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems rgya chung ba dang / dma' ba la dga' ba rnams yongs su smon par bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa'i dngos po'i bsod nams kyi rtsa ba la yid mi ches par gyur du 'ong zhes byang chub sems dpa' mngal na gnas par ston pa 'di ni mngal na gnas par ston pa dang po'o/ /pha dang / ma dang / gnyen bshes kyi tshogs dang / sngon lhan cig tu spyod spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / sems can gang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba mngal na gnas pas yongs su smin par bya ba de dag gi don du/ byang chub sems dpa' mngal na gnas par ston te/ 'di ni mngal na gnas par ston pa gnyis pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa'i ni rmongs pa med cing dran la shes bzhin du ma'i ltor 'gro ste/ ma'i lto na 'dug pa'i tshe yang dran pa nyams pa med do/ / 'di ni mngal na gnas par ston pa gsum pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' ni ma'i mngal na 'dug kyang 'di lta ste/ phyogs dang 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po rnams dang lhan cig tu 'grogs shing chos bsgrag pa dang / yang dag pa'i gtam bya ba rgyun mi gcod cing / byang chub sems dpa'i stobs tshad med pa yang yongs su ston te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de dag mngal na gnas kyang de lta bu'i smon lam gyi khyad par bdog pas/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni ye shes mu med pa dang ldan pa ste/ 'di ni mngal na gnas par ston pa bzhi pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' ma'i mngal na gnas pa'i tshe/ de ni 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor kun nas gnas par 'gyur ba yod de/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi sngon gyi smon lam gyis de dag yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' mngal na gnas par ston te/ 'di ni mngal na gnas par ston pa lnga pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' mi'i 'jig rten du byung nas kyang / mir skyes pa rnam pa mchog thams cad dang ldan pa ston te/ 'di ni mngal na gnas par ston pa drug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' ni ma'i lus na 'dug bzhin du/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ me long gi dkyil 'khor yongs su drag pa'i bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor lta bur stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su snang ste/ de la mos pa chen po dang ldan pa'i lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phyo chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa de dag gis shes par gyur nas/ de dag nye bar 'ongs shing mchod pa dang / rim gro byed de/ 'di ni mngal na gnas par ston pa bdun pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' mngal na gnas pas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na 'khod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i srid pa tha ma par gyur pa rnams dang tshogs te/ chos kyi brda'i sgo chen po ye shes chen po'i snying po zhes bya ba yang dag par bgro bar bya ba yod de/ de dag dang 'du ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' mngal na gnas par ston te/ 'di ni mngal na gnas par ston pa brgyad pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' ni dri ma med pa'i snying po can zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs shing ma'i mngal du 'gro ste/ ting nge 'dzin de'i mthus ma la yang gnod par mi 'gyur bar dga' ldan gyi gnas rab dga' bas kyang lhag pa'i rgyan ma'i khong du kun nas gnas par 'gyur te/ 'di ni mngal na gnas par ston pa dgu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ma'i mngal na 'dug pa'i mthus 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa'i las kyi phyir/ bsod nams chen po'i me tog kun nas rgyas pa zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa'i rim gro 'byung ste/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par spyod pa chos kyi dbyings kyi snying po mtha' dang dbus med pa yang dag par ston te/ shes par bya ba de shes pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams shin tu phra ba'i 'gro ba bcu ston to/ /

“There are ten phenomena involved in the great enlightening beings’ manifestation of being in the womb. First, great enlightening beings want to develop sentient beings who are small-minded and low in understanding, and not let them get the idea that the enlightening beings are spontaneously born by transformation and that their knowledge and virtues do not derive from cultivation—for this reason enlightening beings appear in the womb. Second, because they want to ripen the roots of goodness of their parents, families, and those who did the same practices as they did in the past, they appear in the womb because the roots of goodness of those people will be developed by seeing the enlightening beings in the womb. Third, when the enlightening beings enter the womb, they are in a state of right mindfulness and right knowledge, without any confusion; and once they are in the womb they remain correctly mindful, without distraction. Fourth, while great enlightening beings are in the womb, they always expound the truth; the enlightening beings and major deities of all worlds gather around them and all are caused to attain boundless spiritual capacities and knowledge—the enlightening beings in the womb have developed such higher faculties of intellectual powers. Fifth, while the great enlightening beings are in the womb, they gather great congregations, and by the power of their past vows edify all the hosts of enlightening beings. Sixth, great enlightening beings achieve buddhahood among humans, so they should receive the best of births, as humans; therefore they appear in the mother’s womb. Seventh, when the great enlightening beings are in the mother’s womb, all the sentient beings in the universe see them, as if seeing their own faces in a mirror. At that time the great-hearted among the various beings all come to the enlightening beings and respectfully present offerings to them. Eighth, when great enlightening beings are in the mother’s womb, all the enlightening beings from other worlds who are in their final lives come and assemble and recite a great collection of teachings called vast treasury of knowledge. Ninth, when great enlightening beings are in the mother’s womb, they enter the concentration that is the treasury of purification and by the power of concentration manifest within the mother’s womb all kinds of adornments of a great palace, all wonderfully fine, to which even the palace of the heaven of satisfaction cannot compare, and cause the mother’s body to be comfortable and free from pain. Tenth, when great enlightening beings are in the mother’s womb, by their enormous spiritual power they produce offerings called opening the pure treasury of virtue and offer them to all buddhas in all worlds; the buddhas all explain to them the infinite matrix of enlightening beings’ abode in the cosmos of reality. These are the ten phenomena involved in great enlightening beings’ appearance in the womb; if they master these, they can reveal extremely subtle processes.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shin tu phra ba'i rgyud ston pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ma'i mngal na yang gnas la thog ma sems bskyed pa nye bar bzung ba nas dbang bskur ba'i bar du yang yongs su ston pa dang / ma'i mngal na yang gnas la dga' ldan na gnas pa yang yongs su ston pa dang / ma'i mngal na yang gnas la skye ba yang yongs su ston pa dang / ma'i mngal na yang gnas la gzhon nu'i sa yang yongs su ston pa dang / ma'i mngal na yang gnas la btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na 'dug par yang yongs su ston pa dang / ma'i mngal na yang gnas la mngon par 'byung ba yang yongs su ston pa dang / ma'i mngal na yang gnas la dka' ba spyod par sbyor ba dang / snying po byang chub tu 'gro ba nas rnam par 'tshang rgya ba'i bar du yang yongs su ston pa dang / ma'i mngal na yang gnas la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yang yongs su ston pa dang / ma'i mngal na yang gnas la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang yongs su ston pa dang / ma'i mngal na yang gnas la shin tu phra la rgya che bar 'jug pa'i tshul gyis mngal gyi gnas de nyid du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba'i byin gyis rlabs kyi rnam pa dang / sgo yang yongs su ston pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shin tu phra ba'i rgyud ston pa ste/ de dag la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ye shes chen po shin tu phra ba bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /

“Great enlightening beings have ten extremely subtle processes: while in the mother’s womb, showing the first inspiration for enlightenment up to the stage of coronation; while in the mother’s womb, showing life in the palace of the heaven of satisfaction; while in the mother’s womb, showing birth; while in the mother’s womb, showing childhood; while in the mother’s womb, showing life in a royal palace; while in the mother’s womb, showing departure from householding life; while in the mother’s womb, showing the practice of austerities, going to the site of enlightenment, and attaining true awakening; while in the mother’s womb, showing the turning of the wheel of teaching; while in the mother’s womb, showing ultimate extinction; while in the mother’s womb, showing a great subtlety called infinite different aspects of the practices of all enlightening beings and the autonomous spiritual powers of all buddhas. Based on these, enlightening beings can attain buddhas’ supreme subtle process of great knowledge.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi cher skye ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na; kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la byang chub sems dpa' dran zhing shes bzhin du skye ba dang / 'od zer gyi dra ba dang / snang ba chen pos stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgyas par bkang ste/ lus snang ba dang ldan par skye ba dang / phyir mi ldog cing srid pa'i tha ma par gyur par skye ba dang / ma skyes shing 'byung ba med par skye ba dang / khams gsum pa sgyu ma'i rnam pa lta bur khong du chud de skye ba dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su lus yongs su ston cing skye ba dang / lus de nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes khong du chud par bya bar skye ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ma lus pa thams cad kyi 'od zer bkye nas yang dag par bskul ba'i lus su skye ba dang / ye shes chen pos rnam par 'byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i lus su skye ba dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' skyes nas kyang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyang rab tu g.yos par 'gyur/ sems can thams cad kyang rab tu 'grol bar 'gyur/ ngan song thams cad kyang rab tu zhi bar 'gyur/ bdud thams cad kyang rab tu spa 'god par 'gyur/ byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa yang 'ong bar 'gyur ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi cher skye ba ste/ de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can 'dul ba'i don du yongs su ston pa dag go/

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of birth: birth with right awareness and right knowledge, free from folly and delusion; birth radiating great networks of light beams illuminating the whole universe; birth in the final existence, never to be reincarnated; unborn, unoriginated birth; birth knowing the triple world to be like an illusion; birth appearing corporeally everywhere in all worlds in the ten directions; birth in a body realizing omniscience; birth in a body emanating the lights of all buddhas and awakening all sentient beings; birth in a body entering contemplative concentration with great knowledge. When great enlightening beings are born, they shake all buddha-lands, liberate all sentient beings, annihilate all states of misery, and eclipse all demons; innumerable enlightening beings come and gather around them. These are the ten kinds of birth of enlightening beings, which they manifest in order to pacify sentient beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gad mo cher 'god pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar kye ma'o 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni 'dod pa'i 'dam du phying ba ste/ 'di la nged ma gtogs par gzhan 'byin par byed pa su yang med do snyam nas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams gad mo cher dgod pa dang / kye ma'o 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni nyon mongs pas ldongs par byas pa'o/ /bdag ni shes rab dang ye shes kyis shin tu brgyan pa'o/ /zhes nas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams gad mo cher dgod pa dang / lus kyi gzhi 'di nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku bla na med pa chen po dus gsum rgyas par 'gengs pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes byang chub sems dpa' rnams gad mo cher dgod pa dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams/ byang chub sems dpa'i mig bsgribs pa med pas/ phyogs bcur tshangs pa'i lha'i gnas nye bar bzung ba nas/ dbang phyug chen po'i gnas kyi bar du rnam par lta zhing 'di snyam du sems te/ sems can 'di dag ni lus su 'phel ba'o/ /bdag ni ye shes kyi stobs dang ldan pa'o zhes bya bar mthong nas; byang chub sems dpa' rnams gad mo cher dgod pa dang / sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i sems can rnams da dung phyir mi ldog par mthong nas/ byang chub sems rnams gad mo cher dgod pa dang / sa bon chung ngu las 'bras bu cher 'gyur bar mthong nas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams gad mo cher dgod pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa don yod par mthong nas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams gad mo cher dgod pa dang / sngon theg pa la lhan cig tu zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams chags pa'i gnas gzhan dang gzhan la chags pas/ sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi che ba nyid ma thob pa mthong nas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams gad mo cher dgod pa dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang sngon 'grogs par gyur pa'i lha dang mi rnams chung ngu na byis pa'i sa las kyang ma 'das shing yongs su skyo ba'i dbang po dang ldan par gyur pa mthong nas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams gad mo cher dgod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ma lus pa thams cad kyi 'od zer dbugs phyin pa chen po/ rnam par 'phel bar byed pas reg par gyur nas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams gad mo cher dgod pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gad mo cher dgod pa ste/ de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir dgod par 'gyur ba dag go /

“There are ten reasons why great enlightening beings smile and make a promise in their hearts. They think, ‘All worldlings are sunk in the mire of craving, and no one but I can rescue them.’ They also think, ‘All worldlings are blinded by passions and afflictions, and only I now have wisdom.’ They also think, ‘Based on this so-called body I will attain the supreme reality-body of buddhas, which fills all times.’ Then the enlightening beings, with unobstructed eyes, look over all the Brahma heavens and all the controlling heavens, and think, ‘These sentient beings all think they have the power of great knowledge.’ Then the enlightening beings observe sentient beings who have long planted roots of goodness and who now are regressing and sinking. The enlightening beings observe that though the seeds sown in the world be few, the fruits reaped are many. The enlightening beings see that all sentient beings who receive the teaching of Buddha will surely gain benefit. The enlightening beings see that enlightening beings who were their colleagues in past ages have become obsessed with other things and cannot attain the great virtues of the Buddha teaching. The enlightening beings see that the celestials and humans who were in the same communities with them in the past still are in mundane states, unable to detach from them, and not tiring of them either. Then enlightening beings are bathed in the lights of all buddhas and are even more joyful. These are the ten reasons great enlightening being smile and make a promise in their hearts; great enlightening beings appear in this way to pacify sentient beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i gom pas rnam par gnon pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i mthu yongs su bstan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams gom pas rnam par gnon pa dang / nor bdun yongs su gtong bar bstan pa'i phyir gom pas rnam par gnon pa dang / sa'i lha'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir gom pas rnam par gnon pa dang / khams gsum las 'das pa'i rnam par gnon pa dang / 'gros yongs su bstan pa'i phyir gom pas rnam par gnon pa dang / glang po'i 'gros dang / khyu mchog gi 'gros dang / seng ge'i 'gros dang / 'gros thams cad las 'das shing byang chub sems dpa'i 'gros khyad par du 'phags pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'gros kyis rnam par gnon pa dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ sa chen po yang rdo rje'i dbyings kyis kun nas bzung bar 'gyur te/ sa'i phyogs gzhan gyis byang chub sems dpa'i lus gzung bar mi nus pa bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams gom pas rnam par gnon pa dang / sems can gzhan spro bar bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams gom pas rnam par gnon pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rin po che bdun gyi nan tan yongs su bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams gom pas rnam pas gnon pa dang / chos nyid rab tu thob pas gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams gom pas rnam par gnon pa dang / bdag ni 'jig rten na gtso bo yin/ bdag ni 'jig rten na phul du phyin pa yin no zhes tshig brjod pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams gom pas rnam par gnon pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gom pas rnam par gnon pa ste/ de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can 'dul ba'i don du ston pa dag go /

“There are ten reasons great enlightening beings show the act of walking seven steps; to manifest the power of enlightening beings; to manifest the giving of the seven kinds of wealth; to satisfy the wishes of the spirits of the earth; to manifest the appearance of transcending the three worlds; to manifest the supreme walk of the enlightening being, beyond the walk of the elephant, the bull, or the lion; to manifest the characteristics of adamantine ground; to manifest the desire to give sentient beings courageous strength; to manifest the practice of the seven jewels of awakening; to show that the truth they have realized does not come from the instruction of another; to manifest supreme peerlessness in the world. These are the ten reasons they show the act of walking seven steps after birth; they manifest this to pacify sentient beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzhon nu'i sa kun tu ston pa'i las te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar yi ge dang / grangs dang / brda' dang / rtsis kyi sbyor ba thams cad las rab tu 'das pa'i bya ba kun tu ston pa'i las dang / rta dang / glang po dang / shing rta rgyug pa thams cad dang / 'phong kun las 'phags pa kun tu ston pa'i las dang / cho lo dang / rnga thabs dang / gar dang / rgyan po dang / rtsed mo dang / 'jig rten gyi dga' ba la phal las 'phags pa'i bya ba kun tu ston pa'i las dang / lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa kun tu ston pa'i las dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pas 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa rgyas par dgang ba kun tu ston pa'i las dang / mi thams cad dang / lha thams cad dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po thams cad las shin tu 'das par byang chub sems dpa'i mthu kun tu ston pa'i las dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po'i gzugs dang / kha dog dang / gzi brjid las shin tu 'das par byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs dang / kha dog dang / gzi brjid kun tu ston pa'i las dang / 'dod pa dang / dga' ba dang / rtse bas myos pa'i sems can rnams la chos kyi dga' bar rab tu dga' ba yang dag par bskyed pa kun tu ston pa'i las dang / chos kyi rim gro bskyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro bya bas/ 'dod pa'i khams thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pa kun tu ston pa'i las dang / chos la dga' ba'i snang bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs yang dag par blang ba kun tu ston pa'i las so; ; kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzhon nu'i sa kun tu ston pa'i las te/ de dag yongs su bstan nas/ de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du 'dod par 'gyur ba'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings appear as children for ten reasons: to manifest the learning of all worldly arts and sciences; to manifest the learning of riding and military art and various worldly occupations; to manifest the learning of all kinds of worldly things such as literature, conversation, games, and amusements; to manifest the shedding of errors and faults of word, thought, and deed; to manifest entering concentration, staying in the door of nirvana, and pervading infinite worlds in the ten directions; to show that their power goes beyond all creatures, celestial, human, and nonhuman; to show that the appearance and majesty of enlightening beings goes beyond all deities; to cause sentient beings addicted to sensual pleasures to joyfully take pleasure in truth; to show the reception of empowerment of buddhas and being bathed in the light of truth.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi btsun mo'i 'khor nye bar ston pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sngon lhan cig tu spyod spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du byang chub sems dpa' rnams btsun mo'i 'khor nye bar ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba brjod pa'i phyir/ btsun mo'i 'khor nye bar ston pa dang / longs spyod dang skyid pa la chags pa'i lha dang / mi rnams la longs spyod dang skyid pa'i che ba nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyir btsun mo'i 'khor nye bar ston pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i zhing du sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir btsun mo'i 'khor nye bar ston pa dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na ting nge 'dzin la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang che ba nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyir btsun mo'i 'khor nye bar ston pa dang / sngon gyi smon lam dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir/ btsun mo'i 'khor nye par ston pa dang / pha dang / ma dang / gnyen pa'i tshogs kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir/ btsun mo'i 'khor nye bar ston pa dang / chos kyi dbyings chen po dang ldan pa'i rol mo brdung ba dang / dkrol ba'i sgras de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod cing bsnyen bkur ba yongs su grub par bya ba'i phyir/ btsun mo'i 'khor nye bar ston pa dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang nas byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas shing / shin tu phra ba'i mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i bar du bstan pa'i phyir/ btsun mo'i 'khor nye bar ston pa dang / chos kyi skyabs dang ldan pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir/ btsun mo'i 'khor nye bar ston pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi btsun mo'i 'khor nye bar ston pa ste/ de dag ni srid pa tha ma pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yongs su bstan nas/ de'i 'og tu mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur pa dag go/

“Having appeared as children, great enlightening beings appear to live in a royal palace for ten reasons: to cause the roots of goodness of their colleagues of the past to develop to maturity; to show the power of roots of goodness of enlightening beings; to show the comforts of great spiritual power of enlightening beings to humans and celestials who are obsessed with comforts; to adapt to the minds of sentient beings in the polluted world; to manifest the spiritual power of enlightening beings, able to enter concentration in the heart of the palace; to enable those who had the same aspirations in the past to fulfill their aims; to enable their parents, family, and relatives to fulfill their wishes; to use music to produce the sounds of the sublime teaching to offer to all buddhas; to dwell in subtle concentration while in the palace and show everything from the attainment of buddhahood to final extinction; and to accord with and preserve the teachings of the buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par 'byung ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar khyim gyi gnas smad pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' mngon par 'byung ba dang / gnas la dga' ba'i sems can gyen du bskyed pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par 'byung ba dang / 'phags pa dang mthun pa'i lam gyis legs pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par 'byung ba dang / rab tu byung ba'i yon tan dang legs pa yang dag par bsngags pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par 'byung ba dang / mtha' gnyis kyi lta ba dang bral ba yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par 'byung ba dang / 'dod pa'i bde ba dang phrad par brtson zhing bdag gi bde ba lhur len pa'i sems can skyo bar bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par 'byung ba dang / khams gsum pa thams cad las 'byung ba'i sngon gyi ltas yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par 'byung ba dang / rang la rag las par spyod cing / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa la brten pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par 'byung ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi bsnyengs pa thob pa dang mthun par yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par 'byung ba dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ chos nyid kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' srid pa'i tha ma pa ni gdon mi za bar mngon par 'byung ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir/ /mngon par 'byung ba yongs su ston pa dag go/

“After enlightening beings in their final embodiment have appeared in a royal palace, they leave home. Great enlightening beings demonstrate leaving home for ten reasons: to reject living at home; to cause sentient beings attached to their homes to give up their attachment; to follow and appreciate the path of saints; to publicize and praise the virtues of leaving home; to demonstrate eternal detachment from extreme views; to cause sentient beings to detach from sensual and selfish pleasures; to show the appearance of transcending the world; to show independence, not being subject to another; to show that they are going to attain the ten powers and fearlessnesses of buddhas; and because it is natural that enlightening beings in their final life should do so. Enlightening beings use this manifestation of leaving home to pacify sentient beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dka' ba spyod pa'i sbyor ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar dma' ba la mos pa'i sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams dka' ba spyod pa ston pa dang / lta ba'i rnam pa la gnas pa'i sems can rnams gyen du bskyod pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams dka' ba spyod pa ston pa dang / las dang bya bas 'khyams par gyur pa'i sems can rnams la las kyi rnam par smin pa mngon sum du bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams dka' ba spyod pa ston pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas par chos nyid rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams dka' ba spyod pa ston pa dang / bdag gi dub pa nye bar zhi zhing mthu dang ldan pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams dka' ba spyod pa ston pa dang / ma yin na chos la chags pa rnams kyi don du byang chub sems dpa' rnams dka' ba spyod pa ston pa dang / 'dod pa'i bde ba dang phrad par brtson zhing rang gi bde ba lhur len pa'i sems can rnams skyo bar bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams dka' ba spyod pa ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa brtsams pa'i khyad par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams dka' ba spyod pa ston pa dang / skye bo phyi ma rnams brtson 'grus rtsom pa la yang dag par sbyar ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams dka' ba spyod pa ston pa dang / ma yin na dbang po yongs su ma smin pa'i lha dang mi rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i dus bsdad pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams dka' ba spyod pa ston pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir/ dka' ba spyod pa'i sbyor ba yongs su ston pa dag go/

“Great enlightening beings demonstrate the practice of austerities for ten reasons: to develop sentient beings with low understanding; to remove false views from sentient beings; to show the consequences of action to sentient beings who do not believe in consequences of action; because it is natural to do so in accordance with the adulterated and polluted world; to show the ability to endure toil and diligently work on the Way; to cause sentient beings to want to seek the truth; for the sake of sentient beings who are attached to sensual pleasures and selfish pleasure; in order to show that enlightening beings’ effort is supreme, continuing to the very last life; to induce sentient beings to enjoy the state of calm and tranquillity and increase roots of goodness; to wait until the time is ripe to develop people’s immature faculties. Enlightening beings use these expedient means to pacify all sentient beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying po byang chub tu 'gro ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bar bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub tu 'dod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rab tu bskyod pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub tu 'dong ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du bdag gi lus rnam par phye ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub tu 'dod pa dang / sngon lhan cig tu spyod spyod pa'i grogs kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams bskul ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub tu 'dong ba dang / snying po byang chub kyi rgyan rnam par phye ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub tu 'dong ba dang / sems can ji ltar mos pa rnams la lus dang / spyod lam dang / byang chub kyi shing gi rgyan rnam par phye ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub tu 'dong ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon du blta ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub tu 'dong ba dang / gom pa dor ba dang; gdeg pa thams cad du ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la snyoms par 'jug cing / skad cig skad cig tu rnam par 'tshang rgya ba las mi 'da' ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub tu 'dong ba dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po thams cad kyi mchod pa blang ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub tu 'dong ba dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes chen pos rnam par phye ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pas/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rnam par blta ba'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yid la byed cing / phyogs thams cad du rnam par phye ba'i mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying po byang chub tu 'dong ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying po byang chub tu 'gro ba sems can 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir yongs su bstan pa dag go / //

“Ten things occur when great enlightening beings go to the site of enlightenment: they illumine all worlds; they cause all worlds to quake; they manifest their bodies in all worlds; they awaken all enlightening beings and all their colleagues of the past; they manifest all the adornments of the site of enlightenment; they manifest various kinds of deportment and all the adornments of the tree of enlightenment, showing them according to the inclinations of the minds of sentient beings; they see all the buddhas of the ten directions; they continually enter concentration with every step and become buddhas moment to moment, without interruption; the leaders of all creatures, unaware of each other, produce all kinds of wonderful offerings; with unobstructed knowledge they observe all the buddhas carrying out the deeds of enlightening beings in all worlds and fulfilling true enlightenment. By these ten things enlightening beings teach and influence sentient beings.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba/ bam po brgyad cu lnga pa/

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying po byang chub la 'dug pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rab tu bskyod cing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub la 'khod do/ /'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bar byed cing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub la 'khod do/ /ngan song thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed cing; byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub la 'khod do/ /'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rdo rje'i rang bzhin du byin gyis rlob cing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub la 'khod do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdan seng ge'i khri la rnam par lta zhing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub la 'khod do/ /yid nam mkha' dang mnyam pa la rnam par mi rtog cing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub la 'khod do/ /ji ltar mthun pa'i lus dang spyod lam yongs su ston cing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub la 'khod do/ /rdo rje'i snying po'i ting nge 'dzin rjes su rtogs par byed cing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub la 'khod do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs rnam par dag pa'i gnas yang dag par len cing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub la 'khod do/ /bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i mthus 'gro ba thams cad byin gyis rlob cing / byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub la 'khod do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying po byang chub la 'dug pa'o/ /

“Ten things occur when great enlightening beings sit on the site of enlightenment: they cause all worlds to quake in various ways; they equally illuminate all worlds; they remove all the sufferings of miserable states; they cause all worlds to be adamantine; they gaze on the lion thrones of all the buddhas; their minds are like space, without conceptualization; they manifest comportment as appropriate; they rest in adamantine concentration; they receive the pure, sublime place sustained by the spiritual power of all buddhas; they can strengthen all sentient beings with the power of their own roots of goodness.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying po byang chub kyi mchog la 'khod nas kyang / ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos bcu'byung ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la snying po byang chub mchog la 'khod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis zhal mngon par bstan te/ phyag g.yas pa brkyang zhing / kye ded dpon chen po/ rgyal bar gyur cig/ rgyal bar gyur cig /ces gsung brjod de/ 'di ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos dang po'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ snying po byang chub mchog la 'khod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad dgongs pa dang / byin gyis rlob pa yang dag par mdzad de/ 'di ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos gnyis pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ snying po byang chub mchog la 'khod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sngon lhan cig tu spyod spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'ongs te/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag la kun nas bskor cing mchod pa'i las rnam par phye ba rnam pa sna tshogs mngon par sgrub pa ste/ 'di ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos gsum pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ snying po byang chub mchog la 'khod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la; 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi dang / gel pa dang / sdong po dang / nags tshal thams cad kyang bsam pa yod ko lta ste/ snying po byang chub gang na ba der 'dud cing phyag 'tshal te/ 'di ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos bzhi pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba'i tshe yang chos kyi dbyings rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du gyur te/ ting nge 'dzin de thob ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur te/ 'di ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos lnga pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ rgya mtsho mchog gi dam pa dri ma med cing kun nas snang la 'od gsal ba'i sa'i snying po la 'khod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi sprin chen po kun nas yog par 'gyur te/ 'di ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos drug pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ snying po byang chub mchog la 'khod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthus de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / rim gror bya ba shin tu rgya chen po rnams/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa'i las kyi phyir 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad du 'byung ste/ 'di ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos bdun pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ snying po byang chub mchog la 'khod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ye shes mchog gis sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang / dbang po dang / spyod pa mngon du 'gyur te/ 'di ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos brgyad pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ snying po byang chub mchog la 'khod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la blo shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du 'gyur te/ ting nge 'dzin de thob ma thag tu nam mkha'i dbyings tshad med pa dang; dus gsum rgyas par 'gengs pa'i lus kun nas gnas par 'gyur te/ 'di ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos dgu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ snying po byang chub mchog la 'khod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus kyi las dus thams cad la yang dag par gzhol zhing / ye shes chen po chags pa med pa rdul dang bral ba'i snang ba dang ldan par 'gyur te/ 'di ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos bcu pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos rnams te; byang chub sems dpa' snying po byang chub mchog la gnas pa rnams la 'byung bar 'gyur ba dag go /

“When great enlightening beings sit on the site of enlightenment, ten extraordinary, unprecedented events occur: all the buddhas of the worlds of the ten directions appear before them, raise their right hands, and praise them as unexcelled guides; all buddhas watch over them and give them power; the enlightening beings who were their colleagues in the past come and surround them and respectfully present various adornments; the plants and trees and all insentient things bend toward the site of enlightenment; the great enlightening beings enter a concentration called observing the cosmos, whose power can cause all enlightening practices to be fulfilled; they attain a spell called oceanic treasury of supreme pure light, and are able to receive the rain from the great clouds of teaching of all buddhas; by spiritual powers they produce superb offerings throughout all worlds which they present to the buddhas; they rest in highest knowledge and actually know the faculties and mental patterns of all sentient beings; they enter a concentration called ‘well aware,’ whose power enables their bodies to fill all worlds in all spaces in all times; they attain pure illumination and unobstructed great knowledge, enabling their physical actions to penetrate past, present, and future. These are the ten extraordinary things that happen when great enlightening beings sit on the site of enlightenment.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ don rnam pa bcu po 'di dag gi dbang yang dag par mthong nas/ snying po byang chub mchog la 'dug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bdud 'dul ba ston te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa na 'thab mo dang / g.yul la mos pa'i sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyi che ba nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' bdud 'dul ba ston to/ /yid gnyis dang / the tshom du gyur pa'i mi dang / lha rnams kyi yid gnyis dang / the tshom gcad pa'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to/ /bdud kyi sde yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to/ /'thab mo dang / g.yul la mos pa'i lha dang / mi rnams kun nas bsdu ba dang / kun nas 'dus pa'i lha dang mi rnams 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to/ /byang chub sems dpa'i mthu la thub pa med pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to/ /sems can gzhan mos shing spro bar bya ba'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to/ /phyi ma'i skye bo rnams la snying brtse ba'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to/ /snying po byang chub kyi bar gyi bdud kyi las yongs su bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi lam thams cad las 'das pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to/ /nyon mongs pa'i stobs kyis nyams smad cing stobs med par byas pa yongs su bstan pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba brjod pa dang / byams pa'i stobs yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to/ /kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa dag tu chos nyid rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' bdud 'dul ba ston to/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ don bcu po de dag gi dbang mngon pas na/ byang chub sems dpa' bdud 'dul ba ston to/ /

“When great enlightening beings are sitting on the site of enlightenment, they manifest the conquering of demons because of observing ten kinds of purpose: because the sentient beings in times of confusion are bellicose, enlightening beings want to show the spiritual power of enlightening beings; to cut off the doubts of people in celestial and mundane states who have doubts; to civilize and tame the armies of demons; to cause people who like the military to come and observe demon quelling, so their minds will be subdued; to show that no one in the world can oppose the powers of enlightening beings; to arouse the courage and strength of all sentient beings; out of pity for the sentient beings of degenerate times; to show that even up to the site of enlightenment there are still hordes of demons who come to create disturbance, and only after this does one finally manage to get beyond the reach of demons; to show that the force of afflictions is weak and inferior compared with the mighty power of great compassion and virtue; and to do what must be done in a polluted, evil world. These are the ten reasons why great enlightening beings manifest demon-conquering.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams bdud dang / las dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad las 'das shing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad la rnam par rtse ba yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan 'byams klas pa thams cad dang ldan pa yin/ chos dkar po'i tshogs thams cad yang dag par bsags pa yin/ chos snang ba rnam par dpyad par bya ba thams cad shin tu rnam par phye ba yin/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du khyab pa'i lus dang ldan pa yin/ sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sems dang / dbyangs su ldan pa yin/ byin gyi rlabs thams cad kyis rab mchog por byin gyis brlabs pa yin/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs rnam par mi rtog pa thob pa yin/ skad cig gcig gis dus gsum rnam par 'tshang rgya ba yin/ shin tu rnam par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba'i ting 'dzin kyang rab tu thob pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang ldan pa yin te/ 'di ltar gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i stobs dang ldan pa yin/ zag pa zad pa shes pa'i bar gyi stobs dang ldan pa yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ste/ stobs bcu po de dag dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o/ /

“Great enlightening beings have ten kinds of attainment of powers of the enlightened: they attain the powers of the enlightened because they transcend the afflictive activities of all demons; because they fulfill all enlightening practices and master all concentrations of enlightening beings; because they fully accomplish all the far-reaching meditations of enlightening beings; because they fulfill all the pure means of fostering enlightenment; because they attain illumination of knowledge of all things and can think and analyze well; because their bodies pervade all worlds; because they can support all by spiritual power; because their utterances are equal to the minds of all sentient beings; because they are physically, verbally, and mentally equal to the buddhas of all times, and can comprehend the things of all times in a single thought; because they attain concentration of precisely aware knowledge and are imbued with the ten powers of the enlightened, from knowledge of what is so and what is not so up to knowledge of extinction of contaminations. If enlightening beings acquire these ten powers, they are called buddhas, truly awake.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni/ chos kyi 'khor lo chen po rnam pa bcu bskor te/ rnam pa bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar mi 'jigs pas shin tu sbyangs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa dang / tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa bzhi'i sgra rjes su bsgrags pa dang / bden pa bzhi'i tshul gyis shin tu brtags pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa bsgribs pa med pa'i rjes su song ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / thogs pa med cing blta bar dka' la yo ba med cing / sdug bsngal gyi gsal shing 'byin pa dang; sngon gyi snying rje chen po'i byin gyi rlabs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du grags pa dang / bskal pa grangs med par chos ston pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / legs par spyad pas bskor ba'o; ; kye rgyal ba'i sras/ sgo rnam pa bcu po de dag la sogs pa rnam pa tshad med pa de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro/ /

“There are ten aspects of the turning of the great wheel of teaching by truly awakened buddhas: they are imbued with the knowledge of the four pure fearlessnesses; they produce utterances consonant with the four intellectual powers; they are able to expound the characteristics of the four truths; they accord with the unobstructed liberation of all buddhas; they are able to provoke pure faith in the minds of all sentient beings; whatever they say is not in vain, being able to extract the poison arrows of suffering from sentient beings; they are supported by the power of great compassionate commitment; their utterances pervade all worlds; they teach endlessly for incalculable eons; the teachings they utter are all able to produce spiritual faculties and powers, ways of awakening, meditations, liberations, concentrations, and such phenomena. When buddhas teach, it involves infinite such phenomena.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi 'khor lo de ni sems can gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la chos dkar po'i rnam pa bcus thogs pa med pa dang / mngon par chags pa med par 'byung bar 'gyur te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar smon lam thams cad kyi stobs kyi shugs dang / snying rje chen po'i byin gyi rlabs dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad mi gtong ba dang / ye shes kyi rnam par 'phrul ba bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa dang / dus la bab par thob par byed pa dang / rigs pa'i tshul bzhin du mi 'khrul ba dang / dus gsum shes par bya ba rab tu rtogs pa dang / lus kyi dbang zil gyis mi non pa dang / tshig gi dbang dmigs par dka' ba dang / ye shes kyi dbang tshig bzhin du khong du chud par byed pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ chos dkar po'i rnam pa bcu po de dag gis/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi 'khor lo sems can gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la thogs pa med pa dang / mngon par med par 'gyur bar 'gyur ro; ;

“When truly awakened buddhas turn the wheel of teaching, by virtue of ten things they plant pure elements in the minds of sentient beings, which are not in vain: because of the power of their past vows; because of being sustained by great compassion; because of not abandoning sentient beings; because of freedom of knowledge able to teach according to the inclinations of sentient beings; because of unerring timing; because of according with suitability and not preaching arbitrarily; because of knowledge of past, present, and future; because buddhas are most excellent, without peer; because their sayings are free and unfathomable; because their knowledge is free and whatever they say is enlightening.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las rdzogs par mdzad zin pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni don bcu'i dbang gzigs nas/ yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba chen po ston te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'du byed mi rtag pa yongs su bstan pa dang / 'dus byas thams cad yid brtan du mi rung bar bstan pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyogs bde bar 'gro bas 'jigs pa dang / bag tsha ba thams cad dang 'bral ba yang dag par bstan pa dang / gzugs kyi lus la zhen pa'i lha dang mi rnams la gzugs kyi lus mi rtag pa nyid du yang dag par bstan pa dang / chos kyi sku la yang dag par sbyar ba dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i mthus phyir mi ldog par yongs su bstan pa dang / 'du byed thams cad 'dod dgur mi rung zhing dbang bsgyur du med pa yongs su bstan pa dang / sa gsum gyi 'khor ba thams cad sgyu ma'i rnam pa lta bur yongs su bstan pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ni snying po dam pa ste/ mi 'jigs pa'i chos nyid du yang dag par bstan pa dang; kun 'byung zhing 'jigs pas 'bral bar 'gyur ba yongs su bstan pa dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi chos nyid kyis kyang de bzhin te/ sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las thams cad rdzogs par mdzad de/ dgongs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs shing chos kyi 'khor lo shin tu bskor te/ 'dul ba thams cad shin tu dul nas/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad shin tu lung bstan par 'gyur te/ mnyam pa med pa'i go 'phang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba chen por yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras; don bcu po de dag yang dag par gzigs nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mnyam pa med pa'i go 'phang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po yongs su ston to/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sgo ste/ yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mang pos gsungs pa'o/ /don tshad med pa khong du chud par 'gyur ba'o/ /mkhas pa'i skye bo dga' bar byed pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa dang / smon lam chen po rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa'o/ /sems can gang gis 'di thos par gyur te/ thos nas kyang mos par byed pa dang / mos par gyur nas kyang nan tan gyis yang dag par bsgrub pa de dag thams cad myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro; ; kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ byang chub ni byang chub sems dpa' nan tan lhur byed pa rnams kyis 'grub kyi/ nan tan dang mi ldan pa rnams kyis ma yin no/ /

“When buddhas have done their buddha-work, they manifest final extinction because of ten considerations: to show that all activities are really impermanent; to show that all created things are unstable; to show that ultimate nirvana is the abode of peace, without fear; to show those attached to the physical body that the physical body is impermanent, so that they will aspire to dwell in the pure body of reality; to show that the power of impermanence cannot be overturned; to show that all created things do not remain as one wishes and are not under one’s control; to show that all existents are like magical productions and are not hard and fast; to show that the nature of nirvana is ultimately stable and indestructible; to show that all things have no birth or origin, yet have the appearance of assemblage and dissolution. Once the buddhas have finished their buddha-work, have fulfilled their vows, have turned the wheel of teaching, have enlightened and liberated those who could be enlightened and liberated, and have made the predictions of buddhahood of the enlightening beings who become honored ones, as a matter of course they enter unchanging, great, ultimate nirvana. These are the ten points of consideration because of which they manifest ultimate extinction in nirvana.
“This teaching is called the far-reaching pure practice of enlightening beings. It is expounded by all the infinite buddhas. It can enable the wise to comprehend innumerable matters and to all become joyful. It enables the great undertakings and deeds of all enlightening beings to continue, If any sentient beings hear this teaching, believe it, understand it, and put it into practice, they will surely be able to attain supreme complete perfect enlightenment quickly. Why? Because they apply the teachings in practice. If enlightening beings do not practice in accord with the teaching, they will be forever estranged from the enlightenment of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de lta bas na/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nan tan la gnas pas/ 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sgo'i le'u byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / yon tan gyi 'byung gnas/ don rnam par gdon mi za ba'i me tog/ chos kyi sgo thams cad la yang dag par gzhol ba/ ye shes kyi sgo la 'jug pa/ 'jig rten gyi lam thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi lam dang bral ba/ 'gro ba thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa/ chos thams cad kyi sgo snang bar byed pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel bar byed pa 'di/ rim gror byas te/ mnyan par bya'o/ /blang bar bya'o/ /yongs su gzung bar bya'o/ /yongs su bzung nas kyang nges pas rtogs pa'i sgos yongs su sbyang ba dang / smon lam mngon par bsgrub pa la brtson par bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dkon pa ma yin no/ /'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sgo'i le'u chos thams cad kyi sgor yang dag par gzhol ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bstan pa'i tshe/ sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i chos nyid thob pas/ phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa rnams rab tu g.yos par gyur to/ /'jig rten gyi khams g.yos par gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang snang ba chen pos rgyas shing gsal bar gyur to/ /phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang dgyes par gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po la zhal bstan nas gsung brjod pa/ kye rgyal ba'i bu/ legs so/ /legs so/ /ji ltar khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la/ 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sgo'i le'u byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / yon tan gyi 'byung gnas don rnam par gdon mi za ba'i me tog chos kyi sgo thams cad la yang dag gzhol ba/ ye shes kyi sgo la 'jug pa; 'jig rten gyi lam thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi lam dang bral ba/ 'gro ba thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa/ chos thams cad kyi sgo snang bar byed pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel bar byed pa 'di bstan pa ni rgyal ba'i bu khyod chos 'di dag la legs par bslabs pas shin tu byang ba ste/ rgyal ba'i bu khyod kyis chos kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / mthus mos pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di legs par bshad de/ nged kyis kyang mngon par bsngags so/ /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis kyang mngon par bsngags so/ / kye rgyal ba'i bu/ khyod kyis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ma thos pa'i chos thos par bya ba'i phyir/ nged kyis byin gyis brlab pa mdzad do//

Therefore, enlightening beings should practice the teaching. “This flower of definitive meaning of the points of virtuous practices of all enlightening beings enters into all the teachings, produces all knowledge, transcends all worlds, is beyond the paths of the two lesser vehicles, is not common to all sentient beings, can illumine all ways of entry into truth, and develops transcendental roots of goodness in sentient beings. This book of the teaching of detachment from the world should be honored, listened to and absorbed, recited and remembered, contemplated, appreciated, and put into practice. People who can do this will soon attain unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.”
When this book was spoken, by the spiritual power of Buddha and by the nature of the teaching, infinite worlds in the ten directions quaked and great light shone everywhere. At that point, buddhas of the ten directions all appeared before the enlightening being Universally Good and said in praise, “It is very good, offspring of Buddha, how you can expound this book of transmundane principles of the flower of definitive meaning of points of virtuous practice of enlightening beings of the highest ranks, which enters into all Buddha teachings. You have learned this teaching well and expound this teaching well; you preserve this teaching by spiritual power. We buddhas all rejoice in this, and as we rejoice for you, so do all buddhas. We buddhas, all of the same mind, preserve this scripture, so that the enlightening beings of present and future who have not heard it may all get to hear it.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur bltas te/ 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad la bltas nas chos kyi dbyings thams cad la bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the great enlightening being Universally Good, by the power of Buddha, looked over all the masses in the ten directions, throughout the cosmos, and said in verse:

gang rnams de dag bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig stong du brtul zhugs dka' spyad pa/ / gang rnams de dag sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig stong las byung ba'i chos kyi sras/ / gang rnams de dag sems can bye ba khrag khrig stong rnams byang chub rab 'god pa/ / dpe zla med pa de dag rnams kyi spyod pa bshad kyi rtse cig mnyan par byos/ /
gang dag sangs rgyas khrag khrig mtha' yas mchod kyang bdag ni sangs rgyas mi gnas pa/ / gang dag nyon mongs bcings pa'i 'gro ba thar byed sems can 'du shes mi gnas dang / / gang rnams de dag sangs rgyas yon tan rtag tu tshol yang yon tan mi gnas pa/ / de dag 'jig rten rab tu dga' bar byed pa'i spyod mchog mdzes pa brjod par bya/ /
gang rnams de dag srid pa gsum na las dang nyon mongs bdud kyi dbang song snang / / gang rnams de dag 'phags pa'i yon tan ldan zhing khyu mchog spyod pa ston pa po/ / gang rnams de dag gti mug nyon mongs nyes bral bsam pa zhi zhing rab zhi ba/ / 'gro ba rnams la spyod pa'i rim pa ston pa de dag yon tan brjod par bya; ;
gang rnams de dag bdud g.yo 'gro ba kun las brgal te thams cad dbang byed pa/ / 'gro ba thams cad dag la sprul pa sna tshogs tha dad mtha' yas rab tu ston/ / sems bskyed gyur ma thag tu gnas dang 'jig pa'i bya ba thams cad ston byed pa/ / de dag yon tan sna tshogs mdzes pa sems can dga' bar byed pa brjod par bya/ /
srid pa'i rgyud na sems can sdug bsngal nyen cing skye dang rga bas gzir ba dang / / 'chi dang mya ngan dag gis gtses shing gnod byas nyon mongs kun tu gzir mthong nas/ / de dag thar bar bya phyir snying rje rgya chen bskyed nas ye shes mchog 'god pa/ / de dag yon tan shin tu dge ba phyogs tsam bshad kyi rtse cig mnyan par byos/ /

Cultivating difficult practices for measureless eons, Born of the true teachings of infinite buddhas, Causing countless beings to dwell in enlightenment— Listen as I tell of the peerless deeds of enlightening beings.
Serving infinite buddhas, abandoning attachment, Widely liberating sentient beings, without forming such concepts, Seeking enlightened virtue, minds independent, Their sublime practices I now tell.
Free from afflicting actions of demons of the three worlds, Imbued with higher conduct with holy virtues, Destroying delusions, minds at peace— I now tell the path they travel.
Forever free of the deceptive illusions of the world, Showing sentient beings various transformations; Mind arising, abiding, passing away—they manifest myriad phenomena: I tell of their abilities to gladden all.
Seeing sentient beings born, aging, and dying, Bound and oppressed by afflictions and troubles, They want to liberate them, and so inspire them— Listen to their virtuous practices.

sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod pa brtson 'grus dga' bar bsam gtan la yang rnam par rtsen/ / shes rab thabs kyi pha rol phyin cing byams dang snying rje lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / / dga' ba'i chos la brtson zhing btang snyoms dga' bas bskal pa brgyar yang spyod spyad pa/ / de dag spyod ldan yon tan ldan pa rnams kyi yon tan bstan gyi de dag nyon/ /
gang rnams de dag byang chub gnyer phyir bye ba khrag khrig stong gi lus skem pa/ / gang rnams byang chub zhi ba tshol phyir srog la lta ba med par gyur pa dang / / gang rnams de dag sems can phan phyir rtag brtson bdag gi bde ba mi tshol ba/ / byams dang snying rje'i sems ldan thub pa de dag kun gyi spyod mchog brjod par bya/ /
rgya mtsho'i chu thigs bgrangs pa re res thams cad zad par bya bar rung srid kyi/ / de dag yon tan bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig du ma stong du brjod byas kyang / / dpe tsam bya bar mi nus legs par brjod cing bstan par mi nus 'on kyang go / sems can phan pa'i don du sangs rgyas yul rnams bstan par bya ba mnyan par byos/ /
gang dag 'gro ba rnams kyi don phyir dge ba kun 'dzin dkar po 'phel byed kyang / / mtho bar mi sems dma' bar sems med mi dman chos tshol ngoms par yong mi 'gyur/ / 'gro ba kun nas don gnyer chu klung ye shes mtsho chen shes rab shing sdong ste/ / ston pa'i mkhas pa de dag rnams ni sa ltar 'gro ba thams cad 'tsho ba yin/ /
byams pa rlan yin snying rje rtsa ba dga' ba sdong po brtan pa sdom pa ste/ / ze ba ye shes dri ni tshul khrims bzang po lo ma me tog yon tan can/ /

Generosity, ethics, tolerance, vigor, meditation, wisdom, Skill in means, benevolence, compassion, equanimity, and so on— They practice these for billions of eons: Hear the virtues of those people.
Seeking enlightenment for billions of eons, They never begrudge their lives, Vowing to benefit sentient beings, not doing it for themselves— I now tell of their compassionate deeds.
To expound their virtues for countless eons Would hardly amount to a drop in the sea; Their virtues are peerless, incomparable— By the power of Buddha I now summarize them.
In their minds, no high or low— They tirelessly seek the Path, As they go, causing sentient beings To live in good, purifying ways.
Their wisdom benefits all Like trees, rivers, and springs, And also like the earth Upon which everything rests.
Enlightening beings are like lotus flowers, With roots of kindness, stems of peace, Petals of wisdom, Fragance of conduct.

sangs rgyas 'od kyis rab tu rgyas byas blo gros ldan pa sems can dga' byed pa/ / de dang de dag pad+mo lta bur 'dus byas ma gos 'gro ba rnams la snang / / sa bon mos pa sa gzhi bsam pa byams dang snying rje dang ni rtsa ba ste/ / sdong po shes rab thabs ni yal ga lcug ma dag ni pha rol phyin rab lnga/ /
bsam gtan shes rab mngon shes me tog rgyas pa kun mkhyen ye shes 'bras bu ste/ / chos kyi shing mchog rdzu 'phrul bya 'khod de dang des ni 'jig rten gsum po khebs/ / rim gyis dkar yangs yongs su spel ba lus yin bden pa rnams ni rkang pa ste/ / dran pa mgrin pa spyod mchog shes rab mgo yin ral pa rnam par grol ba dge /
stong pa don dam sul dang phug yin byams dang snying rje dag ni mig gnyis te/ / de dag seng ge lta bur bdag med sgra 'byin bdud sde rab tu skrag par byed/ /

Buddha emanates the light of truth, Causing them to bloom; The water of the created not sticking to them, All who see them are delighted.
The tree of sublime ways of enlightening beings Grows in the ground of the straightforward mind; Faith is its seed, compassion its roots, Wisdom its trunk; Skillful means are its boughs, Five transcendent ways its branches, Concentration its leaves, spiritual powers its flowers, And omniscience its fruit; Supreme powers are like birds perched in it As it gives shade to the triple world.
The lion of enlightening beings Has pure good ways for a body, The four truths are its legs, Right mindfulness is its neck, Benevolence its eyes, wisdom its head, Wearing the turban of liberation; In the valley of emptiness of ultimate reality It roars this teaching and scares all demons.

'gro ba ma lus rnams ni 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon nyon mongs mi bzad 'khyams gyur te/ / bdud kyi bya ma rta dang rkun por bcas pas zin cing gti mug mdongs gyur pa/ / lam ni rab stor mi mkhas sems can mthong nas ded dpon mkhas pa de dag ni/ / lam gyi mthar khrid 'jigs pa med pa'i grong khyer dam pa mchog la rab tu 'god/ /
'gro ba dag ni 'dod chags zhe sdang mun pa nyon mongs sna tshogs nad btab cing / / yun ring nas ni 'dus byas sdug bsngal dag la gzhol zhing sdug bsngal rab 'bar ba/ / sems can mthong nas snying rje bskyed de nyon mongs pa yi nad pa kun gso zhing / / nad rnams zhi bar byed pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi dam pa dag kyang ston/ /
rgyal po lta bu de dang de dag 'khor rnams dgar byed 'gro la chos ston pa/ / sdig pa spong la dge la bsnyen cing sangs rgyas yon tan rnams kyang tshol cig ces/ / rkang gnyis dbang po'i chos kyi yul la kun mkhyen ye shes dbang por dbang bskur ba/ / rgya chen byang chub yan lag rin chen 'byung gnas de dag 'gro ba'i 'phags pa'i nor/ /
tshul khrims lte ba ting 'dzin mu khyud brgyan pa'i ye shes 'od dang shes rab mtshon/ / ye shes rno ba'i gzhu can nyon mongs 'joms zhing bdud kyi sde rnams dkrug byed pa/ / chos kyi sgron ma che 'byin mchog rnams de dang de dag sangs rgyas bskor ba yin/ / 'khor lo mchog rnams bskor zhing pha rol rgol ba dag dang mu stegs thams cad 'joms/ /
ye shes chu ni zab cing mi zad shin tu rgya chen chos kyi ro dang ldan/ / byang chub yan lag de bzhin bsam gtan rin chen gang ba 'gro kun shes par dka'/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas kyi mtha' rlabs mtha' yas yul rnams dag cing lhag bsam dge / de dang de dag ye shes rgya mtsho mtshungs med bstan pas zad par mi 'gyur ro/ /
'jig rten rab 'phags rtag tu yul gyis mi gos 'gro ba rnams kyi gnas gyur pa/ / bsam gtan mngon shes rab 'phel ye shes rtse mo lhag pa'i bsam pa mi sgul ba/ / gang dag de dang nyer phrad shes rab ye shes mchog gis rab tu 'dra bar 'gyur/ / de dang de dag yon tan ri rab shes rab rab brtan 'gro ba kun gyis bltas/ /
lhag pa'i bsam pa mchog ni rdo rje mtshungs shing 'dra ste brtul zhugs thams cad brtan/ / sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun thams cad mkhyen pa'i spyod yas bsam pa mi phyed de/ / bdud dang sems can nyon mongs 'jig rten rlung dag gis ni mi bskyod rab brtan pa/ / de dang de dag 'jig rten dam pa nyon mongs 'bar ba dag las zlog par byed/ /
byams pa'i sprin rnams kun 'dus snying rje stug po rig pa'i glog chen rgyu zhing ldog / thub pa rnams ni rdzu 'phrul gnas bzhi dbyangs kyi 'brug sgra 'byin cing rab tu sgrog / tha dad yang dag shes dang tshul khrims yan lag brgyad ldan chu yi char 'bebs pa/ / de dang de dag sprin chen nyon mongs zhi byed sems can don phyir mngon par 'phags/ /
shes rab dga' dang khrel yod dag ni 'obs te chos kyi rgyal mtshan bsgreng / / ye shes shing thags yin te thar pa'i sgo phye dran pa de dag sgo ba yin/ / bden pa rnams ni lam chen bzhi ste shin tu dge ba'i rdzu 'phrul rab brgyan pa/ / srid pa gsum na bdud sde dag gis mi thul grong khyer chos nyid dag tu ston/ /

Enlightening beings are caravan leaders; They see living beings everywhere In the wasteland of birth and death, Afflicted, in dangerous places, Caught by the bandits of manias, Ignorant, blind, straying from the right road: Enlightening beings direct them to the right, straight road So they may enter the city of fearlessness.
Enlightening beings see sentient beings Afflicted by the three poisons, Suffering all kinds of pains, Feverish, oppressed through the long night; Arousing great compassion for them, They explain many ways of curing, Eighty-four thousand kinds, To eliminate all afflictions.
Enlightening beings are spiritual sovereigns, Civilizing beings by the right way, Causing them to avoid evil and cultivate good, And wholeheartedly seek enlightened virtue.
Crowned and given predictions of supreme enlightenment By all buddhas, They distribute the wealth of sagacity of people, The jewels of the elements of enlightenment.
Enlightening beings turn the wheel of teaching Just like what the buddhas turn; Conduct is its hub, concentration the spokes; Knowledge is their adornment, wisdom is their sword.
Having defeated the bandit afflictions And slaughtered the enemy demons, They put false teachers to flight Whenever they see them.
Enlightening beings’ ocean of knowledge and wisdom Is boundlessly deep and wide, Suffused with the flavor of truth, Filled with jewels of attributes of enlightenment.
A great mind is its boundless shore, Omniscience is its tide: No sentient beings can measure it, It can never be fully explained.
Enlightening beings’ polar mountain Goes beyond the world: Concentration of spiritual capacity its peak, The great mind rests immovable.
Any who approach it Are imbued with its color of wisdom.
It is far beyond all realms of objects; There is no one who does not see it.
Enlightening beings are like diamond, Determined to find omniscience, Their faith and austere practice Steadfast and unshakable.
Their minds without fear, They aid living beings And thoroughly annihilate All demons and afflictions.
Enlightening beings’ great benevolence and compassion Are like layers of dense clouds; Three superknowledges flash lightning, Paranormal powers thunder, And with the four intellectual powers They rain water of eight qualities Moistening all to relieve The fever of afflictions.
The citadel of truth of enlightening beings Has transcendent wisdom for walls, Conscience for a deep moat, Knowledge as its battlements.
Opening wide the gate of liberation, Right mindfulness always guards it.
The four truths are the level royal road, The six spiritual powers are the arsenal.
The banners of the great Teaching Are hoisted all around; The demons of the three worlds Cannot enter at all.

thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems mchog shing la rab 'dug rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'i rkang pa brtan/ / gshog pa thabs kyi stobs te pha rol gnon mthu byams dang snying rje mig gnyis yin/ / ston pa de dag 'gro ba kun na thub med mkha' lding dbang po'i drag shul 'dra/ / srid pa'i mtsho nas 'don cing lha mi rnams kyang mya ngan 'da' ba'i mchog la 'god/ /
tshul khrims dkyil 'khor rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'i shugs ldan ye shes 'od zer phreng ba mdzes/ / 'od snang kun 'char nyon mongs 'joms shing srid pa'i rgya mtsho rab tu skem par byed/ / stobs dang dbang po dge ba'i sman 'phel sems can pad+mo yongs su rgyas byed pa/ / de dang de dag snang byed chos kyi nyi ma'i khyu mchog 'gro ba kun du 'byung / /
chos dbyings rnam par dag pa dkyil 'khor 'gro ba kun gyis blta na mdzes pa ste/ / nyan thos rang rgyal rnams kyi tshogs mang skar ma 'dra ba dag ni zil gyis mnan/ / sems kyi rgyud rnams mthong nas srid pa gsum du 'phel dang 'grib pa rnam par stan/ / de dang de dag ye shes zla ba 'gro la 'char zhing mkhas pa nam mkha'i mtha'/ /
chos kyi dbang po 'gro ba kun la dbang byed gzugs dang yon tan dag gis brgyan/ / ye shes rdo rje mnga' ba thabs ni mig ste chos la dbang chen bsgyur gnas pa/ / lus dang mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po sna tshogs kun gyis blta ba'i dbang po ste/ / chos kyis 'gro ba kun las rgyal ba de dang de dag chos kyi dbang po yin/ /
