srid pa gsum na 'dod pa'i 'dam dang nyon mongs las las rab 'das kun dbang po/ / byams pa snang dang thugs rje bsam gtan dga' dang btang snyoms rnams la mos/ / srid pa gsum po kun du tha dad lus ston chos kyi sgras kyang go 'byed pa/ / de dang de dag tshangs pa lta bur rnam dag mos shing lta ba'i rnam pa sel/ /
'khor las rab tu 'das shing rnam dag yul dang ldan pa bdag po chos kyi dbang / / phyir ldog mi 'gyur blo gros che 'chang gang rnams theg pa dma' dang tha dad la/ / chos kyi dbang por dbang bskur 'jig rten dam pa ye shes phyir ldog mi 'gyur ba/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i yon tan dbang phyug grags chen de dang de dag 'jig rten dbang / /
nam mkha'i mkha' dbyings lta bur dngos dang rnam bral dmigs pa thams cad rnam bsal ba/ / 'gro ba kun tu bya ba nyams len khyu mchog ci la'ang gnas pa med pa ste/ / 'gro ba kun tu spyod pa dkar zhugs mkhas pa de dag rab tu mi gnas pa/ / de dang de dag ye shes dge zhing dag pas shes rab nam mkha'i dbyings dang 'dra/ /
de dang de dag shin tu rgya chen thabs ldan sa lhar 'gro ba kun gyi gsos/ / chu 'dra de dang de dag byams dang snying rje nyon mongs me ni rab tu sel/ / de dang de dag ye shes mes ni nyon mongs sreg cing bag chags bcas pa bsal/ / ston pa de dag mi gnas rlung dang 'dra bar srid pa gsum na rab tu rgyu/ /
de dang de dag rin chen 'dra ste shin tu dkon zhing 'gro bar dbul yang sel/ / de dang de dag rdo rje lta bur srid pa gsum na lta ba kun tu 'joms/ / de dang de dag yon tan kun gyi phreng ba sna tshogs 'jig rten gsum mdzes byed/ / ston pa de dag nor bu rin chen mtshungs 'dra spyod pa kun gyi gtsug tu phyin/ /

The condor of enlightening beings Has magic for its steady feet, Skillful means for its mighty wings, Kindness and compassion its clear eyes; Perched on the tree of all knowledge, It watches the ocean of existence, Snatches human and celestial dragons And places them on the shore of nirvana.
Enlightening beings’ sun of truth Rises in the world, Its full orb of conduct Running swiftly by psychic travel, Shining with the light of wisdom, Maturing the herbs of faculties and powers, Destroying the darkness of afflictions, Evaporating the ocean of craving.
The moon of the light of knowledge of enlightening beings Has the realm of reality for its sphere, Coursing through ultimate emptiness, Seen by all the world.
In the minds of consciousness of the three worlds, It waxes and wanes through time.
Among the stars of the Two Vehicles, It has no peers at all.
The bodies arrayed with virtues Of enlightening beings, spiritual sovereigns, Are replete with all embellishments and marks of greatness, Looked up to by all humans and celestials.
Pure eyes of skillful means, A diamond scepter of wisdom, They have mastery of spiritual law And civilize beings with truth.
Enlightening beings, as great Brahma lords, Independently transcend the three worlds; They have ended all confusion by actions And are imbued with benevolence and equanimity.
Everywhere they manifest their bodies And enlighten with the voice of truth.
In the three worlds They uproot erroneous views.
Enlightening beings, as controlling celestials, Are beyond the realm of birth and death; Their sphere is always pure, Their wisdom never recedes.
Ending the path of lesser vehicles, They receive the spiritual coronation.
Full of virtue and knowledge, Their fame is heard everywhere.
Enlightening beings’ knowing mind Is clear and pure as space: There is no essence, no reliance— All is ungraspable.
They have great autonomous power, Able to accomplish tasks in the world.
Themselves embodying pure conduct, They induce others to do likewise.
Enlightening beings’ earth of skills Benefits sentient beings; Enlightening beings’ water of compassion Drowns afflictions; Enlightening beings’ fire of wisdom Burns the brush of delusive conditioning; Enlightening beings’ wind of nonabiding Goes through the void of existence; Enlightening beings are like precious jewels, Able to save the poor; Enlightening beings are like thunderbolts, Able to smash perverted views; Enlightening beings are like ornaments, Adorning the body of existence; Enlightening beings are like wishing jewels, Enhancing all actions.

de dang de dag me tog lta bur yon tan rab rgyas byang chub yan lag rtse/ / phreng ba lta bur de dang de dag smon lam bcings shing 'jig rten mgon la gnas/ / de dang de dag tshul khrims ma nyams skyon med rnam dag dri ni dri rab zhim/ / de dang de dag 'jig rten gsum na chos dang ye shes kyis ni bag chags dag /
gdugs 'dra de dang de dag stobs kyi bla res nyon mongs rdul las skyob par byed/ / ye shes rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba'i thugs mnga' de dang de dag nga rgyal mtshan snyol/ / de dang de dag spyod pa'i ba dan sna tshogs yid 'ong ye shes kun tu 'phags/ / gos 'dra de dang de dag rdzu 'phrul yon tan 'gro ba kun la khebs par byed/ /
theg pa 'dra ba khyu mchog mtha' yas de dang de dag 'jig rten gsum las 'byin/ / de dang de dag rab dul glang po lta bur yid kyis rtag tu dul la gnas/ / de dang de dag rdzu 'phrul rtas ni khal chen khyer zhing 'jig rten gsum las 'da'/ / klu yi dbang po lta bu de dang de dag sems kyi yul du chos char 'bebs/ /
de dang de dag 'gro ba kun la me tog u dum war mtshungs 'dra shin tu dkon/ / dpa' bo lta bu de dang de dag nyon mongs 'joms shing bdud kyi sde rnams 'khrugs/ / mi ldog 'khor lo lta bu de dang de dag 'dren pa rnams kyis rab tu btsud/ / de dang de dag sgron ma lta bur mun pa sel cing sems can thams cad lam yang ston/ /
de dang de dag chu klung lta bur yon tan ded cing lam rgyun rjes su 'gro / de dang de dag zam pa lta bur ngal ba med par rtag tu 'gro ba sgrol/ / gru dang gru chen lta bur smon lam rab btab ye shes gangs chen mtsho thob byed/ / de dang de dag mnyan pa lta bur 'gro ba ye shes thang chen mchog la 'god/ /
de dag skyed mos tshal gyi dga' brtse zhing 'gro la yang dag spyod pa ston/ / de dag chos kyi rnam thar mngon shes me tog ye shes gzhal med khang dag pa/ / mkhas pa de dang de dag sman ltar nad zhi byed cing nyon mongs rab tu sel/ / sman gyis rgyas pa'i gangs ri lta bur de dang de dag ye shes 'byung gnas so/ /
de dag sangs rgyas lta bur ye shes kyis ni 'gro ba gnyid log mun pa sel/ / yang dag sangs rgyas lta bur gzhan min yid kyis 'gro ba yang dag rtogs par byed/ / de dang de dag rgyal ba ci 'dra de ltar 'ongs te mkhas pa de nyid gnas/ / de dag thams cad mkhyen pa lta bur ye shes 'byung gnas kun nas sgor yang zhugs/ /
zhi ba skyed pa de dang de dag ston pas rab bsngags 'gro ba kun la ston/ / de dang de dag rang gi ye shes yul dang thams cad mkhyen gyi spyod yul shes/ / de dang de dag tshad med dpung dang 'dra bar 'gro ba kun na thub pa med/ / de dag ye shes mi 'jigs blo gros 'chang ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos kyang shes/ /
gang na gang dag 'gro ba kun gyi gzugs dang ming rnams ji snyed snang yod pa/ / kun tu gzugs snyoms gzugs kyi rjes su song zhing ming dbyangs rjes su song ba yin/ / gzugs rnams kun las 'das shing ming dang rnam par bral yang bya ba thams cad ston/ / de dag mthu ni 'gro ba rnams kyis rnam pa kun du brjod par mi nus so/ /
gang dag 'di 'dra'i yon tan thob cing dngos bral dngos po med pa'i chos gnas shing / / yod dang med pa'i mdud pa thams cad bral ba mkhas pa ye shes mngon sum can/ / thams cad shes kyang ye shes rten pa ma yin ye shes de la gnas pa min/ / de dag spyod la 'jug pa yid 'ong 'jig rten dga' bar byed pa bshad par bya/ /

chos kyi tshul ni sgyu ma'i rang bzhin dngos po dben pa lta bur rab rtogs nas/ / mkhas pas sangs rgyas byin gyi rlabs kyis smon lam thabs dang snying rje dag kyang byed/ / sprul pa'i ye shes sgo dang ldan pas khyu mchog bya ba sna tshogs rab ston pa'i/ / byang chub sems dpa' ma nor yid can rtse gcig mnyam pa med pa legs par grags/ /
lus gcig la ni mtha' yas lus dang rgya chen lus rnams tha dad rab tu ston/ / sems med yid med sems kyi yul med 'on kyang 'gro ba kun du de dag ston/ / khyu mchog brjod pa'i pha rol phyin pa de dag dbyangs gcig rnam par rjod byed kyang / / 'gro ba dag gis sgra skad ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad rab tu rjod/ /
nyon mongs rgyud byung lus dang bral yang sems can rnams kyi lus la dbang bsgyur te/ / brjod du med pa'i tshul gyis zhi ba rtogs shing sgra rnams thams cad rab tu ston/ / de dag sems kyi rang bzhin zhi zhing 'od gsal nam mkha' mtshungs par yang dag shes/ / 'gro ba kun la bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs sgo nas 'jig rten sna tshogs ston/ /
de dag lus rnams gang la'ang gnas pa med de lus kyang de dag ston pa byed/ / 'gro ba thams cad kyi ni skye ba dag dang rgyu mthun gnas pa ji snyed pa/ / thams cad kun du skye ba'i lus dang ldan yang skye ba dag la gnas pa med/ / rang gi lus la mkha' 'dra dngos bral sems can sems la sna tshogs rnam pa ste/ /
mkhas pa kun la dbang bsgyur de dag lus ni mtha' yas kun tu ston byed cing / / me tog dri dang byug pa phye ma sil snyan gdugs dang ba dan rgyal mtshan rnams/ / thams cad mkhyen la mchod pas rkang gnyis gtso bo 'jig rten mchog la mchod byed cing / / mkhas pa bsam pa thag pas lus kyi 'du byed mchod pa dam pa kun du ston/ /
mkhas pa de dag rgyal ba zhabs kyi drung 'khod rgyal ba thams cad kyi/ / 'khor rnams kun na snang zhing mtshungs med de dag zhu ba kun kyang zhu ba byed/ / chos kyi dam pa thos nas ting 'dzin re re mtha' yas sgo ldan thob gyur cing / / blo gros ldan pa de snyed rnam par ldang ba ston pa byed kyang zad pa med/ /
'gro ba sgyu ma lta bur rtogs nas shes rab ye shes thabs kyi pha rol phyin/ / sgyu ma lta bu'i chos dang gzugs spos mtha' yas dang ba 'gro ba kun la ston/ / sna tshogs gzugs dang sgra rnams mtha' yas shin tu rgya che sems kyang rab tu ston/ / 'gro ba thams cad la ni 'du shes dra ba 'jug pa ston kyang gnas pa med/ /
'gro don rjes 'gro de dag la la dag tu thog ma'i sems su 'gro ba ston/ / la lar 'gro ba kun la byang chub spyod pa mtha' yas rgya chen dag kyang ston/ / la lar sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod pa brtson 'grus bsam gtan shes rab rnams/ / la lar tshangs pa'i lam sdud kha cig tu ni spyod pa mchog kyang rab tu ston/ /
mkhas pa rtogs med de dag la lar spyod pa rdzogs shing bzod pa thob pa ston/ / la lar skye ba gcig gis thogs par nges shing la lar rgyal bas dbang bskur ba/ / la lar nyan thos gzugs su gyur cing la la dag tu rang rgyal gzugs su gyur/ / bye ba khrag khrig mang po'i zhing du mya ngan 'da' bas spyod las ldog pa med/ /

Though knowing the appearances of things Are like illusions, all empty and null, Yet with compassion and commitment And the spiritual power of buddhas Enlightening beings, by mystical projection, Show innumerable various things.
Such qualities as this You all should hear about.
With one body they can manifest Unlimited different bodies; Without mind or object, They respond to all beings.
In one voice They can utter all words; The languages of all beings They can produce according to type.
Forever free of an afflicted body, They manifest an autonomous body; They know things cannot be explained, Yet make various explanations.
Their minds are always silent and cool, Clear and pure as space, Yet they adorn lands everywhere, Showing all beings.
They have no attachment to the body Yet are able to manifest bodies In all worlds, Taking on birth according to need.
Though born in all places, They do not dwell on birth; They know bodies are like space, Variously appearing, according to mind.
The body of enlightening beings is boundless, Appearing in all places, Always honoring and serving The most worthy of people.
Perfumes, flowers, music, Banners, pennants, and jeweled canopies, They present to the buddhas, Always with a pure mind.
Without leaving the assembly of one buddha They are present in all buddhas’ places; In those great congregations They ask about problems and listen to the Teaching.
Hearing the Teaching, they enter concentration On each of numberless points, And likewise emerge from concentration With endless manifestations.
With knowledge and skill in means They realize the world is all illusory, Yet are able to manifest boundless Illusory things of the world.
They manifest various forms, As well as minds and languages; They enter the net of ideas, Yet without ever clinging.
Sometimes they manifest initial determination To benefit the world; Sometimes they manifest long-time practice, Boundlessly extensive.
Charity, morality, tolerance, energy, Meditation, and wisdom, The four boundless minds, four integrative practices, And all such higher principles They may show carried to fulfillment, Accepting them without false notions.
Sometimes they manifest immanent buddhahood, Anointed and crowned by the enlightened; Sometimes they appear like listeners, Or like the self-awakened.
Everywhere in ultimate nirvana, Still they do not give up enlightenment practice.

de dag la lar lha dbang brgya byin lha dang bcas pa la lar tshangs par 'gyur/ / de dag la lar lha yi bu mo brgyas bskor la lar gcig pu spyod pa ston/ / la lar dge slong rab tu zhi zhing yid zhi la lar rgyal po dbang phyug 'gyur/ / la lar chos kyi dra bar 'jug pa'i ye shes khyu mchog gzugs kyang rab tu ston/ /
la lar bud med sgyu rtsal pha rol rab phyin la lar dka' thub can du 'gyur/ / la lar 'dod pa'i longs spyod rgya chen ston cing la lar bsam gtan thub pa byed/ / la lar mya ngan 'da' dang tshe yis dang la lar rgan dang byis par ston/ / de dag spyod pa bsams na skye bo myos par 'gyur te yid gnyis rnyed par 'gyur/ /
la lar lha dang 'grogs shing la lar shi 'pho la lar mngal 'gro gnas pa ston/ / la lar mngal zhugs la lar rnam par sangs rgyas la lar 'khor lo rab tu bskor/ / la lar skye ba la lar mya ngan 'das pa la lar bzo yang rab tu slob/ / la lar bud med tshogs kyi dbus gnas la lar ting 'dzin la lar mngon par 'byung / /
la lar khyu mchog byang chub dam par sangs rgyas byang chub shing gi drung na bzhugs/ / la lar 'khor lo rab tu bskor zhing la lar sna tshogs chos rnams yongs su tshol/ / la lar sangs rgyas gyur cing zhing rnams bye ba brgyar khyab 'gro bar ston byed kyang / / byang chub don du spyod pa dag gis tshogs rnams las kyang phyir ldog ma yin no/ /
bskal pa'i grangs la 'jug pa'i pha rol phyin pas bskal pa bye ba phrag brgya dag / khyu mchog sems gcig nang ston sems gcig bskal pa brgyar yang de bzhin ston pa byed/ / 'gro ba thams cad la yang rtog dang mi rtog rtog pa'i yul rnams thams cad ston/ / gsog pa med cing phyogs la gnas med spyod pa de dag kun kyang rab tu ston/ /
gang phyir rgyal ba nye rgyal de dag nyi tshe'i phyogs med kun na bzhugs pas na/ / 'gro ba kun gyi rgyal ba ji snyed pa dag thams cad rdul gcig steng du mthong / / sangs rgyas zhing rnams bsgrubs dang sems can yul dang chos kyi rgyu tshul rnams kyang mthong / / de ltar brtson pas bskal pa khrag khrig brtson byed 'on kyang cha shas zad mi 'gyur/ /
de ltar 'gro ba kun gyi sems can tshul rnams mtha' yas rgya chen rab tu shes/ / sems can gcig la mtha' yas lus dang rgyu dang bye ba khrag khrig yod pa rnams/ / de dag 'gro ba gcig dang ma lus thams cad dag la rnam pa kun du ston pa byed/ / bslab pa 'di yi phyogs la pha rol phyin te ma bslabs rnams ni ston pa byed/ /
dbang po rnon po dang ni 'bring dang gang dag dbang po rtul ba'ang rab shes nas/ / 'gro bar skal ba yod dang skal ba med pa'i dbang po'i 'khor lo skor ba byed/ / dbang po re re la yang dbang po thams cad rnam pa phan tshun gnas pa dang / / dbang po'i dngos po phra ba'i tshul dang gang dag dbang po brtan pa'ang rab tu shes/ /
de ltar khams dang mos dang bsam pa spyod dang nyon mongs bag chags rnams kyang shes; ; sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yi sems spyod da ltar byung ba'ang de bzhin te/ / sems can kun gyi spyod pa'i pha rol phyin kyang 'ong dang 'gro ba yod ma yin/ / ma nor spyod pa shes nas 'gro ba kun la chos kyi dam pa ston pa byed/ /
de ltar sems kyi sems spyod sna tshogs kun nas nyon mongs med pa dag / sems gcig la ni khong du chud nas byang chub mchog tu kun mkhyen rnam sangs rgya/ / sems kyi skad cig gcig gis 'gro ba rnams phye rang gi shes pas rtogs gyur nas/ / sems kyi tshul shes sems med rab tu gzhol bas ye shes mchog la kun kyang 'god/ /
rdzu 'phrul mchog thob ye shes khyu mchog mngon par shes pa kun gyis rab tu 'phags/ / sems bskyed gcig gis khrag khrig mtha' yas zhing dang phyogs rnams thams cad du'ang 'gro / de ltar ye shes dbang bsgyur 'gro zhing bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig zad byed kyang / / skra rgyud shin tu phra ba gcig la zhugs par gnas las gar yang 'pho ba med/ /
'tsho ba'i don du sgyu mkhan gzugs rnams sna tshogs 'gro ba kun la ston byed kyang / / sgyu ma kun btsal gzugs su mi dmigs gzugs yod ma yin par yang dmigs pa med/ / de ltar mkhas pa ye shes thabs dang shes rab rgya chen sgyu mar zhugs pa rnams/ / sprul pa phun sum tshogs pas 'jig rten phal chen khyab par byas shing rab tu ston/ /
nyi ma zla ba mkha' la rgyu zhing mdzes la shin tu 'phags pa'i rnams/ / ma rnyogs chu rnams ji snyed dag tu snang yang de ni chu dang 'dres ma yin/ / de ltar chos nyid dag pa'i dkyil 'khor mchog la shes pas shin tu 'phags pa'i rnams/ / 'gro ba dag pa'i sems kyi yul la snang yang 'gro ba dag dang 'dres ma yin/ /
la la gnyid log rmi lam dag na bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad byed/ / lo ni bye ba khrag khrig mang po zad par rmis kyang mtshan mo de ma zad; ; de ltar chos nyid rang bzhin mtshungs par rjes rtogs bya ba sna tshogs kun ston te/ / skad cig gcig la bskal pa bye ba zad byed de dag ye shes zad mi 'gyur/ /
ri yi dbang po'i ri sul gnas pa 'jig rten dag dang mnyam du thos pa'i sgra/ / kun nas sgra yi sgra brnyan de dang 'dra bar brjod kyang rtog cing g.yo ba med/ / de bzhin chos kyi rang bzhin shes pa'i khyu mchog byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa dag / rtog pa med par sems can sgra rnams ji snyed par ni chos dang spyod pa ston/ /

They may appear as Indras, Or as Brahma kings, Sometimes surrounded by goddesses, Sometimes alone and silent.
Sometimes they appear as monks Quietly taming their minds; Sometimes they appear as monarchs, Ordering the laws of society.
Sometimes they appear as artful women, Sometimes as ascetics; They may appear to enjoy sensual pleasures Or to enter meditations.
Sometimes they appear newborn, Sometimes young, old, or dying; Any who tried to conceive of this Would be doubtful and go mad.
Sometimes they appear in celestial palaces, Sometimes they manifest spiritual descent; Sometimes they enter or abide in the womb, Sometimes they are buddhas preaching.
Sometimes born, sometimes extinct, Sometimes they appear to enter halls of learning; They may be with consorts, Or apart from society practicing meditation.
Sometimes they sit on the site of enlightenment And naturally realize true awakening; Sometimes they manifest active teaching, Or they may appear as beginning seekers of truth.
They may appear as embodiments of Buddha, Sitting at peace in infinite lands; Or they may be cultivating the nonregressive path, Accumulating means of enlightenment.
They penetrate countless ages And reach the Other Shore of them all, Infinite ages a single moment of thought, A single moment of thought, infinite ages.
All ages are not ages, But they show them as ages to the world; There is no advent and no accumulation, Yet they accomplish the tasks of the ages.
In a single atom They see all buddhas In all places everywhere, There being nowhere there is no buddha.
Lands, beings, phenomena— They see them all, in order, Through incalculable ages, Ultimately inexhaustible.
Enlightening beings know the number of living beings Is vast beyond bound: All those creatures’ bodies Arise from measureless causal relations; As they know one is infinite, So indeed are all.
According to their competence, They teach the uninstructed; They know the faculties of sentient beings, Superior, middling, inferior, are not the same.
They also know faculties change, And which can be taught and which cannot, And that one faculty and all faculties Are mutually interrelated, And their subtle individual differences, And their precise order.
They also know the mental behavior Of beings past, present, and future, Their inclinations and understandings, All their vexing habits.
They realize all actions Have no coming or going.
Once they know people’s behavior, They tell them the unexcelled Teaching.
They know thoroughly all kinds Of defiled and pure conduct; In an instant becoming enlightened, They accomplish omniscience.
Dwelling in buddhas’ inconceivable Mind of ultimate knowledge, Instantly they are able to know The actions of all beings.
Having mastered the functional power Of enlightening beings’ spiritual knowledge, They can in a single moment Travel to boundless lands.
Going swiftly like this Throughout endless ages, There is nowhere they do not reach, Yet without stirring a hair.
Just as a skilled magician Makes all kinds of forms appear Yet one finds in those illusions Neither form nor nonform, Likewise do enlightening beings Use the magic of knowledge of means To manifest various forms Throughout the world.
As the clear sun and moon, Bright mirrors in the sky, Reflect in myriad waters Without being mixed up by the waters, Likewise, you should know, Enlightening beings’ wheel of truth Appears in the water of minds in the world Without being mixed up by the world.
Just as a man in a dream Makes all kinds of things And may go on for millennia Without one night ending, Enlightening beings dwelling in the essence of reality Reveal all phenomena, And while countless eons may end, Their instantaneous knowledge is endless.
As in mountain canyons And in palatial halls All sounds are echoed Without discrimination, Enlightening beings dwelling in the essence of reality Can, with autonomous knowledge, Widely utter words adapted to types, Also without discrimination.

dpyid zla dag gi smig rgyu g.yos la ji ltar sems can chur ni 'du shes nas/ / de nas chu rnyed mi 'gyur btung du med cing je bas je skom rnams 'phel ba/ / de ltar mkhas pa thar la zhugs pa sems can dag gi nyon mongs g.yo ba'i rnams/ / shes pas rtog nas sems can 'du shes bya med phyir zhing bya ba rnam par 'phel/ /
gzugs ni dbu ba lta bur khyu mchog ston te tshor ba chu yi chu bur 'dra/ / 'du shes thams cad smig rgyu lta bur rag las 'dus byas chu skyes shing dang 'dra/ / sems ni sgyu 'dra bsgrub bya skyed byed de bzhin bya ba sna tshogs rab tu ston/ / de ltar phung po dgod pa ston kyang dbang bsgyur dag ni de la gnas pa med/ /
skye mched stong pa'i rang bzhin dbang med 'khrul 'khor bya ba kun du 'byin byed dang / / khams ni chos kyi dbyings mtshungs dngos po dag dang bral bar 'gro ba rnams la ston/ / dam pa'i don tshul zhi ba las ni bden pa sna tshogs rnams kyang rab tu ston/ / de ltar de dag chos tshul rnam par dgod pa ston pa byed kyang gnas pa med/ /
'ong ba med cing phyogs su 'gro ba med la rgyud du gnas pa med pa yi/ / nyon mongs rgyu las byung ba'i las dang las las sdug bsngal de ltar lam gsum du/ / rkyen la rag las 'byung ba rnams dang yod dang med las rab tu 'das pa yi/ / yang dag don dam dbu ma'i lam ni dngos po med la gnas pa rab tu ston/ /
skad cig gcig la dus gsum khong du chud kyang skad cig sna tshogs rnams kyang ston/ / 'dod dang gzugs med khams kyi yul dang bya ba sna tshogs ston par byed; ; sdom pa gsum gyi spyod dang rab tu ldan zhing thar pa gsum yang rab tu ston/ / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gcig la theg pa gsum du rnam par dgod pa de bzhin ston; ;
gnas dang gnas ma yin pa rab tu dbye ba'i chos dang dbang po pha rol phyin/ / khams dang mos pa dag dang nyon mongs rnam 'byed kun du 'gro ba thob gyur pa/ / mig gi yul gyur sngon gyi gnas pa dran zhing nyon mongs zhi bar mkhas pa dag / sangs rgyas stobs bcu dag gis ye shes shin tu yangs kyang stobs la dmigs pa med/ /
sangs rgyas thams cad rjes su dpog stong 'gro ba kun du mngon sum chos bzhed de/ / nyon mongs zag pa lhan cig skyes pa mi mnga' byang ba'ang brnyes par gyur pa med/ / 'byung ba thugs su chud pa'i ye shes rgya chen des ni 'gro ba 'don pa mdzad/ / 'di yi gnas la rgyal sras 'jigs pa med cing 'on kyang zhi bar spyod pa med/ /
'khrul pa mi mnga' lam las g.yo ba'ang mi mnga' dgongs pa nyams pa'ang mi mnga' ste/ / mos dang brtson 'grus ting 'dzin shes rab rnam par 'byed pa ye shes gang du'ang nyams pa med pa/ / thams cad mkhyen pa mdzad sdom pa gsum mdzad dus gsum kun la mngon sum mkhyen mnga' ba/ / 'gro ba kun gyis ma thob byams pa'i chos nyid mi 'phrogs chags pa med brnyes pa/ /
chos sgo gang dag gis ni spyod pa 'di dag rab tu thob pa smra ba'i mchog / de dag yon tan mang po don gyis brgyan pa'i phyogs tsam bdag gis brjod par bya/ / de dag spyod pa bskal pa khrag khrig dag tu brjod kyang zad par mi nus te/ / 'on kyang ji ltar sa la sa rdul 'dra ye shes spyod pa phyogs tsam brjod par bya/ /
sangs rgyas ye shes rten ldan bsam pa thob pas ngo mtshar 'du shes gnas pa rnams/ / spyod pa mchog dang ldan zhing byams pa'i rjes song brtson 'grus brtan pas rnam gnon cing / / tshul khrims mi g.yo dbugs phyin de dag 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par byed/ / lung bstan rab tu thob nas rgyal sras rnams kyi spyod pa tshul bzhin thob par byed/ /
sangs rgyas yon tan dag la zhugs kyang sems can sems dang zhing la sems pa byed/ / bskal pa'i dus la 'jug pa'i ye shes ldan zhing mkhas pa skyo ba'i 'du shes med/ / gzungs kyi tshul dang yang dag tha dad stobs rnams thob cing yang dag don gyis rgyal/ / bstan pa mtshungs med sems kyis mkhas pa byang chub zhi ba rnam par 'tshang yang rgya/ /
sems kyi spyod pa thams cad bzang po'i yon tan spyod pa'i mchog tu smon pa byed/ / snying rje'i rkyen dang byams pa mchog rten byang chub dam pa sbyong bar byed dang ldan/ / brtson pas pha rol phyin rtogs rab tu mkhas shing skyo ba'i pha rol phyin gyur pas/ / khyu mchog mos dang rab tu rtogs pa'i stobs thob byang chub dam pa mngon 'tshang rgya/ /
mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa thob cing ye shes tshul gyis chos mchog ston byed pa/ / yon tan thob byed spobs dang ldan pa de dag chos kyi dbang phyug mchog tu 'gyur/ / dbang la gnas kyang gnas pa med pas mnyam pa med pa'i sems kyi 'brug sgra sgrogs/ / ye shes mchog dang de bzhin gshegs sprul sgrub cing byang chub zhi ba nye bar 'gro /
mkhas pa de dag bskal pa 'byams klas byin rlabs shes pas dbugs phyin rab tu thob/ / zab la gnas pas brtan par 'gro na gnas shing nem nur bsal bas mkhas pa rnams/ / ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab chos kyi dgongs pa mkhas shing rnam phye pha rol phyin/ / snyoms par 'jug pa'i ye shes yul la zhugs nas thams cad mkhyen par 'tshang yang rgya/ /

As one seeing a mirage And thinking it is water Chases it but finds no drink And becomes even thirstier, So too is the case Of sentient beings’ afflicted minds; Enlightening beings take pity on them, Rescue them and free them.
Seeing form as like clustered foam, Sensations as like bubbles on water, Conceptions as like heat waves, Dispositions as like the pith of a plantain tree, And consciousness as like magic Manifesting various things, Thus knowing the clusters as such, The wise have no attachments.
The mediums of sense are all empty and silent, Yet turn like the cogs of a machine; The elements are in essence unconnected, Yet fabricate the appearance of the world.
Enlightening beings abide in real truth, The supreme truth of voidness; They teach widely in many ways, Yet their minds do not dwell on anything.
There is no coming and no going, And also no remaining, Yet afflictive actions, the cause of suffering, Continue to flow and develop.
That which is interdependently originated Is neither existent nor nonexistent, not real or false: Thus do enlightening beings enter the middle way And teach it without attachment.
They are able in an instant To manifest the minds of past, present, and future, And all the various phenomena Of the realms of desire, form, and formlessness.
Following the three modes of conduct, They expound the three liberations, Define the paths of the Three Vehicles, And accomplish omniscience.
They comprehend what is so and what is not, All actions and all faculties, Realms, understandings, meditations, Where all paths lead, Recollection of past lives, clairvoyance, And annihilating all delusion.
They know the ten powers of buddhas, But cannot yet fully achieve them; They realize all things are void, Yet always seek the sublime Teaching; They are not mixed up in afflictions, Yet still do not annihilate contamination.
With extensive knowledge of ways of emancipation They liberate sentient beings; In this they attain fearlessness And do not give up cultivating their practices.
Unerring, not deviating from the Path, They do not lose right mindfulness.
Their vigor, determination, concentration, And meditative wisdom are undiminishing.
Pure in conduct, meditation, and altruism, They clearly understand all times; With great compassion for sentient beings, They are totally unimpeded.
By entering these gates of truth They accomplish such practices: I now tell a little Of the sense of their arrays of virtue.
Even if one told of their practices for countless eons One would never exhaust them; Now I tell a little bit, Like a mote of dust of the earth.
Resting on buddha-knowledge, They generate extraordinary thoughts, Cultivate the best of actions, And embody great benevolence and compassion.
Heroically striving, inwardly at peace, They teach and enlighten conscious beings; Abiding by pure precepts, They fulfill practices leading to enlightenment.
Able to comprehend buddhas’ virtues, Sentient beings, actions, and lands, They also know all ages With never a thought of weariness.
With total command of differentiating knowledge, They arrive at the meaning of truth; They contemplate and explain the incomparable, Peaceful, and calm true awareness.
They generate the mind of Universal Good And cultivate the actions and vows; With the causal power of compassion, They proceed on the Path pure in mind.
Practicing the transcendent ways, They perfect conscious knowledge; Realizing power and freedom, They attain unexcelled enlightenment.
Achieving impartial knowledge, They expound the supreme truth; Able to preserve it, endowed with sublime intelligence, They arrive at the position of the supreme teacher.
Avoiding all attachments, They expound impartiality of mind; Generating knowledge and wisdom, They produce miracles and attain enlightenment.
Preserving the truth through all ages, The knowers are most joyful; Deeply penetrating it and relying on it, They have no fear or confusion.
They realize the inconceivable, Unravel artful mysteries; They skillfully enter concentrations And see all spheres of knowledge.

ye shes rnam thar kun gyi pha rol phyin cing mngon par shes pas rnam par rtsen/ / rig pa'i snang ldan rnam grol nyon mongs bral bas 'gro la skyed mos tshal dang 'dra/ / gang la dkar ba'i spyod pa'i gzhal med khang mdzes sna tshogs spyod pa ston pa po; ; 'gro ba kun la rgyan rnams du ma rab tu ston kyang sems las g.yo ba med/ /
bsam pa shin tu shes pas bstan pa rab tu mkhas shing pha rol phyin 'gyur bas/ / mkhas pa dag ni dag cing sbyangs ba'i byang chub phyag rgya snang ba'i ye shes kyis/ / 'gro ba dag dang mi mtshungs zhum med khyu mchog lhag pa'i bsam pa ri bo 'dra/ / ye shes rgya mtsho 'dra dang yon tan mi zad don du spyod pa chen po spyod/ /
de dag rin chen 'dra ba'i gnas la rdo rje lta bu'i go cha bgos pas gnas/ / shin tu rgya chen rtsom la rab tu mkhas shing 'gro ba kun na thub pa med/ / byang chub mchog tu lung bstan skyon med khong du chud pa'i rgya chen sems la gnas/ / sangs rgyas gter mchog mi zad thob nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'tshang rgya'o/ /
rtag tu kun rdzob shes pas dbang 'gyur rnam par 'phrul ba rnams la mkhas pas na/ / zhing rnams kun dang chos kyi yul la rnam par 'phrul pa'i ye shes rgyud la gnas/ / lus dang smon lam spyod yul ye shes rnam par 'phrul pa la yang de bzhin te/ / 'gro ba dag la rnam par rtse ba bye ba khrag khrig du ma mang po ston/ /
mngon par shes pa'i rdzu 'phrul stobs kyis rnam par 'phrul zhing nges par rnam par rtse/ / khyu mchog de dag sangs rgyas yul la stobs thob 'gro ba kun gyis thub pa med/ / mkhas pa 'jigs pa med dang bag tsha med dang ma 'dres rnams kyis shin tu brgyan/ / sangs rgyas sras dag las rnams thams cad byed cing shin tu mdzes pa'i lus dang ldan/ /
de dag lus kyi las kyi dngos po shin tu rgya che dag kyang dag cing dge / de yang 'byin pa'i tshe na rgyal bas byin gyis brlabs shing las ni mchog kyang byed; ; dam pa de dag sems bskyed gcig la sems rgyas byed pa'i sems kyang rab tu ston/ / rgyal ba'i dbang po thob pas rtag tu dbang po'i ting 'dzin dbang la rab tu gnas/ /
bsam bdag cing g.yo rgyu rnams dang bral te lhag pa'i bsam pa mngon sum gyur/ / mos pa'i 'jug pa rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad 'gro ba dag la rab tu ston/ / bag chags thams cad spangs nas spyod pa dam pa rab tu 'dzin/ / nan tan bya ba grub pa'i ye shes mkhas pas thams cad mkhyen par 'tshang yang rgya/ /
bsam pa rnam par spangs nas de dag skyon med gnas pa zhi ba mchog kyang 'thob/ / mkhas pa 'di lam shin tu bslabs pa de dag ming ni yon tan sgo nas grags/ / mtha' yas sems kyi yul ldan gnas pa med par lam rnams yang du sgom pa byed/ / ye shes tshul la gnas shing 'gro ba rnams la lam gyi rgyan rnams shin tu ston/ /
spyod pa lag pa lta bu dag dang ldan pa lto yin snying po ye shes mchog / snying ni rdo rje lta bu snying rje'i go bgos ye shes gdab pa'i mtshon cha yin/ / shes rab mgo ste chos rtogs mig yin byang chub spyod pa yang ni rna ba yin; ; tshul khrims dag cing nyon mongs med la gtsang ste mun bzhi byed sna yin te/ /
spobs pa lce yin lus ni rig pa yin te sems ni ye shes dam pa yin/ / spyod pa rgyu ba yin te byang chub shing gnas seng ge'i khri ni 'dug pa yin/ / tshangs pa'i lam rnams dag ni lam yin stong pa chags med dam pa spyod yul lo/ /
gang gis de dag snang bar 'gyur ba'i snang ba bde bar gshegs kyi ye shes yul/ / sems can spyod la rnam par lta ba ye shes mchog ste rnam pa sna tshogs bsgyings/ / sems can dben zhing chags dang bral ba'i sbyin pa bsnyems pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang / / bzod pa mi 'khrugs brtson 'grus mi ldog dbang bsgyur ba ni bsam gtan dam pa yin; ;
rgyu ba med cing nam mkha' 'dra ba shes rab byams pa sems can rnam par 'dren/ / skyo ba med snying rje rnam dag chos ni dga' ba nyon mongs gnas las btang yang snyoms/ / don ni zhi ba chos kyi yul la nye bar 'gro ba bsod nams 'gro la bsngos/ / ye shes tshogs ni ral gri rnon po lta bu snang ba chen po rig pa ste/ /
'gro ba rnams la thos pa ston pas mi ngoms bskal par 'dren kyang 'jigs pa med/ / nan tan byed la gnas te bdud rnams btul nas bdud kyi lam yang rab tu bcad/ /

Consummating the liberations, They exercise spiritual insights; Forever free from veils and bonds, They roam freely in gardens and groves.
Virtuous ways are their mansions, All their deeds are admirable; They cause boundless adornments to appear, Their minds unmoved by the world.
Observing well, profoundly intent, They can elucidate with wonderful eloquence The pure marks of enlightenment, The light of knowledge illumining all.
Their dwelling place is peerless, Their minds are indomitable; Their will is like a high mountain, Their virtues like a deep ocean.
They rest in truth like treasure, Wear the armor of vows, Undertake great works, Ultimately invulnerable.
They gain the destiny of enlightenment, And are steadily broad-minded; Their hidden resources are inexhaustible, They awaken to all truths.
Masters of worldly knowledge, They function subtly, without obstruction: Sentient beings, all lands, And all kinds of phenomena, Embodiments, vows, and realms, Knowledge, spiritual capacities, and so on, They manifest in the world, Countless hundreds of billions.
Their spiritual powers and states Are free—none can inhibit them; They are adorned with all works Of powers, fearlessnesses, and unique buddha-qualities.
Their bodies and physical deeds, Their words and purified speech, Are under protection, So they can accomplish ten things.
When enlightening beings are first inspired And when their minds pervade all, Their senses are undistracted And they attain higher faculties.
With profound minds, overmastering minds, They get away from deception; With various sure understandings, They thoroughly penetrate the world.
Abandoning afflictive habits, They take to the supreme Path; Skillfully practicing it, they fulfill it And arrive at omniscience.
Avoiding regression, they enter the absolute And certainly realize silent extinction; Generating the Path of enlightening teaching, They embody epithets of virtue.
The paths, the paths of infinity, Up to the paths of adornment— Successively they go by these Without attachment to any.
Hands, feet, and guts, With hearts of adamant, Wearing the armor of sympathy, Equipped with many weapons, Heads of knowledge, eyes of understanding, Deeds of enlightenment their ears, Pure conduct their noses, They destroy darkness, unhindered.
Intelligence is their tongue, Their bodies are omnipresent; Higher knowledge is their mind, They cultivate their practices in action and repose.
They walk on the site of enlightenment, Sit on the lion throne, Recline in universal goodwill, compassion, joy, and equanimity, And rest in emptiness.
Their spheres of action and contemplation Illumine the realm of enlightenment; Observing the acts of sentient beings, They spring forth and roar.
Free from greed, they practice pure giving; Abandoning conceit, they preserve pure conduct.
Never angered, always tolerant, Not lazy, always vigorous, Mastering meditation, Wisdom uncontrived, Kindly saving, tirelessly compassionate, They take joy in truth and abandon afflictions.
In all realms They know meanings and principles; Their virtues are fully developed, Their wisdom is like a sharp sword.
Fully aware, they delight in learning And clearly understand how to proceed; They know demons and their ways And vow to get rid of them all.

rgyal ba rnams kyi 'phrin las gang yin ye shes spyod pa lhag pa'i bsam pas 'dzin/ / nga rgyal las rnams rnam par spangs te rtag tu ye shes kyi yang bya ba byed/ /
bdud rnams byin gyis brlabs bcom mkhas pa de dag sangs rgyas byin gyi rlabs kyis 'phags/ / chos kyi byin gyi rlabs thob blo gros chen po 'chang ba lha yi gnas su 'dong / / lha rnams byas te 'chi 'phos song nas mchog gi mngal ni shin tu phra bar 'gro / skye ba mchog ni nye bar bstan nas mchog gi gom pa bdun ni 'dor bar byed/ /
mkhas pa de dag sems can kun la bzo dang spyod dang btsun mo'i 'khor kyang ston/ / chags pa med par mngon par byung nas byang chub shing drung chos kyi rgyan kyang byed/ / stong pa stan las 'od zer dra ba yangs pa skye zhing yang dag bskul ba byed/ / bdud rnams btul te byang chub go 'phang sangs rgyas chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor/ /
sangs rgyas sa yang rab tu bstan nas 'dren pa de dag mtshungs pa med par bzhud/ / gang gis mkhas pa bskal pa bye bar rnam par rtse zhing yang dag byung gyur nas/ / sems can bye ba khrag khrig stong phrag du ma sangs rgyas yon tan rab 'god kyang / / rnam pa kun du sems can mi gnas chos la ma yin spyod la ma yin pa'i/ /
de dag gi ni spyod pa 'di 'dra mtha' yas shin tu rgya chen mdor bstan te/ / de 'dra'i spyod dang ldan pa'i ye shes khyu mchog rdzu 'phrul dag gis rnam par rtse/ / zhing rnams bye ba stong yang skra rtse gcig la bskal pa khrag khrig brgyar 'dzin te/ / lag tu khyer te zhing rnams bye bar 'gro yang lus la'ang ngal dub gang yang med/ /
mkhas pas khyer nas ji lta'i gnas su bkod kyang 'gro ba dag la gnod pa med/ / 'jig rten mkhyen pa'i zhing gi rgyan rnams ji snyed rnam pa tha dad bstan pa dag / kun kyang ba sbu gcig gi bu gar khyu mchog de dag yang dag rab tu ston/ / mkhas pa ba spu'i bu gar rgya mtsho chu rnams ma lus khong chud rab ston kyang / /
'phel zhing 'grib med 'gro ba dag la gnod par 'gyur med bya ba de yang ston/ / khor yug khrag khrig shin tu phra ba'i rdul byas lag gis bsdus khyer zhing / / zhing rnams khrag khrig bye ma snyed du 'dor byed gcig tu gnyis kyang gzhog mi byed/ / zhing rnams de dag rdul du byas te de bzhin gzhan yang rnam par 'jig byed de/ /
de 'dra'i rjes su dang ba zad par gyur kyang 'jug pa de dag mi zad do/ /
'jig rten kun gyi nyi ma zla ba skar ma gang dag stong rnams ji snyed dang / / gang yang nor bu'i 'od dang me yi 'od dang gang na gang rnams lha dbang 'od/ / mang po de dag rab tu 'das pa'i 'od zer khrag khrig spu gcig khung nas 'gyed/ / 'jig rten kun gyi ngan song sdug bsngal zhi bar byed cing chos kyi dam pa ston/ /
'gro ba ma lus sgra yi rnam pa sna tshogs skad rnams thams cad ji snyed pa/ / sku mchog de dag tshig gcig rab tu brjod pas sgra rnams thams cad tshang bar brjod/ / srog chags bye ba rnams kyis yid du 'ong ba'i sgra thob dga' zhing mgu bar 'gyur/ / rgyal bas bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam pa ji snyed thams cad de las thos par 'gyur/ /
gang yang ji snyed 'das pa'i bskal pa yod pa de dag ma 'ongs bskal par ston/ / gang yang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba ji snyed de dag 'das par ston/ / khyu mchog dag ni zhing rnams 'tshig dang gnas pa rnam pa tha dad ston pa byed/ / 'gro ba ji snyed thams cad mkhas pa de dag skra rtse gcig la rab tu 'god/ /

Seeing buddhas and buddha-works, They determine to embody them all;
Free from pride, they cultivate knowledge, Not taken in by the power of demons; They are supported by the buddhas And also sustained by truth.
They appear to live in the happy heaven And also appear to die there; They appear to abide in the mother’s womb And also show subtle processes.
They appear to be born and smile, And appear to walk seven steps; They demonstrate study of arts And learning in the palace.
They leave home and practice austerities, Go to the site of enlightenment, Sit straight and radiate light, Alerting living beings.
Conquering demons, they attain true enlightenment And turn the wheel of the unexcelled teaching; When their manifestations are done, They enter great extinction.
Those practices of enlightening beings Are cultivated over measureless eons; They are boundlessly extensive, And I now tell but a little.
Though they enable numberless beings To become established in enlightened virtues, They ultimately grasp nothing Of sentient beings and religious principles.
Imbued with such conduct, They freely exercise spiritual capacities: They place myriad lands on a hairtip And for trillions of eons, Holding innumerable lands in their palms, Go everywhere, without fatigue, Then return and place them in their former locations, Unbeknownst to the beings therein.
Enlightening beings place all lands, Variously arrayed, In a single pore And show them as they really are.
Also in one pore They contain all oceans Without increase or decrease in the oceans And without injuring sentient beings.
Numberless iron mountains They pick up and crush to dust, Place each mote in one land, Using up every particle, Then take that number of lands And reduce them to particles too: The number of these particles might be known, But the knowledge of enlightening beings cannot be measured.
Through one pore They radiate infinite light beams; The lights of sun, moon, and stars, Of jewels and fire, And the lights of the gods Are all eclipsed thereby.
Annihilating the pains of miserable states, They teach beings there the unexcelled Way.
The various different kinds of speech Of all worldly creatures Enlightening beings can utter In one language: They can explain distinctly with certainty All the Buddha teachings, Causing the living who hear it To all be very joyful.
All the ages of the past They place in future and present; The ages of future and present They place far in the past.
They show infinite lands Burning, becoming, and subsisting, All the various worlds Being in a single pore.

'das dang ma byon pa dang phyogs bcu kun na bzhugs pa'i rgyal ba ji snyed pa/ / de dag thams cad rang gi lus las ma nor dbang bsgyur rnam par 'phrul pa ston/ / sprul pa'i byin gyi rlabs la shes pa'i mkhas pa de dag 'gro ba ji snyed sems/ / de snyed lus rnams rdul dang bral ba ston kyang lus la gnas pa gang yang med/ /
lam rgyud drug po gang rnams ji snyed yod pa'i 'gro ba kun gyi lus bsdus shing / / brgya byin tshangs pa'i 'jig rten mgon po rnams dang de bzhin lha dang mi yi rnams/ / gang yang nyan thos rang rgyal rnams la dad cing sangs rgyas sku la mos pa la/ / sangs rgyas byang chub 'grub pa'i spyod pa dag dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i spyod pa ston/ /
'gro ba kun gyi 'du shes dra ba rab dang 'bring dang tha mar 'jug pa rnams/ / thams cad shes shing byin rlob byang chub 'tshang rgya zhing rnams kun kyang rab tu ston/ / 'du shes dra ba rnams bsgoms blo ldan 'jig rten 'du shes rnams la dbang bsgyur ba/ / bya ba dang ni sbyor ba ji snyed pa dang kun mchog byang chub spyod pa sten/ /
de dag de dang rnam par 'phrul pa shin tu rgya chen dam pa gzhan yang ston/ / de dag gang la 'jig rten sa min pa dang yul min de dag bya ba ston/ / ston kyang bya ba lhur len ma yin gzhan yang phyir zhing gong du ston pa byed/ / de dag sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji bzhin spyod pa ci bzhin yang dag 'jug /

All buddhas of the ten directions, Past, future, and present, They clearly reveal In their own bodies.
They know the methods of transfiguration And skillfully adapt to beings’ minds; They manifest various bodies Without attachment to any of them.
They may manifest the bodies of all sentient beings In the six states of existence; Or the bodies of Brahma, Indra, or world guardians, Or the bodies of all other celestial beings, The bodies of listeners or individual illuminates, Or the bodies of realized buddhas; Or they may appear as enlightening beings Cultivating omniscience.
They skillfully penetrate the web of beings’ thoughts, Weak, middling, and superior; And show the attainment of enlightenment, And the lands of buddhas.
They comprehend the web of thoughts And gain mastery of thought; They show all the expedients Of enlightening practices.
Far-ranging spiritual displays Such as these they show; Such realms of experience No worldlings can know.
Though they produce manifestations, Nothing is manifested; ultimately this is supreme.
They adapt to beings’ minds To get them to travel the way of truth.

lus ni nam mkha' lta bu dag dang yid la chags med 'jig rten gsum gyi gtso/ /
tshul khrims spos kyi byug pa rab tu zhi ba gos yin yon tan sna tshogs rgyan/ / chos kyi go 'phang skyon med thob cing thams cad mkhyen pa yid bzhin nor bu ste/ / bde gshegs kun gyi ye shes dbang bskur thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal po'i thabs la gnas/ / pha rol phyin pa rtag 'byung 'khor lo yin te glang po mngon par shes pa mchog /
ye shes rdzu 'phrul rta ste chags pa med 'gro shes rab nor bu dam pa yin/ / spyod pa btsun mo bzang mo bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi po khyim bdag dam pa'o/ /
thabs la shin tu mkhas pa blon po yin te mkhas pa de dag 'khor los bsgyur/ / stong pa khyim ste ting 'dzin grong khyer mchog yin byams dang snying rje'i go cha'o/ /
shes rab ral gri yin te dran pa gzhu mdzes dbang po rno ba mda' yang yin/ / 'jig rten mkhyen pa rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs ni gdugs te/ ye shes rgyal mtshan bsgreng / / de dang de dag bzod pa'i stobs kyis bdud kyi dpung dang sde rnams 'dus pa 'joms/ / gzungs ni sa ste byang chub spyod pa chu klung ye shes lu ma shes rab shing; ;
me tog byang chub yan lag ting nge 'dzin ni rta ste rdzu 'phrul rnam par brgyan/ / stong pa rnam thar brgyan pa rdzing bu yin te rnam par dpyod pa bzang po btsun mo yin/ / thar pa bdud rtsi bza' ba yin te chos ni btung ba theg pa gsum gyis rtse/ / de dag spyod pa de 'dra yid 'ongs khyad par 'phags te de bas gong du mang / /
gang gi bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig stong du skyo ba yongs su mi skyo bar/ / ston pa mchod cing rnam dag zhing la brtson pas 'gro ba ye shes mchog la 'god/ / kha na ma tho kun med ye shes rab gnas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rgyas byed; ;

Their bodies, speech, and minds Are equanimous as space; Pure conduct is their perfume, Myriad practices are their clothes.
With the turban of truth, the topknot of purity, The jewel of omniscience, Their virtues are all-pervasive, And they are crowned as sovereigns.
The transcendent ways are their weapons, Spiritual capacities their elephants, Psychic travel their horses, Wisdom their bright jewels.
Sublime deeds are their consorts, The four means of integration their treasures; Skill in means are their generals, Enlightening beings are the rulers.
Concentration is their citadel, Empty silence is their palace.
With the armor of benevolence, the sword of wisdom, The bow of mindfulness, the arrows of insight, They spread the canopy of spiritual power on high And raise the banner of knowledge.
Their forbearance immutable, They break right through the devil’s troops.
Mental command is the level ground, Spiritual practices are the rivers, Pure knowledge the wellsprings, Sublime wisdom the forests, Emptiness the clear lakes, The branches of enlightenment lotus blossoms.
They adorn themselves with spiritual powers, Always enjoying concentration.
Meditation is their consort, Nirvana is their food, the taste of liberation their drink.
They freely employ the Three Vehicles; These practices of enlightening beings Subtly develop further as they cultivate them Tirelessly over measureless ages.
They honor all buddhas, Purify all lands, And cause all sentient beings To abide in omniscience.

zhing rnams rdul gyi 'brur blags re re nas kyang 'grang zhing brtsi bar nus 'gyur la/ / bar snang mkha' chen 'di yang skra yis gzhal te zad par bya bar nus srid de/ / skad cig gcig la 'gro ba rnams kyi sems ni bgrang tshul shes par nus srid kyi/ / sangs rgyas sras rnams spyod pa dag ni bskal pa brgyar brjod zad par mi nus so/ /

Even if the number of atoms in all lands Could be known, And all realms of space Could be measured with a grain of sand, And every thought in the minds Of all sentient beings could be counted, Still the virtues of enlightening beings Could not be fully told.

gang zhig yon tan rnam dag 'di dag 'thob par 'dod cing gong du gzhan 'dod dang / / gang zhig sdug bsngal rnams las 'gro ba thar byas bde la dgod par 'dod pa dang / / gang zhig bde bar gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs dang mnyam du 'gyur bar 'dod pa dag / des ni rdo rje lta bu brtan pa'i sems su gyis te yon tan bslab par byos/ /

If you want to be endowed with these virtues And higher subtle qualities, And wish to enable living beings To be free from suffering and always peaceful and happy, And wish to make body, speech, and mind All equal to those of the buddhas, You should make an adamant resolution To learn these virtuous qualities.
